review: Let's see. Almost 1000 hours into this game i am ready to give my opinion. 1. This game needs to be optimized as soon as possible. The lower limit of the fps can go as low as 45fps while i'm playing on low to medium settings on a GTX 1060. It is annoying and lethal to both my mouse and computer table.2. Server is always busy and SEA is somehow laggier than AS when i live near Singapore.3. SEA's server still doesn't have TPP yet after so long. WHY DO YOU FORSAKE US? WE PAID FULL PRICE FOR THE GAME AS WELL.4. The hacker issue has subsided a little bit as compared to the month of January and February. During those two months out of 10 games 8 of them was infested with hackers.5. Region lock China.Still I'd recommend PUBG simply because it is still fun despite all its flaws. It has potential to grow further beyond the fortnite hype.

review: EDIT Dec2017 Hacking is still there not as bad but somewhat playable but apparently the script that fixes the hacking is something like 6000000GB of data that is causing the game to rubberband (unplayably for the first 10 minutes of the game) even with a high end computer and executing some steam launch options that give it even more dedicated power. I honestly can't believe they made so much money and still can't hire someone with a clue.EDIT 26Sep2017 The new patch claimed to clean up some of the cheating like the overlays for ESP. I reinstalled to give it a shot and honestly it does look a lot better. I did have a few instances of people still loading in game without textures and shooting me through walls as well as a few "fishy" kills using auto fire at 200m with every shot landing but those can be circumstantial and just luck. I am going to give it a few more weeks see where it goes and I may change this review. Something has finally been done so hopefully they keep up the tempo.Edit Nov/2017 The cheating is still bad I just had a good run of luck lately but no it is back to as bad if not worse. Here is a link to a guy cheating still and this is what you see in almost every game https //www.youtube.com/watch?v EQQ2OZqTRiM. Auto Aim is TERRIBLE and obvious ESP is still being used relentlessly. Sorry these guys are not doing what they should be doing and sorting this problem out I can't give this a thumbs up. This game will stay as a negative review until it is released and this problem (if ever) is sorted. Don't buy it if you are a serious gamer that enjoys friendly honest competition you will not have fun. This is a hack fest. I do VERY well and usually end up in the top 10 if not 3 but the majority of the time that is because I identify someone that is obviously hacking such as auto aim a full auto AK at 200km to land every shot and avoid them. This is trash another great idea with devs that don't sort out the hacking. Sadly gaming is on its way down the tubes because of these cheating losers. Sadly this is a negative review. The game is FULL of cheaters if you don't cheat you are going to lose. It seems EVERYONE is using ESP. They claim to have banned them but that is BS. You can search YouTube (highly recommended before buying this turd) and find TONS of people blatantly posting their exploits time and time again and STILL not getting banned. Do a search for "Best PUBG Hacks AIM &amp ESP (Undetected)" in youtube for a perfect example that was posted less than a month ago. These people have made a fortune claiming 8m copies sold and they still dont even give a damn to fix this problem. Just another bunch of leeches taking money for a potentially good game and letting it go to hell like Rust and all the others. Don't buy this crap unless of course you are a hacker you will have a great time.Otherwise could be a great game but its not its full of cheaters. DONT BUY IT

review: This should be a great game. But it's not.The concept of a battle royale game is fun in itself but this game just doesn't feel good when you play it. It's janky it's buggy and it's hard to get a good feel for the game.It's hard to 'get good' because of how inconsistent the game feels. Just when you think you have it down you empty a clip on a player standing right in front of you and fail to register a single hit.I prefer the more realistic approach PUGB takes compared to something like Fortnite but this game just isn't fun to play. Dying in consecutive matches because you can't find a weapon. Walking aimlessly for 20 minutes and dying without being able to fire a single shot. These things don't make for a fun game yet this is what you will frequently encouter playing PUBG.I have over 300 hours put into this game and I still don't have a good feel for it. It's impossible to learn when you're constantly fighting against server lag desync issues hackers bullet reg problems etc. How can you learn from your mistakes if you can't tell if the problem is you or the jankiness of the game?
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is an excellent game. I am not a big shooter person but this game and it's mechanics are fantastic. The shooting works well and the part luck plays in the game makes it almost like a game of cards.The reason I can't recomend this game is due to the fact that it's in early access. I hate the early access business model. Instead of having a free beta they make you pay money for an unfinished game. The problem with paying to beta test a game is that the devs have no incentive to continue working on it after they already have your money. Its been months and they still have yet to fix the horrible sound direction or add a vaulting mechanic. The amout of deaths you'll have due to glitchy t and poor sound direction makes this game almost unplayable for me. My advice Wait until the game is finished then buy it. I will revisit the game when it gets released but for now don't buy PUBG.

review: Firstly this game is super addictive but there are far so many negatives and outtings that annoy me so much that I change my review again.Pros Good graphics Pretty good FPS Never struggle to find a game It's fun (to a degree)Cons FPS drops in certain areas bad hit detection Always get killed in a car shoot at a car and you never hit them. Wear a level 3 vest shoot someone with level 1 vest but you die even after hitting them with 80% of your magazine. Level 3 helmet get killed with 1 shot with kar98k use M24 on level 3 helmet (twice as powerful) it just downs them. Screaming players down the mic making you deaf unless you mute it. Laggy doors. Opening doors but never open or do but has invisable force field causing you not to enter thus getting killed. Unloading a full clip into someone for them to 2 shot kill you even with you having full body armour. Cheaters so many cheaters with auto aim etc to win. Imagine Call of Duty campers.... times that by 10 then that's the campers on this game.The game is fun but most the time I feel like throwing my PC out the window nothing more annoying than having level 3 helmet level 3 vest and getting 2 shot killed after shooting a full UMP clip into that person. If you want a bit of fun at the start then disappointment after a while of realising the games faults then this game is for YOU!!!

review: A true testament to wasted potential and greedy developers almost beginning to remind players of a vile publisher known as EA. Maps are large but static. Gunplay feels punchy but stiff especially at range. Movement feels floaty vehicles don't navigate very well if they happen upon odd invisible geometry. or just explode for no discernable reason. The game causes even higher end systems to huff and puff despite not much at all happening on screen especially since the only destruction in the game is picket fences and glass windows the desync causes many frustrating deaths from around corners with the new kill cams not really shedding any more light as to how you died. The community is torn because of the devs inattention to hacking and constant ping abuse from Chinese players while they continue to push more paid cosmetics and CS loot crates which are purely for streamers because lets be honest here without Twitch this game would never have reached this point. Can this game be turned around? Sure just ask once Bluehole loses this lawsuit to Epic Games.

review: For an anime fan the gameplay of PUBG is very similar to BTOOOM! Therefore I would firstly give some credit to the creator of BTOOOM! followed by a great appreciation to the Devs of PUBG. Keep up the good work guys. Although I would recommend PUBG for pretty much any player who loves to play and are open to different types of games. But since it's still early access do expect some unexpected bugs which somehow for some odd reason the bugs have added a bit of bitter sweet flavour in the game. Also because of certain unfairness due to unfair banning please hold on to your steam credits at this time. Otherwise you'll buy something that may DIE OUT in a few months. Not worth it.PS After having read some posts and the concerns of other dedicated players in the internet I would like to plead to the Devs to PLEASE STOP THE NONSENSE OF FAVORABLY LISTENING TO THE CROCODILE TEARS OF some STREAMERS (although they made your game famous) AND ALSO PAY ATTENTION TO DEDICATED GAMERS (because whether you like it or not they also contribute if not 90% more than 60% compared to streamers in helping your game to be popular without them having to get paid). Would be great to see an actual stat of how often stream snipping happens compared to banning. Also streamers should just expect to be stream sniped and get over it. Just go back to the lobby and play in another server just like everybody else.

review: I've good internet and good PC. Some days I can run this game with highest settings on without any trouble but suddenly I can't even run it without FPS lagging and slow loading on structures even on the lowest settings and this may continue for weeks. Then like a week afterwards I can run it again on highest settings for days without any problem. Then like a week afterwards it FPS lags like crazy on any settings again.I would say the game has issues in that regard most of my friends need to play on low settings although they have good PC's and I don't even think the graphics of this game is advanced. I personally don't like how the game doesn't have a "hold in to aim" button option. You are forced to aim by just clicking once. It is not something I'm used to. You can change the aim button with scripting but it will bug out your character once in a while (it will walk slow as if it is aiming although it isn't).The only good thing about this game is that it is currently super popular and it has a high demand on rare items so you can earn quite much money on e.g. an in game skirt which is only visual.

I loved the game then it just stopped getting cool new things imo the addition of the groza was the final update i really enjoyed. Now the weapon skins that i have seen people using (i dont play anymore) they seem like a last resort kinda thing to try take old pubg players back from other BR's and other games. Personally I don't like the look of the skins as pubg doesn't seem like a game that should be bright colours and cheery when i played i tried to have dark camo clothing because of the theme of the game realistic. fortnite on the other hand they way they have skins is perfect bright obvious cool looking skins that work with the cartoonish fast paced version of BR.Eventually I may consider playing again but for right now the game is stale and boring for me. also miramar sucks worst map ever4/10

review: bought this game when it first became available. Had fun playing for a solid few months....but the bugs ...glitches...sluggish character movement...and poor gun play was what made me hate this game. The developers have done little to nothing to fix the major gameplay issues within the game....but they found plenty of time to add new maps and a terribly slow and sluggish "vaulting" mechanic. Not to mention the terrible mechanics behind vehicle driving. Looting was spotty ...id run through 2 3 houses and find nothing but backpacks or a pistol. The loot needed to be fixed. Everything about this game screams no more tha $9.99 ...but somehow i got dooped into paying $30 for this awful excuse for a Battle Royale. This to me is a running/looting simulator more than a Battle Royale. Dont get me wrong...there has been some fun times had in PUBG ...but that fun is over shadowed by the bugs ....glitches ..and overall poor optimization of the game as a whole. Wish i could get a refund ...thats how terrible this game is.

review: This game is really good far better than any battleroyal game I have played before. However do go into this game with an above average pc as it can be a little hard to run.Edit 1 After drastically increasing my hours in a short space of time I have become highly addicted to this game and after upgrading my pc I have very little performance problems any more and all problems are swiftly being dealt with by the devs. The development team for this game is exceptional they are constatly releasing bug fixes and everymonth release a new patch adding lots of new content. For me personally this game is not part of the early access for ever stereyotype as the dev team has not delayed their release date as of this review and are 2 months from their supposed full release (I hope).Edit 2 Fun fact I said that in april the game was fully released in december and in 2 coming up on 3 months since then there has been no new content. They have announced stuff but who knows if that will just get delayed like everything else. This game is a bag of Its still badly optimised better than before but still bad the hit registration is still bad especially in close quarters I can record me doing the best spray of my life fully staying on a guy and it takes 30 bullets to down him. Not to mention how unreliable shotguns are I can shoot 3 shots at a guy see the blood splatter on all of them then he 1 shots me at the same range and oh look he has a quarter health left. Should I add all the micro stutters whenever someone pops up my pc isnt amazing but it is still above average I play with people who have insanely good pc's and they still get micro stutters when someone pops out on them.The crates yay lets grind to then have to pay money and that will rest my case for them i dont want to rant and get into that section of micro transactions just please split up the pay to open crates and the free to open crates.Time to discuss the bad quality of the awful desert map and all the stupid in that. Like buildings in major cities that you can't open thats a good idea when you need to loot fast. It probably is for performance reasons but when you are trying to loot your first building and you find out you can't enter it you are completely ed and have no hope of survival. Not to mention the buildings that are built around the vaulting of the games but then they arent checked to see if they work an example is there are these 2 multistory buildings in a spot I cannot remeber where but on the top floor balconys you should be able to vault and walk across a wooden plank to the other side but you cant because there is some random thing in the way and you cant get on top of the plank from one side.As a simple way to put this game is lucky timing look at h1z1 for example that was the game before pubg that everyone thought was going to do amazing but they didnt do enough for it and the game was too buggy and badly optimised. The only reason pubg was seem as the globally amazing game is that it was the best of a bad bunch and people had so much hope for it me included as you can see in my earlier reviews I even loved it but what they delivered is PUBG is only as good as it is because it came out first and had Brendan Greene (might have spelt that worng) with it so it got enough hype and then it got all the media support. However if Fortnite BR and for example Darwin Project had come out before PUBG it is likely that pubg would have boomed again for being super tactiacal but bust quicker and harder as there are better alternatives avaliable at the start. Unlike now where it is constantly called its reviews have tanked but enough people bought it and there are enough die hard fans that it will not die. It's like having someone immortal but then mutilating all of their limbs they wont die but they are useless.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Would be an absolutely amazing game if they were to optimize it for preformance. The servers are almost as bad as Rainbow Six Siege's back in 2016 before the second year/season update of operation health. Servers going in and out throwing up errors players not being able to log on and get online etc. Bluehole needs to (at least) start optimizing the game to run more predominantly on the Unreal Engine. I feel as if the game does not offer enough graphics options. Some of the reasons why I personally think the game runs so terribly on most computers is because of it's extravagent materials textures and assets that are required to execute when the game loads as well as particle effects amount of players and GPU cost of rendering these as well as drawing over them. Anyways I am still going to reccommend it. (As if it matters what I place in my review) My point is Player Unknown Battlegrounds would be a more enjoyable game experience without the issues I talked about which may seem difficult to fix but is vital for your playerbase and community to stay interested as well as gain new players.EDIT Don't buy this rushed A piece of hit unless you have a god tier PC/close to the recommended specs or above. Just get fortnite instead mine nibbas.

review: Update 03/02/2018 Legit with a 1060 6gb 16gb memory and an i5 6600k I can run PUBG now at the max settings with an occasional drop to 60fps. I wouldn't recommend playing on high settings at all but it's to show that PUBG is definetely a lot more playable than it's been.As for the game it currently features two maps (three sometime by Q4 2018?) a good variety of weapons and attachments. Sure they really need to figure out the regional server issue which I'm sure they will but overall it's still fun whether by yourself or friends. My only big complaint are the hackers which they are currently trying to combat with an anticheat system. Nonetheless still good and playable.Older Update Pff so these guys were like "hey we're gonna fix the performance issues a little more and stuff"Ha okaOh wait they kinda improved it.Okay I can write this review now PUBG isn't too bad of a game. It can be fun if you're into the battle royale type of games like H1Z1 DayZ or even Minecraft Hunger Games. Sure performance isn't top notch but it's definetely more playable now. Whether solo duo or squad PUBG has a lot of fun aspects and you can have a lot of cool and funny stories from the game. It's a race to be the last standing on now two very large fairly okay maps. It's fun and you can be apart of the hype.7.9/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Been playing this game for over a year almost 700 hours yet I cant recommend this game to anyone. The cons far outway any pros I can even think of mentioning. The amount of times shot I clearly killed someone on my screen then watch the replay where I didnt shoot a single bullet and they take no damage. The company is full of false promises to fix the connection/hacker issues for a year and still hasnt delivered. Its an unfinished product that is as far from polished as you can possibly imagine and I wont waste anymore time for a game that I "hope" works. 2/5 stars

review: Although it's buggy unoptimised and makes me rage a helluva lot I still love this game.Nothing gets your heart pumping more than being in the last 5 surrounded by enemies and just crawling in grass hoping you don't get spotted.New genre "crawl simulator"EDIT After a further 200 or so hours i'm now changing my review. The game is now somewhat optimised and runs fairly smoothly on a high end PC but now the problem is hackers. Every game you play I guarantee you you will be faced with a hacker. It is absolutely rampant you can either get shot through a building from the other side of the map or watch a guy trace you through walls till you're in line of sight to spray you down in the killcam. From what it started out to be to how it is now is pretty sad and the onus lies completely on the devs for not region locking and opting for a punkbuster style anti cheat program.Don't waste your money on this trash.

review: I loved this game at first. Who doesn't love battle royale games? Arma 3 then h1z1 and then this gem came along. However this gem turned out to be a fake diamond. The devs do not really give a they say they do but their actions are too slow. They say the game is incomplete but they knew they gave us a deadline for version 1.0 so they just threw some piece of better running for us. But now I could live with that because the majority of devs just do not care. What has pushed me over the edge was the hackers who ruin this game and I am not just trying to explain away loses. I just got done playing a game where we got killed by a really suspicous Asian player. Turns out after watching the replay that there was not just one squad hacking but there was a total of FOUR squads with at least one person hacking for a total of seven hackers. This is not the only game as well. I am uninstalling this garbage until they fix the hacker issue but I doubt they will fix it in any meaningful way.

review: Is it buggy? Yes.Laggy? Yes. Full of hackers? Probably. Rage inducing? Yes. Is it fun? Absofnlutely. All issues aside this game is a blast to play. Do I die from seemingly bs all the time? Of course. Maybe they're cheating maybe I suck more than I thought I did. Extremely laggy at times rubber banding back and forth across the map team wide 'network lag detected' popping up randomly client crashes and way too much audio fluctuation can be extremely annoying but when it works (let's say 80% of the time I don't have any issues) it's awesome.It's an early access game so some of the issues are understandable but patch to patch performance tends to vary which is sort of a bummer.I don't regret buying it at all even if I do curse the game the company and whoever kills me for whatever reason it happens. Pick it up have some fun and when you get too just throw your headset off say I'm never playing this game again get an ice cold beer and come back for more.

review: A lot of these reviews are for when it was in Alpha so I'm posting about the differences in the game modes after its 1.0 release.Solo options 1) go to school die2) go to school get a kill die3) go to school get three kills die gitting gudder...150) go to school kill everyone with a pan and come out victorious get sniped by Kar98 headshot hackDuo options 1) spawn with obnoxious chinese boy child2) spawn with obnoxious english boy child3) spawn with obnoxious american boy child munching on the crunchiest crisps in the galaxy4) spawn with a no mic5) spawn with "HEY WASSUP MAN I'LL BE STREAMING TONIGHT LOOKINGFORWARDTOAGOODGAMEMYMANWHEREAREYOUFROMLETSGETTHISGOINFORALLTHEFANSOUTHEREHITTHATLIKEANDSUBSCRIBEBUTTONBEFOREYOULEAVETONIGHT6) spawn with dude who doesn't stay together and goes to Party in Po i and dies7) spawn with Gilgamesh king of kings as he mounts you on his back like a wet towel and punches all remaining 98 players to death3 man squad options 1) Try desparately to ignore the fact that you and your two friends just cant find an extra fourth person to play with you2) die immediately to some scrubinius maximus who killed you immediately after downing you because they have kill pre jac syndrome so you now have to watch the rest of the game as your 2 friends loot and play dress upSquad options 1) spawn with 3 randos in a discord/irc/skype/steam/teamspeak/3 way call and they don't talk to you2) spawn with the chinese3) spawn with the chinese and one child4) spawn with a chinese person one child and one no mic5) spawn with a priest a rabbi and a vegan5) spawn with children that yell where to go and end up fighting each other6) spawn with 3 dude bros who tk you when you land for laughs7) spawn with 3 TheLegend27s that ignore your existence and win the game after you die upon landing8) spawn with AFKs 9) spawn with 3 decent human beings that are fun and crack jokes only to have them taken away from you during the first firefight as you are left with nothing but three lifeless corpses and the dreams of what might have been a good gameSolo squad options 1) you honestly thought you'd have a better chance to get more kills and git gud so you can get more BP to get that mini skirt so you can sell it for 40 quid and buy another gameI wish I didn't have to give a thumbs up or down because I occasionally come back to this salt mine when I'm in the mood. If you want to experience exponential decay in skill and exponential growth in rage as you play the game go for it. If you're a masochist that likes getting the absolute ing shit ernut beat out of them in an online game buy it. If you'd rather just experience what it's like to have a crappy job and what it feels like to complain about it to your friends this game is for you. If you'd rather go to McDonalds buy 15 2for2 sandwiches go home unwrap every sandwich and arrange them over your existing LayZBoy in a Game of Thrones style arm chair then watch Burrito The Next Generation as the grease and oils from the sandwiches slowly absorb into your skin and thus into your bloodstream as you slowly die of cardiac arrest over the course of 7 agonizing days go do that.I'd rather do the latter thumbs down.

review: Description PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a last man standing shooter being developed with community feedback. Starting with nothing players must fight to locate weapons and supplies in a battle to be the lone survivor. This realistic high tension game is set on a massive 8x8 km island with a level of detail that showcases Unreal Engine 4's capabilities. Pros Large area of playing fieldMuch more complex than any other battle royale based game (H1Z1 KotK)Beautiful graphicsInteresting map with diversityPlayer customisationGood weapon balanceReasonable accuracy with weaponsGame turn out based on strategy rather than luckCons Poorly optimised (constant stutters game just feels unsmooth)Few bugs (can sometimes get caught in buildings when parachuting down)Graphical artifacts (I think this is only a problem with few AMD cards)No ranked match making (not exactly expected considering it's only just been released) Conclusion This game is very good considering it's current development stage and provides interest for fans of h1z1 who are getting bored of developers ignoring requests. It has allot more depth than other games whilst still providing good gameplay and graphics.Rating 7/10Worth it? Definitely worth the extra 10 price tag! Yee

review: You'll have to have a 4 man squad to have the most fun out of it or duo is fine too . while its solo is very exciting as well This is a great game no doubt but it also has alot of flaw ...First off the graphics . to start off with this you cant even play PUBG on a standard grade gaming pc on lowest quality without lag and spikes .Secondly FPS drops and loading screen lags . you may have a monster pc gaming everything at extra or ultra graphics of course running this game on ultra or high is not a problem normally you would get a smooth 120 fps out of all the game out there while this game drops your fps all the way down to 40 50 .Screen lags yes this game crashes and lags alot you'll have to bear tru all the lags be it server lags or bugs . Lastly the player base /language barrier . yes there is alot of wonderful people out the in the pubg community but when you actually play the game it seems like 70% of the player base tru out all the servers are chinese and most of them only speak chinese . i'm a chinese myself and i think this is pretty unfair for all the non chinese out there .No doubt this is a really a fun game but it also has alot of space for improvements it really upgrade almost everything they're offering right now as the player base is booming .

review: After seeing the progress the game has made on the Test Server I changed my review to positive. Most of the issues listed below have been fixed but have not yet been deployed. My original review can be found below. PUBG is what you get when the wrong company makes the right game.The game is extremly enjoyable however the corporation behind the game PUBG Corporation was not the right developer for this. They have prioritized banning innocent people sueing other companies and quick money grabbing updates (ads on Chinese version and crates) over fixing issues with the game such as terrible performance clipping lag and much more.This game is in Early Access that means the company behind it should prioritize FIXING and FINISHING their game before adding UNNECESSARY garbage like cosmetic crates and ads (yes ads eventhough you already paid for it) to their game.

review: As much as I want to give this game a good review. I can't... The sound is absolutely horrendous. There are multiple bugs and glitches. There are a lot of things to list that I really don't want to spend the time listing. I really hope someone comes out with a better version of this style of gameplay.

review: Brand new fresh review. I have to say I was playing fortnite for 6 months straight now I've quit and am heading back to pubg. Why if you give a simply because fortnite is getting boring and repetitive. As far as optimization goes the game has had a massive boost in frames. Currently can get about 130 fps on high settings 1080p. Sometimes it drops when flying out of the areoplane. Is it worth full price still? No current sale is when you should buy it. Normal retail price should be like minimum $23.99 $33 (I'm australian).Last time I picked up this game the map was boring nothing looked fun to do except snipe people. Now they've made it more interesting by adding 4x4 mode which I died within 5 seconds of landing. What type of pc can handle it Not i3 series because I used to own an i3 2120. GPU GTX 770 and higher. If you've got the money spend $400 on a gtx 1070. I'd say for cpu go for i5 6400 or i7 4790. Ram wise you're looking at 8gb but lets be real nowadays chews up more then 8gigs in the background so at least 16gb ddr4. If you're on nvidia Go to your nvidia control panel and change the settings from quality to performance may make it look like slightly pixelated and but will improve performance. The game it self needs more optimization but the devs have been doing pretty good. One thing I will say though which I agree with is region lock ing China. And yeah.

review: While I recommend this game let me make this clear I am not happy with the game in its current state. While I love the rush that this game gives you and the realism present the game is not easy to play. Dying behind cover happens all to often due to client side hit registration which is infuriating and the fact the game is unoptimized and bugs run rampant is also a huge let down. And the locked crates? People criticize EA for the Battlefront II crates and heroes but this game makes you pay $2.50 for a key to open a SINGLE crate containing a SINGLE item. All in all features that would make this game much more enjoyable are The addition of content more freqeuntly IP Bans for cheaters with multiple offenses Optimization Server side hit registration More "game changing" content (Most of the content recently added has been exclusively cosmetic) More frequent updates Dedicated ServersPUBG is a $30 game that has a lot of potential but Bluehole has dropped the ball. With all the money they have already made off of this game they should easily be able to hire more staff and give their game dedicated servers. Right now though they're greedily sitting on they're profits doing next to nothing to further the development of a could be great game.

review: This game is the most frustrating fun anger inducing rewarding game ever. Here's how a typical game goes.I jump out of a plane and open my parachute. I look around and I see an enemy parachuting down right next to me. My heart starts pumping. We land and I dash into the house on the left he dashes into the house on the right. Frantically I'm searching every single room. "Gimme a gun gimme a gun!" I find A baseball hat... Summoning up some courage I tell myself "Whelp he probably hasn't found anything either let's just go in and have a round of fistycuffs!" I charge out the door and am greeted by a guy that looks like he's just finished the end game of fallout 4. He has a gas mask leather trench coat lv 3 back pack lv 2 helmet. I can almost see him grinning as I throw my underwear and baseball hat clad body at him as he opens up with a fully loaded AK47. For some reason I start another round.

review: Update 2018 06 14Bluehole just announced their new features of the upcoming update Map selection will be removed . As I mentioned at the bottom of this review Bluehole doesn't give $#17 about the community.This game WAS fun... but that was in 2017. The more patches it received the worse it got. Also the handling of the weapons is now (May 2018) a disaster. Cheaters everywhere!!Don't buy this game as long as there are so many cheaters (especially from Asia)Vehicle physics suck!Driving any vehicle is a disaster. Either your car/bike is drifting at medium/high speed or the vehicle is crap (like the bus). Why should anyone use the bus? Because there are far too few vehicles on the desert map.No one cares about the communityScrew that game developers don't care about the players and make it worse and worse. They just add more and more loot boxes instead of implementing a effective Anti Cheat Engine.E.g. People were asked what they think about the "red zone". A vast majority was against the red zone and wanted the devolopers to get rid off it. But the creative director of PUBG still doesn't care what the community wants.Conclusion DON'T BUY THIS GAME!!!

review: This game is a blast to play with friends and really encourages teamwork and communication. That said their 1.0 release is still riddled with bugs. I can't play this game for any lenth of time because I find myself incredibly frustrated for not being able to shoot through negative spaces getting the new map repeatedly frame rate drops at the beginning of games and an insaine amout of de sync. Their melee combat is also unusable in its current state. I didn't complain while the game was in beta but if this wonky flying into walls while punching is expected to be the norm they should just remove it. If this game was polished i would recommend it but looking at their 1.0 release I doubt that will ever happen.

review: Firstly i have to start this review by saying that when i first played this game i was completly obsessed with it. The first 20 30 hours of play were really interesting and exciting and it genuinely felt like a new gaming experiance i had not really had before. However after this duration of play i started to feel that many elements of this game felt really one sided and frankly not very well designed. Early Access or not there are some big problems with this game.The gunplay in this game is good the weapons have a fairly nice feel to them and are fun to shoot this is a big draw for a lot of people especially now FPS mode is avaiable in the game. The collection of items is also fun as long as you don't spend too much time doing it each match.PUBG exceeds at certain elements that many other online PC games fail at in a big way. I think that the game has really shown a lot of promise when it comes to playing with friends the game is pretty much designed to be played with at least 3 people. The way it almost forces players to work together using the compas for enemy location callouts and also develop vocal stratagy to navigate a combat situation is compelling. However this is frequently undermined by the fact many people find it easier to just sit and wait for players to show up and kill them. The design is there to promote team play but the game is actually easier to play when you just sit on a hil top with a sniper rifle and don't move for 80% of the match. Nothing is more flawed in a game than when it has mechanics to promote a type of play but frequently is too fussy in other ways for players to properly impliment these more team based skills.To elaborate on my criticisms above concerning team play. In a team based game luck should not be the defining factor. Unfortunatly luck plays a major role in PUBG. And one might argue that luck is a part of any multiplayer game which is true. But many other multiplayer titles give you ways to reduce your reliance on luck in the form of perks and killstreaks and other bonuses. There are of course problems with these systems too however PUBG gives you no tools to reduce being at the mercy of luck. You can get a perfect loadout of amazing guns and gear but all of that is just a distraction half the time. You could have a fully upgraded weapon and good side arm and mountains of health items but someone with a stock uzi can still just destroy you almost instantly. The argument against this is that the more players you have with you the better your chance of survival is which is true to a degree as you can have more eyes on the landscape that way and thus better chance of spoting people creeping up on you. But when it comes down to gettign into combat many people never really use a team mentality and your team of 4 can be destroyed by one or two people often. And i think this is becuse of what i mentioned above of the game giving you very simple tools to comunicate a complex combat landscape. Even if the game had small features like sniper scopes reflecting the sun and more cover would make the whole experiance of combat so much more enjoyable. Becuse of this very sparse toolset players will frequently just sit in stractures or under trees and wait for the plasma wall to reach them before they move.Half of the time in the game you feel like you are in an empty server and frankly the boredom of the mid game is unbarable. Its hard to imagine a survival shooter to be boring but somehow PUBG manages to be one of the most boring games i have ever played. Only the very skilled will run around shooting at everything and i think this is where another big issue of PUBG lies. The skill required and learning curve on this is immense generally i have no issue with hard games or games with a high learning curve i'm certainly not unwilling to take a challenge to learn a game inside and out. However PUBG just has the wrong kind of attitude to skill and learning. It has this constant feeling of repatition that you can only improve by dying over and over and over again and learnign a tiny bit each time. It has no payoff it feels like more of a grind than most long and drawn out RPGs. And some people will tell you that the crate reward system is payoff. It isn't. The PUBG Pioneer Crates or just loot boxes is another disapointment in the long line of disapointments this game has to offer. With rare items having a worse drop rate than most other loot box systems in any other game with this terrible feature i hav played. Often players are left with garish outfits that you can spot a mile off. Which hinders gameplay. Some may choose this but frequently the loot boxes offer little to no satisfaction with the items avaiable the fact that you get duplicate items is also just embarasing. Having a character you want to play as in terms of visual apperance is almost a pointless ambition in this game.The visual character of this game is very standard and effortless. Ranging from very light post apoc themes to mostly really boring average military gear you have seen a billion times in other games. This game could have really held my attention for longer if it was visually compelling and made me want to spend time getting a good loadout then getting killed after running 20 mins through a pretty sci fi or fantasy landscape.While on the subject of landscape it is actually probably one of your biggest foes in this game. The level of physics bugs and irritating camera problems when interacting with the landscapes is going to be madly frustrating to new players and will get you killed loads and loads of times before you learn to awkwardly work around them in your own way.To bring this review to an end before it goes on too long i have to say as a final conclusion that while overly negative i feel all my points are true and are problems for many people and not just myself. I wanted to really get into PUBG and enjoy it but after 100+ hours my patiance is just worn thin. I would warn many people looking to buy this game that it is probably better to buy this game when it is out of early access. I think that way many people can play it an not feel like i do and want my 100 hours back and my regret for bying into this game that has been disapointing and has a terrible online and streamer community to boot. I do feel that many of this games problems are not becuse it is in early access though. its just badly designed and feels almost like it embraces those flaws to make people frustrated enough to keep playing to get better which in my opnion is objective bad game design at its finest.I cannot recomend this product to anyone.

review: The overall concept of the game is great and if they had fixed everything this woule be game of the year no doubt. The problem is the poor optimization resulting in lag disconnects and bad frame rates. on top of the there is almost a cheater is every round and it makes the player feel like they were cheated when they were doing well. A system similar to Valve's VAC ban system is needed that scans the players PC for any cheats. The method that is used as of this review is simply not getting the cheaters banned and there is no feed back to whether or not your report actually got the player banned. If these problems were fixed I'd highly reccommed this game as for know I think I'll play Fortnite with the majority of the other players are going.

review: Edited 17/01/18I still stand by my original review this is by far one of the most fun games I've ever played and I highly recommend it.However...I must make people aware all through the early access phase I never once encountered a serious hacker issue maybe in the entire time of playing since release there was possibly 3 different times where there may have been a dodgey player but difficult to tell since release however the EU servers are completely and I mean completely filled with Chinese speaking players and lots of blatant hip firing 300m+ headshotting hackers with the replay function its so obvious to see the amount of hackers that are around now and it simply is ridicules. The Asian servers need to be fixed so they can play there as Chiese speaking players completely dominate most lobbies over voice chat and I'm sorry to say it but most of the hackers I've encountered seem to be from the group of players too.Vehichles are still far too glitchy and need addressing and things like shooting through a chainlink fence are still a total nightmare.We still have no sign of mod support which was claimed to be a big thing from the start I for one would love to see the game opened up to the point where we can have custom maps and such so much potential for modding on this with game modes and genres e.g. Space Jungle Medival(with weapon change up) maps.Don't hold out on us fix what needs fixing we wont hang around forever and the more you release these "paid for" skins/creates without fixing issues present from day one the more you annoy the loyal players that have stuck around and supported from the start.I'm changing my review to a thumbs down until I see a genuine response to resolving the Asia region issues and hacking issues as they are seriously effecting the enterity of the game currently. Original Review For me this is by far one of the most fun and addictive games I've played in a long time.No stupid pay to win or outlandish costumes/skins just plain and simple scavange kill run repeat.Don't get me wrong it needs some polishing and it's well on it's way there I experience menu/loadscreen glitches for my first game or two each day but actual gameplay is relatively flawless with the odd rubberbanding once in a while. The melee system needs some major work imo and grenades need a quicker way to be thrown.The guns seem relatively well balanced the vehicles work nicely and the looting is very random so always a different game every match. I would urge the dev to work on things like fences and railings however as you don't seem to be able to shoot through things like wire fences or stair/banistair rails which can get rather infuriating. If your looking for camparisons to me this game has the thrill of looting I got from Rust Legacy the Battle Royale style gameplay from H1Z1 KOTK(though a far better quality production) and the tactical teamwork capabilities from the likes of Counter Strike Battlefield etc. All in all a very fun and fullfilling game.The price seemed steep to me at first but I can hand on my heart say I'm very happy with what I've paid and the quality of game I have recieved and its updating and getting better each week. From my experiences I definately recommend this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Extremely flawed in its current state but an all around good contribution to the Battle Royale genre. Bluehole have proven that you don't need a big AAA budget or huge development team to compete with the big dogs. However PUBG still has a long way to go to be the "complete BR experience." It's still a buggy mess and lots of promises (2017 is nearly over) that have yet to be delivered (vaulting new maps etc.). Bluehole seem to be the masters of teasing.With games like Fortnite Battle Royale showing up late to crash the party and offering a slightly more casual experience it will be interesting to see how the PUBG community shapes up in 2018. Again given its current state PUBG is not ready for competitive online play. The potential is there but the game state has a long way to go in that regard.I'll be rooting for PUBG albeit with a very skeptical eye in 2018 when it comes out of Early Access. Only by then can I truly recommend it to others.

review: I joke it all the time "LoL eSpOrTs ReAdY" because its got some really things that occasionally happen.But I've invested a ton of hours into it because its incredibly fun and incredibly satisfying when it goes in your favor. The biggest thing about these types of games is you don't win all the time so if you get killed you have to shrug it off and requeue. Even if you get killed because of some of the bugs (one way fences for instance)... you have to understand everyone is facing those bugs you just got to be the victim of bad positioning. Do I recommend it? Absolutely. It can only keep getting better and BlueHole seems to want to support the community by updating it and making it better. I'm eager for the performance improvements in 1.0 release and I hope that the game continues to grow. If you're hesitant wait for a sale to grab it but its definitely worth it.

review: This is not a good game and i wouldn't recommend it over Fortnite or other games of the same genre. This doesn't mean it is a bad one either... The game itself has some good fundamentation cool gameplay style decent graphics but still it lacks on the basics of a competitive shooter and by this I'm referring to good servers that take count of at least ALMOST every shot (PUBG's server are not even worth mentioning) and good performance because pubg has many performance issues making fps drops frequently gamers with better rigs have a huge advantage when up against lower end computers.SO if you want a battle royal game and you like playing tps i would recommend you to go for another game Fortnite's allways an option but if you're like me and only like fps than you don't have many options.I play PUBG every day I get mad at it 'cause the game sucks and I won't recommend such game.

review: First off I have to say the cheaters in this game are ruining it I used to play 5 10 hrs a day now I might play 1 hr a day and be mad at the end of it. The game has too many cheaters fix the cheaters or add region lock for china. JUST DO SOMETHING ABOUT THE CHEATERS!Overall I like the premise and hope they continue to add to it. I would like to see a system in place for people who play alot they can get small increments of boost. Like at lvl 50 (500 hrs) you get plus 1 hp or an in game emblem or something. Just something minor like that it wont affect gameplay that much but it gives you something to work towards once you unlocked the pants you want.Mainly I want clothing to give some benefit to wearing it even if its just minor. For instance if you are wearing pants with knee pads you get 1 percent reduced fall damage or something.I will add now that I have played it for more time there seems to be in increasing amount of 'odd' behavier. Things like ppl getting a headshot on you with an m16 from 600 m away with their first bullet while you are running through a forest. lucky? maybe. Cheating? probably. It seems like 1 of 3 games I'm killed by someone who does something like that. Sometimes its fair but 35 percent is alot of times to not be angry. Im to the point currently where my friends ask me about this game I tell them. "its fun for a few games but theres very little almost nothing to work towards and the things there are to work towards are just clothing that do basically nothing and can be found in game anyway plus theres A TON of ppl cheating. So no dont get it."Armour should do more and clothing should mean something. BUT MAINLY THEY NEED FOR FIX THE CHEATING.The average game has between 1 and 5 AFK people and it causes the mid/late game to be slow (sometimes they really cracked down on this). Its ruining the dynamic of some of the games but is much less big deal since they made it so you dont get farming points anymore.Edit I took out some parts as they were fixed but the rest still stands. You are able to report people super easy and that seems to do nothing there are cheaters everywhere. Like 5 10 ppl in every game are using aimbots! The game is gaining alot of ppl and it doesnt seem to be slowing down which is nice. You still die VERY VERY quickly and that is incredibly annoying. I do think that the devs need to add micro transactions along with the free box to give extra clothing. The reason is if ppl are buying the paid box then the devs still get money and thus are more willing to work on the game. If you ever wonder why games get abandoned its because there is no longer a reason to update them either they have made all their money or the cost of updating is more than the money they will get in return. Plus clothing still does basically nothing so its not pay to win like ppl think.I very much have enjoyed this game but there is little here. I really hope the devs continue to update the game and change some things. Like for example there are bullistic face masks that dont reduce damage at all. There are vests that are suposed to add armour but seem to add very little and you die very quickly even with them (lookup youtube videos of the damage states for them they only block like 1 bullet and sometimes non).

review: Totally worthless game.Pros Not very expensive Nice graphics Can be quite fun sometimes but mostly on solo (no annoying reviving bullsh*t)Cons constant crashes that requiers to restart my PC (cannot kill process in task menager) D**k sucking server tick rate (constatly shots not detected by server especially on the beggining of the match) Random fps drops (often exactly in moment enemy player peeks playing on low details on GTX 970/i5 4690 8gb RAM game installed on SSD) Terrible hit detection (i.e. bullet from SKS landed directly on enemy chest but game detected it as hit to the ground) Poor rng (too often struggle to find anything better then pistol vs enemies that lands directly on SMG/shotgun/rifle or zone closing on the other end of the map) Totally annoying peeking. Game doesn't show any kind of indicator if the gun's barrel is blocked by obstacle (like in Rising Storm). Also it is quite often the rifle barrel doesn't seem to be blocked but bullet still hits your cover/ground. Squad playing is broken (ability to revive fallen squadmate infinite times without need of using any kind of resources i.e. first aid kit. Headshots doesn't matter 'cause you can revive enemy anyways.) Unbalanced weapons (M16A4 or M416 have nearly no recoil and have similar damage to AK47 which recoil is nearly uncontrolable even when tapping on single shot mode) Loosing HP during proper parachute landing. Hip shooting on short distances is much more profitable than aiming through sights poor sound (Jeez in CSGO I can hear how far is the enemy and find out directly the sound of the steps in PUBG only left/right/in front/behind also steps sometimes can be heard from millions of kilometers and sometimes its impossible to hear enemy sprinting few meters from you) Higher ping advantage. As developers made amounts of money beyond their expecations they forgot that game content should be improved. Instead of improving tick rate adding new maps/weapons they add useless stuff such as plane icon.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The biggest problem is all of the cheaters. I've owned it for about a week and I've noticed the same names over and over. Whatever passes for "anti cheat" for them clearly doesn't exist. Tell me how a guy that I can barely see with my x4 scope can hurl a grenade right at my feet and have it blow in under two seconds. Hitting the ground and blowing up before I can put the third shot into him with a semi.Even the people who clearly have 0 recoil don't get a slap on the writ. I know they say an update to their anti cheat is coming but I'm doubtful.So until they can get the basics that every other multiplayer shooter has I can't recommend anyone get it at this price. For a multiplayer only game where the entire point of playing in a squad is to die like a bunch of monkies that stole my cousin's brownies.

review: Game's good can sink many hours into it. The more hours you sink into it though the more you realise it's actually not that good. Still I got many hours of fun out of it and I can expect many more closer to release. UPDATE REVIEW.Adding a premium pass to a game that has already made HUNDREDS of MILLIONS $$ that's ing dumb it's a cop out and a money grab a kick in the face to those that have supported the game from the beginning. Starting a lawsuit against Fortnite for "similarities" and then adding the same ing systems from Fortnite into you own games that's ing dumb. A kick in the face to an already dwindling playerbase *lost 60 ing percent of its playerbase in the last 6 months* that's ing dumb.I'll continue to play this game occasionally but I will now NEVER spend any money on any DLC cosmetics Event passes this company has lost my trust and I now have no confidence in their ability to produce a product that is safe from money grabbing t.I sincerely hope this is the final nail in the coffin for many other players and they quit playing or atleast vote with their wallets tell B uttHole to go themselves. Perhaps B uttHole will wake up and see that this is NOT the way you treat loyal customers.I'll be off supporting one of the many other BR games you B uttHole.

review: So after 300+ hours I think I'm ready to say this game is up for a review on my part. This game currently the biggest hype flavor on the season. Is that bad? I think not. The shooter genre has needed a good mix up latley and with PUBG it's definatlly a new flavor compared to what we are use to. I find the game equally fun played with friends or solo. I as well have had crazy chance encounters from a naked guy pulling up to my house and screaming "Get in loser we gonna kill mofos" To my friends and I all driving our own car and as some acident crash into eachother and exploding and dying. I think if you pick this game up for fun. You'll definatly have it.

review: **Edit**Changing review. The developer of this game is quite possibly the worst software developer I've ever seen. Not only do they refuse to ping lock the regions their "anti cheat" measures are complete trash. You shoot another player in face with an entire magazine of 7.62 nothing. He's turns and pops three rounds with a pistol you're dead. The mechanics of this game are terrible. The amount of people who know where you are at any given time is by far the worst of any multiplayer game I've seen. Check out pubgradar.com if you don't believe me. Blueballs doesn't seem to care about that now do they? They're probably the people behind it. Worst money I've ever spent on a video game While this game is endless fun for you and friends the absolute refusal of the developers to instill a ping lock to keep well known hack players out of the North American servers heeds a thumbs down review from me. It is widely known and understood the vast majority of players from Asia play on NA servers with either blatent modifications to their game or pings so high it's worthless to match them. A simple ping lock would fix this issue for millions of players yet the devs refuse. Why have a marketplace or community for a game that is so easily hacked? Why permit cross region play when ping is going to be an obvious drawback? Great game and fun concept especially with friends. Terrible operation of servers update implementation (7pm PST? Seriously?) and an obvious disdain for their playerbase with the refusal to ping lock the regions.

review: I wrote a review for this back in July of 2017 and I recommended it. I asked for more weapons clothes maps vehicles and Bluehole delivered. But now I highly uncrecommend this game. Unless you have a killer PC and you're pretty good at the game keep it. I just uninstalled this game before writing this (6/03/2018). I know someone will say I quit it and hate the game because I suck at it or I'm a Fortnite fanboy. Truth is I've gotten plenty of wins for 500 hours (in my opinion) and I don't even play Fortnite that much (I have around 45 hours and haven't even considered buying the Battle Pass). I don't recommend this game because of the horrible preformance issues. Long loading times (for walls weapons and textures) and crashes are the main problems. I have a decent rig and it still can't handle the problems this game brings.

review: What can be said about PUBG at this point that hasn't already been said a million times? It's a very strange game. It's a disaster but somehow still comes out on top. The game is filled with bugs inconsistencies network issues and very questionable design choices... Yet still ends up being a very addictive and fun experience when it works. This is a game that forces you to run around and loot items for 20 minutes risking to lose it all by a mere bullet to the head by some random guy 1 km away who had more luck finding a sniper than you did. It can be infuriating but also very satisfying.The game relies on tension. You know that if you die you could lose it all. Maps are very open so you can never be sure if someone is watching you or not lining you up on their corsair as you're frantically rushing away from the border that'll cause you a lot of damage you can't afford to deal with. Being dropped into a huge playfield with 99 other people and praying you (or your group of friends) come out on top can be very nerv wrecking but also very intense. The fights you do win gives you a feeling a lot of other games can't and I think it's this feeling that manages to keep the game engaging and keeps players coming back.You'll probably hate a lot about this game. I know I do. But what it gets right it gets right very well.

review: Very good game! Just need to be litlle bit more optimized. Everything else for the early access game is literally perfect (at least in my opinion). I'd recommend everyone to buy this game even for solo players because you have the option to be paired with another random person if you want to play duo or squad!EDIT After few months i've decided to revise my positive review. After all these months game still feels like it's in early access. Optimization is sh*t there are still many glitches and also they implemented skins for weapons which doesn't suit this style of game (it's not cartoonish style game like so that it fits the it's style!) they took idea from the games like fortnite and few other games!Also this game has one of the worst ever net codes that i've ever faced in a game and their servers are sh*t (i have fiber optics internet so the problem is not on my internet side). AND MOST IMPORTANT thing this game was made in wrong engine which limits the how the game works/plays (both server side and game side).All in all this game is SH*T and i wouldn't recommend it to anyone.I have a lot of gameplay in this game so i know what i am talking about.

review: Is it fun?Yes but if you get unlucky with loot it may feel frustrating.Does it have problems?Yes the optimization is still horrible servers aren't great oh and there are micro transactions.Micro transactions in an early access game?Yes because the devs got addicted to their sales figures and decided to supplement it with some good old micro transactions. Thankfully they're purely cosmetic and don't affect gameplay in a signifiicant way.What's the gist of the game?Well you parachute onto a random location then you have to loot randomly generated weapons and try to kill each other.So it's a battle royal game?Yes and no Bluehole you don't own a Genre and if anything you're not the first Battle Royal game on the block so stop acting like the fine bros and improve your game.Should I get this game?If you like battle royal games (Minecraft Survival Games servers 2012 PlayerUnknows's Battle Royal Mod for Arma 2015 H1Z1 KotK 2016 Tom Clancy's the Division Survival 2016) sure but if I were you I'd just play fortnight and come back when the game is fully released.

review: I have had a lot of fun in this game and it was worth the sale price I paid for early access. That said it still needs polish IMO before it should exit early access.My chief complaint is that at the start a player is often at the mercy of the random item generator which seems to like to generate multiple copies of the same 2 or 3 items in a cluster of buildings. I don't expect to see every building have 1 long gun 1 shotgun and 1 pistol but 3 buildings don't need 8 quick pistol clips yet no pistols. That said there have been a few rounds that I started with nothing and managed to slink into the top 40 before finally finding an unused long gun and that felt like an accomplishment. But those are rare cases I usually just get sniped without ever having any means of defense.Other than that I think there are either lag or hack issues as I have either been shot through walls or my computer never rendered my opponent rounding the corner (I'm on gigabit fiber so I don't think the lag is on my end).So while I recommend the game go in knowing it still needs refinement for a good balanced experience.

review: This is my review after 24 hours of gameplay.Pro Realistic shooting you really feel like shooting a real weapon you need to lead and calculate the angle based on the distance of the target Great sound for weapons Decent to meh graphics (come on it's 2017 you have unreal engine at hand...) Big map Vehicles to travel faster You can play with friends in duo's and squadsCons Very bad optimisation the FPS is low and there are frame drops even on very good computers and this is a very important factor given the fact we're talking about a shooter The tick rate is just bad too bad... Again we're talking about a shooter... The competitive system is not very well done I don't feel like competing for a place in the world I would rather like some division like system or something similar A lot of bugs but I will not lower it's rating for this because it's still early accesThere are good things and bad things about the game but overall it's fun to play even better when you play with some friends. I consider this game the best "Battle Royale" at the moment mainly because it doesn't exist something better at the moment there could be something better but apparently the big studios do not care enough to make one. The good part of this game is that it has a capable team behind it that until now seemed to really care about their product so we may have a surprise after it's full release. I look forward to its full release to see how things evolve let's hope for the best.

review: This game is really fun. I switched from H1Z1 to PUBG and it's helluva fun. But one thing that plagues this entire game is perfomance issues. I thought I was the only one experiencing this but after some research alot of players are experiencing this. When I land most of the houses aren't rendered properly they look like that someone made them from clay. There is no collision whatsoever and I can't loot what's inside so there's a high chance that I won't be able to defend myself because I didn't have any weapon! Another huge problem is whenever I open up inventory by pressing TAB the game freezes for few seconds or more. Performance while playing Solo is alright but playing Duos or Squad is impossible. Because of the huge FPS drops and whenever I want to shoot an enemy the game freezes for two seconds or so. I tried all sorts of fixes from typing in launch commands to tweaking commands in the game folder. It looks like that it helped a little bit but I'm still experiencing the problems. At this point I can't recommend this game.EDIT So the performance got a bit better. I dont get FPS drops that often and the game doesnt freeze when I open the inventory. But one thing that blows my horn is that the buildings STILL DONT RENDER. I CAN WALTZ RIGHT THROUGH THEM LOOT THEM AND WALK OUT THROUGH THE WALL!!!!!!!! A guy was in a building a building that wasn't even rendered at all it was just empty space. I could see him whole it gave me sort of a wallhack which made it unfair. I dont want to get called out a hacker just because of game related glitches and bugs.Edit (as of latest update) After the major update the game performance is even worse the buildings are not fixed whatsoever my game begun to crash freeze for few minutes. I don't even want to play this game anymore.Edit (Major update)Performance got wayyyyy better buildings started to properly load new map is my favourite because not only it does not lag that much but also it's a new experience and a smaller map which is why it's action packed. Now I would recommend buying it.

review: Bought it and it is very fun but it has alot of issues. I'm judging this on 1.0 launch. Chinese people are on most server so it's best to hide early game so you stop lagging and can actually kill people after they all die. $30 is not a bad price for a game honestly but it looks like it's gonna have microtransactions if it doesn't already. Sure they are just "cosmetic" but in a $30 game is kinda low. Csgo is like $7 and I can kinda understand why it has that but $30 is pushing it. I never played or followed this game til today and it could be hard if you forget to unplug you xbox controller like me so when you look at stuff or try to do anything it says press B and you are like WTF nothing is happening and then you get killed by a chinese guy with a crowbar. These are the only issues I have so far after 2 hours. I hope they fix the servers or at least lock chinese people out of US servers. Let them play in Asia EU and other servers. I get man is risking his life to play PUGB but that shouldn't be my problem and it shouldn't be anybody else's. If they fix servers get it if they don't it won't be worth it. A game like this with laggy servers will kill this game.EDIT 6/22/18 They have a Battlepass in a $30 game. In a f2p game like fortnite thats acceptable not in a paid game. Don't buy this. They haven't fixed any bugs or ways to cheat in a year. They want people to cheat get caught and get banned so they buy like 50 new keys and keep on cheating. Why because they make more money that way.

review: Despite all the issues regarding cheaters performance issues and the developers' lack of timely effort to address these problems since the game was released I think it's a really fun game that will make you wanting to play more. Every round the outcome will always be different which makes it such an addictive game. Playing on a team (duo/squad) makes it a lot mroe fun and engaging and recommend playing with friends. Playing with randoms however you bear the risk of teaming up with non english speakers (especially players within the AS region) who just love spamming the mic with Mandarin in whatever PC cafe they are in. Annoying as . For those looking to purchase the game please keep up to date with the latest reviews and see what fixes have already been implemented or lack thereof and make your decision then. See you on the battlegrounds!Edit Came here to change my recommendation. Too many cheaters. I'm not talking once in a while. It's gotten to the point where at LEAST half of your games there will be a guarantee hacker. This needs to be fixed immediately and very sad for the developers to have this problem for so long.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: After over 200 hours played in this game I can say that its most glaring issue is the gunplay.It's like RNGzus decides whether or not to bestow upon you bullets that will actually hurt people from match to match.I'm constantly putting shots on targets who are both near and far who are not even moving that leave me with no indication of whether or not the shots actually affected them. Yes there's the blood splatter that pops up when you successfully hit someone but what I'm saying is that I find quite often that it's not present even though I'm hitting people. I've put people down many times without seeing a single blood spray at both close and far range.This is a huge problem because I'm constantly second guessing myself as to whether or not I'm actually hitting my target. Since I can never be sure I'm hitting my target due to this I find myself getting extremely mad and frustrated believing that I'm not even hurting a person standing 10 feet away from me while unloading an entire magazine that realistically probably wouldn't connect with every shot anyway but should be more than enough to kill a person.I like the sense of realism that comes with a yes or no did I hit my target judging by the blood spray system but when it's so inconsistent it drains all of the fun out of the game. Many other FPS games include a system that leave no doubt about striking a target I.E. hit markers. I'd much rather have the blood spray system but if the developers can't make it work then maybe they should give us a band aid hit marker system until this is fixed.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Extremely fun game... usually. 2 things would make consistantly funner for me (although neither of these will apply to many players) #1 Region lock so many non english speakers on the NA server from 2 00 am 8 am. The last 2 games I got intentionally team killed after 30 minutes of play if they aren't going to region lock it I'd like to have the option to change my name to something Asian for those early morning hours seems many don't like Americans.. and some Americans are complete dikks to them (verbally) but typically don't team kill (I suppose if you play with friends this issue will work in your favor). There is a report player option that shows up about 5% of the time but never has when I was actually team killed. #2 I play with an xbox controller I'd like to be able to adjust sensitivty of the joystick it's waaay too fast when aiming (so I have a mouse on my couch arm for when I need to aim). After I die the spectate player option only shows up about 5% of the time.Changed review to negative b/c I just got a forum ban for posting an "unneccessary thread" in the off topic section of their forum.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Got into game. Once I landed I was able to walk through every building in sight. They looked like half formed blobs barely resembling buildings. After trying to go up what I can only assume was a ramp. I fell through the floor and was stuck with half my body int he ramp. When I exited the game throuhg the menu the game froze my pc and after about 2 min I was able to get to see my desktop but the game was STILL running. It was hogging 96% of my ram thus making everything move very slowly. I was unable to close it from task manager so I manually shutdown my pc. The only good thing about this game is the cleaning session it sparked once I shut down my computer.EDIT Second game.... Crashed after clicking play on main menu.EDIT Continues to disappoint. You will literally ahve a clear shot at a target standing still and will somehow hit the ground in front of you or some part of the window and I'm 2/5 games for crashing with blob buildings.

review: I can honestly say that I have had truly unforgettable experiences with this game.I have had periods where for days I was just getting destroyed left and right moments where the frustration was so intense that it made me want to cry.but then again I had these games where I got a victory that seemed so impossible considering the odds in that round. The sheer pressure I felt me the lone survivor the whole team watching the tension that builds up more and more towards the end all released at once. Moments like that gave me a feeling of happiness like I have never experienced before.I understand that there are issues with the game and that many are frustrated for that reason.But the game itself to me is a groundbreaking achievement in the videogames industry.

review: Straightforward Review I am writing this review as of 24 hours of recorded in game time. Don't judge too much pls XP.PUBG is fun and i really mean FUN while retaining the "challenging" aspect of a competitive game. The exciting feeling when playing this game makes it fun storming into houses getting stormed finding nothing but trash finding level 3 armour and helmet in one spot airdrops landing right above you sniping random people running head first into a bullet hard carrying teammates feeding getting high on discord(to my own embarassment) etc etc.Stealth aim prediction game sense positioning strategy teamwork coordination and even luck are all factors that PUGB tests you in (maybe not luck because that cannot be tested from person to person its random)But definitely play this game with your friends because that makes it more fun by 10 folds.Despite the occasional hacker mopping the floor with my entire team (by occasional i mean like 1 out of 20 games) i still think PUBG is worth my money. Ironically i didn't want to buy it at first but my friends convinced me so thanks guys! No regrets!

review: 110% Mediocre. You will spend your dollars on 15 minutes of looting per 2 minutes of combat. Landing "hot" is a joke when the games net code is non existent. You will be shot by players in which on their screen lean out and shoot but on yours be completely behind an object. You will find the recoil of the guns the spray and overall handling to be completely and utterly broken and to me at this point so stale and unable to work with. You will get shot by enemies in buildings you cant see in or shoot in due to some prison bars. You will spend 3k on a PC and still hate this game. Ive spent so much time and i honestly cant say i like or even slightly enjoy the game anymore. New crates no new guns no updates to optimization no road maps no blogs or anything. This will be the game that ruins BR IF they do not get their together. Simply if you like having fun and enjoy pc gaming for the experience and to dominate this game is far from that. A since recent billion dollar company this game is simply a complete joke guys. The hours Ive put into this game are solely from making my money back almost 3 times now making money off this game for free steam games is the only reason you should ever play this. This is not competetive this game takes zero skill this game is underdeveloped and over hyped.

review: 07/04/2017I very thouroghly enjoy this game. It is definately more fun with friends however. I recently refunded this because of my poor ping but once that is fixed I will for sure get the game back. I recomend this for anyone who enjoys PVP or arena games.Edit I switched ISP's and re purchased the game. Runs smoothly and at the time of this review have 18 hours logged which isn't much but I have been playing alot recently. Great game overall.03/11/2018Update Despite the massive fluxuation of negative reviews I still hold form to my original opinions on the game. I would recommend it to everyone and anyone with a PC capable of running it and would DEFINATELY recommend this hunk of beauty over the overly hyped and arcade like gameplay of Fortnite. Since the recent update people seem to be complaining of frequent frame drops and delayed item spawns which I have experienced myself despite not having played for quite some time. This issue can be solved with an easy fix and very popular idea of removing the cosmetics spawn alltogether from the loot tables. In case you haven't noticed yet there's a ton of cosmetics in the game with no lack of new additions. As of right now just about every one of those are included in the loot tables. This is obviously a major suspect in the issue of early game performance issues and delayed spawn times. Keeping some of the cosmetics wouldn't be a big issue either but only if there were a small ammount of them and kept at a low priority durring spawns. Another new addition people seem to complain about is the newly implemented emote system. I personally think that it's a great idea and something that we have needed for a while. As unpopular an opinion it may be those are my thoughts. Those who are against use a few common arguments such as "emotes are not needed because it makes the game too much like Fortnite" or "why do we need a system for stupid things like dancing a slow waltz over someone's dead body?" Fortnite's emote system is utter cringe and dumb as hell I agree completely on that argument but Battlegrounds' emote system is different. It's not completely composed of mockery or old trends but rather useful handsignals that can be used to communicate without the need for a mic. Emotes for things like waving surrendering and even nodding in aproval are all included and useful for different scenarios. Ever tried telling your teammate where someone is only to be in two different posistions making your bearings different? There's an emote for pointing so now you can give a more accurate visual instead of saying "that tree over there." So not everything is as bad as some say it is. Overall despite it's issues PUBG is still a very enjoyable game.
