review: Well so I guess I should also write a review about this game...I'll keep it short and simple.The game is ridiculously fun when playing with friends be it duo's or squads. I've made countless memories and had some of the most tense moments in any video game. The learning curve is steep when you are new to the game since you have to get used to the gun mechanics and you will most likely die before you even see who attacked you. But you will find that you keep coming back to it. "Just one more round" or "We can't end the night like this" are just some of the phrases heard during every pub game. But unfortunately these phrases have taken a turn for the worst lately...At the time of writing this review hackers are destroying the game. Most games end by dying at the hands of the most "skilled" players the world of PUBG have ever seen. Be that they can see you through walls or that their aim locks on to you they are everywhere. In my last game I got killed by a guy with a machete in a bulding 100m away from me. He just hacked at the wall (I saw this through the death cam afterwards). Fun. The developers keep on flashing all the awards pubg have won in front of everyone's noses as a selling point but it means nothing. They have milked the cow and are trying to squeeze the last drops out.I have played since early access and the games has had many ups and downs. But the state in which it is lately is ridiculous. DON'T BUY THIS GAME if you are wondering about it. At least not in its current state. It's disgusting. Except if you are a hacker....then I hope you rot somewhere dark and moldy because you are the lowest of lowest among toxic scum in online gaming...seriously...

review: 200 hrs in. Okay plenty addictive and can be very funny. However over 30 million copies on steam 4 million copies on Xbox. That sums up to more than 1 billion dollars. And THIS is what we get after a year of release? Still just 70 developers? Graphics are not impressive but descent. Extremely poor performance from your rather average pc poorly optimized to map design. Rubber band lag flicker lag hard lags ask for it and this game has it for you with its crappy servers. Remember its now V1 0 they are essentially calling it a finished game. Hire more people because it is progressing too slow or at least make an effort into hiring competent people. Next update? Guess what amazing stuff we will get? Emotes. NOBODY asked for that! We must realize that probably a dedicated animator(s) did this but id rather have more versions of reloading an AK vaulting a wall and etc than dumbass dance moves that doesnt belong in the game. ing pathetic Blue Hole. Blue Hole is unfortunately already digging its grave.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is *awesome. On it's merits alone I'd recommend this game to anybody that enjoys first person shooters but is sick of the same CoD / CS GO style action. You drop in via parachute along with 100 other players getting to strategically choose where you start across gigantic maps and then you loot and survive. However the reason I'm writing this review is the same reason that as of this point I would NEVER recommend this game to somebody I liked rampant cheating. With each game consisting of you and nearly 100 other players having even 1% of the population hacking ruins nearly 100% of the matches. Now I've managed to get into some games where I'm unaffected by it and have managed to win 10 or so in the 100 hours I've played it. But for each game I've won I've died 10's of times to people blatantly cheating.Though the developer says they're "working on it " nothing seems to actually be working. Over the past 5 months or so the hacking has gotten just down right out of control. I can't tell you how frustrating it is to get 20 minutes into a game with multiple kills a great load out and awesome end game position to have a hacker's crosshairs just magically jump to your head when your clearly not visible on their screen or have somebody shoot you with a scopeless gun from halfway across the map when you're lining up a sniper shot with an 8x or 15x scope. This game has turned into something less about surviving the game as it was created and more about getting lucky to not run into hackers within the first 15 minutes.Overall I love what the publishers are doing with the genre and the game itself but it really shows how inadequate or unwilling they are to solve any of these issues ruining an otherwise incredible experience. Ruined so much so that again I'd save your money if you're thinking of buying this and wait until when you type "PUBG Cheating" into Google you don't see a million horror stories and actually see signs of progress from the developer.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I absolutely love this game from the intense firefights to the overall development of the game. now i know the game is getting bad reviews and well thats unavoidable but despite the negatives i think this game has so much potential. i agree the game could be optimized better or the servers could go through some better maintenance but im not going to let such small trivial things bug me about an early access game. its going to be buggy and its going to have problems and i cant guarentee the best experience all the time but for what this game is and what its bringing to the table is outstanding. i feel given some time this game will shine for years all we have to do is be patient bluehole is doing their best with what they have for an indie development company with only around 200 employees and not all of them are working on this game. I would in its current state give this game a solid 7/10 only being due to the optimization if it was better optimized it would be a definite 9/10. other than that the game has great gameplay and a pretty high replay value if you are actual willing to get better at the game instead of complaining and i would most definitely recommend it.

review: It was a fun game when it first came out New concept to a shooter game the idea of looting was unique to me and my friends and the rush of winning your first few games Oh man nothing compared to it. However as time went on this game showed it's ugly true colors. The incompetency of it's development team the rampant hacking and ping abuse (as well as the Dev's solemn resolve not to do anything about it) and the PLETHORA of bugs and glitches de sync the consistent addition of micro transactions rather than addressing the pressing issues at hand and just overall poor game coding has turned this game from an enjoyable new shooter to a living nightmare. Not to mention the HORRIBLE optimization they have done I run a GTX 1070 Ti with 16 GB of RAM and an I5 8600k and consistently with minimum settings on my graphics I get horrible frame drops in fights and even just generally running through the map trying to outrun the poorly designed "blue zone" and the completely useless "red zone". Streamers across the board are abandoning this game for much better renditions and outtakes And with good reason. I wouldn't in my life recommend this game to anyone. After about 400 hours I have called it quits on this game and will not be playing it anymore until the development team and BlueBalls studio learns how to fix their broken game.

review: It is finally time for my review of PUBG now. Mostly only because I'm currently bored. Well here we go stay with me.There's 10 people alive you finally made it to top 10. The circle is quite small but still bigger then your p****. You dont let that bother you though. You hear gunshots all around you not sure where most of them are coming from. You look left and sure enough there's a guy sitting on the tree next to you. You look at him and send his fate of another loss right at him. You begin to think to yourself was it worth killing "adirtysock" maybe he just wanted to win like you did. Either way you can't let it bother you as the next circle is already closing in. You crawl on the groung knowing that the other 5 people alive are doing the exact same thing. All is quiet and for a brief second you thought there was some sort of universal understanding that no one will kill each other. Then of course "moistwheat" decides to ruin everything and kill someone with a grenade. Then there was 4. The circle begins to move in again forcing everyone even closer together. In your head you start to see things moving. Of course we all know these are normally your typical swaying bushes but not this time. You fire and miss most of your shots since you can't see him that well. He fires back and hits you a couple good times. Then you remember that you picked up that energy drink and some aspirin earlier so all is well now. That's a true champions breakfast. It is now down to 3. You begin to think "I can do this I can really do this" but then you see something you could have never predicted. A man by the name of "QiShinGiyao" takes out the other dude. All sorts of fears run through your head knowing how many Chinese hackers have gotten banned but not today. You move right to a tree and it seems as if this guy cannot miss a shot. You first aid up and take a drink. You crawl on to the ground to a rock that was to your right. He didn't notice you. You pop up and aim. This is the moment you've been waiting for. You fire 2 shots and all you see is "WINNER WINNER CHICKEN DINNER" and you've done it. You hear a mans voice though and you find out that the guy you killed was just a dude from Wyoming who took a break from Fortnite. All your fears are gone. You have accomplished the impossible. *Hops in another game and gets punched death* What can I say its bitter sweet.10/10 would recommend for for fun with intense moments of rage.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game still has some pretty serious flaws and should not have launched from early access. While it can be an insanely good time with friends and on your own the glaring issues are starting to become too much after approaching 400 hours of gameplay.Early game lag makes the game unplayable for some lower end pc's have trouble loading into the map areas of the map will straight kill you with falling damage or something while driving you'll hit invisible walls or small rocks that catapault you to your death shotguns being bugged since 4 months ago with no change but the biggest problem across all modes of game play is cheating.The blatant hacking and cheating that the creator of the game seems VERY standoffish to address is nightmarish. As of the time of this post there are 3 confirmed hackers in the top 10 for US duo first person 5 in first person solos and 4 in squads. Firing through walls loot ESP player ESP aim bots lag switches air drop locations on mini maps no recoil macros from 3rd party programs you name it they got it. And this is only the obvious cheaters.

review: This is a superbly executed first person shooter with tons of replayability. It's got good mechanics good weapons and a "mute all" button for the raging racists that you will probably find in the North American lobbies. Occasionally a game is ruined by hackers but in my experience this is closer to around one in 20 or 30 deaths and is not a deal breaker for me. I am far more likely to die from stupid tactical errors like running across open fields without cover or cowering in a corner while being stalked by someone far better than me. If you can find the game on sale for 20 25 USD it's definitely worth the aggravation lost sleep heart palpitations adrenal overload and general cussing. The only real con at this point is the "point" system. You get a certain amount of points depending on rank damage done and kills. These points can then be redeemed for loot boxes. Before the last update all of these loot boxes were free and you could open them by virtue of the fact that you had enough points to get them in the first place. Now though there are several different types of boxes which are given randomly. Several tiers of these boxes now require that an additional key is purchased in order for you to open them. In essence you earn the right to purchase the box with in game points then you have to buy a key to open them. I will accept this if and only if Bluehole changes its name to "Rusty Brown Hole".

review: Having about 800 hours in the game I think it's time for a real review on it. PROS Solid gunplay Realistic feeling Looks nice if you have a okayish computer I mean the game literally redefined the BR genre of games CONS Bluehole or PUBG corp whichever they prefer is a money grabbing hole of a developer. title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Great Game Rip H1Z1Gunplay and gun variety is so much better than h1z1 tons of different weapons. Attatchments make weapons interesting and create many different styles of play based on what enviroment you are in. Healing is done very well to make sure you cannot spam heal items but also doesn't hang you out to dry for 4 minuits while you slowly heal. Med kits only bring you to 75 health and you need energy drinks pain killers to max your health which give you passive healing overtime. The gun play feels very satisfying compared to h1z1's tap shooting style. You have free reign to spawn in different locations when jumping out of the plane instead of just random spawns. Cars are balanced as it is easy to shoot you out of them but you cant just do a hit and run jumping out of the car at full speed to do hit and runs. If you jump out while the car is moving you risk dying or taking massive damage.The game has some lag and desyncing errors which should be fixed as the game progresses. Be wary if you have a lower end pc this game is not fully optimized yet. The game didn't have as many glitches as I would expect besides dying randomly one time by a door.In conclusion this game is fun. Buy it if you are a fan of h1z1 or other battle royale games buy it. If you are running a lower end pc wait for it to be optimized first. Definentely is an addicting game for you and friends.

review: Play Fortnite people may hate on it but atleast its still fun.There's progression so far I haven't seen any cheaters but I'm sure there are a few but not as many as this game right here. Fortnite is faster paced so games are shorter and don't feel as much of a running simulator. There are some "good" cheaters too though. Several times I joined a game and was queued with a cheater in my group. He dropped all the weapons you could desire with all the attachments you could need. At. The. Start. Of. The. Game. Then he threw a grenade in a corner with him in it making sure he was as far away from us as possible. Left the game to do more immoral good samaritan deeds. Prolly his way of making a statement to the devs. His own rebellion. Take note he isn't the only player like that. As I've said I've had several games like this and several games where the bulllets just keep going through walls. So that says a lot about this game. Fortnite. Its free sure you can't make money off of Fortnite to fuel your addiction of buying games you won't ever finish but its decent and its fun.

review: If ever there was a more unstable and poorly optomized game in PC gaming history I don't remember it.So I played a lot of hours in this game before I decided to write a review. I wanted to give it a more than fair shake given that there is such a large playerbase I thought that it may be possible that it takes time to appreciate and get used to the excentricities/bugs.After a lot of play time I can say that the game is very very poorly optomized lacks basic 101 functionality and is buggy well beyond what is acceptable. The bugginess of this game is beyond what you would expect froma free to play game and is totally unacceptable for a game of the price it is. To make matters worse there are times you can spend as much as an hour trying to get onto a server and the ping times are absurd.Also I'm not sure there is another game I have played that crashes as often as this does. Something else to note is taht the sound is terrible. You'll have no idea whatsoever where sounds are coming from at any moment. You're better off playing without any sound.The only reason this game has any player base at all is the unique concept of the shrinking map. It would be fantastic to see a real game developer come up with a similar concept. Then we would have something beyond this steaming pile of dew dew.Basically here's the deal It started as a great project by a guy who has some serious insight into what can make a great FPS but then they released it early and people liked the idea. Word caught on to a new game with a great concept and more peaple wanted to play it. Soon people were paying full price for a beta (at best) game and then the developers suddenly had absolutely no will or incentive to improve it. Why would they?

review: Aright what's about this game? A talanted dev who created the Battle Royale mods for both Arma 2 3 games and h1z1 t decided to go further and hung out with Bluehole studios to release a standalone game the incarnation of Playerunknown s dreams about an ideal Battle Royal game. What do we got? A world's bestseller full of kids who don't even know that this gameplay concept existed before. A LOT of bugs this game literally runs on bugs. Btw it s the reason for somebody to play this garbage due to having fun by blowing up vehicles when launching them into the window of camper's buildings for example.The serious side poor netcode input delay (esports ready okay) u may check latency tests on the YT channel "battle(non)sense". And everything could have been fine if devs didn t run away with their fresh moneybags. A large project like this needs to be working properly before being released as well as the servers need more performance to hold packet verification but devs decided to throw this part away less load on the networking and now the data can be easily modified in RAM range of game's process and be succesfully sent on the server to synchronize well done. U can even find written classes of game objects to manipulate with on some closed reposes. And as long as it would be like this not any anticheat will help. While lurking for cheat's signature in database the new software will be created over and over again."But oh.. it costs a lot to hold 3kk players this way...". 1% of company's income? Or maybe two? (xd) Anyway if going "esports ready" none of things like that must persist in game.

review: This game has been in maintenance 3 out of the last 5 times I have tried to log in in the past month. If there was a better system for letting a customer who paid money for the game know that I wouldn't be able to log in other that just being confronted with a "servers are busy" message it may be more forgivable. The 2 times I have played lag was a serious issue. I've also been playing since pre release none of my stats get saved pretty much every time I log in my career stats are at zero. It's a fun game when it works but seems like a waste of time and effort here recently. Worth maybe the initial $30 but come on I'm not going to pay $2 to open a chest for purely comsmetic items that may not be something I even care about. Makes the game feel cheap.

review: So despite all the negative things people were saying about cheating sloppy framerates and servers....I went ahead and bought the game anyways. It is quite fun and exhilariting cool concept and looks/sounds pretty dang amazing..yet there is one major thing that just made my blood boil IMMEDIATLY. It isn't cheaters (something that they seem to be trying to take care of at least *but the actual cause is out of their hands*) or framerates (get a better PC mine seems to run perfect on Ultra in 4k....*so again out of their hands*) Or even how sloooooow you gain Battle Points (unless you get 1st place which most causual people probably wont even get CLOSE...*this is on them totally but I can deal with the grind even though it is beacuse they want people to BUY loot crates. I can still deal with it) However when I bought a special loot crate with hard earned Battle Points I tried to open it and it says I have to buy an elecronic "early bird key" to open the lock on the box. ARE YOU FREAKING KIDDING ME?! After supporting this game and paying for it (and even the $30 is a stretch since the game isn's completly working like it should!) I REFUSE to pay another $2.50 EACH CASE to open special loot that isnt clearly labled so!! (might as well just sell the loot box at $2.50 outright and not make it an option to buy with earned points and basically duping players into buying these keys) That is COMPLETE garbage and greedy AF...the game has sold quite a bit yet they still want more .....anyone involved should be ashamed of themselves!! I am seriously astonished that a company would be so petty as to electronically lock loot that can be bought with earned points! Or that people still buy into these micro transactions and perpetuate this (that is now trying to be sneakily forced in this case)

review: I absolutely cannot recommend this game. In early access I could understand some of the various bugs and glitches and occasional crashing but even upon release the game has barely improved and in some ways gotten worse. For one there is the lack of region lock which puts me in lobbies with chinese hackers of which get first place every game. They ruined the already bad driving mechanics (cars lirerally float after hitting a hill as if they weigh less than a feather and when turning you might as well be on a ing ice rink). Running into a 2 foot tall plant at 3 mph takes a 5th of your health away. But the worst for me is the complete innacuracy and seemingly random damage model on weapons. I lose gun battles to fresh drops when im wearing level 2 armor and have watched a hailstorm of bullets from my gun go into them. I dropped in with an enemy who had a 1911 an I had a KAR98 before he saw me I got 2 shots into his chest and he ended up killing me. This game is total and complete trash with seemingly no effort put into it whatsoever and its getting ier with every update.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have played this game since it came out but it is getting worse and worse. Gunplay is inconsistent as all hell servers are laggy as and the game's new map is total and utter garbage. It is actually like an H1Z1 map which doesnt fit this game at all. Relies way too much on vaulting. Only good part is that they fixed it to give us 50/50 so that we only have to suffer 50% of the time. But there are no preferences or anything for maps. I only want to play Erangel not too many cities smaller map more fun and less time per game usually. This new map takes 6 ing minutes for first circle and the map is just too ing big. It is honestly a terrible experience. Until they either give us preferences or add in a lot more maps this game will continue to fail. I just don't know how so many people can play it and enjoy it especially solos.

review: December 30th 2017.0500 Hours.Erangel The Chinese have invaded. Supplies and morale are low.I've given my last pack of lucky strikes to my squadmates to ease their worry if only a little.I tell them to press themselves a little flatter in that foxhole fire until dry and go down fighting.I think of home.On a serious note PUBG was fun when it was fair.It is no longer the PUBG I played just a few short months ago.The chinese playerbase is so overwhelming and full of hackers. I have yet to have a game where I do not see some arbitary Chinese/English/ string of numbers combination of a name rack up 10+ kills in mere minutes in the kill feed.Sadly there are too many players to allow the devs to implement an effective anti cheat. The need to get a leg up on people is so great there will always be cheats.As much as I love this game for the high replay value. The unwelcomed community of Chinese cheaters makes it a no from me. Don't fall for the hype you see from videos. Those are cherry picked moments. I cannot suggest anybody buy this game in it's current "full released" state. Too many chinese players who hack and abuse desync. Bullet physics made worse. Vehicle physics are borked Loot tables are still terrible.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Edit So finally they've done enough to earn a really favorable review with me. My only recommendation is never go in to 3rd person. Learn the game in FPP and only play there. If you go TPP it's filled with all wingding names and hackers. Not the "oh my god how did he get me that's so cheap" hackers. Like the kill your whole squad with single shots in less than 4 seconds hackers. They've reduced the numbers so I've heard but they're virtually impossible to find in FPP. Buy the game it's a ton of fun great gun play funny rag dolls and vehicle glitches that aren't even annoying they're more hilarious than anything when they happen.

review: Ok so I have quite a few hours in the this game.Used to play religiously with friends everyday for quite awhile. When I first had found out about the game i was watching a video made by Jack frags where he pushes the game to its absolute max in 4k! The game in that video almost a year ago is a far cry from what the game originally had looked like.Now its like theres a weird static from the foliage that makes the game feel broken. I understand they needed to optimize the textures for all of the in game assets but you could have at least made them look less visually busy.not sure if these issue will ever be addressed but who knows.The gun play has changed drastically from how it used to be. guns used to act more or less like how you would think of those weapons.But with the addition of more weapons. And more amour. (I swear theres like 3 pieces of armour for ever starting player in the game.) The gunplay has been reduced to a contest untill you get shot in the head. or one of your games crashes. the new map is good. the desert map was attrocious. personally had this issue where going to my scope would cause the game to go to 15 frames or desync completely durring critical moments. This game is STILL in EA no matter what the devs say. it was never ready for release.I think my favourite moment was the annoucment of the games release and we all laughed cause we knew tha the game was not ready for release let alone a BETA. This game used to feel like a gritty fight to the death with gorgeous visuals and scary heart pumping fire fights.But now it feels like a shell of its former self.With their exciting ideas for expanding the experience boiling down to being a rip off of the battlepass of fort I have a hard time getting back into this game. And its not even because of all those things. its because the devs knew the whole time what we where asking for but they didnt dare ackowledge it untill they could come out with this PR stunt to give them more light compared to their competitors.I wanted to be excited for this game It was and may be again but i'm not ready to lend them any hope in hell of me waiting for them to finish.I don't regret my time playing this game. but in reality it was about 200 hours of general frustration 200 hours of looting and running from the circle. 50 hours of spotting enemies and deciding wether or not I should engage. about 30 hours of fire fights. 8 hours of waiting for servers to refresh only for the devs to push it back two hours twice same day after promising to give themselves more time so that WOULDN'T HAPPEN. and the rest of the time was either getting shot in the back killed from not being able to hear an enemy between a friend and me while being able to hear my friend foot steps clear as day. I could litterally go on for hours about all the crap this game has. but instead I bid thee fairwell until the game gets fixed in a few years till then i'll play insurgency and bf5
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

But since it is clearly too much to ask for you to do something to stop all the hackers over a 4 month period because of the existance of the crates then you don't deserve to have people play the game.The mentality of let's do crates and encourage hacking but not switch it off until we can handle the problem is utterly stupid. Will not be returning to the game because the customer does not matter only money does.

review: Short to the point version get fortnite im told its better when this game was EA it was good. that should tell you all you need to know. This was a good game it wasnt perfect nor was it a "gold mine". I would call it a rough uncut gem that with a little time and effort could be something special. then 1.0 came along and it showed us that even something that could be good no should be good can be run into the ground with bad judgement. Me and my friends spent alot of nights in this game we cryed we cheered we even managed to get a chicken dinner and we cursed alot. oh my did we curse. but it was fun buggy but fun. but as the fame and money came in the problems seemed ignored. people raised an eyebrow at the lootboxes you need to buy keys for the slow decline of cosmetic items of interest unless your shelling out money. this wasnt to say you couldnt get stuff without paying but lets face it how white T shirts and red Vests do you need.We ended up playing for about 2 rounds when 1.0 came along and we quit after that. havent touched it since. The rubber banding on the desert map was so bad it wasnt even funny worse still that i saw on the forum that the play testers had told bluehole this was a problem and it still was pushed for release. i dont know if it was true but considering how bluehole has managed this show i would not be surprised at all. oh sorry not Bluehole i forgot they tryed the "if we change our name people wont know it was us" trick. Its the PUBG Corporation now. my bad. all in all im told fortnite is better and we're planning on moving over to that when we can be bothered. look how long it took me to write this. So the good it made battleroyale popular in the mainstream pushed other developers to do something and in one case do it better.I won a chicken dinner solo and we won a chicken dinner in team mode.The bad 1.0 was rushedI "reviewed" itif you made it this far why did you read it? im not good at reviews no doubt someones going to complain about format spelling Your still reading....stop. now.

review: A potentially good game ruined by ABYSMAL map design atrocious optimization apathetic developers and some of the worst controls to ever touch an fps. Seriously you have to actively fight the game to get your character to respond to movement in all but the most simple gestures... such as running in a straight line. This game wouldn't be worth a look if it was free much less as a $30 game. I guess elaboration is in order.The map design in this game is unspeakably terrible. The maps are designed specifically to be overly dangerous to traverse and require inhuman spacial awareness to remotely stand a chance of retaliation to an attacker. The random nature of the game is the least of its worries with 3 or even 4 story buildings populating dense cities that reward cheap play and pacivity. The game's optimization or lack thereof is barely worthy of meme status. Anything less than having the game installed on an SSD with the strongest graphics options available will punish the user with low FPS stuttering pop in late loading textures pop in lighting effects and shadows and a game that is a buggy unresponsive mess for the first 2 minutes of the match. The Xbox one version is almost comically terrible and is completely unplayable.PUBG corp does not pay mind to the state of the game unless said state is related to microtransactions.The controls are a joke. This is the Bubsy 3D of FPS this is the Knuckles Chaotix of the modern era. Performing an action more simple than walking on the floor has hideous delay and slow muddy physics. You are not in control you are dragging your character across the map while their feet happen to move by pure coincidence. This is a repeat of Dayz. Don't bother.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I honestly WANT to love this game. I enjoy the Battle Royale concept and this game has the best gunplay out of all the BRs I've tried and tested up to this point. Unfortunately the developers who created this game have a LONG way to go when it comes to optimization community approval and just generally making this game what it has EVERY ability to be.There are quite a few issues plaguing this game in it's current state. The optimization needs an overhaul. Frame drops desync rampant exploitation of known glitches you name it they've got it. I have avoided writing a review on this game up to this point because they were doing better about updating the game weekly and fixing SOME of the optimization issues seen in the past. I really thought the developers were starting to get to a point where they could give the community what the community wanted. Now however the developers have announced that this is the second week we will see no updates.I can't give a recommendation for this game in it's current state and that's unfortunate. When this game DOES work it works very very well. The gameplay and the graphics are great and I enjoy playing the game quite a bit however if you aren't ready to deal with a large amount of cheating/glitching/bugging/crashing don't buy/install this game just yet. Give it time and hope (like I have) that the developers will get their resources together and make this game GREAT.Last thing to toss into this review Many have already mentioned this but it deserves repetition. Bluehole is currently charging $30 for this game. They also have multiple in game crates/keys/cosmetic items that cost money. So you have to ask yourself with how much money they are bringing in from this game HOW have they not dedicated some of that to hiring a team with enough experience to FIX the bugs and FIX the cheating.I honestly hope they make this game more playable and more enjoyable. I'd hate to see this game lose it's potential due to developers being unwilling/unable to fix well known issues. Fingers crossed...
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is good and has some brilliant mechanics but lacks in a few areas.First of all I'll go over what I like. This game builds off the classic battle royale concept (devised by player unknown himself back in arma 3) and turns it into a game that is actually really fun.It does this by incorporating a decent amount of customisation the fact that it's easy to get into servers and that the gunplay is really fun. The graphics are ok and effects like blur on your sights are a touch that help build realism. Another thing is that the ballistics of weapons are actually quite realistic eg 5.56 bullets shoot faster than 7.62 but do a little less damage they are also quieter. This close attention to detail can make the difference between a winning shot or a bullet stopping short.Now the bad. So for starters for some people the game will start but will freeze when loading a game. This happened to me but I reinstalled it and it works fine now. Dunno why.Another thing is the.... Below expected level of optimisation that forces some people into using low level graphics settings or downscaling. This isn't really a problem for me as I have a decent pc but if you have a sub 500 laptop then expect to be dropping frames more often that you'd like. A gameplay issue I have found is that the rifles are zeroed to 100m (not sure about the pistols) and this makes accurate short ranged shooting slightly frustrating if you are trying to shoot through small horizontal slits or such.Now the big question pubg or fortnite? Personally i prefer pubg because I prefer more realistic games(it takes around 3 or 4 rifle shots to kill someone) but if you are more of a casual gamer then this might not be for you. That being said lots of casual gamers who play this end up really enjoying it and having a lot of fun.All in all this game takes practice and in order to do well you need patience and mastery of the controls (for example I once died thinking a car was out of fuel but I was really in the wrong seat the change seat control is ctrl + the no. of the seat you want to change to) but once you get used to how it works and start thinking from a more realistic standpoint you enjoy it a lot more than you would otherwise.

review: After the long wait for this game to leave its beta stages I decided it's time to buy this. I have played 5 hrs and still playing. I initially went into this game with a bad taste in my mouth after reading a slew of comments good and bad. I came to the realization years ago that the modding community for online games were going to severly impact my enjoyment that I get from online games like this and GTA V. Playing this game on anything other than Solo without friends is almost unplayable unless you speak forign languages as there is no region locking in place. Once you drop with your team you will most likely be shot on sight by your own team. With that said I enjoy playing this on both my XBOX One X and my PC. It gives me countless hours to yell at my Tv / Monitor. I have always been a fan of tactical games. If I could give any advice in the further development of this game it would be Must have some sort of region locking in place to make it a fair and level playing ground for all of the user base because comunication is key. Put a system in place for bad sport players. If this game is going to use micro transactions for cosmetic atire then adjust the BP to crate price so you dont feel like grinding is to over whelming. Add more choices to the charactor customization so we can feel like we own the charactor for that immersion factor. Overall I would give this game a 3 out of 5 stars. The game is addicting. Hours will pass by and you wont even realize it. The game ddoes an excelent job of roping you in to saying one last match and 10 more go by. I cant wait to see future updates. Hopefully the Devs hear their players and make the changes to the region locking. I feel that will play a huge roll in the life of this game as there will be other games that will come to market with the same premise and if that region locking isn't put into place alot of this games player base will flock to the better choice. With all that said Go Get Those Chickin Dinners!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is one of my favorite games since its BETA release in 2017. Every fight is differnet and requires quick thinking and being fast on the trigger all the time. I highly recommend this game to anyone looking for a fast paced shooter or people who are looking to improve their skills. I havent ran into these so called Chinese hackers everyone is runing into recently. (or atleast that I have seen). The one problem i am having so far is these new locked crates. I dont play CSGO for that reason because I felt i should have a reward for saving up my points to buy a crate and not have to pay a 2.50 USD paywall for a key to unlock said crate. Of course there are still problems with the devs who seem to add more crates rather than fixing the issuses at hand. My girlfriend love playing together but the problem is that her 970 will barely run the game on low settings. With the game mim requirements stating as of 02/22/2018 say it requires a Geforce 660 or better.Need to fix issuses with lag and mim requirements but fun on a 1060 or better. 8.5/10

review: Just got my first Chicken Dinner after close to 40 hours. Don't let all the hacker talk sway you not as bad as they say (or maybe I'm just lucky or haven't seen them who knows). Don't be fooled though getting good takes time patience and learning from your mistakes. Incredibly tense gameplay. Play with headphones!! Everything and I mean EVERYTHING makes a noise and sometimes it can be the difference between life and a frustrating death.All of this said the game is far from perfect. There are a few lag issues especially at the start of matches. All of the guns have a decent learning curve this is not just a point and shoot type of game. You WILL get killed by people you can't see but have a perfect bead on you and there WILL be matches where you spend 20mins getting kitted out only to be sniped by said person mentioned earlier. That is just the type of game this is. It is hard to recommend this game to everyone but this is deffinetly a unique experience that shouldn't be missed.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've had to change my review since I last posted it in August. This game has gone downhill since then but still remains enjoyable. Hackers are somewhat rampant absolutely aggravating bugs still exist and there are numerous issues with the game in general but I still keep coming back. Why? Because this is hands down the best experience you can have with friends. I never find myself playing solos in this game but the tactical decisions you can make with a few buddies in discord is astonishing. Out of my 226 hours I've currently played maybe 10 of those have been spent on solo games and that was just me dicking around. Solos yield about as much joy as putting a toothpick under your big toenail and kicking a concrete wall but Duos and Squads on the other hand are pure fun to play.One genuine flaw between all game types though is the bugs and server glitches. The better half of the time I don't find myself blaming me for my death and it feels like the server or game cheated me out of surviving. Sometimes the hit detection can be ridiculous and the movement can feel like a clunky mess but here's hoping it gets fixed by the end of this year.Overall I do recommend this game for the sole reason that I've managed to get over 200 hours of enjoyment out of it. I feel like once the actual release hits on December 12th many things will be fixed and it will be a much more enjoyable experience.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I was really hoping that when I bought this 3 days ago that some of the problems had been adressed. I was putting off buying it untill I saw noticable improvements in the Steam reviews. Unfortunately I wasted my $30. Granted I've played 9 hours so perhaps I've just had a consistent run of crap luck .Hackers are a problem. When I've got someone's genitals in the barrel of my 12 gauge shotgun and they don't die from the shot that's a problem. I could go on but that would get repetitive.Lag is a problem. I play on the NA servers and while I live out in the middle of nowhere I've never had as much of a problem with lag on any other game as I've had with this game. I would say 80% of my games have had lag issues at some point. For a game that's made so much money you'd think that some of that revenue would have went into improving the basic infrastructure of the game. Especially as the whole thing is dependent on players being able to play against each other.Those are just a couple of issues I have with this game and why I wouldn't recommend it. I'll admit my setup isn't optimal for PUBG (or really most games for that matter) but I've been in massive fleet battles in EVE Online and had less problems than I have had with PUBG. I'll keep trying (in part out of an odd combination of masochism and boredom) but I'm not holding out hope that it'll get better in the near future.

review: TL DRStay away from this game. Don't get tempted by streamers and promo material the game is far from finished has a myriad of unaddressed bugs since Early Access and provides more frustration than enjoyment. Greene and "PUBG Corp" (BlueHole) are unreliable breaking promises and clearly protecting vested interests such as streamers rather than consumers.Definitely not recommended not even if it's on sale.Also the reason for my high amount of gametime despite the negative review I'm playing selling the crates to get my 30 back. After that I'll uninstall it. That is how bad I rate the game.Long versionGame has been released Dec 2017 after 8 months of Early Access together with X box release.It's inconceivable for me as to how such a decision was made. The game is still laughably detrimental to the intended enjoyment it should provide FPS stability and performanceUnstable. Framerate hikes during firefights creating too much variability to adapt and improve. In a game where spotting enemies from far away is key this becomes an important hindrance. Too much style over substance.LootingFrustrating beyond words. Tense situations force you to loot as fast as possible and gain the upperhand but that's incredibly hard when looting feels laggy the item boxes are extremely big causing you to pick up unintended items and arranging attachments on weapons can be a real mess.Additionally I cannot fathom what went through BlueHole's mind to put CLOTHING / GAS CANISTERS as loot in the game. Nobody is interested in those items nobody loots them. They occupy actually useful item slots (such as weapons ammo gear or attachments) and arguably seem more prevalent than the aforementioned utilities. NO ONE loots those things let alone uses them.RNGProbably the keyword for this game pretty much defines the whole experience. You will have cases where you're frantically running through seven buildings to eventually find a P93 (weak handgun) as your only protection against that fully geared guy who's been chasing you with an AR.GameplayExtremely clunky. Movement feels like Arma with a mediocre improvement to gunplay. Your character feels heavy and can sometimes be hard to control (or as desired). The weapon recoil feels solid sometimes overdone (such as the AK). Getting a kill can be very satisfying as that little red personal killfeed can give you a nice dopamine fix after a pumping situation.Driving is questionable and sometimes buggy. It passes as OK however the amount of vehicles is infuriatingly low. There should definitely be more as running to the other side of the map with the blue zone on your heels (literally) is and will always be aggravating.The blue circle of death is incredibly annoying and frustrating. The idea is good and solid but the execution is poor. The game also incentivises camping more than actual run and gunning. Can be tedious at times and will more often than not be boring.Red zone is absolutely horrible mostly depreciated by the community but still present by the infinite wisdom of BlueHole and Greene. Somehow. At times you'll feel like it's specifically hunting you and stifling your progression in the game.NetcodeA veritable travesty to the FPS genre. It's bad. I can't find the word horrible horrendous horrid ish downright atrocious... Just record your game and compare it to the replays based on what the server records. You'll see how laughably BAD it is. 18 Hz tickrate because they can't handle more. This is THE main showstopper without question.Oh be prepared to have non native people playing on your server with high ping. You'll die behind cover and some of your hits will not register (properly). MapOk but monotonous at times. Currently has 2 maps with some mixed feelings about the newest one (Miramar desert map). I feel like there's not enough cover and at times it seems too big.CommunityIf you feel courageous just check the discussions going on there.SecurityIf only there was something resembling it. It seems rampant with cheaters (around 20 of TOP 100 rankings are usually cheaters). With the influx of the Chinese market (making up a vast amount of concurrent players) it becomes even worse. Furthermore people have a reason to cheat the inflated prices of skins on the marketplace and tradeable goods. Another big showstopper for this game.MonetizationNot worth it. No added value and overappreciated by BlueHole causing more focus diverted to cases and skins than actual game optimisation.Developers Questionable practices promised no monetized crates in Early Access but released the Gamescom crate (with the E sports tournament funding as their excuse). Considers the battle royale genre as their own product and brushes competition away. Considered legal actions against the provider of their engine (Epic Games). Made me laugh a bit. Rushed X box release instead of focusing on PC version. Seemingly supported and catered to streamers screaming streamsnipers by banning accused people. Blind and deaf to community suggestions and wishes. Sometimes downright condescending ("I just don't get the attitude of some people" when some people have been rightfully asking for region locks due to unfair ping advantages. Apparently that comes over as "racism".

review: This game is a great option for players with patience and a group of friends. It is however an extremely frustrating game to play in it's current build. Progress is being made and the playability has improved since EA and initial release but this is not a finished game. Damage often feels like it's decided via dice roll and gun "rebalancing" is a nightmare but my real gripe with the game is the development. Bluehole does what they can but bugs like the lobby not loading deathcam delay poor collision mechanics and framreate dips in cities/towns all add up to make for a clunky game. If you're an NA player expect servers to be down once a week since Bluehole is on KST and frequently runs maintenence around 6 PST. Hacking is still an issue but that's a dead horse at this point and frequently misused to justify a particularly lucky shot or shoddy deathcam. I have high hopes for this game and will continue to play it but I will not recommend this game and would jump ship if a better option came along.

review: *EDIT*Leaving my OG post below But after a few updates and setting my potatoe to overclock create a dump file setting the game AND battle eye at high priority and cosing everything not needed to run this game Its been mildly playable for me. Only after a few games do those damn playdough houses begin and the game slows almost to a stop but i can at least play for an hour or two before that happens. Gotta give this game a 6/10 because there are still things wrong with it HOWEVER its still in alpha and I have high hopes they can hash these bugs and glitches out sooner rather than later. Good graphics as expected from a UR4 game and thought its not tagged as a horror game playing FPS SOLO on a map that has the deadly trio makes it a Horror for me atleast. Think about it Its dark outside its raining AND its so damn foggy you cant seen 15 steps ahead of you. Love the uneasy feeling it gives.I continue to have an ongoing problem with the game sometime after drop the game will freeze up my PC and the only solution is to hard rest my rig. Its no easy task to do that 32 gig ram i7k pros and 1080Ti graphics card. I should be able to run this game fine but strangly at random it crashes hard and i get no errors in the previous recovered syst logs. gameplay is awesome when it actually works(9/10) but this problem prevents a good mogirity of that so funtionality is 1/10.Overall id say out of 10 this game's a 4 until that gets fixed.

review: Honestly a fun game alone or with friends but more so with friends. What kills this game for me is the fact that I can get hit behind cover and third person cheating is so common and blatant. In addition I don t know if it s just me but the cheaters are starting to leak into first person. For a while my friends and I were winning at least once in a PUBG sesh. Now I just die to questionable snapping and accuracy when I or my friends have a clear advantage. Rather than see more content and loot crates added to the game a ping lock and better banning system would benefit the game much more. If you have the patience to lose a game due to desync or a cheater relatively often then get it I still have fun usually.

review: Review from positive to negative Adding to the review below cause to be honest I think Iv run out of patients with this game. If your a Dev for this game looking for things worth fixing my ranting list below might be of some use to ye...(TLDR boo urns glitchy lag) No doubt its one of the best games I'v ever played... but only when it works.For something like this to work long term it needs to be stable. This game is anything but stable. The lag makes it unplayable. Try stalking someone waiting for a clean head shot to come all of a sudden they glitch all over the place and they are gone. What's the point of a FPS where the enemies glitch around the screen?It's not my internet connection that's running at 80mbs. It could be theirs but surely a ping limit is necessary for these games or region lock people to reduce latency. But its not just that picking up weapons is extremely slow. Good luck quickly picking up a weapon in the first few seconds of a match (click click click click....click.wtf).... boom! your dead 3 minute waiting time to start again. Well that was a waste of 6 minutes. Frantically running around houses trying to kill someone lets just wait for this insanely slow climbing animation to play.What about that door surely it's a normal door that will open when you tap f. Wait no! This is one of those annoying doors that doesn't open at first so you tap f again. Then it quickly opens and closes. Frustrated you quickly tap f again. Boom! Your dead. All this door activity has been attracting attention. Ladders how are there no ladders in this game? F**k your crate system. "Rewards" locked behind a pay wall.... are you serious... give out (non transferable) keys for chicken dinners at the very least you absolute snakes. Saw one or two clips for the PGI that grenade from shroud...... proof that the combat mechanics are completely messed up. That other magic smoke grenade....The death cam I get it's a close match of what really happened.... but this is a computer game that should rely on exact positions. When you see a death cam that doesn't match up to how you saw things happen it makes you very suspicious of what actually did happen. How can the death cam not replicate the exact position of each game object throughout a match? It seems like the "reality" of the match is some mishmash of each of the players own experiences.How don't the parachutes work yet....... please wait as I destroy this game object and create a new one on the ground this may take a number of seconds. Why is it not a single player controller that is just slowed down by the parachute press f delete parachute game object player just falls to ground under gravity. You should be able to land on telephone wire if you could be bothered. Scopes are absolutely essential in this game the maps are just too big to not have a scope. Make scopes more common. Its gotten a bit better I feel Sanhok was a step in the right direction wrt guns. Vehicles should be everywhere! Like every corner should have a car put less petrol in them if necessary. It is so so annoying when the circle goes against you and there isn't a vehicle for miles. Finally get a few kills and a good weapon next circle comes and you die after like 5 minutes of running directly to the next one. Or else you take a chance on a town where you would expect to find a car. But no... now your totally screwed no amount of energy drink will bring you back from this one.... but let's waste 10 minutes trying and die to the blue zone anyway.... Level selection why... why why... you know what im taking about. Just why.... Notice a few things I didn't mention. I haven't mentioned the price... 30 bucks is a great deal for this game (when it works fix it and it might even be worth 60). Haven't talked about the types of guns or any radon gun features. I didn't mention the small number of maps. Didn't mention the event modes. Didn't talk about the finer details on the walls of houses or the limited number of building models. Didn't mention the absolute terror of a 1 on 1 encounter with someone in a tiny mountain village. I didn't mention the leader board. Why? Because these things work. Stop working on them like immediately. Sort out the basic game play before a competitor does it first.And possibly most importantly I didn't give out about the Sanhok event pass (I actually think this is a good move). You sell the games make buckets of money buy loads of infrastructure players have a laugh money dries up servers go down sad players. Selling keys to gammy rewards crates is not the way stop this. Sell event passes maybe even make them open competitions if not for really money for exclusive gear? Like the reward you get at the end of the event based on your player rank over that period. Have a wide variety of prizes for completing missions during matches wide variety is key if everyone has the latest prizes no one will want them they need to be varied enough for people to be seeing new thing all the time. Always wondering where did he get that....If your still reading this then im shocked if you agree with my ranting up vote this to show the devs why people are qucikly loosing faith in this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Approaching 400 hours and may I say it's been a long journey. From being the first of my friends to recieve the game to now having 6 close friends playing it has been wonderful. If you want to read reviews on how bad the game is scroll elsewhere. Instead of going on about all the bad things about the game I'll tell you about the development and skills of myself and my fellow cohorts. 1. (Myself) aka Skewer The first player out of this group of friends to play the game. Skilled enough in battle. He's grown up to be a fierce warrior. Born from the fires of FPS games. Not the best FPS player but it is his preffered gametype and he excels at most of them. Some might say if he had to choose between Beginner Intermediate Advanced or Hardcore difficulty. He would pick Advanced. Hardcore is for wussies. 2. (Lewi) aka Moneyman aka CuriousMoney He didn't jump into the PC race until last year but he's made a big footprint in the world of PC gaming in the past few months. Some might call him a Rocket League connoiseur but this man can adapt to any playing field if he enjoys the game. Put him in an FPS he gets good at it. Put him in a Strategy game he gets good at it. Hell if you put him in a farming simulator he could somehow do what you do and do it 100 times better. That's just who he is. Not only is he lethal but he has your back 100%. An asset... No! A necessity to the PUBG squadron. 3. (Josh) aka Joshy A skilled warrior in the art of FPS combat. This man carries the background of over 700 hours in Counter Strike and an accompanying 700 hours in Rocket League. He has the reflexes and accuracy of a highly trained sniper. Even though he only has 53 hours in PUBG he is a force to reckon with. Don't let a few beers get to this guy. After he knocks a few finely chosen brewskis down his accuracy goes from 100% to 1000%. Devastating on the playing field and always has your six. 4. (David) aka Flamennight aka Nice Ugly Boy The Dark Souls addict. Almost 500 hours in Dork Souls. He has mastered the art of the sword but what happens when you put a rifle in his hands? Where do we start with him? This guy has always been one to jump into FPS games with me. If I buy a game and I like it this Ugly Boy is down to join me. Quite adaptable to any game really. I wouldn't say FPS games are his #1 but he's got skills. I've had some delicious chicken dinners with this one. Nice boy. Nice ugly boy.5. (Adam) aka AdamWest aka Big G aka Caboose This guy... This guy... This mofo will teamkill you with a grenade and not even blink. He says he's sorry but we all know he doesn't mean it. This dude has 1 700 flippin hours in Total war games! Like who does that?! Anyways... He is not a bad FPS player. Hey I didn't say he was good. Just kidding Big G. He's good at FPS games. In PUBG you need to be a good strategist and G just needs to figure that part out. Don't leave it to him to call the shots. I personally think he has a lot of potential in PUBG. He just has to reach the breaking point. You'll get there someday buddy. Oh and he ALWAYS is the last to leave a location and takes forever to search a building. 6. (Colton) aka The Postman This dude can be a little stubborn. It took him long enough to buy PUBG but he finally did and he really enjoys it. The Postman has a very large palette for video games. He has many hours in the Fallout series but also quite a bit in Garry's Mod Just Cause and Unturned. It's fun to have him in the squad because he enjoys the game no matter what. I'm sitting here getting frustrated when we lose and he finds the fun in it all. Not my first choice to have my back in PUBG but he can get kills when you need him and can get you a laugh at any moment in time. Skilled and fun what else can you ask for? 7. (Dylan) aka Cowbell aka Groot Oh Dylan. Poor poor Dylan. Even though you always get dragged into our silly games you find a way to have a laugh and enjoy yourself. I still don't know if he has a kill yet in PUBG but he only has 27 hours in game so it's alright. Let me tell you something. He is an awesome looter. He is also very appreciative of the vehicles in the game. I have witnessed an amazing thing from him. After three vehicles zoomed past me in game they headed straight for G Ugly Boy and the marvelous Groot. I watched as Groot took on a speeding buggy backwards. He looked away from his attackers. They didn't deserve his final stare. He looked away at death and laughed. It slammed into him... and knocked him down but he took it like a man. Respect for this guy. He'll follow you into to battle and even though he might be the first to die. He died for you.

review: EDIT As of mid October this game has had a surge of cheaters on it using aim bot RPM and movement teleporting. Has made the game unplayable.Let me start off by saying that I have not played any of the battle royale mods from H1Z1 or ARMA. So I came into this game quite new to this format. Previously I was mostly playing The Division but after given no reason to continue playing it this game released on Steam Early Access while I was finding something else to play. Checked out some quick gameplay footage and decided to buy it.Holy was I happy.For an early access game I would say it feels pretty good. FPS can be bad at times even with my i7 6700k/ GTX 1080 Ti 3440x1440 (This game does support ultra wide monitors) but with some of the settings set to low while keeping draw distance at ultra I mostly get 70 FPS but can dip down into the 40s depending on the area.What I love about this game is that it puts everyone on an even playing field and requires you to learn the lay of the land to find the best loot. The enclosing circle keeps people on the move and learning to look all around you becomes rewarding once one becomes accustomed to it. I also love that this game is both First Person and Third Person. Since playing The Division for so long I've grown to love Third Person over First.Some issues that I do have with the game besides the obviously much needed hardware optimization would be the bad grenade throwing mechanic no kill cam to see how you died issues inviting friends some bullet caliber balancing switching between auto run and manual fluidity not being able to get up from prone with shift+w &amp maybe adding some sort of visual size/weight system so players can see what's taking up the most space in their bags.In conclusion if you're looking for a shooter that breaks from the mold of spawn kill capture die respawn then this is it. In my opinion this game is well worth the 30 dollars even if you only put 30 to a hundred hours into this game while waiting for the new summer/fall release of games.Update As of the new month 2 patch I noticed my FPS has gone up significantly and stays consistent at 100 FPS on my system.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game simply put is incredible. review: No story line. I would like to know why there is an island with guns and ammo laying all over the place and it just so happens a plane full of murderous people happens to crash land in it. Also what is this strange blue force field that traps people into smaller and smaller areas?Edit Fun game but I am thinking of changing my review to neutral only because of the cheaters that I have seen now that they implemented the replay feature. There is also a report feature but it is so lame seeing someone running up a hill has no line of sight but snaps to aim and shoots you. Being able to survive running into a building and hiding to heal the same person comes to top of the hill and around the corner and auto snaps to aim right on me and shoots me while I'm in the corner of a dark room through the window. How would he have seen that I was even there? I have reported many players for this type of cheating but who knows when it will be addressed. It is too popular and don't get me wrong it is a fun game however very annoying watching your death replays and a lot of the time seeing these type of auto aim cheats.

review: Remember playing Counter Strike and loving the suspense? That's this game.Remember the UT fanboys that hated Counter Strike for being too slow too much running around and too few kills per minute? Oh yes that's this game.Remember running around for 5 minutes in Counter Strike and then getting shot dead all of a sudden and never knowing where it came from? That's this game too. But luckily there's a death cam so know you can watch your own stupidity.Remember teaming up with friends for Counter Strike connecting with ventrillo and doing a clan match? That's this game every night if your friends are online.Remember creating a battleplan to storm a location and then watching the whole thing fall apart in one big chaotic mess or every so often seeing it succeed brilliantly as if you're pro's? Oh yes that's definitly this game.Remember playing a clanmatch and getting your and several other body parts handed to you on a silver platter by the other team? Oh yes that's this game too but hopefully another team schreds them before yours encounters them.Great game.

review: I don't write many reviews but after 515 hours I think I have a bit to say about this game in its current state (January 2018).I've thoroughly enjoyed the game up until recently.The core mechanics of the game allow for a wildly different experience from one round to the next and there's a significant learning curve from where to drop and loot when to move when to fight and what the hell you do when you're in the top 10. The RNG can screw you but after awhile you manage to cope and heck it creates some tense early game moments! Vehicles are ridiculous and fun to drive. The two maps currently in the game play very differently to eachother and they have different vehicles and some different weapons. As a new player the desert map will just be another part of the game but for older players tried and true strategies have been thrown out the window.Now if the issues I'm about to present weren't in the game then I'd recommend the heck out of it. But alas I have to warn buyers to bide their time...No matter what region you play on 50% of your lobby is going to be Chinese players playing from China with ridiculous pings (thanks to the games netcode lag benefits the one causing it). Player Unknown has recently called anyone who wants the game region locked "xenophobic". If you try and play team modes with randoms odds are you're matched with Chinese players who either ignore you or act as if you're an imposter it's not very fun.The largest issue I've faced in all my 515 hours has only been happening to me since the game went live (and subsequently Chinese players started filling servers)... Cheaters.The amount of deaths to blatant hackers is too much for a game of this scale with anticheat is t. 480 hours played in alpha so in 35 hours I've experience more cheaters than 480 thanks to whatever the .But no I'm xenophobic because I don't want to die to Chinese hackers.Nothing seems to be being done about this. So the game isn't enjoyable. You either die due to lag or cheats.Oh yeah the Oceanic lobby used to be filled with great banter. Now it's filled with Chinese players who don't know what push to talk is and maybe one or two English speakers telling them to off. lmao.tl dr great game but filled with laggy cheaters atm. avoid until you see gaming news sites reporting on it being fixed.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Saying that I'm a good player would be drastically overstating my current skill. As a player I can say that I find this game fun to play I tend to get into the top 20 easily although more often than not without a kill. I find myself on the edge of my seat as I run through a house looking for a gun hearing the shots get closer the roar of an engine booming throughout the chaos. I feel terrified I feel without hope but boy do I feel alive.Playing this with friends might be the best experience you could get here find some good friends and just ing play this game until you can't keep your eyes open. Trust me it's worth it. The constant walking might gey annoying the only thing keeping it mildly entertaining being the fact that someone might currently have their sight trained on you this very moment. Yea I recommend it if you have a bad temper... Good luck. And please region lock so we don't get the ing chinese with their ping.

review: This game is fun. I cannot say that it isn't but there are problems with it that the developer has refused to see too such as the amount of players that pour from China into other servers with ping that is raised due to connecting to a server accross the planet and third party VPNs that further increase this issue. The ping on these players is so bad that you can kill / down them and still take damage even after you get the kill or they are knocked down. It can cause people with usually solid internet connections to lag and rubberband if there are to many people from the other side of the globe. Another reason I can't recommend this game is just how popular it is. It doesn't feel the same as when I bought it almost a year ago and the fact that you can get a LOCKED crate from the rewards where you have to buy the key is ludicrous. Sure you can sell the crates on the marketplace but the price scaling to actually earn a crate isn't worth it with the decreased BP you earn at the end of a match.I used to recommend this game but right now I cannot. You'd be better off playing Fortnite for free.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. Mein Kampf One day I was sitting in my chair drinking all the diabetes in the world without a care. It was then that I looked at the TV and saw the news broadcast. It said there were a group of Logangsters breaking into people houses kidnapping them and taking them to an unknown location. Then I heard it. The window smashed as a hoard of 12 year old kids came rushing in. They leaped on my and put what looked like a Tesco shopping bag straight on my head without hesitation. They were savages. They also took my wife and 2 kids. Suddenly the bag was taken off my head and I was on an island where I was greeted by my family but also a bunch of Russians yelling "China Number One". I didn't have time to count but there must have been about 100 of 'em all bunched up in groups of fours some more aggressive than others punching other peoples' faces. There were alos a couple of them with stylish yellow jackets and maching tracksuit pants resembling a banana. Without notice we all somehow teleported into the back of a plane where Russians continued to shout things such as "Drop in Pockinki !!" The doors at the back of the plane opened and the Russians began leaping out. I knew something wasn't right and then all 4 of us were pushed out above a shooting range (for some reason this shooting range has blackboards and desks in it). When we got close to the ground we all pulled the parachutes and I spotted some people picking up various weapons. I looked at my family in horror and told them to follow me as I rushed down the stairs in search of a gun. I quickly explained what was happening and gave an M16 to my 5 year old son (probabaly not my best idea ever) while I held an S12K in my hand. I looked down the corridor and saw a family of Russians running around with guns looking extremely paranoid. I knew it was inhumane but I had no choice. I shot the youngest he must have been about 8 straight in the head which somehow didn't kill him but he was crawling on his hands and knees shouting for help. His father turned round so I shot at him as well as my son opened fire with his M16. He didn't manage to hit anyone except for his sister who cried out in pain. My wife ran over to help her and like a miracle she was fine again after about 10 seconds. I quickly finished off the rest of the Russian family and checked them for supplies. One of them had a big rucksack that I grabbed with no hesitation and filled it full of various attachments I found in the room. My wife picked up the Kar98k from the body of the father and pulled a scope from her back pocket. She put the scope on the Kar98k making an overpowered killing machine. My daughter managed to scavenge a first aid kit from the next room and healed herself up. We were all ready and all had guns so we ventured out into the unknown. Suddenly some text began to appear in the sky above which read "RESTRICTING THE PLAY AREA IN 10 SECONDS". Did they think this was some sort of a game? I had know idea what this meant and so I asked if anyone had a map. In an instant a hologram appeared in front of my eyes and it displayed a white circle a blue circle (which seemed to be moving towards the white one) and a few multicoloured arrows grouped up together. I quickly realised what this meant. I explained that we were the little arrows and the blue circle was the edge of the play zone. I also determined that the white circle must be a safe zone. However when I opened my map again there was a filled in red circle where we all were. I didn't know what it meant so i just told everyone to go towards the white circle. A couple of seconds later bombs began to rain down from the sky the first one striking Jimmy right in the head and the next one killing him for good. My wife began to cry but I knew the same would happen to us if we stopped. We all sprinted as fast as possible until we made it to the white circle weher we spotted what looked like 4 friends in a car. The two in the back were hanging out of the windows trying to aim their guns. I told Sarah and my wife not to shoot as we don't want to give away our position. Before long the text once again appeared in the sky so we were on the run. The blue circle was faster than us this time and consumed us all but we found out that it didn't instantly kill as I though it might. Sarah and I managed to get out alive and she pulled out 2 energy drinks. She gave one to me and we each downed them. We felt ourselves becoming able to withstant more bullets as we continued to run for our lives. We both looked at eachother and were able to tell what eachother were thinking we had to win . When I opened the map again I noticed something I didn't see before and it said "14 ALIVE". We were both crouched down behind a rock when gunfire started in our direction. We got behind the other side of the rock and I peeked my head out. It was then that I spotted them. I opened fire my first 5 bullets missing before I landed a headshot on one of the three people. Sarah followed in my footsteps as she took aim and fired straight at another one of them who was wearing one of those yellow outfits. The third one stood no chance as he tried to revive his downed teammate before the outside of the play area engulfed him. I looked again at my map and this time it said "8 ALIVE". I decided it would be a better idea to hide until there were left people but Sarah argued otherwise. She ran to a nearby tree but on her way she was struck down by a sniper who then proceeded to finish her off. Now there were only 5 alive one of them being me. Gunshots rang out and I watched as 3 hopeless people of varying ages were shot down. It was then that I realised it was just me and one other person alive. I knew where he was due to him shooting those people so I watched intensely at the wall that the bullets came from. Struck by surprise the edge of the play area rushed past me and I began to feel very ill. I had no way of healing now I just had to take the fight. I watched as he ran from his hiding place clearly trying to draw bullets from me to compromise my position. But I was smarter. I flanked round the right side and threw a grenade where I was before while he was turned round. He instantly turned to the explosion when I jumped out of the bust and sprayed in his direction. However in my panic I only landed 1 shot and now he knew where I was. I crouched behind a tree and peeked in his direction when he fire a bullet straight past my head. I noticed however that he was wielding a bolt action sniper so decided to use this to my advantage. I peeked again to draw a shot then lined up a shot right at his head. He died in an instant and a hologram appeared in front of me and it said "WINNER WINNER CHICKEN DINNER" along with "6 KILLS". Suddenly Logan Paul began to fly down from the sky like an angel and said "Well done on beating my little game here I hope you enjoyed. Be sure to get ready for the next one I set up many of these games and I will be taking the winner or winners from each one and make them battle it out to be the ultimate champion." I couldn't bear it so I took out my gun and swiftly shot Logan in the head and soon after myself.
