review: OK here is my story called "Caught in The Zone"By TheRealistOne Today was the day. Me and my comrades gh0st and stink were set a mission. The mission seemed simple. All we had to do was kill 97 other people on an island as we fight to be victorious. However in the briefing they said that we weren't allowed to bring any weapons and that we had to scavange for our own supplies and weapons. Even something as simple as a pan could kill someone. We were all ready. We were transported to a deserted island in the middle of Russia. We had 1 minute to get our senses together and come up with a plan. Stink said that we should go to a place called Rozhok. We all agreed. Then like magic all 100 of us were put on to a plane. Some of the people on that plane were insane. Screaming the N word or yelling things about China. All I had on my mmind was to get the mission done and be victorious. The doors to the back of the plane swung open and people began jumping out like cereal being poured into a bowl. (Kelloggs sponser me pls) We then said our prayers as we passed over Rozhok. 1 by 1 we all jumped out. as we were freefalling gh0st was dabbing. we came close to Rozhok and pulled our parachutes. We all landed but we were all at different sides of the town. I ran into a 2 story house and found a AKM on the floor with some 7.62 lying on the floor. I grabbed both and loaded my weapon. I switched my gun into fully automatic and charged upstairs hoping to find some more supplies. All I was able to find upstairs was a pan. What was i going to do with a pan? Make an egg? Well I wasn't aware of the power of the sacred device known as the pan. I jumped out of the window and ran to another house. Then someone fired at me. I turned around and returned fire. I was shocked as i didn't know how i wasn't injured in anyway. Then it clicked in my brain. The pan saved my life. i ran back out wielding the pan deflecting all of the guys shots. I then got in range and smacked him around the head with it. I didn't believe it. I just killed a man who had an AR with a pan...He turned into a brown crate which had a M416 with some 5.56 ammunition. We scavanged around for a bit until we had filled our backpacks with medication ammunition and weapons. We all grouped together as it was announced that the blue zone was going to shrink soon. As we were together a blue dacia with one guy in it came straight towards us. We all evaded it apart from stink who was hit. He started crawling towards us. As he crawled to us gh0st fired his beloved Kar98k at the dacia taking out 1 of the wheels. The car spun out. The driver got out and began to fire back at us. Well mainly towards stink. We both looked at him. He was defenceless and couldn't do anything. stink looked at as and told us to go. Then the fatal blow that punctured his skull killed him. We had to go. Me and gh0st found a Motorbike parked on the side of the road and headed towards it. We both got on it and left Rozhok. When we were driving around we noticed the plane flying by. It dropped of a crate. A supply crate."Look we need to be the first one their!" I yelled. gh0st went as fast as he could but it was too late. When we got there there were multiple enemies fighting. Often stopping to drink a energy drink or eat some painkillers. We both layed down in a bush. I glanced over my right shoulder and noticed something unusual. There was a bush next to us with another man laying down in it. He was wearing a ghille suit and had acquired a M24 with a suppressor on the end of it to muffle his shots. I told gh0st. I then snuck up behind him. Pulled out my sacred pan and hit him over the head. Instantly killing him. I grabbed his M24 and the ghille suit. We then thought it would be good to leave the area. Maybe they would drop another one? As we drove around we were told that only 15 people were alive. This was including us. We checked our electronic map and saw that the blue zone had came in a lot and that the circle was starting to become very small. It looked like the circle was going to close in on a place called Mylta Power. So we headed towards it. We thought if we were the first one there we would have a higher chance of winning. Then disaster stuck. As we were off roading on the bike gh0st decided to do a flip on the bike. At this moment we were racing the blue zone as we didn't want to get stuck in it. Mid flip gh0st said to me over the comms "I don't think we are going to land it."And he was right. We landed directly on our head knocking us off of the the bike. The bike exploded as it bounced of the earth. Gh0st was down but not out. I was severely injured. I was forced into using my medkit to get back to normal. Then I noticed the blue zone coming in. Gh0st was laying in a field with the blue zone heading straight towards him. There was no way I was going to get him. Like stink gh0st said to go. The zone then engulfed him instantly draining the life out of him. I had loads of pressure on me. I had to move on. It was intense only 5 other people were alive. (Including me) I was laying in a bush as it made it harder to spot me. I noticed a 2 women running in a field together. 1 was wielding a M249 and the other had a pistol with a suppressor on it. I held my breath and took the shot. I took down 1 of the 2 people. Luckily I had a suppressor which made it harder for her teamate to try and triangulate my location. I took another shot Instanly killing her. Both of them had been killed. That meant that only 2 more people were alive. I had to move as the circle was not in my favour. When the time was right I darted across a field. However I attracted to much attention as I was starting to get shot at. I was so screwed. I was able to get behind a tree. I heard 2 people shooting at me. It was a 2v1. I didn't know what to do I was running low on ammo.I had to use the remaining amount of ammo I had left even if it wasn't a lot. I leaned around the tree and was shot down straight in the face breaking my helmet. I was badly injured. I had nothing to heal up with. This was it. I was sweating profusely. I had to take another shot. I leaned around again and was shot down. I was killed there... All my friends were mad at me. We then exited to the menu and instantly queued for another game. We then won that game.The End

review: Truly amazing game with excellent developers. By far one of the most exciting and adrenaline pumping games I have ever played. Find a few buddies who play squad up and get yourself a win. 10/10 would reccomend this game to anyone I know.On the more technical issues I am still impressed with this for being an early access game. Devs may not always stick to their original schedules for updates but they never fail to impress when they do come out a few days late. It does require a halfway decent computer to run it on medium settings and totally potato computers can handle the lowest settings at a decent framerate.Edit 1 Still enjoying the game much happier now that they have ping priority matchmaking. I still wish that they would region lock china but it is much better than before. Cheaters are still little bastards but again the ping priority helps a lot. Without having terrible cheaters all the time it makes it a lot easier to win games. I won 3 in a row last night with only one cheater that our squad ran into. Definitely still a work in progress but the devs do keep pushing out updates which I approve of greatly.

review: This is a review for PlayerChinese's Hackergrounds.Bluehole Company is swimming in TONS of money by selling the game in the Chinese market to Chinese gamers they DO NOT and WILL NOT care about what experience you have or what feedback you give about the game.Yeah right we all love Emoticons and Steam achievements more than an update to the Anti cheat. (if you didn't catch that that was sarcasm). The cheating is blantant obvious frequent and have deeply impacted the game that has made me a person who bought the game to enjoy it with my friends at first but now have decided to stop playing.During my short 40 hours of play accumulated through a month of owning the game I have met so many hackers that I lost count and all my report seems to not do anything.And don't waste your time screaming REGION LOCK CHINA. I know it is one of the best solution but BlueHole will never listen and would never do such a thing to hurt their revenue. So the best course of action right now is to stop playing this game for good because honestly you will not enjoy it any further anyway and wait until a better company a company that sees the complete and utter destruction of BlueHole to do a better job at the formula. To BlueHole we gave you many chances and a very long time because I have heard and seen cheating through Youtube and Twitch ever since the game was in Beta almost 2 years ago and you have done next to NOTHING to remedy the situation. And if you go screaming "You're racist! You just hate Chinese people!" let me tell you snakes one thing "Not 100% Chinese players hack but 99 99% of hackers are Chinese"Let the Chinese deal with the Chinese let them fix their own mess not SEA or EU or NA or SA or JP or any other people.Screw off Steam or maybe you can ask Valve to teach you how to do Anti cheat.

review: So a friend suggested I try this game out and I have to be up front I suck at shooter games and I have really tried with this one but you spend the entire game looking for loot or if all you do 24 7 is play this game you jump right to the good stuff camp and snipe your way to the end game. This is not for the casual player. On another note one can tell the age group of those playing by observing what goes on in the start up que. First 90% of the toons are female and naked (really) Second Half of the population is running around punching each other in the well for 10% the Johnson and for the other 90% the snatch. And all his Beta testing fun can be had for 30 bucks and a wing and a prayer that the friging game does not crash. One more thing to know if you don't get a scope quickly your chance of hitting anything 10 feet plus away is next to nothing and those who know where the scopes are will stand in the open while you miss and headshot the out of you. I have logged a few hours since I first reviewed the game and I still want my thirty bucks back. That said it is addictive and fun to play right up to that point when you get killed by someone who was camping outside the circle (In the blue zone) much longer than possible or be tracked while out of line of sight (checking the DEATH CAM) in a ditch or behind a hill only to have some dog eatting cheater come up right where you moved to. The way I see it is PUBG should stop throwing money into cheat detection and go two ways 1. set up an alias web page like "YOUTAKEIUPTHEARSEIFYOUCHEAT.COM" and sell a cheat that claims to out cheat all the other POS cheats they buy it for oh THIRTY BUCKS download it and when they activate it a message pop's up and says "you have a small Nixon and you are banned for life from PUBG cheater" BAM that's thirty for the game and thirty for the cheat sixty bucks and it might discourage the cheaters. Or option two create bots that can be dropped into the game and detect anomalies within the Current player base track and record and if they are cheating execute them on the spot or show their positon on the map and the hud of everyone in game with the bot right up in their face wearing all orange no ban needed the fun of jacking with everyone would be over and they would either play honest or go away. I guess there is an option three put all the cheats in the game it takes away the incentive to make them ($) and the advantage to those idiots who pay to use them.

review: PUBG isnt the most polished game on the market but what it lacks in visuals it makes up for in creative and entertaining game play. A major shortfall of this game is that it can quickly turn into a running simulator if you decide to drop in the wrong area on the map. In addition to that their is a major issue with cheating players in this game. All that aside PUBG still keeps me coming back for hours and hours of game play. Relatively easy learning curve. Lots of guns to choose from with multiple attachments. Large community of gamers to play and connect with. Worth the purchase.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: As someone who plays this game daily I can tell you this game is ok. The amount of issues that plague it become ever so apparent the longer you play it are not ok. There are tons of issues that can be easily solved (like no.1)1. items spawn weirdlyspawn everything needed in the waiting rooms so the server doesnt get overloaded when people spam the server for requests to pick up items only to have them fail. so what if waiting times are a bit longer. other games do it just fine *cough fortnite cough*stuff that is super important but harder to fix 2. bullets/projectiles dont registershotguns either one shot or do nothing at all. bullets either hit or do nothing. grenades fling you to the side and you die from hitting terrain3. terrain clipping/ building clippingyour character can get stuck on by in under and through terrain vehicles buildings4. vehicle physicsclips with terrain and spazzes out. sometimes makes no noise. gets stuck in terrain and explodes or flies off5. game crashesfatal error game stops responding ui refuses to render6. matchmaking on uistops working a lot7.rubberbanding (may be due to anticheat and how it positionally tracks players)game will teleport you back over and over and over at the beginning and sometimes slightly later on. server dependant as I've found a small percentage of servers I have played on have had little to none of this occur. interesting enough when erangel is played and less than 80 people play it there is little to no rubberbanding occuring8.cheatingone in every (I'd say) 10 15 games will have a very obvious cheater. whether they're using speed aim or other cheats they use them constantly. (you'd think with anticheat they wouldnt have the ability to do it but uh.... i dunno you figure it out)There's probably a ton more issues maybe I've forgotten some maybe I havent experienced them yet but for a game this popular its a shame to see something that could be more popular than any AAA game become ruined by things other devs seem to have a handle on. So yes even tho I still play this game lately it has been less and less because everyone I know has become even more and more frustrated with it. If they fix all the aforementioned issues this game will be one heck of a game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: awesome game highly recommend it is just about to exit early access at time of writing this reviewI would like to see better servers for the australian community and hopefully vulkan support added in the futurePros* A fun game if you're into PvP survival.* No pay to win only things you can pay for are cases that give cosmetic items * Large map* Realistic gunplay (bullet drop winds penatration etc)Cons* The servers are not 100% optimized which leads to crashes freezes and lag* There isn't a huge selection of weapons or items * Low end computers are going to struggleMy PC Low EndProcessor AMD FX(tm) 8350 Eight Core ProcessorRam 16gbGPU NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 4gbMotherboard MSI 970 GamingI have to run everything on low or very low settings to get around 60 fps.that being said is not stable at all so most the time i am hitting around the 40 fps mark when in a fight.hopefully that will change sometime soon and will become better optimizedI really do hope they add vulkan support and better aus servershowever feel like that wont happen unless they have a massive push from the community asking for it / demanding it

review: LOVE THE GAME I've loved this game from the beggining. I enjoy its combat the heart pumping end games and the whole thing&lt 3 in general. Can't complain about money grabs and bugs as they are trying to listen or atleast show it. The Game is only improving. The fun in beating or outlasting 99 players is great also knowing you dominated many Winning is a rewarding feeling.But a game that can be fun for hundered of hours with only a portion of winning games is a greater achievment.Unlike other E sports it can put on a great show for everyone even players who have no grasp of the game. Pubg corp really is driving to only go further and further with this E sport and i love it.My only complaint is that after the ping based matchmaking update In my region (Oceania) a fix for the local players in other countries around Australia joining and increasing server tickrates. Also many other updates which greatly improved the servers. The matchmaking has become long probable due to small playerbase here in Australia so when queing for First person perspective(FPP) my prefered style the only way to find a game is que in squads which can still take a minute. TPP games can be found but its no where near as fun.My other option is to switch to South East Asian servers which can be 50 ping higher at some times so slightly noticable beside when i die )

review: So after several hundred hours I can finally leave a honest review about this game.I'm still slightly miffed about the devs not following through with the agreement of no microtransactions duiring EA but that aside I very much enjoy PUBG.With each initial startdrop and lootspawn being different there is a huge RNG element to the game but that's pretty much every game at this point. I understand it needs to be part of it and I won't let it sway my opinion. They've come a long way since I started playing PUBG. A new map new mechanics weapons bugfixes etc. etc. They've come much further than other devs. Not without mistakes mind you such as the streamsniping banwave etc. but that's expected. It happens we make mistakes and move on.The gameplay has become a lot more reliable. Less and less am I being trapped in random objects unable to detatch my parachute flung from houses instantly killed. I like the direction it has gone in and the developers work to improvce the game where possible.It's enjoyable and the RNG means it's addictive. You don't know how each round will go. Once you've got decent loot you have a chance to show your skills and capabilities it's not all just RNG. There's one thing that they still haven't 100% fixed and that will be because it's not an easy mechanic to just "fix" and that's vehicles. I'm still being flung around flipping over 8 times from a small bump at 20 KM/h etc. All in all it's good fun has variance but there is still room to improve. I'm hoping I get to see that happen.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is a very good multiplayer game that puts you against 99 other players on a giant map full of loot where your only goal is to be the last man standing. You can also play with up to 3 other teammates in first person or third person perspective.The dev that came up with the idea PLAYER UNKNOWN definetely knows what he's doing since he worked on many other ARMA Battle Royale mods so this is a plus for the game since the dev is experienced.Pros easy to learn hard to master endless replayability entertaining gameplay huge map good graphics the level or realism is very high lots of guns attachments healing items etc. has cars you can play with friends very good game mechanics (e.g. leaning right or left ADS crouching proneing) can make money out of crates or items from that crates by selling themCons lots of bugs (e.g. dying when exiting a vehicle cars flipping like crazy shots not registering) cheaters voice chat spammers in the planeOverall it's the best Battle Royale game in my opinion. The bugs and cheaters can sometimes make life hard for you but when you play with friends that havr comms getting the chicken dinner feels amazing especially after you kill 20 people.9.5/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Update Since my last review back in October Blue Hole has pushed this game out of early access into what they classify as a "full release".While the game still has plenty of issues ranging from desync rubberbanding and FPS issues they have dealt with alot of the bigger problems to make it a more functional game. Overall im going to change my rating to reccomend as the game is actually quite fun with friends. They have improved it enough to be fun. review: A game people are extremely divided on.The truth is it can be a very enjoyable game but only if you forgive the issues and come to terms with the gamble you have to make each time you queue up. It's very possible to spend nearly an hour at this game and not get back anything that resembles a good time. It's also possible you'll take part in a kickass operation and as your last surviving opponent tries to escape on a motorcycle you tag them in the back of the head from half a kilometer away. There is a certain 'Rainbow Six'esque feeling when you and your friends formulate strategies like flushing out a building with grenades while they cover exits.This game is not without its flaws. Optimization/performance issues mean most people won't be able to run it at a framerate high enough to justify 'competitive' play let alone stream it. RNG dominates the early game and maintains a strong hold all the way throughout to the late game. The difference between a Red Dot and an 8x alone becomes very apparent anytime a blue circle forces you through a long flat open field with high visibility and no cover.The addition of killcam may resolve hacking to some extent but the current state of affairs is that hackers can project their arms through walls and geometry from any distance looking a bit like Stretch Armstrong before auto aiming your face. As you might imagine that's not a very good time when it happens.In my opinion the key to enjoying this game is to treat it as an experience rather than a competitive game. Would recommend moreso on sale because there's not a lot of content at the current price. There is also no denying how poorly developed this game is.

review: This game is loads of fun adding a mix of survival and shooter. With Blueholes success and implementation of FPS only this game shows promise. Don't let that fool you though. This game is early acces so you will encounter bugs. I only hope that Bluehole decides to spend their money on increasing the team to add more quality to it. I'll go through a list of cons and pros Cons Registration of enitites. The game has a few things which are sometimes fun sometimes annoying. Like people getting stuck in doors people being able to see through entire houses. The game is far from polished in this sense. Hitting play and nothing happens. You need to remake team and refresh to play. This is a very minor con but it does make the game feel less polished. Car collision is a dangerous thing to play with albeit extremely fun and it really takes you back to old days of gaming seeing bugs like this. Initial lag. Whenever you drop down you have lag it can be hard to open doors for the first 5 10 seconds. This is a minor bug if you ask me.Pros Fun Gameplay! Graphics are okay. Immersion is really good. A good dynamic between an intense and chill game as you will often loot for a few minutes and then fight.A final word on the entire microtransaction thing. It seems that Bluehole wants to have a microtransaction system like that of CS GO which is very understandable giving it's success in terms of sales. I've always hated these things I've never been much for skins and stuff that are 'irrelevant' to the core game but which requires money to acquire. Because the money spend on producing these things are time taking away from creating a greater game. It's a sad trend to see gaming industries relying on people and mostly kids when these money machines basically are slot machines. It's gambling and it's combined with an addictive product. There should be laws about these things. READ THIS FOR AFTER THOUGHTS So I've played the game for a few months. I no longer recommend this game to anyone. Sure some of the above is still true. But after PUBG's success you expect to see more improvements. This is just another cash grab game it seems to me. Game gets increasingly more bugs without the core ones getting fixed such as misalignment of scopes. Recoil animation differing from actual recoil making it impossible to learn to spray. Desync. Decent rig. Laggy game. Even though it looks like it was produced in 2005. Sound bug. You hear sounds where they are not. Not cool in a Battle Royale game. Picking up items in the early game is still slow as and requires the patience of a buddhist monk.Buy it for cheap thrills but don't ever expect a polished or finished game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Overall a very good game. I've played way more than my fair share of time on it so speaking from experience its a rough start for many. There's a lot of tactics to learn so it does have a good amount of choices depending on your game style. Having the choice to play solo or along with friends is refreshing and makes for a unique experience just about every game.The game does have some flaws a major one for me is the crashing. There is also some odd hit box moments and server lag that can kill you but other than that nothing game breaking. Looking forward to more content as the same old stuff can become stale after a while of playing.

review: Ok ok ok.....Yes this game has some bugs that you need to learn to work around. Yes it's painfully difficult to learn to play due to no trainer/tutorial. Yes your going to die a lot. I mean A LOT! That's how this game works.Now let me explain my first experience with this game. Purchased near release. Had zero clue what this game was about or what I was doing. Loaded my first solo match. Checked buttons so see what I could do. Landed and ran around trying to find things to loot. Died to a punch to the head. Time wasted 5 minutesLoaded a second match. Checked buttons again to see if I could find an edge. Landed and ran around trying to find things to loot. Died to a headshot from a pistol. Time wasted 5 minutesRefunded the game.Repurchased the game after I watched some videos and talked to some friends about what to do and what I was doing wrong.Loaded a team match with some friends. Landed and started looting. Continued to loot. Still looting but running too. Running more. See a guy. Run more. Hear a car. Stop running. Car comes over the ridge. Team shoots car. People die. Loot more. Take car because running sucks. Heart pounding to the end.It's a of a game. Be prepared to suffer early and often. But damn is it fun.

review: The most popular game on Steam right now is a total waste of money. The game is broken full of horrific hit reg and glitchy gameplay tons of bugs and lag. On top of that the overall game requires you to have an incredibly high end PC to play it even somewhat decently. If you don't you'll encounter nothing but dropped frame rates and rubber banding. Moving on to the player base players play incredibly cautious to the point of being campy. In fact most games you will die to someone who is camping or playing super cowardly as this game rewards players to play that way. This game has fun moments but most moments are frustrating and unenjoyable. Don't buy this game while it's in early access. Don't support this garbage company as the more support they get the less they'll try and update it. I've never been so disappointed with a game's potential in my life.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Player Unknown's BattleGrounds (or PUBG) is a phenomenal game for anyone who loves first/ third person shooters. If you can use a mouse and keyboard to shoot other players and you like the idea of "The Hunger Games" then this is the game for you. There are plenty of weapons and locations to keep one entertained for a couple hours. The game is even better with friends.But just like everything PUBG has it's flaws. One the game is demanding on your system. If you have a MAC book or Laptop this game will run like sh*t even on the lowest settings. Two the servers are very unreliable (in my experience). Connections can cut out at critical moments or at the start of a round (again in my experience). Three for some odd reason the servers tend to get swapped. One moment you think you're hopping onto a North America server the next thing you know some guy is yelling at you in Chinese. In a game like PUBG this can be annoying as it makes communication and focus EXTREMELY difficult.Overall though it is good. I find that a 100 person deathmatch can be rather enoyable after a long day at school/ work. If you haven't got it then I recommend you wait for a sale then get this rather decent game.

review: I was banned from Pubg on March 5 2018. It came up under a steam notification. I am assuming from team killing. Myself and 2 other friends were dropping in locations that we thought people were not going to find us and had fire fights with each other as more of a TDM instead of playing the battle royale. Why I am banned really is beyond me because we were not cheating by any means and just having friendly fun against each other without involving other players. Maybe if you guys allowed custom servers for everyone instead of just Streamers things would be different. I am saddened by your actions against my account and wouldn't of wasted 30 dollars on this game knowing that if i wanted to play a game with my friends the way we want to sometimes this would be the result.

review: 纯就游戏性而论 BR确实是一种能与Team Fight Deathmatch分庭抗礼的游戏模式 当我们谈论FPS游戏时我们可能会想到CSGO 5人小队对战 资源来自于事先购买 除了捡枪以外地图上没其他资源 另一种玩法是Quake系列的死亡竞赛 地图上固定位置会定期刷出资源 你要记熟资源位置 刷新时间 某种意义上OW守望先锋也可以算是FPS 它提供多样化的角色与技能 游戏内的资源几乎不存在 玩家主要靠自身技能战斗 有人称它为 FPS MOBA 然后是PUBG的 大逃杀模式 Battle Royale BR 资源随机在地图上生成 你可以自由选择跳伞降落的位置 出生位置 在随机出现的毒圈的驱赶下所有活人被迫聚集到在一起 最后活下来的人或队伍能在晚上食用鸡肉

review: I started playing this game fairly early and while it had issues They were forgivable. Things like texture glitches and occasonally an inventory glitch but not enough to take away from the experience. As they fixed the early issues and the popularity grew the quality of gameplay has declined severely. I cant get through a single game without network lagging at least once. The speed of server communication in this game is laughable. I have died behind cover more times than I can count and it's infuriating. To me it shows the devs have made their profit and are using their early access staus to excuse glaring faults with their servers. Until they significantly raise the tickrate (both up and down) this game will continue to be a joke. In N. America servers the problem gets so bad I can have a smoother experience on the Asiatic servers.

review: For starters I know this is an Early Access game so some bugs are to be expected and optimization issues as well. But are you ing kidding me? Instead of fixing for example their horrible movement system they would rather develop on the crate system. There have been gamebreaking bugs from the start of which some/many are not fixed yet and the optimization is absolutely horrendous. The only feeling I am left with is that the developers have no interest in fixing this game but only want to milk the money cow. Teasing a massively improved movement system and then not releasing for (I don't know) how many months while adding new vanity items and crates. That ain't right. review: Product received for free. So far I do like the game for the three and a half hours that I have played. But there are some cons that outweigh the pros.(Also a friend did buy this game for me to test it out.)For instance picking up a VSS and getting a few headshots on a player doesn't quite do the trick when the person you're shooting at takes a couple of pot shots and takes you down instead. Now I understand that the VSS from what I have been told is a fairly weak sniper. I get that but headshots should deal sufficient damage if not take the player down after four or so hits. The armor rating based on levels is good I do like the fact that a higher teir(Level) equals more armor but... the frying pan is the save all beat all weapon. The people I have played with have said that the frying pan is OP and have shown me that it can stop bullets... multiple bullets. He then rushed and took out a squad of people with just the pan one guy and his frying pan. Almost sounds like a bad URL portal.... OneGuyOneFryingPan.

review: Hackers everywhere poor netcode optimization and in general mediocre in almost every way.I have put in the most hours into this game than any others and that's because when it works it's amazing. Great concept with a very addictive game style. However it never felt polished even after the 1.0 release. Though the 1.0 release was monumental in fixing bugs adding features and bringing us a new map. It still did not address some core issues.Gameplay Wow this is a fun game. However the main issue I see right now that they have 100% control over is the consistent action within game. There are typically two styles jump to a popular location to get top loot or jump to a random location and hope for decent loot. Within 5 minutes you will loose half the people due to these two very different styles. From minutes 5 20 you are really just traveling looting and very infrequently fighting. It's boring. Then comes minutes 20 30 where it picks up again and is truly the most fun. Heart racing and incredibly tense as you vie for the best strategic location as the world closes in around you.Hacking This is where I just couldn't play anymore. I have numerous replays that I have gone through to watch the person kill me by following my every move within buildings behind walls around mountanous areas and just everywhere. Then instantly kill me the second I pop up. Even shooting at me before and just hitting the wall. Everything fun about the gameplay is taken away when you spend 20 minutes building up your characters buildout to just get headshot by a hacker. The last night I played it was three games in a row and I just couldn't take it anymore. Uninstalled right away.Other problems Sound is just terrible nothing like going deaf while flying in the plane driving in a car and being around the red zone. Then having to listen intently to hear footsteps....it is just sad. Loot is very finicky when you first land especially if you jump right away it will not be there when you initially go through a location then the person behind you will find all the weapons that spawned just after. Game still crashes randomly no idea why. Just does.....the list goes on and on and I am sure it's talked about a lot in other reviews forums and anywhere you see PUBG being talked about.Overall awesome game with just the worst execution for a team that clearly has made a TON of money. Resources should not be an issue with making this more playable.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is thrash I can tell after 400 hours of this game. They say it is out of early acces but you shouldn't believe this. review: I gave this game a hard time to begin with and I will still be bustings its nuts a little today. Hackers glitches lag failure death crashing graphics issues uneven statistics no region locks racism.. This game is absolutely horrific. Although A lot of these things are beginning to be dealt with nicely. Each issue is pushing a little more in the direction it should have been going the whole time but none the less.. It's something I enjoy playing with friends for sure. I say yes to buying it.. but I am being very very cautious about the decision. One update could cause 10 more and 10 more updates could destroy the game completely. I say keep it away from kids.

review: In between the time I last reviewed this and now I have become utterly disapointted with the direction of the game. Ever since 1.0 there was a serious lack of communication updates and new content. It feels like the devs have hit and run. Don't get me started on the new emote system... That can right off. It took them 3 months to get a roadmap out. Not even a roadmap really more like a "this is what we WANT to do. thats it. bye." Doesn't feel right. Bluehole you have done next to nothing to fix your stupid cheater plagued game. First Review Damnit I love this game.It has its problems. The game still crashes sometimes. Sometimes it feels like the netcode is wonky.But once all that is shoved to the side you have an excellent game with a rush like no other. You can feel your heart pounding through your chest as you make it through the top 10.. top 5... winner winner chicken dinner. That feeling will always bring me back.

review: **ORIGINAL** Constant cheating even still in mid february. Easy to tell when you watch replays that half the players can see through walls because they are only ever looking the the EXACT direction of enemies. And not to mention when you're level 3 vest and helmet get melted from 500+ yards away in just a few seconds. Some cheaters have even gotten to the point where they auto aim for the chest so that it's more difficult to get caught by the system and guess what IT'S WORKING. They are all over the place. Multiple games in a row. Multiple cheaters IN ONE GAME. And easily verifiable. And those are only the ones that I run into. At this point my strategy has been to listen to shots and watch the kill feed. If they're going down instantly to the same guy over and over I've literally have to just run away. No fun and blue hole are making it so easy for them. 500+ hours and lots of fun in the past but I'm putting this game away until something noticable changes.**UPDATED** better on the cheating but it comes in waves. Bugs here and there but it's playable again.

review: Welp as someone who was a massive fan of this game as the ARMA 3 mod. This standalone version is a heaping pile of garbage.With the amount of money they've made on this there is so much more work that needs to be done that while the game is playable the hit physics hacking and server lag just make me want to play elsewhere. I was hoping by now the developers would have started to address some of the fundamental issues the game has but alas they would rather focus on new even more buggy content instead of tighting up the core functionality of the game. Almost 2 years in and it's still rough around the edges and feels Beta. Even other Beta games have more polish. Do yourself a favour and buy Escape from Tarkov instead!

review: * UPDATE *The review below still stands but there has been a multitude of additional bugs that have made this game a little bit harder to like. You have been warned.This game is probably the most fun I've had with a loot n' shoot type game in a while. There are quite a few positive notes to be had about this game but there is also the equally as many negative sides. The biggest issue that most people will see right away is the controversy involving streamers stream sniping and subsequent banning.While that is a very awkward subject to reach common ground on it is something to be aware of before you buy this game. Besides that there are just minor issues that rear their head once in a while but when they all are cataloged and added up it shows that this game is definitely still in need of a fair chunk of work before I could 100% recommend it.However the positive sides of this game are amazing. The intense firefights the constant decision making required and a little bit of luck all go into making this game something I will gladly put 100's of more hours into.

review: This game is my first ever attempt at Battle Royale. Initially I hated the concept but after I tried PUBG it changed my mind about this genre. I have grown to like it.As far as map size goes this game is awesome. You can play the same map over and over again and you'll always discover something new a new location a good hideout or a nice spot for long distance sniping.Gameplay can be clunky at times especially the running/crouching and jumping over obstacles but it's not game breaking. However I sincerely hope that devs will improve movement over time especially landing with parachutes as it's glitchy and you can get stuck on invisible barriers around buildings.Aiming/shooting is very well done but scopes are very hard to master since some of them have inaccurate zeroing distance.Vehicles are well done they provide very low armor (which is realistic) and you can't bunker yourself in a van vehicles are merely necessary for quick transport between A and B good for a quick resource gathering trip to those high yielding drop spots. It's also very noisy which is making you a moving target practice for any listeners out there.This game provides good diversity of gameplay. You can totally be a crossbow Rambo type or a sneaky silenced SKS assassin. Either way you will find the game highly enjoyable.Now the concept of a shrinking zone is VERY annoying. I must say this is the only part of this genre that I have absolute conflict with. I understand why it is necessary to get the group closer together for a good shootout endgame but I think that zone could have been done much better.First of all it shrinks WAY too fast and the countdown timers are too short. I believe they should make the countdowns 5 00 for each phase. The endgame is the least fun part of the game. You're bunched up with 5 10 people in a very small area and you can't even utilize cover if the zone ends up being in the middle of the field.I believe the zone needs some serious improvement. I also hope that devs will introduce more maps with diverse weather in the near future. All in all I'd recommend this game I got it at full price and I don't think it's worth $30.00 at the moment but if they add new maps/weapons and improve the zone I'd say it would be worth even more than that.

FLY!Spend 10 Minutes Looking For A UAZ Get Into Intense Heavy Gunfire Somehow Survive 20 Alive You're Drowning In Play Area Pull Out SCAR L That Took You 15 Minutes And 1 Kill To Find Fire An ENTIRE ING EXTENDED MAG INTO THE GUYS SKULL Get Away With No Health Left (Somehow)5 Alive Field Mini Hills Guys With AWMs AKMs And Grozas You Kill A Guy Hide Like A In A Random Shack In The Middle Of Nowhere Despite You Having Better Gear Than Everyone In The Lobby Guy Walks Into Your Shack And You Take Off His Nipples With 5.56mm Rounds 3 Alive Hill Kar98k 8x Scope You Hear Footsteps Behind You YOU TURN INTO A LITERAL ING NINJA AND TAKE HIS EYE SOCKETS OUT Loot Him Get A Med Kit Feel Like A God For 5 Seconds Realise It's A 1v1 And Start Hyperventilating 2 Alive You See Him Hiding In The Grass And You Think You're Smart When You Throw A Frag At Him But He Sees You Turns Around Shoots You Multiple Times But You Get One Hit On His Level 2 Vest With An M4 And You Win...This is just my personal experience with PUBG I still enjoy it im just mocking the fact on how i can be literally the worst person in the entire server but luck is somehow on my side throughout the entire game so i just dont die no matter how many stupid decisions i have made during this match...I reccomend PUBG to anyone who doesnt care when they get shot 500m away and somehow doesnt get off this is the complete opposite for me however but... i still play it for some reason /

review: Hot damn get this ing game. RIGHT NOW. Think third person shooting (or first person if you'd like) warfare scavenging and survival. Imagine immersive essentially infinite maps and the impressive player count of J RPG meeting a polished ever expanding strategy oriented survival game.This game is worth way more than it costs. It's fairly polished (except for getting snagged on some objects every now and again) and it pulls no punches in its range of arsenal. You are unlikely to find the same weapons twice in matchmaking which forces you to be versatile and adaptable.You simply must buy this time. If you're not sure just yet watch some livestreams of this game from a high skill player or team of players and see what this game really offers. Hell watch a few different livestreams of this game to get a feel for how different you'll have to play to make the Top 10 or even be #1.

review: 3rd edit to this review. 18FEB18.Still think this game is not worth a recommendation. Would be nice to see the game constructed better. Don't get me wrong I still find it a lot of fun. I will say though not as much fun as I used to. I like the new map I really do but I seem to get it 4/5 games and its really annoying because I like the old map too. The new map has so much land mass and is so spread out I often find myself seeing a few players right after stepping out of the herc and then no players again until under the top 20. The map is good and I like the design of it but it's just too spread out and even starting with 100 people I still find it boring unless your run at every shot you hear. Can't wait for a AAA game dev to make a battle royal. So many early access and unfinished games being released at the moment it will be nice to see a polished complete product.

review: This is abosolutely an amazing game by far one of my new all time favorites. This game feels extremely balanced and fair and every match feels like im in a different movie every time. This game is going to get your heart pumping hunting down llittle enemies like animals or being chased down by a some kids with 8x scopes it's all engaging and win or lose my satisfaction seems to be high. For example me and a friend duo'd in a foggy match and we ended up getting into the top ten. We ended up having enough supplies and armor to hold down an area and we picked a top point upon a ridge and we stayed prone...and we waited. Covered by grass behind a tree on this point we began to see movement nearby so we moved prone and my God. The atmosphere the shots firing around you nobody sees you but you see them. It felt like I was playing 'All Ghillied Up' from CoD 4 and it brought back so many memories. This game is all run and gun tactics run for your life or be the last man standing in a small house. Don't hesitate to buy this game for an Early Access it really blows my mind. If you're complaining that you keep dying instantly every game because of other kids suiting up quick then my suggestion is to stop complaining because you're dropping next to squads. Move off grid find some quiet areas gear up move quickly but slowly keep your guard up and understand that you have an environment to work with. You don't have to kill everyone you see either just move. I have had no experience with the streamers ban thing but those streamers. This game is most fun with friends but i do recommend playing alone if you want to truly progress your skill instead of relying on your girlfriends to get you that chicken dinner.

review: All I can say now after almost 200 hrs is STAY AWAY. I love the this game and it can be a lot of fun with friends. As of the last 2 months I have been running into shameless Chinese cheaters in every single game. Guys that can shoot through walls guys that no matter how well you hide or how silent and careful you are the ALWAYS know where you are. It is sad and absurd that Bluehole can't seem to care enough to do anything about it. There are many more games that are copying this game type so there will be many more options for those who want to continue playing something like this. There is obviously Fortnite as an alternative as well as Dying Light getting a BR mode as well as Call of Duty looking into it. Don't even get me started on the buggy mess that is PUBG. My parachute gets "caught" in thin air more often than not and releases me with the force of a catapult and leaves me with 3/4 hp to make sure I get ed in the as hard as possible.

review: This game I don't know how to explain. This game is something too much. They add vaulting which took them 3 months to make then whilst they do that they ing made the desert map. Nobody asked for that god awful map. I'm starting to get used to it but once you actually look at it it makes no sense on why its been made. Nobody asked for it its ing spanish most people in Korea never even experience desert in Korea like even went to one in Korea. What would've made more sense is to add another russian map that was snowy. You know something they have in Korea and that they can relate too. Another thing is the RNG you can land in po i get a 1911 and a shotgun and then somekid already has a lvl 3 helmet vest backpack with an m4 and a kar. Which is so stupid I'm not saying RNG should not be a thing BUT LEVEL IT OUT FOR GOD ING SAKES. And especially how you can hit someone in the head and it will count as a body shot for some reason. You can hit somebody in the head 3 times with no helmet but they can one shot you with a scar no problem like your some ing chihuaha. THEY NEED TO ALSO FIX THE CAREPACKAGE THING WHEN YOU GO ONTOP OF ONE YOU DIE. This game is gonna end up like H1Z1 decent and abandoned by its creator. They still need to figure out some with the goddamn optimization and for some reason while the game is unfinished they decide to release it out of alpha. Despicable these Koreans should stick to what they're good at making MMO RPGS and thats not coming from a racist stand point thats coming from what they did before make mobas and these games. They have no experience except some kid that made Battle Royale mods for ing arma and abandoned his first project H1Z1 KOTK. Hope I could change your minds.

review: Brazilian player here.Can't recommend the game at this current state. Not enough optimization even if i have a somewhat potato pc it should run a little better destiny 2 did. Tick rates are insane and i won't even begin to talk about diferent supports in diferent regions (We need a little better support here). Bugs in vehicles are sometimes hilarious sometimes enfuriating there's a lot of inconsistancy there. The main reason is due to hacking. I see that North America players are asking for region lock primarily locking China and even if i understand their frustration there are lot of hackers on South America also for this reason locking China isn't the full solution. The real problem is on the actions that are not severe enough or not put enough effort into baning. While playing in squad is the main reason i play this game i can't enjoy it a little more competitive when whole squad drops in 4 seconds 1 kill per second when someone shows up with any weapon. If is about to happen a region lock please do support the other servers the fun of this game is playing togheter with quality.

review: I don't normally write reviews for games but I couldn't resist this time. Third game with 2 friends one is good at the game and the other is a noob like me. Enter town at the start of the game at least 10+ people. Skilled friend gets into a 1v2 fist fight. Since half the people in the NA servers are Chinese he says " You!" in a Chinese accent over voice chat. One Chinese guy replies "No you!" in the same accent. Begin back and forth of " you!" as more people joined in the fight. Eventually have 10+ people fighting in the middle of a yard yelling " you!" at each other. Victor was a Chinese team. Final words were "China numba 1!!!!" By far one of the funniest experiences I've ever had in gaming.

review: This game is trash I have over 200 hours in this game and yesterday I literally had my damn breaking point. Yes the hacking is ridiculous but if that didn't exist this game would still be absolute hot garbage. At best it looks like a PS3 game and I'm talking early not later console life. Now if it looked like trash and still ran well I would give it a chance but it looks like trash and then you have to wrestle with constant stutter and rubberbanding in this "full release" game. I was patient with it when it was in early access but ffs it's full release and it STILL has the same problems it's been having since day one. Even Region Locking China isn't going to fix the inherent issues within the engine itself. The worst part is that the company in charge has made their ing money back and more but still want to charge for keys to open cosmetic lootcrates. If you haven't bought it do yourself a favor and just download Fortnite instead it's actually made by a real game company that listens to the community. this game and may PlayerUnknown eat fish heads.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I can't give this game a thumbs up in its current state. This game had (and still has) the potential to be one of the best games ever. The only thing holding the game back is the misconception the devs have to why players want the game to be region locked. I'm sorry it's not xeonphobia that makes the player base want china to be region locked. The player base wants china region locked due to nearly all cheaters coming from their plus they have an advantage when playing on NA due to them having extremely high ping allowing them to shoot where players were before they ducked around a corner and have it register as a hit even though its not. The quality of my games have been going down steadily and it is really not worth playing unless i have a full squad on.Please fix this game. Theres no competition for it now but once there is alot of people are going to jump ship.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Game used to be almost perfect at one point. But then it started getting "improvements" every single update seems to mess something new up. Always some weird optimization problem vehicles just don't work no matter how hard you try to carefully drive them (btw have you tried going on a head on collision with a bike and a buggy? It's pretty funny ) ). Servers are just terrible there is something wrong if you go behind a corner and get shot a second later from the same area while you are in cover. Cheaters cheaters oh and cheaters... last like 2 3 months you will run into AT LEAST 1 hacker of some sort every gaming session if not every game and that's not even exaggerating. I like the consept and everything used to really love the game and use to play every single day. Now it's a game you play just to goof around with friends or if you have nothing to do and decide to give the game another chance. There is very little skill involved at this point since the server desync is just ridiculously unpredictable. Headshots basically do nothing no matter what range you are at (Just search youtube and you'll find a butt load of clips where the shots just don't register at all). Also constant updates that "improve" the server perfomance... ever thought of removing the clothes that spawn in every single house?Also region locking all servers? Not a fan at all if it does come out that would mean I wouldn't be able to play with any of my NA friends. Just lower the ping cap? Anyways if it does come out I'm probably uninstalling the game with no comeback.

review: There are a lot of issues with this game. To start off with it's a lot better optimized than it once was but it's still pathetic for how long its been out. Vehicles are also evil don't trust them. There is a chance unless you wait until it stands completely still that you will "die from falling" by entering it. These bugs aside the gameplay itself isn't really me either. It doesn't matter how good at FPS games you are nothing will gurantee a win in this game. It's land loot hide or get killed. This game relies heavily on being patient and cunning rather than reflexes like other FPS games do. Which wouldn't be a problem if it wasn't so boring. If you want to experince what I would call a Battle Roayle game done right go try out Fornite. It's a lot faster paced and better optimized. It's also free.

review: This game is very enjoyable and below I will list my Pros and Cons.Pros Rewarding in the sense of getting your first chicken dinner. Realistic items (IE Guns armor vehicles graphics) none of the Super Duper Crazy Mode Shotgun or Quadruple Barreled Revolver. Can find lots of different communities on Discord that make the squad based mode a lot more fun. Can find tactical people or chill players what ever you want! Overall gameplay is great. Competitive communityCons Lag at the worst of times however its rare these days (for myself) Cheaters the number has dropped significantly for me since I first played however. Before it was 4 or 5 every game now I might get 1 every 10 games or so. Connection into lobby this needs to be fixed. When you join a game (usually always my first game of the day but sometimes more) it gets stuck on the PUBG loading screen. No sound nothing. Will usually correct itself but can be frustrating at times. No Unranked servers. I would like this a lot because theres times where I want to mess around but not screw with my ranking. (IE Crate hunting games or pistols only) View distance. There is nothing worst than getting a ghillie suit finding some tall grass sniping with flash hider and getting pegged off from someone 300 yards away because the grass doesn't render for them that far and it's like you're sitting on a flat background. Graphic Settings "cheaters" same as above sort of but by reducing your graphics to low you get an advantage as less foliage renders in giving you more ground to look at for people who are prone.Mixed Feelings Loot boxes I am fine with loot boxes as they are purely cosmetic items and give zero benefit to the game. However they've introduced a box that now requires you to purchase a key for $3.00 CDN and that's just wrong in my eyes. As a side note for beginners or anyone who hates playing with random people in squads and always use that as an excuse for region lock join a discord server and find some people to play with. It's not hard at all and can get a squad in 3 minutes of looking.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: When it comes down to it this is a really fun game. Some games aren't as fast paced as others and some are just downright slow for 10 minutes or more (You literally see no one). You also have a lot of influence on how each particular game plays out especially in the beginning. This makes for a very unique experience in every match. When you get to the last ten players it starts to get really intense. Somone could pop out of anywhere you might even have just walked by someone hiding in a bush that is going to shoot you in the back of the head. So you always have to be aware of your surroundings.This game may still need a lot of work but it's also priced at half of what your usual game would cost. So really it's a lot for the value. While I do not agree with loot crates they are purely cosmetic and I don't feel like I need them to be as cool as the next guy. Unfortunately including loot crates also promotes cheating. I've been lucky enough to feel like I don't really encounter them too often but I definitely believe it is a problem as there is so much money to be made by doing so. Bluehole does seem to be working hard to deal with the cheaters though.So all things considered I would highly recommend this game. At the moment it should not be taken too seriously as there is still a long way it needs to go. At this current time though it still provides many hours of fun and the devs update it very frequently and have come a long ways in really not that much time. So I have faith in them continuing with their improvements and look forward to a game that continually evolves and becomes something much better than it is even now.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It has everything you'd think this game should have. The custom matches don't work yet but this game is still in beta. When it becomes available. I'd like a setting to allow the map's alphabetical boxes that grid the map as you look at it to become randomly filled with the blue circle thing instead of the blue circle thing restricting you to a defined region that you have to run your *** off to get to. It would make it more like Battle Royale the movie. Since that's what they do in the movie. They marked the maps to regions that were 'locked' and anyone inside of it would die off if they remained in it. This would give the online battles more longevity for those who like to have things feel a bit more campy. Plus it would make it easier for beginner players to survive longer.Also maybe opening up the workshop would be nice to have some custom weapons and armor and clothing etc. Although the grid blue box thing would be the only thing I'd want more out of anything else.I am not sure what else I thought might be nice for this game. Although that's all. I will return and fix this review when I've thought of more stuff. Otherwise It's a great game and I can see why people play it so often. Worth checking out for an hour. Incase your unsure.P.S It would be nice to have a feature where we can see who we've played with in the past few games. Like Xbox does. So we can friend ppl when we've forgotten to afterwards.

review: Satisfying kills and victories.Matches found fast quick pre game lobbies most of the time.Good variety of weapons and other items.Horrendous hit registration and desync issues.Does not feel like UE4. No fluidity to animations interactions with environment are weird and choppyVery poor optimization.Any given match quickly devolves into a hide in a room simulator.Could look better when everything is maxed out.Unreliable servers random spouts of downtime.Steep asking price all things considered.Luck is too important a factor in late game.Low reward gameplay.Weapon mastery/challenges/etc. would have gone a long way.Devs really didn't do much after exiting early access and handed the throne to Fortnite willingly.Specs Graphics Nvidia GTX 1080 Ti Founder's EditionProcessor Ryzen 7 1800x 8 Core 3.6 GHzMotherboard MSI X370 Gaming ProRAM G.SKILL Ripjaws V 64Gb DDR4 SDRAMHDD Samsung SSDPower Supply EVGA Supernova G2 1600WDisplay Acer Predator XB321HK 32" 4k

review: So after 110+ hours of playing I have mixed feelings about this game. On one hand I ve had a lot of fun with friends doing impossible things and killing other players. Had great times. But now that it is nearing 1.0 the thing that I used to ignore "because it s still just a beta" hasn t gotten any better the optimization. You will die because someone shot you through a corner. You will kill someone because they accidentally glitched through a wall. And none of this has been improved in a long time. The client side of things are pretty smooth (60FPS+) but the server code simply needs a lot of work. You need to wait until a few people die at the beginning of the game so the game doesn't screw you up. You end up trying to pick a simple gun and some bullets at least 5 times because the game just won't let you. So in summary sure you re gonna have some fun with friends. But don't expect the game to be fair and/or "logical".

review: I really liked the idea at the start but extremely liked the idea of being first person only hell I got to the second person alive at one time.However after waiting and waiting and waiting for first person only servers to be released for the Oceania area I grew bored of it. I can't play the Asian servers because of the immense lag I get and it isn't my internet oh no I have Fibre (Gigabit Fibre in fact due to this being a newly made house in a new area). I don't really enjoy being killed from someone camping inside a room using the third person camera to peek outside of said room. I understand that it's a game mechanic but with the option of having first person only servers I would rather play that.Aside from that there isn't much in terms of progression aside from being top x that is really it hell you don't get much in terms of being the overall winner it'd be nice if you got a box at the end or something.This game is $40 for me (NZD) and in reality I paid for something that I didn't get too much out of the thrill wore off at the start and well what can I say it's boring waiting for them to have first person servers in other areas. I get they are adding new maps and such that's awesome but with something already implemented it should be easy enough to open up a server in different areas it isn't like they have to recreate anything DevOPs was made to be able to clone something that works for a reason.Also the talk of hackers is sad this game must have made enough money to hire a whole company to dedicate their time to bug test and find every exploit possible but it seems like that isn't the case. There are bugs that have yet to be fixed and the IRRITATING bit is the refresh of the start menu I get it Bluehole developed the game I get it this game idea was decidedly and assumed to be made by "Player Unknown" when in fact if you look at the idea it's a rip from a book.You can get this thrill from playing the free version of fort nite and once the hype wears off you'll be where I am bored.

review: This game is very good for its current state being alpha still a few bugs that they need to fix and optimizing the game a bit more wouldn't hurt either. Guns feel very nice and look good firefights are very fun and intense map size is very large and the vehicles control well too. Plenty of different weapons for how early this game is and I have a ton of fun playing it even in solo matches definitely recommend this game to anyone looking for a battle royal/hunger games type of game with a lot of realism to it.

review: Having played H1Z1 for a few hours i can honestly say for those who like realism this game might be the best BR system in place right now. There is a ton of tweaks that needs to be done ASAP but the basis of this game is pure and fun after watching Summit1G play this game relentlessly i can say I would do the same if i didn't have a job. The only other BR game i see competing is the Escape from Tarkov game but that is still up in the air since it is in development.PROS (Compare to H1)CANNOT GET OUT OF MOVING VEHICLE !!!No hit marker A lot more customization towards gunsthe looting method (IMO)verstile and different guns give better match upsCONSNeed a lot tweaking before being the H1Z1 killerthere needs to be more action during phases of circles a lot of times people just ran 4 5 Minutes before seeing anyone.

review: Everything below still applies the game has had waves of cheaters stroll through and get banned which has severly hurt the playability as well as the complete non optimization of the game to run on the PC. This is worrisome as the game comes close to launch in December and it still behaves as a BETA. I sincerely hope it does well but I don't think this is going to continue to trend upwards as other publishers and developers have jumped on the concept to make their own versions. This is a review of the July Early Access. So far exceeds my expectations for an early access it plays like a Mod (surprise right?) and has its fair share of bugs and glitches.That being said it will probably create a new niche similar to WC3 DOTA led to stand alone MOBAs (or which ever one you believe). Large scale well done battle royale the game play is over all fun adaptable and epitomizes the combat is 90% boring waiting and preparing and 10% pi$$ing yourself when taking fire from an unknown direction. (Disclaimer this in no way actually resembles real life combat or the life and death stakes of it. It's still just a game.)You can have several different play styles from super aggressive to pacifist trying not to kill anyone and still win but the game rewards those who think about movement timing patience and skill. But it still throws everyone for a loop with randomness.TLDR Hunger Games on steroids set in Russia with mostly modern weapons.

review: Product received for free. I recieved this game for free so I might as well play it to see what the hype is all about as most of my steam friendslist have turned to PUBG. I have played matches with a squad of friends and solo for most of the time i find myself just playing with a friend.you can most likely solo the game on the solo que but its not as fun as having someone to back you up and talk with you through a wasteland filled by 100 people itching to kill each other as much as possible just play with a friend since its not insta kill and you might have a shot to make a comeback.Personally I found this game fun. its not perfect but its fun and I find myself with the itch to get on and play the game when I am in the mood. I believe its the fast paced first half of the game is what I am looking for Scavenge (Fun) Gear up (Fun) Kill People (Fun) but as soon as the game hits Mid to End game its just heart pumping survival and I think thats what makes the game Interesting but not fun why? because everybody has the mindset of winning and its anybody's game. you being so close to that chicken dinner and suddenly robbed by the opportunity to win. which comes to some of the bad parts of the game and I am sure it has happened to most people.BUGS GLITCHES SUDDEN STUTTER and ETC...anything can happen in game the game is in alpha and is not optimized to suit everybody's pc specs which has made the game unplayable to some. "the game is not optimized" hearing the crowds plea and screaches. we are nearing the 6th month of the games release and I am sure PU and the team are doing what they can for the people. realistically we wont see an fps increase or stutter fixes bug fixes etc. within a year of updates. the game has alot of potential and has already set the standards for most people as this game brushed DOTA 2 off to 2nd place of most played games on steam so let the game sit for awhile let it breathe and in few months improvements will come one by one.Ill be honest anyone who has knowledge to create a game can make a fun battleroyal game. anyone. it just so happens that PUBG was one of the first along side KOTK if you ask me if PUBG did not have the player base then it would not be as successful as it is right now. given that the game has alot of unoptimized bugs glitches errors stutters etc.. I would not play it if I had to wait 5 10minutes to find a match. there are alot of games that are battleroyal based which is actually fun if you look around although fun as well they do not have the player base and thats the reason why I play PUBG is because I dont have to wait to get in a match after being hit by my stupidity every match as I commit common mistakes and dying to it with regret in my heart I can just click matchmake again and play.So do I Recommend the Game?Yes you can suck out all the fun on your first hours of the game since learning a new game is always a fun experience. Its gameplay is what makes players come back for more "I can do better" or "Just one more" mentality OR if you are a Sick Mental Individual and just enjoy genocide then click matchmake and sooner or later you are chained to the game. play with someone each match is a new and different experience which you and your friend(s) can laugh about. let the inner killer in you out and try and survive to get a taste of the dinner.

review: I've had this game since one month into Early Access. I have seen every change patch and countless bugs to this day. I have played this game quite a lot as well. That being said this is my review. TL DRRecommend? YesPrice? Completely worth itGood/Bad PC? GoodHacking Issue? OverratedGameplay? Extremely fun solo or w/ friendsLoot Boxes/Microtransactions? 7 Crates. 3 Of them require keys. Don't worry about loot boxes.Skill Cap/Difficulty? Easy to learn/Hard to masterReplayability? Extremely highBugs? There are quite a few but honestly most of them are just funnyShould I buy this game? Do you like shooters having fun with friends the occasional foreign screaming car explosion or random death by someone completely across the map? If so get this game. If not get this game anyway. I honestly cannot think of anyone that would not have at least 50 hours of fun for this game. PLAYERUKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS has filled me with a sense of accomplishment and excitement unlike any other game has for a few years now. When I first bought this game I could feel my heartbeat increasing as the match progressed. At this point I was only in top 60. This game allows a ton of hours of fun. It's fun to play solo however if you get a squad or even a duo it's 10x better.PUBG has also had a fair share of problems throughout it's life. In Early Access it was extremely buggy. There was an issue with optimization as in most super computers locking at 30 fps. Bluehole did a very good job of putting out some small weekly bug patches and bigger monthly bug patches however most of the community felt they were being ignored with optimization since Bluehole seemed to not be prioritizing it. This was in Early Access. A ton of patches tuning down my resolution and graphics and one SSD later I am finally running the game at a constant 60 80 FPS. I don't have a fantastic gaming computer however it is only a couple years old. Should this much work have happened to play this game at a constant 60 FPS? No no it shouldn't have and this is one of the biggest issues I have with this game. If you have a mediorcre or average PC I suggest getting a different game if you cannot handle this.Hackers. Yeah it has them. But honestly playing through almost 300 hours I have not encountered a ton. If you are hesitant on buying this game because of the potential hackers ignore it. If that is your only reason for not buying this game yet stop waiting and buy it already. The hackers are exaggerated. Yes there are a few bad hackers that you will encounter say 1/25 games. But it is still worth it to buy this game.This game has gone through many changes including some controversial patches such as introducing paid crates focusing on cosmetics and maps rather than optimization questionable priortization etc. However I feel like this game is 100% worth $30 even with some cosmetic microtransactions and loot boxes. Final Words Most of the issues with this game are exaggerated and blow way out of proportion. The community enjoys making a bigger deal out of things. This game is fun. It has issues like every other game on the market. Oh and yes it is better than Fortnite.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I very much like this game. A few things that annoy me but for the most part this game is worth the money. The first thing I dont like is that it is pretty hard to get a team of english speaking teammates when doing any sort of random team. Second thing the drives me crazy is after you play a solo round of any sort The game resets your game options. I personaly enjoy the fpp as I feel it is more realistic. After a round the game tries to throw me into the childish tpp. "Where are you from? My english is bad." all random players.I have met and added many friends while playing. Lots of good players out there if you look. The hackers and cheaters are out there too but getting fewer day by day. With a new map on its way and the hunger for chicken dinners increasing the salty salty fun is growing. I suggest you get a copy and keep your cry pillow close because I will be out there with a salt shaker and my louder with crowder mug drinking your liberal tears.

review: Played over 250 hours on this game. Pro's and Con's really. Great game graphics are good gameplay is 'ok'. However this game is incredibly buggy... you'll be lucky if you sometimes make it on to the plane. Black screen saying PUBG lasts around 5 minutes if you just sit there but half the time you'll die before you even make it in the game. (I am not the only person experiencing these issues). Laggy servers sometimes people will lag when you try and shoot them again not the only person experiencing this issue. Before you start releasing new crates and a new map sort the gameplay out it's getting to the point where I feel PUBG is not optimized for PC or Xbox One. It needs a revamp (gameplay). If someone asked me about PUBG this would be my response. 35% is positive whereas 65% is negative. If PUBG don't sort their 'stuff' out then it will start to lose people. I am putting a yes to recommendation as It can be a great game.
