review: EDIT I am addicted nowThe game is really intense... the fact that you only have one life makes it more brutal then any other shooter that I have tried even in the lines of Red Orchestra and Squad. You have to be careful and thoughtful in your movement and resource usage which I really like. Rushing in this game will always kill you (and a ganker in a toilet.. yea.. never forget about that one in a toilet)I noticed that even the game is very demanding and you end up dying alot here it also has this sweet balance in match duration. The matches seem to last just enough time to make dying not so frustrating knowing that you can always jump into another game which would only last 15 ish minues.On the technical note I am writting this one on its first day of ea and also I am seeing subpar fps and occasional stuttering and teleportation the entire thing feels write and I have no doubt that dev are taking this project seriously and all will be ironed out sooner then later (looking at you DayZ)
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Positives 1. Fun immersive gameplay including a great map and a few different weather scenarios.2. Good gunplay not arcade style and not too clunky either.3. Good variation of guns vehciles building types and end game locations.4. Great fun to play in squads.5. Leaderboard system to see how much you suck or pwn.6. Truely an exciting gaming experience being in the last few alive.Negatives 1. I have a 980Ti Overclocked and acheive 20 100 FPS with constant drops stutters and hitches (On Low/Med. 1440p using most of the tricks from the Reddit optimisation guide). The game isn't demanding and barely uses 50% GPU or CPU at this point. With optimisation this game could take off properly.2. 26 is fairly high considering the current state of the game and various other BR games can be had cheaper.3. No way to see ping in game killboard or various other UI items that would be considered standard in most modern games.4. It takes a long time to unlock each box (that gives you ONE cosmetic item) and the items so far seem to be terrible I.e. brown shoes grey t shirt etc. 5. The nature of the circle shrinking in a random location can make the end game pure luck for a win or a loss.Overall it's enjoyable but needs higher FPS. The game has brilliant potential and a steep learning curve but it's worth it for that WINNER WINNER CHICKEN DINNER!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Keep in mind this is an alpha and my following statements must be taken into consideration with that thought in mind.First right off the bat the game has set a precendent for greatness. I only have limited time in it but the few rounds I've played I can say that for a new early access alpha it has done better than its predecessors. Pros Fairly unique style.A large map.Ability to parachute where you want.Weapons work and bullets go where you expect them to go.Hit registration seems on point.Cons Price in alpha is too much.Some sort of lag input between the mouse and keyboard.Smoothness is on par but borderline awkward.Sound isn't precise.The UI isn't exactly user friendly."Peeking" (Q and E keys) is odd.Using the F key to interact is wierd.Picking up items has a slight delay.You'd expect right click to use your red dot sight but in my case it did not (I have to work out the controls I guess). Otherwise it seems like the development team is on point with updates. I haven't ran into hackers yet but I don't doubt there will be some issues with that as with all multi player alphas. As far as completeness goes it seems they've done a much better job with development and release to the general public than most alphas.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is pretty fun most of the time however the last 2 games i have played since recent updates seem to have ruined the motorcycle. I was going 40 kph in on game and landed on a guard rail...The ones you can step up on or over these are not tall.. The bike became stuck on top of the fence and i almost instantly blew up on a full hp 2 seater bike.. My Last game 2 minutes ago i had another 2 seater bike.. pulled up to a house and spun around then proceeded to backup on the bike until touching the house the back tire creeped up the house just barely and threw me off the bike and the game then said "died from falling" I was going 3 KPH!! saved this bs replay as well . Please fix this horse I do not recommend this game in its current state i seem to die more from glitches than other players shooting at me. I have only played 2 rounds of this game in the last week and the motorcycle glitched and killed me both times. Talk about getting Blue Holed..
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I played a good amount of BR in H1Z1 before it became KOTK and really enjoyed that but this is another level up from that entirely. The gun play feels good the graphics are decent and the map is detailed. Matchmaking is super quick even with duo and squad play (probably due to the amount of players). Squad play is the most fun for me playing this game with friends and the communication needed to suceed is a real treat.Yes the performance is less than ideal at the moment but the road map shows the expectation of big improvements by April 14th. Till then I'm still enjoying the game even with the dips in frames.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: alright mates after losing my real life to this game i have deemed it worthy of my first review.i give the game a 9.5/10i highly recommend this game for anyone who prefers suicide over victory as you will be running into gunfire for your first few matches. this game requires you to act fast and be tactile. its not always best to fire at anyone you see. as anyone who is just watching like a true predator will scope you out faster than you can jerk it. as of the recent updates the game is more and more playable. i started playing towards when it first came out. while still fun it was loaded with bugs and hilarious glitches. most of those are no more! scopes have been fixed since there was a split second lag. may not seem like much but trust me when firing at squads hiding behind trees all latency is apparent. i do wish the motorcycle with the side car would be tweaked so it doesnt flip as easy but who uses that pos anyway? im in love with the tweaks done to the submachine guns especially the ump which is now a viable weapon to use. the graphics are pretty nice but id like to see more done with it. currently able to run normal settings at 60 70fps average with gtx 10870 + fx 8350(upgrading soon). server desync is quite a problem that i have faced but it usually smooths out in a second or so.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I think my main gripe with this game is that multiplayer matches where your group doesn't fully wipe are just time sinks. If you die close to the start of a match and your team makes it to top 10 you've effectively wasted 15 30 minutes. You can choose to spectate the rest of your team flounder against a full strength squad to grab that dinner or alt tab out and watch YouTube videos. Solo is arguably better in that perspective but just not up my alley.

review: This game has grown tremendous amount of popularity for the battle royale genre but sadly the devs of this game don't care about its actual gameplay but instead continue to milk the game for money. I bought this game about a year ago having a first go at it having 30 fps on lowest settings and not liking the gameplay. Started to come back to the game recently and since I've come back they've not seemed to fix any of the lag or desync but now there also seems to an issue with cheaters and Chinese people being forced to play on western servers because of the amount of cheaters on the Asian servers.People post almost everything about this game to region lock China so they cant ruin the experience for the western players but then the Chinese that play fairly and want to win have no chance of doing so. This game needs to fix its hacking epidemic optimize the game engine and stop making useless updates like emotes.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Riddles with hackers which devs won't do anything about. Lag is a huge issue and this game is severely overpriced for the experience it gives you. Looting is bugged as you will randomly drop helmets/armour/ammo/guns and sometimes when speed looting it wont even pick some stuff up.Plenty of other Battle royal games that offer a better experiene without the hackers and the bugs. Money hungry company that dosn't care about its community. Micro transfactions through crates which you need keys for which are $2.30 on the market when the game itself costs $30 is horrible. Bad business Model for an even worse game. If i could I would refund it but i have spent plenty of hours trying to find the positives in this game but there is none.Circles are way too scripted and not randomised around the map enough (on both maps) sound quality of airdrops going past and red zones are way too loud. Way too many vehicale spawns and when looking through 8/15x scopes rocks regularly do not render in (even with a maxed out fiew distance)Rate this game 2/6 floppy socks
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Would I recommend the game? Yes. Is it a good game? Also yes.Is it great? No.PUBG is pretty much exactly what you want the generic go to large scale battle royale FPS. It's not groundbreaking or high art but it's exactly what you want for this kind of gamemode. It had standard guns action vehicles and map design. It's nothing too gimicky or stylized like the Culling which had elements that made it harder for you to just jump right into the action. With PUBG you just get right to it.If you like battle royale and want a game that's just battle royale and nothing else then this is it. However that's not to say this game is perfect.First off it's kind of clunky. The movements and actions don't feel very smooth at all and the controls don't feel satisfying. It feels like everything is dragging quite often. It doesn't have to be as simple as the movements in something like Half Life 2 but it definitely feels like there's room for improvement. Second and this might not be an issue for some but the game relies entirely on RNG meaning it's not really skill based but rather depends on who gets the best gear before everyone else. Personally it doesn't bother me but this is probably a shortcoming for most. However at te same time I have to agree it's kind of frustrating sometimes. You can go into a large building expecting there to be at least some loot but there's a high chance it's completely empty. It feels like everything video games taught me is a lie.Third and I don't know if this is just me but the ping on this game is pretty awful. The first few times I ran it not only did my game crash but it made my net go down entirely for my PC. Why? This is a guess but I don't think they really have a good enough servers for the amount of people trying to join a single server. Apparently the people who made this are modders not actual game developers so that might explain a lot. Fourth reigon locks and hackers. The UK or at least Europe doesn't seem to have this issue but if it's effecting anyone at all then it's a huuuuge issue. This should be a problem the developers should be on top of but they're instead working on emotes because I guess they're really terrified of Fornite doing better than them.You don't have to be like Fornite to be good just fix the problems that are making the game unplayable for a lot of people. You've made millions of dollars and are seemingly calling it a day. You can't do that. A lot of people care about your game and you're paying them back by ignoring huge glaring issues. Come on.CONCLUSION If you like battle royale or Hunger Games style games then you'll enjoy this game. If the problems above bother you then you won't enjoy this game. If you wanna be like me and hope it gets better over time then buy the game and see what happens. For now this reigon lock BS doesn't seem to be effecting Europeans so if you're in Europe you have even more reason to buy it.

review: First off this is a very good game but it also comes with its flaws. It's a one life battleroyal game to the death. You start off unarmed and run around looking for weapons to battle your way to the end game. The map is quite large so parts of the game can be quite quiet and you could go 1 15 minutes without seeing a person and even if you do you can be shot by someone hiding inside a building watching for people to run past. There is only one gamemode at the moment which is what I have described but hopefully the makers will bring more modes out for the future to make this a better game. Cons Can be laggy and desync sometimes plays a part in that Has been alot of cheaters in this game but they are working to improve it. I have nearly 500 hours in game and only came across 2 or 3 Realism is a little off at times. Bullet drop etc damage markers Random loot is so bad. I have seen my self go around at the start game and not find a weapon till my 10th house. Needs looked at Not enough transport in the game Lacks choices of maps (only 2 at the moment)Pros Ok graphics Good gameplay Makes you want to play more Great devs keep updating the game all the timeI could be here forever telling you stuff but if you like FPS games and enjoy playing them then this game is a must.

But they aren't EA. They haven't made it pay to win. They haven't outright tried to destroy their game. So a 7/10 is still positive. I do reccomend this game but mainly if you have someone to play it with. Alone just makes your realize all the quirks in the game. I hope you enjoy whichever decision you make.

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS for me is a love hate relationship. There are times where this game horrible optimization and game stability frustrates the hell at me and turns me away from playing it. But with the recent March 2018 content update I must say optimization has been greatly improved. People are always comparing this game to the recently released battle royal game Fortnite. Now as a player who has tons of hours on both games my favorite is still PUBG. To be fair Fortnite has a way better development team who listens to their player base and releases constant updates every week for there players to enjoy. PUBG on the other hand releases updates less frequently but when they do come out they add a lot of great content. Now lets talk about the gameplay. Now this might be quite opinionated depending on your experience and with that being said to me personally I love the gameplay. Gun play feels smooth interacting with your inventory is great driving with the recent update is greatly improved. Like holy its been way improved. Before the latest March 2018 content update driving felt horrible. Car handling was garbage. Now regarding the two maps that are currently in the game Erangel and Miramar. They both have completely different play styles with one having lots of mountainous terrain and the other being repetitively flat. My personal favorite map is the desert map Miramar because of the large open landscape and tons of huge cities to explore. But some negatives with this large open map is the difficulty to find enemies. Depending are where you drop it can take to the top 20 to 30 to start seeing people which might be a negative to some. Erangel on the other hand you will might find yourself in tons of more gunfights and struggling to find decent loot. Unless you drop it on the popular locations. With all this being said I love PUBG and will continue playing it almost every day. For $30 there is a lot of content here. We just got a cool new emote system steam achievement and a new jungle map releasing on the test server towards the end of the month. My rating for PUBG at its current state a 9/10 and cant wait for the new content to release.

review: It is truly a fun game... finding myself playing this more than I even watched gameplay of H1Z1... more to do etc. But it is early access and as such it has it's issues. I won't hold the issues against it since they obviously state it but in terms of development (and I do like how these devs are actually working on it) I wonder if the priorities of what needs to come and when are correct or not. Don't get me wrong I don't know what they have planned or in what order but there are certain things I wish the devs could put a little more priority in such as server delay or lag. Sure it can be a difficult fix for large scale map and hosting of 100 or so players but it can be heartbreaking being Top 5 in a match only to be killed while hiding around a corner or over a hill 100% in cover but still killed potentially because your body is still visible out of cover to another player. And the issue isn't a connection or hardware issue from my side so I'm confident in saying it's the game.Conclusion I'm not upset enough at the servers cucking me to be angry. The game is fun and I continue to play it despite some of the random BS I see and experience. Guess that's a really good thing huh? Coming back for more despite an abusive relationship? I feel like Rihanna.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The number of hackers makes playing the game an infuriating waste of time after you spend fifteen minutes surviving to be picked off by someone who has no line of sight and auto aims on your position.The games death cam will let you see just how blatant the cheating is and it is getting worse by the day. This used to be the main game I played with my friends and now none of us want to touch it.In addition to hackers prepare for constant ping abuse by players on the other side of the world who will get mad at you for speaking English on the North American server.TLDR The game had a lot of potential but the publisher has let cheating become rampant and in a game with no respawn it's just not acceptable and ruins the fun of a good survival shooter.

review: Below is my original review when I didn't reccomend it. I now recommend the game. I'm a bit lazy to write right now but most of what I mentioned in the below isn't an issue now worth the money. Old review Pubg is a fun game with a lot of potential however that's the issue. A game should not have potential it should have already achieved it. This is clearly an early access game that got released early because the devs realised that there wasn't much competition in 2017 so an early release allows them to gobble up rewards.The reality is that this game will be good in the future if the devs continue to develop it but if they do develop it further then isn't that admitting it was never finished? They've shot themselves in the foot with that one I think either admit it's not finished now or never acheive the potential. I wish they just called it continuos release rather than say "It's done but we're still working on it"So all in all it's an early access with a full game price tag. Maybe one day it'll be worth the full tag but the hype will be over then. If the game is on sale get it it'll be worth it. If it's not on sale then you're supporting devs who put you 2nd.

review: good joke game to play with friendsi cant recommend it for 28 whatsoever (compared to the free alternatives)if you're into the combat in arma and a slower more tactical based battle royale then by all means get this game.Personally though im not a great fan of the slower pace of this game. Everyone ive encountered has shot me from somewhere i cannot see them (leaning behind a tree or hiding in grass using a suppressed weapon) and nearly all my kills are from me hiding in tall grass or in a bush waiting for an unsuspecting player to walk by.im also not a massive fan of the cosmetics system in this game either. I feel at the start everyone looks very similar and once you save up your hard earned bp you end up getting a crate you need a key to open. the basic loot inside these crates i dont exactly like and the neato looking cosmetics are all rare and so have a high value. After they removed the clothing spawns ingame ive never been able to find any neat cosmetics when searching a house (i love the trenchcoat haha) and i dont see why they've done this. Sure it increases normal loot spawns but they can make them seperate and so you find weapons with the clothing.in my last few matches i havent really encountered any noticable bugs. which is a great improvement from when i used to play. The game used to be horrible to play bad fps loads of bugs and the graphics looked like doo doo. However i don't know if anyone else finds that its different for them.Anyhow its a fun lil game. best played with friends. however id wait untill this game goes on sale (if i ever does cos i dont think ive ever seen it on sale)

review: Sure the servers can be buggy.Sure maybe once every 20 or 30 games your whole squad gets insta headshot by one guy with an AKM a mile away. Sure a door might not open when you tell it to and then you try and open it again only to have it slam in your face.Let's face it the game has problems. What most negative reveiws I see seem to forget is the simple fact that PUBG is still Early Access it's not supposed to be perfect yet. Give it time and the issues will be addressed.I do have to say this game manages to get my heart racing and adrenaline pumping like no other when I have good rounds and don't just sit there dead spectating my friends mopping up. Overall absoulutely recommend and it'll only get better as time goes by and bugs are worked out.

review: Fun game but...The game needs a region lock (no Brendan it's not xenophobia). Unfortunately if you had to lock one region it would be AS/China but I think all regions should be restricted. There are enough Chinese players to keep those AS servers populated. There is no good reason to continue allowing Chinese players with either 300 ping or cheats (a sizeable percentage of them) to play on NA servers. They contribute NOTHING positive to the NA community. They can't communicate with NA players most of the time they will never have good connections to NA servers and they simply do not belong in servers on the other side of the world. They have their own servers... MAKE THEM USE THEM!I have no problem with players who live in China/other regions that want to play with friends/family in NA. The lock should only apply if every member of the lobby is originating from a region that is not the one they are connecting to. Ideally this means solo players should only ever be able to play in their own regions. This should apply to every region. If you are Polish Australian Korean Zimbabwaen or Turkish it does not matter. You shouldn't be able to queue into another region's servers unless you have a party member originating there. I realize that VPN's are a thing and it's not a perfect fix. Beside that Brendan you are an idiot to think this is about Xenophobia or racism. It's a matter of STABLE CONNECTIONS AND GAMEPLAY! IT'S NOT FUN TO SHOOT AT CHINESE HOUDINIS THAT TELEPORT AROUND LIKE MAGICAL GNOMES!EDIT 4/25/18 The problems with cheaters and Chinese laggers have gotten moderately better. The game is still riddled with design flaws. My review is maintained at not recommended.

review: It's a pretty good idea executed semi competently at best. Rendered basically unplayable due to problems EA (gasp) and battlefield et al solved over a decade ago. Demonstrates power of streamers &amp their mentally handicapped fans to raise a mediocre product to a level way beyond warranted by any tangible merit. Looks like a lazy asset flip too.Refunded after an hour or so. Matches seem to consist of 3 parts 1) 5 minute frantic scramble for weapons and gear at the start.2) 20 40 minutes of nothing3) 5 minutes of placing the crosshair directly on enemies' heads and clicking inneffectually untill a chineese shoots you through the terrian.4)Rinse and repeat.The whole project reeks of a dev team trying to grapple with a concept that is simply beyond the limits their skill sets and competence.

review: I hate the hype train. I hate things that the "unwashed masses" like. I hated ET I hated Titanic I hate vaping. But I have to say I actually like this game that everyone and I do mean everyone likes. This game is more than a "hunger games" clone. It's more than a shoot em up. It's more than a platform for you to be featured on as this week's "Awesome Death" on some lame streamers channel. It's a thrill ride and it will litterally make you sweat and shake. You really feel the adrenaline pump and you know that you are in a contest like no other even though it's a game. I haven't seen a game elicit a reaction so vicseral in me for a long time. This is already an instant classic and it's in open Beta!Do yourself a favor and get this game.

review: PUBG the Most played game at the moment but it Perfectly shows that even if millions buy something it won't ake it good. Infact the game is a mess an absolute mess. The Anticheating Measures are an absolute joke back then Anti Cheat tools scanned before starting the game if something was off Battleye can do that too but only with a predefined list of tools with the speed Hackers come up with new things it makes it obvious that Battleeye is not able to handle it at all. The Optimization of the game is another joke and like the Anti Cheating Measures this one isn't funny At any given time the game is unable to maintain a stable FPS even high end machines struggle my PC isn't the Best anymore but if i can manage 60fps in Star citizen then PUBG should run way better hint it's not. The Game does not look that great to justify the needs. The server performance however is something odd sometimes it's good then it goes back to absolute garbage and that even within matches.The game has an amount of bugs never before seen anywhere else the game can basically crash at any given point Starting the game Joining a match or simply picking up an item people seen more bugs then enemies within just one match the Vaulting is hella bugged as well sometimes you can enter through a window but don't leave through the same window. Picking up Items is mostly Laggy and bugged most of the time it picks up the entirely wrong item. The community of the game is the hatechild of Dota League of Legends and Counterstrike GO the most Toxic community you can encounter ever. A bunch of Internet Rambos playing epeen meassuring on the Steam Forum those with a bit of intellect left already left the game for good.The Performance problems of the game could be explained quite easy Bluehole stopped giving a wet damn Xbox Version Mobile Version that's what they care about and you can see it the game is in an abysmal state and Blue Hole doesen't give a damn. And remember there is no excuse for it being in the state it is in it was released in December and it still is a buggy mess. stay away from it and even further from it's community.

review: Sooner or later you will succumb to the inner feeling that you need to stop playing this game.Largely down to two things 1. The inconsistency of performance and how flippantly they seem to break the game and fix the game right now actually it seems in a good place drag looting feels the best it ever has and the game seems to be running smooth but there is always the inevitable feeling that the next patch will break the game.If the the impact of this was minute it wouldn't be so bad but when the game fails to load in half the time or a lag spike at the most inopportune moment it becomes intolerable.2. The loot. Honestly. You can sometimes loot half of a main town and come away with nothing... The 50/50 battles you might have with someone that lands at the same building as you fair enough it adds to the tension of the game and is a fundamental part of the Battle Royale Genre but looting 5 6 sizeable buildings and having a crossbow and shotgun at your disposal is frankly unacceptable.Sure this is randomised but jeez just increase the drop rates of loot I never heard once anyone complaint that there is too much loot in the game or that the game is being overly favourable towards you it is inconsistent beyond believe and unforgiving in doing so.I am recommending the game because as frustrating the game has become for me to the point where I cannot wait for a decent developer to come along and give us the Battle Royale game we want I put over 500 hours into this game and it gave me some of the most memorable gaming moments that I can think of. It is a fantastic game to play with friends very engaging and allows for each game to approached dynamically....But be warned...... as much as I wanted to love this game and play it for years to come....You will succumb to that feeling.

PUBG is an early access battle royale title with early access imperfections that will not be reiterated doesn t make sense to. Focus on core gameplay and replay ability. First PUBG a massive free for all brings players together through intricate player driven lobby mini games that can be as unique as the core game itself. Second the butt clenching feeling of a rear exit door opening on a c 130 isn t executed at all instead it s replaced with random almost simultaneous screams of a particular #1 nation. Last gameplay is short within a few minutes of actually landing you are forced to harvest equipment for other players.

review: The game is fun but frustrating as hell with its downfalls.Server instability buggy mechanics and infuriating movement sometimes.Its a good game needs work wouldn't recommend it unless your willing to 1) Lose more games than you win2) Have absolute horrible luck in RNG3) Play with instability in servers or gameplay4) Have friends unless your a solo person*Added*After 1.0 ReleaseThe game is somehow worse than before 1) Guns bug out now unable to reload on pickup2) Loading screen bugs which force you to close the app and restart to reconnect3) Hit registration is garbage4) Basic UI QoL changes haven't even been considered or implementedThis game is probably the most infuriating thing I've played and that's not due to the game. The real issue is just inconsistency. Some good fixes would be 1) Allow players to choose what map they want to play2) Have the game remember what game mode was played last3) Improve optimization by just removing grass4) Improve net code to reduce packet loss which results in desync or bad hit regGame is barely a 3/10

review: Writing this after 34 hours of playtime. The game is pretty fun to play. I have yet to encounter a hacker as so many reviewers say keep in mind I play on EU servers. The performance is honestly not as bad as some are painting it to be. It could definetely be much much better which it will be (I've tried the 1.0 test servers) but even as is it's not that bad. I play on low settings on a GTX 1060 with i7 2600k (oc'ed to 4.3) with 8 gigs of RAM and the FPS is generally above 60 with some drops to 30 40s in some areas. To sum it up great game don't get it if you're easily frustated tho.

review: This game has potential but for now I wouldn't recommend buying it unless it's on a serious sale.This game has been plagued with issues from the beginning hackers falling through the map flying into the sky and dying from fall damage server issues and much more Personally I don't have any issues with the performance but it's worth mentioning my computer is complete overkill for any game on the market so it should run well but your mileage may vary. This game can be fun with friends but the issues may grow on you to the point where you lose all trust in both the developer and the game itself. I really wish this game was brought up by a developer with an actual work ethic that isn't just interested in nothing but money. They don't fix the game they don't address the real issues with the game there is no love put into this game whatsoever and the insane amounts of money made from the game cashing in on the hype has not been put back into the game whatsoever. For the hours I have on the game I still got my moneys worth in term of entertainment but I really wish I hadn't given money to such an atrocious developer and I never will do so again assuming they don't go on vacation and never make a game again but maybe that would be a positive.For all informaiton on this game you won't have to look far for the current state of it but unless you're desperate for something new to play with friends I would urge considerable thought being put into this purchase even if you have money to burn.

review: Cons 17Hz Tick Rate (as a cs go player i am used to 64 128Hz and therefore this is not bearable) client side hit reception if you hit the player on your screen you hit him. which means also that a high ping player can kill you even when you are 2 seconds behind the corner. total t. weird melee/close quarter hit reception (not always but sometimes in crowded spots) cars crashing at invisible edges soft movement behaviour even at constant 100fps when you press W A S or D your character responds after 0 3s or sth which is ing weird for a fps. no deathmatch mode to try out gunsPros fun with friends (only reason i still play this game) the thrill of the end zone (20 people alive) decent game idea worst execution
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Oh Plunkbat How I hate to love you. This is the first game I have surpassed 500 hours in and still find myself going back to. The premise is simple Jump onto an island with 100 other players find loot be the last alive. Sounds simple right? Until you realize at least 20 of those players also have 500 + hours and won't fall for your silly tricks. While I often joke as do others of how great a run simulator this game is (You do have to spend quite a bit of time running across the map usually trying to avoid the ever encroaching blue circle of death) the thrill of spotting an unsuspecting player across the map with your 8x scope is hard to surpass. The long periods of waiting hiding listening is broken with sheer chaos of automatic weapon fire explosions and when in luck the triumphant victory over the opposing team. I played the game in third person view on Solo for about 100 hours before finding the real gem of the game Is in playing on teams. Whether Duo or Squad (First Person View if you do not want to get cornered or shot by someone who did not have you in their line of sight) provides an endless dialogue of strategy and entertainment for you and your teammates. Whether you enjoy skirting the edge of the map preferring to remain silent until the end game or jumping into the death zones for instant action there is a element to PUBG that I have not found in any other shooter. The fulfillment of getting a kill in this game is leagues beyond any other game I have played.

review: Excellent game even while having to nerf the graphics for my 7870 to keep up. Definitely needs a very up to date PC and a bit more optimisation but this game ****s all over anything I've played in the last 20 years or so... really hope it's cross platform servers when it goes live on console as I have a feeling this will attract a lot of people.Hard to pin point what makes this so incredible the scenery almost reminds me of being lost in a San Andreas trip through the countryside but it's sooooo much bigger than that. Even when you haven't got an enemy to shot at (which can happen for long periods early on) you constantly have that shimmering blue wall of death penning you in. There is nothing more annoying than someone pinning you down in the deadzone when that's closing in... you have to go for it and several times now I've died to that in the last 5 or 10 standing.Really hope this stays as good as it is and avoid the microtransaction market. This has the potential to be a COD killer in my eyes and for all the right reasons.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have over 150 hours on this game granted that's not as much as some people but I enjoy the game. Do I think there are stupid ways I ended up loosing like my car glitching out? Yeah but all the fun times I've had with my friends on this game make it worth it. I personally don't play solo as that's just not really my style but I think they are trying to cater to a big crowd now. I really don't think the game was ready to be dropped onto console like it was and probably not even mobile but I get it you have to spread your resources to compete especially now that Fortnite is taking over. I think the new map is really going to help those who want a faster game in PUBG and I personally wish I could choose what map you'd like to play on so I don't have to leave right after joining a game when it's a map I don't like but thats a minor thing for me. For 30 bucks I don't think I wasted it.

review: Yes this game has issues. Bugs lag hacking (which I do not experience often as I almost exclusively play in FPP mode)But. And this a big ol' but. I have put nearly 200 hours into this game with friends and EVERY single game feels different from the last one good or bad. I do not take this game overly seriously. It is a game for me to join up with buddies and go on an adventure. I have been pretty consistently playing for nearly a year and I can still easily recall so many hilarious and amazing moments from that one year alone.If I didn't have friends to play this with I would probably give it a negative review. But because I paid 30 dollars for this have played it for almost a full year ....and because I also got really lucky with a loot drop and made over a hundred dollars on it.... I cannot possibly give this game a negative review. Get the game play it and draw your own conclusion.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I ve been playing this since EA. It was a decent game back then hard to win but it was possible even though the weapon damage is a joke its like i m using rubber bullets... D but i really liked it. I ve never been really good at it but got my fair share of chicken dinners.Now that its released i loved the new jump mechanic it was horrible in EA but after a few rounds i was suspicous that im being killed by cheaters. As time passed and now im barely able to get into top 10 i realized that its true.Cheaters in every second game i play. Shooting with autoaim or through walls or just high ping players killing me after im behind cover. I just cannot accept this.Though i have no problem with any nation Chinese people flooded all the servers. Not just the problem that 90% of cheaters are Chinese but if you want to play in squad they just talk in their own language making it unable to enjoy a random squad game.Pro + Nice graphics+ Fun game mode+ Huge playerbaseCons Cheaters everywhere nowadays Game crashes in the middle of the match then wont let you reconnect. 9 out of 10 times it forces me to play on the desert map i hate Weird weapon damage Serious latency issues Worst rentable servers New paycrates but only cosmetic item so idc Every promise they made proved to be untrue to this point. In the past few weeks nothing was improved Hitregistration is a complete messAs of now 1/10 UnplayableHigher ping means low ping players can hardly hit you while you can hit them any time you want. )Do not buy this product now. Wait until they fix the main issues.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I like this game It is a fun game. However at the moment this game is under intense scrutiny.Before updates a new map and a vaulting system were promised THEY TOOK AGES to release these updates (I understand why but come on plz) Now that is here I highly priase the vaulting system it is amazing and just adds a whole new level to gameplay. On the new map... It is fun to play but I feel there are just far too many wide open spaces with not enough cover to move across safely with the way the game renders textures etc. Recent updates have improved performance for me and my friends that I play with. This game will get better It just needs more time. Be more damn patient. When it runs smoothly no laggy servers more content etc. This game will be 10/10.

review: A fun and casual King of the Hill game especially if you're playing with friends. The game has ups and downs sometimes you really get screwed but it's just how the game works. Winning is up to RNGesus and hiding but it's still fun to win the game especially when your only kill is the final kill.For an open world game though optimization is absolutely terrible. It's an 8gb game that looks and runs like poo. Graphics aren't everything though. The game mechanics also aren't done yet... And there are tons of hackers which is the worst part. It's not worth buying yet the devs have their sales and can only fix the game now.Save your money or buy something else.

review: I want to like this game because the graphics and guns are done nicely and the overall gameplay and idea is awesome. review: I have around 142 hours in this game so I guess it's enough to leave a review.First the game mode is amazing. Everything is so fast and you need to constantly be on point that it's hard not to enjoy it. It kinda becomes annoying after a while when you're spending 20 minutes into a game just to die to a guy who had a better position than you but that's just how things work.Sadly that's pretty much the only good thing I can say the game mode is fun.After playing for so long I get why some people would rather go to Fortnite or anything similar most games run better than this one A LOT better.I think PUBG is at the present moment the only competitive shooting game I like but man they make it SO DAMN HARD to love it when everything runs so bad.If you're having a great day and A LOT of luck you may be able to play 5 or 6 games in a row without having to open Task Manager to close the game because it stops working.If you're REALLY lucky you may not have to experience the neverending "Initializing" loading screen that appears before the main menu. I can't even count the amount of times I had to close the game because it stopped working.And just to clear this out I have a good computer Ryzen 7 1700 GTX 1080 and 16 GB of RAM. The game is simply poorly optimized and it's SO DAMN FRUSTRATING.Talking about optimizing I'm playing The Witcher 3 with everything on Ultra and the game runs at over 80 FPS all the time but this damn game has pretty much the same FPS with EVERYTHING on VERY LOW.That's just t.When it comes to cheaters I only encountered one that for some reason knew where I was without even seeing me once. And I mean I've been staying in the same house for over 5 minutes because I had something to do on my phone. There was no way for him to know where I was but suddenly he came right to the house I was in and started throwing grenades exactly in the room I was in.But except for that situation I didn't encounter any cheaters and if I did I didn't notice it.I don't regret buying this game it's a lot of fun especially at the beginning when you don't really know what you're doing. You're just having fun and dying over and over again.However when it comes to how the game runs I'm really ing disappointed low FPS with a damn GTX 1080 o in my computer with everything set to VERY LOW the game constantly stops working and I have to close it again and again. When it comes to audio well it just has a mind of its own. If you're lucky you'll actually hear where someone's shooting from. If you're not you're gonna spin in circles trying to figure out how the the guy is shooting from everywhere just to look at the death cam after you die and see he was 5 meters away and you couldn't ing see him because you were looking in the wrong place after the audio decided to make it sound like he was on the other side of the god damn map!I can't complain when it comes to how fun it is because I have over 140 hours in it so that's something but I invested $30 into a game with so many problems? Feels bad man.I'm surprised they just don't do something about it because even if you don't compare the game with things like The Witcher 3 Wolfenstein or any other single player game out there games similar to PUBG start coming out and they are doing great because guess what they don't have as many problems as this one.No bugs no problems decent FPS and a lot of fun. That's why people love Fortnite right now and they will keep loving it if the developers know how to make use of the luck they got and add more interesting things to the game in the future.Sadly Bluehole is blind compared the the people working on Fortnite and they care so little about how the game works that sooner or later it will probably die and people will just focus on a game that you can actually play without having the Task Manager constantly open just in case something doesn't go right.I truly hope they do something with this game to improve its performance. I don't give a crap about skins. I just want the game to run well and then I'll start playint it for entire hours a day once again.Sorry for any grammatical mistakes )

review: Some flaws but fun and exciting gameplay. As the circle closes the game gets more and more intense each choice requiring precision to survive and get a chicken dinner. The weapon quality is great fairly balanced and intriguing gameplay. The matches are short enough to not matter if you win or lose but long enough to provide quality gameplay. It's less competitive nature allows for the bulk of less skilled players (myself included) to not have to grind or take the game really seriously. It's an amazing buy especially for an early access game and my recommendation couldn't be stronger.

review: Summary(TLDR) PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds(or more commonly known as PUBG) is a battle royale game where you and up to 99 other players are dropped either by yourselves or in squads of 2 3 or 4 on an island. The goal is simple kill till you are the last person or team standing. This game has had its fair share of problems hacking bugs and optimization issues but it honestly has improved immensely since release I used to only get around 40 frames with everything on low/med. NOW I get over 90 frames on everything high/maxed. They have decent customization options and they just added skins. All in all this game is worth the money though I would recommend playing squads starting out with a group of friends who can show you the ropes because you will die a lot starting out and with squads you go down first you can learn from your mistakes. This is a game with some luck in it but good amounts of skill positioning and teamwork can beat the luckiest of people. BEST WAY TO PLAY(CASUAL) Mess around do random things grab 4 cars in squads and run up on random players blaring your horns. Or something random to lighten up the mood after a heartbreaking loss or frustrating defeat.(SEMI CASUAL) Mess around somewhat until 50 people die then decide to get somewhat more serious.(HARDCORE) Land tactically work together call out effectively position yourselves evenly distribute gear but making sure people are confident with what they have.(TRYHARD) Land either at the end or the beginning and work together and dominate so hard that it would make soldiers blush. Then if any of the petty casuals thought it would be a good idea to land with you rip them a new one. Every squadmate has a role and is near perfect at what they need to do.(NOTICE) IT IS NOT RECOMMENDED TO PLAY TRYHARD OR HARDCORE ALL THE TIME IT WILL MAKE YOU RAGE MIX IT UPIF YOU GO HARDCORE ONE MATCH AND LOSE GO SEMI CASUAL IF YOU GO TRYHARD AFTERWARDS GO CASUAL.Sidenotes/MisconceptionsAlso just keep in mind one thing if you get hit by your own car its because S is to reverse SPACEBAR is to break and if you want to stop you car IRL DO YOU REVERSE INTO IT? NO YOU hit the breaks! Vehicles will roll down hills! If there are two players left and both fire at each other at the same time who ever bullet speed is faster from their gun will win you both don't die. They thought about this the guns all have different muzzle velocities. If you are in cover and in third person and you shoulder aim and your crosshair is aim on another player but your body isn't far enough over and you shoot and you hit a wall it's because you are too far off to the side you can prevent this by looking next to your characters gun if you're not far over enough there will be an red X in front of your weaponThere are bugs such as where when you ram into a vehicle and you go a thousand feet into the air you may fall and get launched (Though I have never had the privilege of experiencing said bugs) are honestly quite fun. Again this is extremely populated game with 2 million players on it at once per day there are going to be people who find bugs.Yes there are hackers but they are banning them in large quantities (But again I only ran into 1 3 in over 150 hours and it was more of the guy snapped onto me when they didn't know where I was not the speed hacker or super aimbot type)All in all I would recommend this game it has a few bugs but it's more of the WTF THAT'S HILARIOUS sort of bugs. 8.9/10 Would Drive a motorcycle over a cliff do 2 back flips and stick the landing again.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: BattleEye is useless in detecting and banning hackers and it does not seem like a problem that Bluehole is able to fix. The leaderboards have been dominated by blatant hackers for months. Upon release of 1.0 there are still far too many hackers to make the game truly competitive. There also needs to be region lock so that high ping asian users combined with low tick rate servers dont give the US playerbase cancer anymore.

review: A Game That Should Still Be In Early Acces Battle Royal History I have played many Battle Royal games! Arma 2 Arma 3 H1Z1 Rust EtcBut all of them had issues that really did not make the games so fun as they should have bin Anything from broken guns to just being super laggy or buggy but PUBG changed that! PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS This game is really damn fun it is a mix of Realistic but as well has a bit of arcade to it the game has not bin out for a very long time so knowing that and that it is in a Beta stage. The game itself is really stable and yes the FPS still need a bit of work to be done with but I actually get better fps on PUBG then i did on H1Z1 and that is pretty damn sad! Loot System The loot system is really well made because they actually have Gun attachments in the game but not only that the loot in put into a Tier System (1 being bad 3 being the best) so its not like in H1Z1 where you look for 4 mins and you're all looted up and just camp the rest of the game. In PUBG you're scavenging stuff the whole game looking for scopes and such to make sure that you are set up for all situations! Guns There is a nice Arsenal in the game and more guns will be added. Each gun has its weakness but as well each gun has its good side Anything from an Ak47 having awesome damage but the recoil being really high or the m16 doing less damage but being really has no recoil so its nice for long range battles. There is as well SMG(s) and Shotguns(s) and yes in this game the Shotguns actually work pretty darn good! You as well can get some special guns that you will only find in Airdrops like AWM M24 M249 Tommy gun. Other stuff There is a nice amount of cars in the game and the physics for the cars are much better then H1Z1 they flip less and they handle much better then they did in H1Z1. Other stuff as the Animations and movement is really well done as well Only thing is missing is Vaulting because sometimes trying to jump over something can be a bit of an issue! Pros Great Map Good Hit reg Lots of nice guns Working Cars Custom Servers Solo Doubles Squad Great Looking Game Really fun to play Cons FPS Drops Server Issues No Seasons Prices is a bit High A few small Bugs Game Crashes Sometimes Final Vedic I love this game it's one of the most stable early access games I have ever played on steam and yes the price for the game is a bit high but if you can get the money for the game then you should most likely buy it! If you are a fan of Battle Royal like I am you mostly likely already have this game in you're library because it's one of those "need to own games" because it actually is playable not like many of the other Battle Royal games out there in the market right now! Hope you like the review!

review: This game is insanely addictive. If you like first/third person shooters where you scavenge for gear (think DayZ) this game is orobably for you. There are definitely still some bugs but thwy have not made the game unplayable for me yet. Depending on how you queue solo duo or squads of 4 and how well you do each match can go from a minute to 20 or so. I prefer playing with friends though solo is fun as well. Each match is different and gets your adrenaline pumping!Pros addicting game play able to play one match at a time and be done Great to play with friends every match feels unique frequent updatesCons still some bugs

review: PUBG is the King of Battle Royale style games (pun intended). The gunfights are instense and require skill the map is incredibley balanced and the game is just plain fun. Being an Early Access game I expected there to be a lot of issues and maybe even some drop off with dev support. Nah...this game gets small weekly updates and then a huge monthly update that introduces useful features and addresses important parts of the game. Do yourself a favor and buy PUBG even if you're not into FPS'. You honestly don't even need to shoot anybody until the very end (even then they can die outside the safe zone) so if you're into stealth games this could also work for you.Drove Jeep full of entire squad off a steep hill did a backflip and exploded 10/10

review: welp i have had the game since its day one early access release and the game has improved faster than i thought it would. however its not done yet still many things i wish to see dealt with i.e the ing net code and server lag that out of the way i strongly recommend this game its very fun when you win and the complete randomness of the loot really keeps the game fair so you dont end up with players that always know where to find good loot to have a better chance at winning. pubg is more fun to play with friends but if you want a real heart pounding experience when its just you alone on solo with the red flashing "2 players left" in the corner it keeps you coming back for more and more however the more i play this game the more i find myself having a love hate relashionship with it with all the current problems it can make it very frustrating to play sometimes but the current problems should and i hope be fixed in due time. all in all great game and will be even better in the future.

review: Timeline of the evolution of my review July Wow really addictive gameplay lots of rough edges but those will be patched soon. September Bullets being blocked by fences(but only on one side) getting hung up on laggy doors random disconnects low tick rate is starting to wear on me. Good thing a patch was promised in Q4! October Why the heck is vaulting taking so long to implement? Why do test dates keep getting pushed back? Why are they wasting their time on an Xbox One version? Why did it take forever for leaderboards to get reset?November What is wrong with me ? Why am I still playing this? FIX IT NOWProbable December 2017 review This is a trash game made by trash people for other trash people like myself who keep playing it anyways.Actual December 2017 review They actually did it! They hit their deadline for December! Amazingly they managed to fix the rubberbanding and the memory leaking crashing. On top of it we get the endless entertainment of laughing at videos of the Xbox One port.

review: This game is really good despite my hours on it I haven't found very much game breaking glitches however I would recommend it as it's a very fun game. I do believe they would later come with cases that you can pay to get but for now it's just grinding for that certain case. When with a squad or doing duo you gain the currency which is a plus side as to h1z1 you play with a friend its a waste of time not gaining exprience. The gun play is very nice with a limited amounts of guns (hoping for more when it's out of early access) but is better than the standard h1z1 Ar and AK. The map is a vast in size but I don't mind it as I go for the areas with more buildings. It's hard for me to find a vehical but for others it's a breeze. One side note to all I recommend getting a good pc in order to play this cause the frame rate is if you don't have one. All in all the minor cons are somewhat easy to get by and this game is worth the 30 bucks right now or wait until the summer sale to get a better deal.Game got ruined by streamers.

review: I actually liked this game as it felt like the publishers were taking good care of it but for the last weeks I experienced so many bugs and problems with this game that it often was hard for me to enjoy it. I hoped that the publishers would fix some of the common problems while adding some of the new stuff aswell but once more I feel like the greed took over and the publishers decided to announce the xbox version for december while the game for pc isnt even close to being finished. I understand they want to make money but I feel like they will lose a lot of customers due to the bad reviews they recently get.Edit Game feels more broken and to play with every update they make....

review: So here's my basic review for PUBG. In its early stages of release(post full release) the game was great however with the most recent mega patch(players who have been with the game since its early beginning arrival on steam will understand) the game is unsteady. Everything that was core to the mechanics of the game is now completely upsidedown. So its a game I rarely touch now. However for new players finally jumping into the game I will say it will suck at first you will die more than you will win and sadly despite best efforts you will run into hackers. Although there's these issues the game is still fun for those who play with friends duos or squads makes the game worth playing from time to time despite how broken the game still is EVEN in full release. So that's my review. Take it as you will but it's true inside and out. Whether you're new to the game or you've been playing awhile its fun yes but will it survive? No I don't see this games fan base lasting.

review: Played this alot with friends through all stages of development. Pros * When playing with friends it can be hilarious and fun* Gunplay/Battles can be quite exillerating * Good way to waste time and neglet all of your adult responsibilitiesCons * Connection plays a huge role so while on your screen you are shooting at the person you may not be. Which isnt the games problem it just can be annoying* Bikes and Buggies can be quite frustrating to drive as they can flip and kill you off small bumps in the road. * This game is (sad to say) only fun when playing with multiple people in a squad. Due to how slow and boring it can be between battles.Overall Even though this game is still in Early Access there is alot of potential to create an amazing game. As long as they continue to listen to the community and act upon it the game will continue to grow. TBH just doing this review to finish the Steam Awards lol

review: This game is kinda what DayZ intended to be in a fast paced scenario. It is fun to play if a potential early death in the game doesn't bother you (you can leave and rejoin pretty easily).Even more fun to play in a group of 2 or more then tactical thinking comes more into play solo is mostly finding the best spot and being a little lucky at aiming if you live long enough to be within the top10 it gets really intense and pulse rises!However this game IS STILL IN DEVELOPMENT! It is playable but still movement seems a bit notchy (on foot as well as in vehicles...especially in vehicles!!)hitboxes seem to be a little bit off texture (may be wrong I percieved it like that)only one map. It is big but after a few hours ingame you've been to most of the interesting locations and essentially know the map. Another map or two won't hurt for sure!

review: Great game. I feel the game is running pretty dang well now atleast for me and the team does seem like they care and are dealing with hackers pretty well. Better than CS GO imo anyway. It can be frustrating still some games of course because of the semi realistic nature of the game but thats what also makes the game and this genre kind of different and unique. I much prefer this over a game like fortnite because the adrenaline and anxiety that can come from this game. The gunplay is amazing as well and the best part of the game. The player base has quite a lot of degenerates and a holes though like in squads teams can rush you and one person on the flank can kill your whole squad which is annoying...RNG of course will always be a thing as well. I wish there were more vehicles in Miranmar as well and if they could shrink that map a bit it would make it a lot better imo the map has nice weapon spawns and good and interesting fights either in citiies or out in the mountains or whatever but its size is a bit much. Sanhok is really fun and a great map and look forward to its release hopefully they dont change it up too much.

review: After playing 90 hours of this game I can safely say it's a huge piece of Nothing that hasn't been said a million times but the optimization is ABYSMAL. Feels like you're jacks with a bunch of f*ckin' potatoes. You absolutely cannot play this game seriously in solos. Teams with your friends looks fun just because you can mess around with friends not because the game works in any coherent manner. It seriously just barely runs (I have a 1060 GTX 6GB) and you feel like you have no control over certain gun battles due to lag and rubber banding. This game has caused me far more stress than fun. If you have no one to play this game just don't even bother playing it. Garbage. Sad thing is I was hoping the devs would work on it over time but no it still sucks monster a*s a year later.

review: Game is entertaining fun and worth the money however here are a list of reasons as to why i DON'T recommend the game.1) Paid crates in EA despite the opposite being promised. 2) The creator neither cares nor gives answers to questions surrounding South African Servers literally just doesn't care about us asking doesn't even give a goal to achieve. 3) Latency issues and server issues in game this is an early access well aware of it but that's no excuse for servers not having the performance this game has sold millions of copies they can afford to create a massive server bank for this game they just aren't.4) The map becomes a bit boring friend of mine has pretty much given up on the game because of the map and the latency issues.5) Doors opening and loot spawning late. I have had it so many times where you run into a building after glitching through the door you attempted opening 3 or 4 times only to find no loot so you go upstairs and find a dot site or whatever and on your way back down someone is looting an m416 or shotty off the floor in the same building you just checked thoroughly then blasts you into oblivion. In summary the creator doesn't care about you as the gamer latency in South Africa is a b$%#h Loot spawns slowly at times server lag is real and there seems to be little to no intention of fixing it. #GreeneCameForCashAndHasNowLeftTheBuilding
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

But when you do feel like playing seriously you'll just find yourself getting annoyed by being killed by some script kitty that kills from a mile away with a smg. And the loot boxes are just greedy lazy way to make a quick buck I would not recommend this game in it's current state unless you just want to mess around with friends but if you are looking for a game like that I would recommend totally accurate battlegrounds the silly physics and controls makes the experience way more fun than PUBG's.

review: This battle royale game can get pretty frustrating. With the physics seen in the cars. Apparently a car moving at the speed of a snail can wipe out half your health?!!!Apart from that wierd physics. I think its a pretty great game. It (retains its realistic competitive shooting style)** and the fluency of the game definitely improved over time. Graphics looks x2 more amazing than its original design. And vaulting definitely gave the game a huge improvement.So if you want a realistic style competitive battleroyale game**. Go for this. Spend some money on this game trust me its gonna get better overtime. Theres this prominent love hate relationship that u will have with this game. For sure.But if you want ripoffs on mobile where u have to look at your puny screen. than be my guest.

review: Just let my hours be a testament to how fun and good this game can really be and I haven't even played that many matches to be completely honest. Yea it has it's bugs here and there but nothing game breaking and yea being that it's still in a technical beta state you're going to have to occasional match with people running hack mods but if you can ignore how few and far between those things are then you'll find a fresh and completely fun new take on shooters with the battle royale style. Every game can go completely different than the last and there's no leg up that people with a thousand hours of play time will have over people with 1 hour of play time starting each and every match it's all just a matter of skill of survival which will is something you'll absolutely learn and get better at with each match played. 10/10 would recommend to everyone who's a fan of shooters and especially those that can adapt with what they have and play the long term survival aspect of each game.

review: Wonderful concept but terrible execution!The servers are 10 tick (bad for a FPS) the servers are laggy (the game doesn't even let you see your ping). You get extreme desync and rubberbanding.There is no way to practice. Imagine a FPS in which you can't practice your aim can't create a custom server/game can't play on LAN. That's PUBG.There are tons of bugs (the menu is buggy vehicles fly at random hitboxes are buggy)Blatant hackers everywhere. The devs tried to fix it but banned thousands of innocent people instead.The devs are only trying to monetise the playerbase and have forgotten about actually fixing their game.

review: Its good... just temper yourself to be frustrated from time to time and youll do fine. Just remember to take your time and look all around you. This isnt a Deathmatch. You have one life and the longer you go the higher the stress as the circle of blue death forces you and your oppenents together over a half an hour 1v100 match. Last man standing wins. Don't get too worried if you dont win though. Its about the journey each round. Win or lose you'll probably not be content to just play one round. A warning make sure to break every two rounds or so... Gotta survive the BR known as life and you cant do that with blood clots from too many back to back rounds of PUBG.

review: so 620 hours game time and im deciding to write a review...i dont understand why there is so much negativity for this game...yes you encounter cheaters yes u encounter lag yes there are bugs yes the lobbys are annoying with the nut job people screaming racist/homphobic and generally horrific things.... HOWEVER all games that are online have this kind of problems and degenerate users.... and these issues/problems should not consitute for more than 20% of a review the review is for the game on the whole an not your own upset view because your not good at it... and i says its a FANTASTIC game!its a whole new style of game its not easy and it certainly not call of duty garbage its a hardcore "Battlefeild 2" that has been given a new look and syle. People complained about BF2 jus as they do this game but its not hard to leave a game and join another for whatever reason? its so quick to play either as a camping sniper or a jack bauer wannabe.i like the fact you can spend the whole game looting and get geared up to be killed in 2 seconds flat bacuase your careless it teached patience and demands you to be aware of your surroundings.i have had many WTF moments because i watched a death cam and it was not fair that lag was the culprit or because i stopped for 2 seconds to pop a bandage and got done by some one with an uze 1/2 a mile away but hey its a war game LOL!Overall i definately rate this game its supereb yes it has issues but what game doesnt? yes it hard but all games need to you to adapt and learn and better yourself! YES it has chinese hackers but atleast they are hacking the game nd not our government!i would rate this game for everyone and with a squad of friends or even randoms this is so much fun!my nly dislike is the sme as everyone elses they removed the different weather condition maps its not hard to leave a game and instantly join another they should have kept this feature it made the game better!

review: Bluehole is going to run this game into the ground. Most of my hours on this game are on xbox and that version is mostly reguarded as a failure so I'm not talking about that right now. I had expected the pc version to be incredible compared to the xbox version but the countless bugs optimization issues lawsuit drama toxic playerbase and overall slow and boring solo expirience just make this game look like a pile of steaming garbage next to another battle royale game that I could be playing on pc. To translate how bad the optimization is on this game I get 60 fps with max settings and vsync on Realm Royale but on pubg at the absolute lowest settings with vsynce disabled I can't even hit 50. Not to mention the lotto gambling garbage that is the microtransactions. I don't mind microtransactions as a way of buisness but LOOTBOXES. I'm very dissapointed and would not reccomend anyone buy this game. Get Fortnite or Realm Royale or hell even that goofy Totally Acurate Battlegrounds game. Those games are all free and in my opinion they absolutley blow pubg out of the water.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: All of these negative reviews are mostly BS by people who eitherA. Are mindlessly hating this game for having paid skins that you cannot sell on the market as if no other game does this and that this ruining the gameB. Are people with no skill that complain that there are "chinese hackers" even though China has been server locked for months nowC. The people with 200+ hours complaining that this game was "good at the start" and that it has "lost its charm" which is redundant considering they've continued to play this "awful game that they wouldn't recommend" consitantly since launch and continue to play it.And finally my favorite category of them all the people who complain about bugs that are now no longer an issue and they use this as an excuse for why they are bad at the game"I totally shot the guy but the stupid hit registration didn't count it""I got killed while I was behind cover" tThese problems are usually all related to people's individual connection to the server and have nothing to do with problems with the game. In my 400+ hours with this game I have never once been effected by these ridiculous problems unless there was a problem with my internet connectionIn conclusion don't let these negative reviews full of blind hate outdated problems and children trying to excuse their lack of skill with non existant problems get in the way of you buying this amazing game. This is by far one of the best multiplayer shooters that has come out recently and I will certainly be playing it for years to come (as long as these idiotic reviews stop depleating the playerbase).

review: One of the things that bothers me still is the character desync. Apart from that never really had problems in the game other than the very odd vehicle physics at times and instant death when you hop out at any speed higher than 3 kph. Just got out of a game and headshotted a guy twice with a one hit kill M24 and he only had a lvl 2 helmet on at less than 80m away. Apparently when I shot him on the screen he was just behind a rock from which he was peeking out of. But on my screen he was out on his he was behind. And the bullet travel on it at that distance is instantaneous with that rifle.It's a game in progress but damn.... sometimes small things like that decide between losing or getting that chicken dinner.

review: Player Unknown Battlegrounds is a game that is built on technical debt. You need a decent computer with good graphics to be able to play the game on low. In one situation I was getting 18 FPS with my 1080 ti during a shootout. This is unacceptable. While I understand that people need time to develop more features are being added without consideration for the stability of the game.While people might argue that this is a "Early Access Game" they are currently on Version 3.7.30.8. Since PubG has now entered competition with Fortnight PubG are doing more and more kneejerk reactions to retain it's playerbase. The latest was an 8 Man Squad Play which was an absolute nightmare. So by expanding the capability gameplay suffered. Playing this game requires different ways to resolve the many technical issues with the game.In addition to this I would also like to point out that even though this game is quite popular at the moment. The playerbase is currently suffering with the many technical issues that are in the game. However I do feel that like DayZ this game will fall to the way side since developers are too busy trying to compete in a market with a platform that can't outperform their competitors. A focus needs to be placed on rewriting and optimizing code rather then releasing additional content on a buggy platform.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: After playing this game since it's very beginning I can't reccomend it. It had potential but remains a buggy broken and unoptimized ugly mess filled with the worst playerbase I think I've ever seen and interacted with save for the few people who made the game slightly more enjoyable. Horrible hit detection and dropoff laggy servers and rubberbanding stuttering frame rates and network lag make this a chore to play. At this point I only play it to get the few cents and dollars from the loot box market so I can buy games that run 10 times better than this. Just because it's "Realistic" doesn't mean it's fun and reccomended persay.GRAPHICS 5/10. Decent for 2012.OPTIMIZATION 1/10. Horrible network lag bad servers stuttering framerates and crashes even on the toughest rigs I've seen. Even after it's broken "Out Of Early Access Release".GAMEPLAY 5/10. It's mostly looting then getting shot by some sap with a sniper rifle and horrible hit detection and while it is different each round the concept stays the same and can wear.COMMUNITY 4/10. Better than Overwatch but that's not saying much.STORY N/AIf it weren't for the developers that are more focused on turning this into an "ESport" and that abandoned optimization after the "Out of Early Access Release" I'd say it would be worth 15$. That's how much this game feels it's worth. This isn't even a real "Game" persay they just used ARMA 3 as a base and centered it around the mod. Playerunknown seems to be a cool guy that loves to mod but I need to shoot some things down. No. He didn't create battle royale. No this is not an Esports ready game far from it. And finally no it isn't worth full price. Final Rating 4/10. it might seem harsh but it's bugs glitches and problems hinder it from being a great game but at this point it's flaws are starting to show. People are moving on and it's a shame too. It had so much potential.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Please do yourself a favor and do not buy this game. Desync is the worst I have ever seen Chinese players playing on Northa American servers and getting lag compensation so that they win every fight 70% of the time you more than likely die to a guy who can one shot level 3 helmets with a p1911 while doing a 360 and running 600 mph. Shotguns do not work at all. PlayerUnknown has no clue how to make this weapon. He does not possess the mental capability to even begin to comprehend how a shotgun works. Can't shoot people in water Start getting shot at make it 40 feet behind cover start healing and then die because of desync from a guy that can't even see you. 42 000 people banned for cheating daily. Its ridiculous how terrible the anti cheat is. You are literally going to die due to a cheater 7/10 times. Don't even think about getting on a bike. If you hit a bump going 15 mph you are going to die because your bike flipped and threw you 600 feet. SHOTGUNS DO NOT WORK. Grenades are complete and utter It takes 10 seconds to take a grenade out and then 5 seconds for your character to actually throw it. Reloading animation does not match up with when the gun is actually reloaded. Already introduced a pay to open crate even thought this game is still in alpha. They might say its in beta but this game is so far away from being remotely finished and it definitely shows. OPTIMIZATION IS THE ABSOLUTE WORST I HAVE EVER SEEN IN A VIDEO GAME IN MY ENTIRE EXISTENCE All of the weapons are inconsistent as The main menu is literally a web page. early game is basically unplayable because of all of the desync.The only good thing about this game is its battle royale. That is the one pro that i can give it. At least bluehole is focused on $500 000 tournaments instead of fixing their broken as game. Please don't buy this abortion of a game. The developers are atrocious. They already got their money so they don't even care if they ever finish this excuse for a game.Save your money buy the free game "Last Man Standing". Its basically the same exact quality of production but it is free. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.1.0 Review Still trash.

review: Introduction Playerunknown's Battlegrounds or known for short PUBG. Is a Battle Royale game with 100 people in the map. You can play Solo Duo 1 Man Squad 2 Man Squad 3 Man Squad 4 Man Squad. On 3 maps. One being 4x4. As the time of this review the 4x4 map is finally being tested soon. So in this I will talk about Mirmar the desert map and Erangel the soviet union grass map. My Stance PUBG is very fun. It can be very hard for new players that have no one to play with in Solo. Which is why I think 4x4 map will make the game better for newer players to get used to the game. As someone who plays Duos and 3 Man Squad most the time. The game is very fun and can be player up for hours every day and week. With Mirmar being my favorite map. This game is about waiting. Not to rush in the beginning of the game. During the last 30 players. This is the time where you should start playing and not to camp. As camping will screw you over. This game also is about looting and walking around the map till you run into other players. Which can be boring at time. The only problem is with hackers in the game but region lock is there to stop hackers to play on US servers. You can also customize your character and weapons. With clothing and weapon skins. Good Stuff Very Fun Being able to change character Weapon Skins Events Free Crates No Pay to Win system Bad Stuff Hackers To much walking and looting Hard to get used to when first playing Score 8/10
