review: I cannot believe this game has "mixed" reviews. It was AWESOME months ago and it's STILL exactly as awesome. The devs have done nothing that made the game worse. And if anything they've made it slightly better here and there.If you have friends you can play with this is one of the most fun competative multiplayer experiances you can have today. It has a winning formula that doesn't get old and there's a very high skill cap. Just like Counter Strike.I've got 200+ hours in CS GO as well and I have to say I like this better. The firefights are intense and tactical but at other times you can also goof around a little without it drastically reducing your teams chance of winning.A lot of people are complaining about hackers but in my 200 hours i've only been killed by hackers 2 times that I know of. I think that's totally reasonable. Im in North America maybe it's worse in other regions? Idk.

review: This game can be fun. It can. But mostly it's not. Crap servers. Crap optimization. Crap everything really. But can be fun with friends. Other games however can be more fun with friends. I am sick and tired of dying in this game through no fault of my own. When I die it is usually because I kept shooting a guy in the back of the head and the game denied me to hit for some reason then he just spins right around after noticing the 25th bullet whizzing by his head and then just sprays 7 bullets right in my face. Fun. Superb. Anything but close range engagements I find it hard as F to hit a damn thing. Not because I suck because the game does. So poorly optimized it must be a joke. But people keep buying it and they keep making money like crazy so why should they improve the game? They don't have to. They'll make tons of money wether they do or not. Instead of actually fixing anything they make minor pointless tweaks to the game. Which are just simple code re writes that take a few seconds to do. Then release these things months apart as if they actually did something to improve the game. Which they didn't. They just tweaked it slightly in a way akin to changing a few numerical values in notepad.Would not recommend this game. IT's hyped up like crazy. You might even enjoy it a little. But is it fun to loot for ages get good gear then have it stripped away from you by a guy that you ambush miss with two magazines and he then sees where you are and just insta headshots you while all your bullets flew off in any other direction than where you were actually F'ing aiming? I say no. I say this pisses me off. Dying and lsoing because the game is bad not because I am is annoying as heck. If I sucked and I died then I deserved it. If my aim is on point I ambush a guy and fire off 60 rounds into his chest/head area and none for some reason hit that is not ok. And that's pretty much this game in a nutshell.It's a cool concept but by no means original. Battle Royale came out what in the 90's? So 20 years later they had this great idea to make a game that is basically the same thing! Shockingly fresh breath of air right there. So creative and new. ......Don't get it. Please. If I could un get it I would and get my money back from the devs. They don't deserve your money. For your money you deserve a better game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. Now hear me out.This game is absolutely wonderful and has a lot of potential so dont get me wrong.I also enjoy playing it on a daily basis and I don't even know why there is just something about getting geared up looting and looting and looting until you finally find the freaking weapon or the attachement you wanted up until your dream setup is complete and you finally beeing ready to battle.But in my 70 hours of playing this game still counting I haven't gotten a single win in solo neither duo or squad even though duo and squad is a lot more communicative and especially is way more fun than playing alone in my opinion.Because you 'tend to just get frustrated in solo.Think about it this is how every game goes atleast for me You jump out of the plane go to a nearby hangar or building or whatever get a gun get ammunition etc. just gear up run for the zone and then literally just out of nowhere someone comes up to you who is just 10.000 times better than you and shoots you in the freaking head.Game over better luck next time!And the thing is you can't do anything about it I mean you can try spazzing out and start dancing or wiggling out so he doesn't hit you but in the end he will freaking hit you and you're going to be tilted.It's always the same and I don't even know what to say or what to improve 'cause the game itself is wonderful and I have a blast playing it with friends but from my perspective maybe it's because I'm new to the kind of "war" or "battlegrounds" kinda games maybe it's because I'm bad who knows.But for me it's just that everybody is better than you no matter what even if I tend to get to the top 10 I never had the chance of winning the slightest cause the people are just sweating so hard.That's just my opinion but I still recommend this game 'cause if you're good at those kind of games get it!It's really fun beeing good I guess.

review: After seeing all the negative reviews I felt compelled to leave my opinion of the game. First it seems most of the negative reviews are related to either item trading OR the lawsuit against Fortnite. Politics aside reviews should be about the game itself and not what's going on outside legally. This doesn't adversely affect your gameplay. Great. Now that we've covered that let's talk about the game. This game is without a doubt the best $30 I have spent on a game in a long time. I started playing in Early Access and have enjoyed watching the game grow and add new features weapons vehicles customization and events. It's also a great game to watch on Twitch with the Doc Shroud Viss or even Break. The game has issues sure but all games do. I find they do well to resolve issues quickly and make balance changes each new update. After reading through a lot of the reviews I can't help but get the feeling that a lot of the negativity stems from either an inadequate PC build or someone who hasn't practiced enough to feel competitive. That isn't reflective of the games enjoy ability but rather your ability to get better and practice. I can't think of a game that has kept me entertained this long for only $30. Jumping in first person with your squad is always entertaining. Maybe you get a good drop or maybe RNG slaps you in the face. Regardless you can jump right back in and try again. Thanks Bluehole/PUBG Corp. Here's to more chicken dinners.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I enjoyed PUBG despite it's flaws for a long time but I just can't do it anymore.The cosmetic system is abysmal. While the crate system in place has potential to make someone a lot of money the drop rates are so horribly skewed that you're guaranteed to line the pockets of PUBG Corp in exchange for a few Zest White Turtlenecks that go a few pennies on the Steam Market. This game is the slot machine at the local casino that no one plays because all the other machines provide a more rewarding experience. The developers need to learn that it's not about winning big. It's about winning enough along the way to keep people interested in the big win.Hit detection is a joke plain and simple. I forgave this for a long time because the game was a work in progress but over a year later bullets still hit around corners. Want to hit someone with a melee weapon? You'll be lucky if one out of five swings hits the target even if the target isn't moving. Grenades can be rendered completely useless by a thin leg to a shelving unit. Some fences can't be shot through or can only be shot through from one side. Parachutes get stuck on everything including literally nothing.PUBG is still very much in Early Access despite dropping the tag in December 2017.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Alright small review to what i experienced in my 400h of gameplayThis thing is more rage enducing than listening to Feminazis yell if you get angry easily do not buy this piece of Great game concept but its nothing new in fact its getting old and everyone is jumping onto the "battle royal" train now.Which is obviously what will happen when something gets famous people will copy it to get a piece of the cake themselves.The main problem with PUBG is that it eliminates fun and progression with bugs and desync take those two factors out and you would have the next Counter Strike.Now with Pubg there are A LOT of problems game breaking problems. Faulty textures that will also make you lag and recieve errors.(Mostly at the start of the game) Buggy Cars (like in all Battle Royal games...for some reason) Sometimes you won't get past the start screen (Servers full / Connection Failed) Sometimes the game freezes on you (usually after you get fully geared up and are ready to smash) The ammount of times your shots wont hit the dude will trigger the living out of you. The Hit Registry is the worst thing ive seen in any game so far. The obvious one you wont be able to avoid the game HEAVILY relies on luck in the early game sometimes you will loot everything you could possibly need and terminate every no pants wearing dude trying to find literally anything that shoots.Or you are the no pants wearing dude trying to find anything that shoots while running away from gun shots coming closer and closer and eventually kill your dumb and you rank #90 Most of the times I die is actually behind the wall or inside a house the desync IS INSANE in pubg it's beyond repair...ALRIGHT those were the cons now to the pros.+ Can acctually be alot of fun with friends when the things above dont take place.+ The feeling when you bamboozle your enemy or win a game is amazing+ Really gets your adrenaline goingWho thought 31$ would be a justified price tag for this rage enducing thing called H1Z1?Now last but not least everytime I discuss literally any game or make a point about any game angry kids will write "you're just bad hnnngg Xdd you suck ballsack" and think they've won an argument or some I'm currently Top 0.09% on the EU Ladder in TPP Duo which is around rank #1100 https //pubg.op.gg/user/LordSabo?server euhttps //www.youtube.com/watch?v u0dWDFDUF8shttps //www.youtube.com/watch?v Gsde3uuZD8

review: One of the hottest fps action games in the market recently. Based on the battle royale concept from Fornite Battle Royale PUBG works on a different touch. Omitting the special abilities PUBG relies on player's aiming skills hand eye coordination and ability to distinguish distance and location of footsteps in the game. Those are the fundamental capabilities that work across every battle mode in the game solo duo or squad.Parachuted into a map of 6 km by 6 km your own survival relies on your own skills teamwork &amp communication and perhaps followed by a small percentage of luck. The intense competition starts at the second you land on the ground. Finding the best locations for best possible loots of various armories protective armors and vehicles. Each single decision will define the end result of your survival.PUBG is a highly competitive game while for solo mode sounds tough playing as duo or squad does also challenge us into many different aspects. Loot sharing will not only help you in the game but as well as in the community. Communication lies deeply when playing duo or squad as every bit of intel or information is critical or important. Navigating through the map pin point enemy location supply drop to finding cover locations are also the abilities you need to practice. The bullets' travel time and bullet drop are just two of various factors each player should learn by experience. Unlike some of other FPS titles PUBG has a more complex physics in term of long range shooting. Each weapon has their own unique characteristics and bullet drop. Distance matters. How far your target from your location and where you put your crosshair on the enemies will define your final fate in the game.The intensity of the game also relies on how you handle emotion and ego. Your playstyle most likely will change from round to round or even in a round you have to be able to adjust yourself well. The pace will change every single time a new round starts. Players are required to read the situation and adjust the pacing from rushing to taking over planning a flank or even fleeing/retreating.Patience is also a virtue in this game. Tho the pacing would be fast being patient does reward you in the long run. It will give players more ability and space to adjust and reconstruct their playstyle. Being in a squad there are some traits you have to have such as adaptable to different tactics or strategies. All in all PUBG asks and lets players to explore their best capabilities to conquer the map for each round. This includes to adapt playing in a group. Players will be rewarded with BP for each damage they deal to any enemies including killing the enemies. This will then be able to be exchanged with crates in which will give the players some cosmetic items from head gears to footwears. Some have high value in the Steam Market due to the rarity and equipping your toon with some of the items also shows some exclusive pride. While some players might not have significant interests in doing so.The community is great with so many veteran players enjoy sharing their experiences and tips. Suggestions and feedbacks are widely welcomed. On the personal level this is one of the FPS games that has a pretty low level of trollings or trash talking.If you enjoy playing FPS with unlimited possibilities of fun PUBG has everything to offer.

review: Do not buy this game!!!!I bought this game back in Feb 2018 It worked fine till end of March after that the game sometimes would just crash and turn off my Laptop. I thought it was a heat problem but my temps never would go over 60 deg C. I tried tuning everything to get it to work. I could not understaned with computer stats that I have that I would have a problem running this game. My computer is a i7 7700 with 1050 gtx 4gb and 16gb ram. It then worked for half of april and may then the last week of May it would crash every game. I do believe the problem lies with the patchs everytime a big patch ie. over 5 gb there was a problem with it crashing. The last major patch was 8gb. I also find it wierd that there are sometimes 3 4 patchs a day. They also whould have these huge patchs for little fixes such as placement of weapons or addition of weapons. They are most likey trying to fix the game. That shows that there are a lot of problems with the game that they are constantly fixing. The surver downtime would be at prime playing time 7pst not the middle of the night. I am not happy with this game as it was paid for to only play it for 2 1/2 months with no problems and since I played it for more than 2 hours I can't get my money back and I am stuck with a game that might work. I run other graphic stressfull games and programs with no problems. Do not buy this game!!!!

review: Okay can anybody tell me why people are so ing butthurt about the microtransactions? Like it doesn't give any advantage at all and you don't even have to buy them? Stop giving bad reviews because you are giving the game a bad rep while it isn't even bad at all. (One of the best early access game i have ever played looking at you DayZ). The mechanics are great and it works great. Of course there are still some buggs that need fixing but it is early access. Please do not listen to the guys saying that you should not buy the game because of microtransactions it doesn't affect any of us and is only cosmetic and doesn't give an advantage at all. This game is great and you should really buy it.EDIT I am seeing so many people whining about the fact that they delayed the update a little bit. 'Oh this game is so bad they worked 1 month on a bit of hotfixes' this right here just pisses me off be happy that they are doing patches and not like DayZ where they are almost doing no updates/adding content. And people saying that there are only hotfixes in this monthly patch? Let me give you a quick recap New UI FOV Slider MK14 First Person only servers bug fixes crates. And who the hell still cares about the crates CSGO has it and people spend thousands of dollars on crates aswell and nobody cares and PUBG adds it and everybody instantly cares they added the crates to fund the upcoming Gamescom Tournament that is coming and people telling that they made so much money with sales. Let me tell you that creating new weapons and gear is really expensive and a couple of million sales are not gonna cut it. If you want to support the game after it is fully released go and buy crates you don't have to and you do not get an advantage from this. So people please stop ing about the fact that they worked on a MONTHLY patch for month. I am not changing my review buy the game while you can and let the H1Z1 crap in the garbage.EDIT 2 Haha i was saying that i was not gonna change my review right. Oh boy i was so wrong. The game has turned to total with the last update not because of the microtransactions but because of the server performance. It is garbage shooting people in the face 15 times with a m4 apparantly doesn't kill people. Hitboxes are so bad that it is so unplayable this is no fun. Focus on the ing hitboxes and not weapons i rather have better hitboxes/server performance then this t where you are not even near a car and still get run over. And can someone tell me why the hell people can one shot me with the shotgun while i cant (Hitting them right in the face should ing let your head explode.) At this point do not buy the game. People are gonna complain that it is early access? off they already could have fixed the hitboxes patches ago. I repeat do not buy this game. (I have enough hrs in this game to know wtf is wrong with it)

review: EDIT 1/18/2018My previous review is below and everything below still stands it runs even better than it used to now. HOWEVER..... This game is FILLED with Asians. I mean if you que up for duo or squads with random 8/10 times it will be with an Asian. Maybe even 9/10. Let me explain why this is bad for everyone. Asians are on the other end of the world they LAG and a ton you can't understand them because they don't speak english and worst of all most of them HACK on this game.Hackers are on the rise. I've encountered at least two a day for the last 4 days. Up until then I had only ever encountered one as far as I know. Asians have their own ing servers I don't ing understand why they don't play on them. Until this game region locks Asians and updates their anti cheat STEER CLEAR OF THIS GAME!OLD REVIEW I've only had this game for a day and I'm already addicted. This game puts all the other battle royale games to shame ESPECIALLY H1Z1. That game is a literal piece of garbage compared to this game in every way. This game has more guns better gun play no RNG T no bleeding nice handling cars. I can run this game maxed out (including anti aliasing) on a 980ti and a 4790k with a minimum of 60 fps. Don't listen to the people with potatoes for pcs. If you've been looking for a better game like H1 but with less t this is the game for you!

review: AFTER u read this review. If u are new about this gamemode u just ing need this game....NOW. But if u come from H1Z1... u little poor kid leave that game and buy this. What we do in this game ?About 100 to 90 players in an airplane that cut the island randomly. Jump. Now YOU are alone against 99 players. Look for guns bagpacks AMMO medikit gadget for your gun. Ok u are ready to survive. Oh... wait there is a circle. If u are out from it u wil slowly gonna die. ...quick..look for a car..or for a motorbike...or GODDD u cant find it ?!? Than FUCING RUN NOW to the ING circle or u gonna die. Are you finally in ? it isnt finished yet. There are players looking for YOUR head. Whats your plan ? Stay hide ? or play aggressively ? its your style that guide you to the TOP 10 . The circle is getting smaller and smaller. The players are near to you. Every usless moviment will decide u if being dead or a winner.Hope you got it what you have to do in this game. Coz ...god i spent 5 h after downloaded the game without stopping.Heres the info. about this game to let u decide if buy or not this game.The game is growing up faster than what u think They are setting bugs reported by the players so the staff is realy active with the players.The things that needs to win a game is luck(obvsly) tattics aim and FU***NG SELFCONTROL. The stress that gives you the game when u are on top 10 is bigger than what u think. And Its realy sutisfing winning . AUDIO Its realy important having a surround Headset.The sound of every gun is clearly different and getting a silencer is like being completely unspotted.The steps ... here is an important part of the game wich make the difference about killing or get killed.GRAPHIC Nothing special. Dont even think is . In my opinion . more realistic would be too havey for the HD or SSD.GAMEPLAY Nothing more that just ONE OFFICIAL gamemode. Take care about the word OFFICIAL coz there are servers (didnt joined yet) with different gamemodes.In the official u can also play in solo or duo servers that means that u play only against others players in duo. Or also in a team of 5 players.( if with your frinds arent enigh for 5 the team will be completed randomly with an another palyer that selected 5 players mode)It was a TPS game wich u can switch to the FPS. Subsequently they added the FPS ONLY gamemode.MARKET do u know Counter Strike ? Ok same Get money in game by playing enogh to buy the cases ( NOT WITH REAL MONEY ). 2 kinds of cases. One need a key (getting it with real money) or the case for poor players like me the case that u can just open without anything else just buy it and open it. Every single object u get fron the case u can sold it on market and also buy it from there.

review: This game was great 6 or so months ago and had great potential but the dev's have no clue what they are doing. They were going in the right direction until they realesed the update that was said to have reduced the amount of hackers in the game but from what i could see the only thing it did was drop frames by about 40 fps or so with marginally less hackers. Their are also problems such as lag issues unreliable servers Very poor comunication between developers and players and many bugs. They also only have reporting options for older hacks and problems. The game has a tendancy to crash at the worst possible times and my recored for most crashes in a single game are three. The game still has the potential to turn around and be good but i do not see it happening and would by no means suggest this game in its current state.

review: UPDATE 28/05/2018Found out that I need to go into task manager and find the executable for the running game and set it to only use 1 CPU core then once I'm in game I can then set it back to all 8 cores. If I don't do this the game will crash.Guess what? I can't even send crash reports anymore either. It compiles the report everytime it crashes then says it can't be sent to the specific address. It's not being blocked by my firewall either. Go figure.Been fully released for a while now and still sloppy performance issues.Very disappointed. UPDATE 25/03/2018After the pointless emote update my game is now unplayable.Crashes every single time I start it up doesn't even reach the main menu.Even the test server crashes on launch!I have tried verifying files uninstalling and reinstalling nothing has fixed the problem.You'd think that sending endless crash reports the devs would try and fix this so that I can play their "fully released" game.Fortnite sucks but I might have to bite the bullet to get the battle royale experience lmao. This is the first ever time I have reviewed a game.I want to start off and say yes I understand this game is in EA.However the developers have given a rough date for the full release (coming out of EA) as later this year in December.This game is far from ready for full release 1) Game crashes2) Unresponsive actions at times (opening a door and waiting 3 seconds for it to open)3) Buggy movement (jumping jump crouching etc...)4) STILL AN UNOPTIMISED GAME4.1) Heavy framerate issues on high end machines (Mine is an i7 7700 MSI GTX1080 16GB Corsair DDR4 and I get a constant 40 FPS when there's no action around me. Whenever I look at the city Yasnaya my frames drop to around 15 20 which frankly is abysmal. If I'm lucky I might get a spike up to 45 55 FPS but that's really rare)4.2) Textures occasionally take 20+ seconds to load even after landing on the ground. My textures once didn't load and I could run through walls and shoot through walls and then when they did load I was stuck in a filing cabinet lolFor these reasons I don't think this game is worth the price tag.Once the game can run on high settings with a solid 90+ frames like all my other ones then I'll change this review to a positive.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: First off I m not just some random guy that has 2 hrs played and complains that their pc can t run it. I have 360 hrs played as I write this review and I m going to be discussing the pros and the cons in this game.Pros Decent graphics Very fun game with friends The best battle royal out there *fortnite is for little children that watch ninja and dr lupo* If ur above the age of 10 years old and still play fortnite then there is something wrong with you. I suggest u seek help ASAP. Constant updates from the devs I paid 40$ for this game back in May of last year and they have added new guns a new map redesigned UI gameplay changes and many other cosmetic items. Currently they are working on a new 4X4 map that should be released very soon sometime this month. Also they have a 8X8 map planned for late this year. Loot boxes I like this idea in this game because it keeps funding the game for future map updates etc... The loot boxes in this game aren t pay to win like in EA's Star Wars battlefront 2. They are purely cosmetics but the funny part is I m not even tempted to buy them since the odds of getting something worth more than 3 cents is very very very rare. Steam achievements very good addition to the game. The game runs very well right now as long as you meet the min requirements you should be fine. This game is very CPU/GPU heavy so don t try and play this game with a i3 from 2010. As long as you don t be a idiot and have decent hardware 770 1050 1060's 960 970 etc... paired with a decent i5 you should be able to run this game at a constant 60 FPS at high settings. When this game launched back in March of 2017 I used to get 45 fps and frequent dips to the 15's on my GTX 980ti and i7 6700K this has now been fixed every patch they bring improves the performance in this game. My pc gets a solid 120 fps at high on 1080P with this current setup. SO if you see anyone complaining about performance they must have an old cpu or an old gpu and they don t understand how their setup sucks and they should upgrade asap if they want to play modern games.Cons Hackers wall hackers speed hackers panda tv hackers chingy chingy chongs ruining the leaderboards with their hacks. You could be minding your own business when a comes flying out of nowhere comes in your house leans and destroys you in less than a second you can be at the other end of the map and a can get a 3000M snipe on you. The anti cheat in this game is a joke and 99% of the hackers come from china. I don t understand why these s must come to other servers and ruin their games. Blueballs I suggest region locking the game when I click on the NA server I expect to play with other Na players and not some ching in their internet cafe hacking away. The AA is this game is so that on the old map you have trouble seeing people unless u run the game at ultra low. The grass is all pixelated on max settings and if someone is prone in a bush or in the grass it s almost impossible to see them. Sometimes it gets even worse if they are behind a tree. The cars in this game are a joke when you are driving them they for no reason could explode without you knowing or they will spin out of control and smash you on the group leading to you losing most of your health or exploding yourself. Blue hole needs to fix their car physics. Why does the mobile version of PUBG have better car physics then the actual pc game? LASTLY THIS IS A BIG ISSUE the SOUND MANAGMENT and the MOVMENT SYSTEM IN PUBG. The sound in this game is a joke if you don t buy a third party accessory called headphones it s almost impossible to hear people in this game unless you have your speakers at max volume blowing out your ears and the neighbors that live around you. Plz improve your sound this is one aspect that fortnite does right. Fornites sound is balanced perfectly you can hear people that are around you or in your house perfectly other sounds such as guns and drops aren t blowing out your ear drums. Second point is why the FK IS THE GUNS AND PLANE SO LOUD in pubg. FIX THE FKIN VOLUME PLZ ITS A MESS. Last point is the clunky af movement system. It uses the same movement as gta 5 when you press spring it takes fkin 5 year for your character to start winding up to sprint and when you want to stop... oh good luck. Vaulting is a mess it sometimes works it sometimes doesn t. Movement in general needs a lot of work.To sum things up this game is a very fun battle royal it s even better with friends. I would say its currently the best battle royal out there since the genera in general is pretty and no one knows how to make a good battle royal these days. The graphics are decent and the gunplay is ok. There is many t moments where you load a entire clip on a person and not kill him while he just clicks on you once and gets a lucky head shot this happens a lot but that normal since the guns in this game are RNG unlike fornite whose guns are actually accurate. The cheaters in this game are getting out of control. Alongside the cheaters you have to worry about your movement bugging out the sound blowing out your ears and the AA not allowing you to see anyone around you on the old map. So until they fix their game unfortunately I cannot recommend at the moment. It should still be in early access since these are key features that should have been addressed day one.I just realized that this review is 1070 words long. D

review: Incredibly fun game I've followed the development through early access since last April and they have made a ton of improvements to the game since then however they've absolutely failed to refine the game to where players expectations are of games in 2018 (whether those expectations are warranted or not is not being discussed here).They certainly haven't been able to execute a generally acceptable micro transaction model for the game with BP directly purchasable items and the randomized loot from both BP and the crates. Personally I haven't played in the past few weeks just to general boredom of the game no interesting changes or cosmetics paired with the same sense of early access frustration just makes the game far less enjoyable than when it was new...

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDSReviewPlayer BaseWhat age group does it cater to? Kids Everyone MatureGraphicsHow does it look? Terrible Really Bad Bad (some players need to lower graphics for performance) Average Good Beautiful LifelikePriceWhat is it worth? Full Price Wait For a Sale Don t Buy It Free Free but not worth the spaceRequirementsWhat kind of PC do you need to run it? Minimal Average Fast High End Supercomputer (if you want good graphics with high performance)DifficultyHow hard is the game? Easy Medium Hard Very Hard (this is hard to gauge but for most people it is very difficult) ImpossibleGame LengthHow long can you realistically play it? Really Short (0 3 hours) Short (2 8 hours) Average (8 16 hours) Long (16+ hours) Infinite (If you want)StoryHow good is the storytelling? Not Relevant Terrible Okay Average Good FantasticCutscene CinematicsHow good does the game look outside of gameplay? Not Relevant Terrible Bad Average Good LifelikeMusic and SoundsHow good is the music and sound effects? Terrible Bad Average Good Audible PerfectionGameplayHow are the gameplay mechanics (combat movement etc)? Terrible Bad Average (some love it some hate it. Personally I like the mechanics) Good SeamlessBugsIs the game broken? Unplayable Plagued and Unenjoyable Lots of Bugs Just a Few Polished and PerfectOtherWhat other info do I need to know?Singleplayer NOMultiplayer YESNotesHonestly this game CAN be a lot of fun but it suffers from a LOT of problems.The combat is extremely fun and addicting but hitboxes are improperly done gun damage can bug and become inconsistent etc.In the end I do recommend this game because of its incredible replay value. Even if you don t like it you will likely enjoy it and come back for more.FINAL SCORE55 / 100

Id rather have them support many other MP FPS titles where developers are actually giving good support optimizations and frequent content updates instead.

review: Product received for free. StrategiesPUBG is a game about survival of the fittest. While this can mean the most aggressive player wins it is by far not the average case. Knowing when to engage and when to lay low is key in having your first chicken dinner.PUBG rewards an active playstyle. Just as much as being too aggressive will probably get you killed being too passive will mean your opponents will have more and more of a tactical advantage through their gear.Making use of the ingame sound can make all the difference. Knowing where shots are fired where cars are driven and listening to that all too careless player stomping around in his punk boots all make for a great way to either engage on your terms or make sure you dont engage at all.Know your strengths and weaknesses. While most players would love to excel in every aspect of the game every player has their own strengths and weaknesses. Be aware of what you are capable of and make sure the situations you get yourself in favor your strengths and avoid your weaknesses.Make use of every distraction. Sometimes you are pinned behind cover with no way out or you know where an enemy is but can't get close without them seeing you. In those cases using grenades is not your only option. Make use of the red zone of the impending blue circle of nearby gunfire your teammates or even the loud sound of the airplane to get out of a bad situation or into a good situation. Oftentimes your opponent wont be able to track your movement.Playing soloAs a solo player you will always have some blind spots. While some positions will allow you to make sure no one sneaks up to you as soon as you are in the open field you will often have to rely on knowing where other players are probably going to be. Always keep track of how far the blue circle is where the new white circle is and how likely it is that someone is behind you.Since you have no team to rely on a single unsuppressed shot even if it kills someone can lead to your death. Players around your position will have a vague idea of where you are while you probably don't know where they are. It is rarely advised to kill someone while completely exposed even if your target is "an easy kill."Playing duo/squadWhen playing with a team it is important to make sure that all players have the same gameplan. Some players enjoy playing fast and ending rounds quickly while others have a more tactical approach and aim for the endgame. If the team does not follow the same gameplan the players will oftentimes not work as a team. Further players need to work as a team. Players that 'wander off from the tour group' are exposing themselves and their team to higher risk.When playing with a team you can make sure all angles are secure at all times. This however requires communication. Make sure you use voice chat (or other methods of communication) to alert your teammates whenever something important is happening around you. Use the in game compass (or notable site names) to inform your team where and what is happening.An early death of a teammate does not automatically mean a round is lost and dying early yourself can be a great opportunity to learn from your teammates. If you are really not interested in watching the rest of the match when dead maybe do something else until the match is finished. Ranting will only inhibit your team even further.How to kill enemiesBATTLEGROUNDS puts you right in the fray and because of this it might be hard to take down players. There's three basic techniques you can use though dependent entirely on your style that can make you an absolute juggernaut.Ranged fireFirst and foremost is the ranged fire technique. This uses weapons with scopes to pick off distant enemies. Wait until your enemies are moving away from you in a clear line to open fire as this will remove most areas for them to hide giving you the most chance to deal major damage. Right click once for scope view hold right mouse click for general zoom view.A big part of this strategy is the idea of the vantage point. Vantage points are areas on the map that are higher ground than the rest or otherwise give you more and better opportunities for aiming and firing. Second floors of buildings tall hills and wooded areas are all examples of great vantage points as they give you a clear sight of the land and the ability to pick off enemies at range.Close and LoudClose and Loud is the principle of engagement where you fire on an enemy in quick sudden bursts after disabling them in some other fashion. This can include using gas grenades or flash bangs and then turning around corners to lay down heavy fire and other such techniques. The big goal here is to disorient your enemies making them confused and thus ineffective.High capacity weapons are important here as you're going to need every shell and cartridge to carry out these sorts of attacks. Keep in mind that a very important part of your loadout is the sidearm as it will allow you to put down resistance even when you've run out of primary ammunition.WaitPerhaps the best combat strategy is one not even of combat just wait. Because you're in a pool of many players you can essentially wait out the clock letting players kill each other before swooping in with one of the other techniques and clearing the area that way. This is a good technique but keep in mind that as the game progresses the battle area shrinks giving you fewer options for vantage points and assaults.Playing the mapA big part of BATTLEGROUNDS is playing the map. Understanding the general concept of where people are likely to go how to move silently and so forth are key to your long term survival.Moving silentlyIn BATTLEGROUNDS everyone wants to kill you literally. With enemies on every side all bearing down on you the ability to move throughout the map without attracting unwanted attention is incredibly valuable. Here are some tips to keep in mind that'll help you to this end Not everyone needs to be engaged. Firing your weapon alerts everyone as to your location and if you see an enemy who is particularly well equipped in a vehicle or simply in a bad spot to fire on don't fire on them. Track them and follow until they are in a vulnerable location or alignment with their surroundings before opening fire. A well placed grenade against an enemy in a building who you've been tracking will kill with a single loud shot as opposed to using a machine gun or assault rifle that will attract attention for your entire area.Move from cover to cover. Almost every path in BATTLEGROUNDS is lined with cover in the form of trees rocks or buildings. Moving through and between them is hazardous in the sense that you might not see trouble coming but it also severely restricts enemy vision and their ability to engage. Limiting attention and visibility in this way will make your movement easier.Be aware. When you hear gunshots even from afar move to cover immediately. Do not line up to the line of sight of people in the distance because you don't know their weapon ranges. If you hear vehicles coming get to cover if you see a single vehicle consider an ambush if they are going slow but default to grenades before engaging in light arms combat.Choke points and high traffic areasThere are a few areas of the map that are high traffic and should largely be avoided. These areas can cause you to be ambushed by multiple players each looking for resources as well so you need to wait and see whether or not the threat is worth the possible reward. These areas include most towns buildings bridges and the military base. While items will spawn here more often they attract players and thus raise the danger to new levels.This is a good and bad thing though. While the danger is indeed heightened it also means you have a good spot to set up ambushes and create choke poit
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've been playing this game for a year or two now. I've seen the worst this game has to offer and can say this is one of the best battle royal games I've played. Is it perfect? No. No game is but as far as balance it would say it is very well balanced. Note I don't say realistic but balanced as in all the guns have a niche with streghts and weaknesses. The vehicles are balanced to do different things well. The only thing I would like to see is a recording mode where we can set up preset cameras to jump between quickly for videos during replay mode.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I once gave this game a thumbs up. seeing the potential of it.However after having played this game for over half a year I must now change that to a thumbs down.There are still good things with this game of course but a LOT of things that are negative aswellFirst the pros * Addictive* The graphics still do look pretty decent (depending on where you look more on that in the cons)* Most of the guns feel pretty good and look pretty good.* Realism* A good conceptAnd now to the main cons * Pretty communication with the playerbase It's community the is not very helpful at all (been rude and more) the game in general is getting worse rather than better they don't listen to what their community want's the most OPTIMIZATION* This game Runs at 60 fps with a GTX 1060 on LOW which makes the game feel kinda considering it's graphics aren't that great (not bad either though)* Some textures still look like for example the stones. * Some weapons like the shotguns are complete . They are very unbalanced still* The servers SUCK. This makes the tickrate low which leads to a very bad player experience. For example when I shoot someone they might already have moved on the servers side which leads to the bullets not registering.My final rating of this game is 4/10

review: Too much china. No offense intented just stating a fact. Fun game really engaging but with many flaws.You need a higher than average PC to run this game in decent FPS even on mostly low/medium settings. Bugs...bugs everywhere! For me thats not really an issue cause its really funny to see all the compilation videos or having a weird bug happen to you while your friends are watching but i can understand how it will get annyoing over time.30 euros/dollars? ...seriously..?! Sorry but the game as it was when i bought it (around 2 months ago i think October 2017) was worth around 10 to 15 euros(or $). Less ? sure More than that? no way. i bought it cause i was bored with everything else at the time. I am not regreting it but the price should drop a few bucks.And thats the reason why i wont recommend it. The price. The fact that you need a good PC to run it (no matter what the settings are) also helps not to buy it. Optimize it and sell it for 15$ and i promise i will buy a 2nd copy for my gf.

review: Another one hour review this time PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDSA quick summary A very well done KIng of the Hill game.Has its roots in the Battle Royal mod for ARMA 3 but is more fast paced and viscious. The Unreal engine renders the environment in gorgeous detail without bogging down a semi powerful computer so much.Fast games that are over in 20 minutes also possibility to play in 2 or 4 men team makes it a nice coop as well.The cons with the game in its current state is that is an Early Access which means a bit unstable behaviour some people has big problems with drop in FPS and there are occasionaly a lot of rubber banding.But overall I must recommend it really fun and has that "just one more time" appeal.

review: Edit 6/10/2018 Ok so this game when first released as EA was amazing. They did a great job at blending a realism BR like arma 3 BR and a fun BR like H1Z1. All was good. Fast forward to now almost two years later. Sanhok seems like the make it or break it map for this game with shorter game times smaller map more loot quicker zone times etc... these are all great changes to not only keep the game fresh but to make gameplay more fun. The game is still the best at what it sets out to do. Here is the inexcusable part...they still have not optimized the game well enough servers still struggle still tons of glitches still lots of hackers still feels clunky and don't get me started on the lootboxes...the time spent on fixing the game instead of on cosmetics and this game would be a masterpeice. But....."sigh"... this is where we are today with PUBG. A game ruined by the massive success and wealth of the devs and the lack of motivation to make a better and better game. Thus the steam reviews mirror that.OG post Best early release game ive played in a long time. Hope they add an ELO system and different divisions and rankings. Game is good as is but could use optimization.Edit They added an ELO system and a leaderboard. Id still love to see a ranking system vaulting and more maps.

review: There are good and bad things but overall a solid investment.This is the first survival game that has been enjoyful for longer than a week.The polishing being done and new map recently added has been very enjoyable.Now the downsides it's got some pretty common bugs still that make or break a round.Fall damage out of no where.Terrible rubber banding at the start of a round when it's most important.Wireshark shows insane datatransfer up and from their servers right before you land and continues for about 30 seconds.Perhaps this could be streamlined some how or streamed over a longer time or loaded in the count down warm up time.Hackers do exist it is annoying but I luckily do not have much encounters with obvious hackers. I have a decent rank in solo duo and squad FPP so it's still enjoyable.Having player community hosted servers that perhaps didn't reward BP/Rank but could have custom rules join password. would greatly add replay value and offload stress and costs from the official servers without hurting BP.

review: Aesthetically speaking the game is cool and for the most part its fun. However so far as mechanics are concerned the game is horribly unrefined and glitchy. Do you enjoy being shot from behind walls? Do you seek a game where your headshots do nothing? Enjoy games where you empty your clip into an enemy but the game's horrid netcode results in you dying anyways? Perhaps an experience in which your character becomes hopelessly stuck in between the game's props? Then PUBG is the game for you!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So i liked the game for the first 170 or so hours. I especially liked joining my friends for a squad game and working our way to the win. And even after 20 or so wins you still get hyped to win because you worked for it. When i later moved to fortnite i didnt get hyped after winning 20 or so games because the games are short and you can just start a new game and get to the action quick. But the problem is just what i gave the game credit for. It's horrible looting system. Imaging finding a weapon. But still having to loot for scopes extended mags and more. It's amazing when you fight to the very end but that rarely happens because you die to hackers with all your loot and you turn of the game. It's so so boring when you time and time again land a good spot and die due to just having that AR but not all the extra clips scopes and so on. I did actually want to give the game credit but thats just not possible in the current state of the game. But then again that looting system is somewhat of their thing.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: OH PUBG......... good game for 30$ USD it is an okay price. PUBG is a battle royal that takes releastic factors into play Maybe not the level ad Escape From Tarkov but it has the essentialls and meats in a way where it has realistic features to non realistic. This game when it wasent blown up and not as mainstream it was a great game and can hopefully can stay in that direction of being good and popular.But being popular isnt the best for this game before official release this game was really good updates once a week test server that ran better than the real servers.Now its a mess first off railings just a bugged mess atm seems so simlpe but it is not the way bullets go through fences/railings is bugged on bolth sides depending on the circumstances.Hackers Dont get me started my first comment is that It is REALLY bad atm unless your high elo or really good at the game. I have multiple video clips of me getting killed by hackers im not just calling people who kill me hackers.... legitamet hackers. I have been shot through walls shot fully auto from 300+ meters away ive seen people with no recoil (this games recoil is arguably what makes the game difficult.) Ive seen increased damage (ex. beibng plae to do more damage with 5.56 then usual or even ignoring armour.) I plan on making a comp of hackers that i experienced so far ones i think that are truely hacking.Next off optimization if you dont have a 1k usd pc your game is going to run like dirt sometimes you will get 100 fps in the open and when in dence cities with alot of people you will drop but when in test server you wont feel these affects as bad.Cheat engine It needs a TON of work a cheat engione that cant calculate where you are and where the enemy is and notice that its inpossible for you to get shot from an angle that hass full cover is just bad imo ( i say this in the instance where i meet someone wall bang me like it was R6 seige which you cant shoot through walls in this game) All around the mechanics and the weapons this game is great for the community and hackers it makes the game bad. people in the lobby waiting just yells N***** over and over and hackers are all over low to mid elo in TPP Wrapping it all up i like the game it has huge potential and blue hole is the only one who can save this if they put as much effort as fortnite is doing it would be an amazing game. as for hackers they need to be dealt with more seriously quicker and efficiently. Every time i play i encounter at least one.UPDATE a year an a half later nothing has chanfged besides jelousy over fortnite and adding skins in box that require time and money to open oh and a new map still nothing fixed
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I wanted to write this after I saw all the negative reviews the games been getting recently which I can't help but feel is unjustified.The core gameplay is GOOD! The matches are fun the gunplay consistent and every game feels unique. The biggest complaint I'm seeing is that apparently the game is flooded with hackers which just isn't true. I've played hundreds if not thousands of matches since the game entered early access and I can count the number of times I've encountered a hacker on ONE HAND! I'm sure there are hackers about but they're nowhere near as prevalent as these other reviews suggest. The only other big complaint I see is about having to purchase keys with real money to unlock loot crates you get by playing. I won t try and defend this it's incredibly scummy of the developer especially considering how they USED TO BE FREE before they realised they could cash in. It's annoying but far from a deal breaker it's honest to god probably the most enjoyable multiplayer game I've played since Overwatch and if you're on the fence take the plunge you won t regret it!

review: If you're into FPS then this is the game for you! I will say the game is much more fun with friends and those with a mic. It's the hunger games mixed with team dynamics. I didnt think I'd enjoy the game but a friend bought it for me as a Christmas gift and here I am writing a review. I've been reading the reviews about "chinese hackers" and I'd like to say just ignore them. Every time a player dies they complain about being killed by a hacker. I'm sure they exist but in this game there's too many variables to say. To be honest I find the Asia and Korean servers to be much quieter. On the American servers there is ALWAYS one person yelling racial slurs and another blasting music through the mic really ruins the experience.

review: This game is crap There are people in it that can shoot you when you are crouched behind a corner with bullets that can appearently turn 90 degrees mid flight and hit you when you are crouched behind a wall far around the corner. This of course verified with the Kill Cam. Not sure if its a better attempt at what Dayz started or if I prefer Dayz although both seem to be in the same catagory of unfinished possibly neverendingly unfinished and buggy. What annoys especially with a game I dont care much to play anymore after all this is the constant massive updates and then the recent addition of the 26.2 mb update every 4 hours it seems not sure if this 26.2mb update is just needed every 4 hours to fix something the developers messed up with one of the daily 9 GB patches you have for the game. They update so much with the game so often they lose track of where they messed up what it seems. So now they need this 26.2mb update every 4 hours or more to keep the servers going or something kicking the can on a problem they can't seem to resolve at its source. Don't buy into all the hype.

review: The game is fun and runs well for the most part. A few minor bugs but most games have those on launch.If you're hesitant to buy it because of the mixed reviews you can ignore any complaints about lag and rubberbanding it's been patched and is rare and modest enough that it won't be an issue. I'm NA playing NA servers mostly but I never really felt lagged on EU or AS servers either which is great for anyone playing with friends from all over.Admittedly the chinese are everywhere. Not all are hackers but you'll see enough at the moment to make jokes about it. My advice buy the game play it have fun rage quit sometimes rinse and repeat the fun/rage cycle to your hearts content.

review: Don't get me wrong it has its moments of pure joy. Winning a Chicken Dinner is a great feeling but mostly this game is a looting/walking simulator. Gunplay is ok it's nothing to write home about especially considering how buggy it can be. Generally gunfights happen in the first few minutes of landing or the last few minutes of the game. MIdgame is a boring snoozefest and since there's no way to practice with weapon handling bullet drop etc outside of joining in a game it turns into a waste of time. Just watch highlights from Twitch streamers and save the $30.

review: As a concept this game is amazing PUBG seems to have lit a fire that has quite a few developers scrambling to create thier own battle royale title. Its fast paced and competitve and somewhat satisfying to play and for that matter win. As a complete title I would highly recommend it to almost anybody I know...However the developers seem to have turn this ship of the course of sucess the game is in official release now and is still plagued but hackers glitches de sync and crashes. On top of all those thing the devs have made changes to the core mechanics for the worse. The loot spawn rate has gotten excedingly worse in an attempt to make the game "more fair" they have infact done the opposite. When I first started playing I could go into a small two story and find twoor even three AKs stacked on top of eachother (which is I agree ridiculus) but now I have to search two of three buildings to find a pistol. I get RNG but this is just bad judgment the game is hard enough to play with de sync/server side lag but I'm expected to fight with a pistol against some dude who has a kitted M4 16 seconds into the game. Evensome of the pro players have said this game isn't esports ready and because the general public is so used to recieving have finished games as full products people have just said "Screw it its awesome!" There is still a lot that needs fixing before this game is considered at all viable to be competitive.Now a lot of people have stated that it takes time and that you can't just through money at the problem. Well they are half right the game has been out for sometime now and pre alpha alpha and beta are where you make sure the game runs properly. Any gamer can forgive poor appearence as long as the game functions as its supposed to hence why people love fortnite the game runs. PUBG however has not made a ton of improvement again the most grave sins being the server side lag and hackers. They have made easily a billion dollars on a title that maybe cost 50 million and yet they have managed to make the game worse. They have failed to learn from other titles in the past and build on them. Now all this aside the game has its moments realistically the best thing they could do help mitigate the BS is just add a non competitive option to the game. Another option entirely is allow for server rentals if I could I would spend 50 dollars a month to have my own instance from a company whose servers I know aren't garbage. In short the game still needs work despite already being in release at this moment I would't recommend this to anybody. I don't like suggesting games that I myself regret buying and I hardly ever regret buying games. Despite spending 335 hours playing this game (at time of post) about 40 percent has been spent cleaning up or dealing with the mess left behind by the developers. The mixed reviews status on the store page speaks for itself this game is failing to meet the standards.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Out of the 350 hours ia have played on this game i'd say collectively about 24 hours of that time was enjoyable however the remaining portion of my time on this game has been spent running town to town finding nothing but shotguns and pistols for the first 5 minutes of the game. if i were ever lucky enough to get past this point and find an assault rifle finally 70% time i was greeted with being on the polar opposite side of the zone running down kilometres of roads and not being able to find a single vehicle. This isn't an issue with the game this is just how the game is for the most part. if you ever are lucky to gather up a vehicle and neccessary resources and find yourself in the last 25/10 situation you will get faced with your next major issue. that half of the playerbase is chinese. Yet they still go out of their way to play on OCE/NA/EU where it genuinely disrupts gameplay for that whole server. you will often find yourself laying a point blank shotgun round or 2 headshots into these players and because of the huuuuuge ping difference you'll find your self getting shot after they should be knocked down or straight up dying. because on the other end they saw you first and shot you first so the game compensates in their favour and grants them the kill. Now regardless of What Brendan Greene states Nobody who is asking China to be region locked is doing it purely for the fact that they utterly despise the Chinese themselves they are saying this because it is causing huge playabilty issues across all servers. (not to mention Brendan himself even admitted that 99% of current hacks were stemming from China) So if you really want to buy this game i say you wait until its rounded and The devs are prepared to do something serious about the connectivity issues and the rampant hacks that make themselves blatantly clear from game to game.

review: I had mixed feelings about this game but I've come to the conclusion that I just do not enjoy playing this game.THE GOOD Getting your first chicken dinner because you got luckyTHE BAD Team Killing There is no point in playing squads unless you're with friends. No one will pick you up when you're downed and they'll make it easy to spot you. That's if they don't kill you first for your loot. The M.O. with random squads is loot a whole town together and kill off your squad for the extra loot because they will kill you and do the same tthe game actually encourages team killing. And learn some kind of oriental language if you want to communicate there is no region blocking and asian countries get a lag advantage for playing in NA servers.Solo See people when you first land and take them out quick. Run around the map for thirty minutes not seeing anybody and get sniped from across the map by some guy laying in the final circle if you don't get sniped by somebody first. I have maybe spotted someone before they've spotted me twice because the hackers are not dealt with in this game. Several times I've been killed by some guy with hacks just firing randomly at a wall.I've probably played about seventy five hours wasted time thinking it was going to get fun.

The developers just seem to care about rushing cosmetics or ports for this game wondering about how much they can cash in before they are legitimately exposed as a fraud. There has been no serious actual content update and they have the audactiy to ignore the community for any feed back whatsoever. Here recently they have started so much work on this new tropical map that they refuse to make the other ones playable. There are very real audio glitches vehicles clipping issues and choppy frames when driving a vehicle. This was more forgivable 6 months ago but still nothing is being done about it.This is just my personal thoughts on the game currently when the company themselves are sueing other companies for no damn good reason. I absolutely give up on this game the devs and would rather play something else with a developer that gives a .

Even for a game in early access the basic mechanics are terribly coded and mindboggling. Play or watch any streamer and watch how bad the hit box and aiming is. Save yourself the money and go shove your dominant hand into a woodchipper for an equally enjoyable experience at a drastically reduced time investment.

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN's BATTLEGROUNDS is the quintessential multiplayer experience. Though it may be a little rough around the edges the adrenaline rush of making the top 10 in solos is unlike anything I've experienced in gaming before. I first tried my hand in battle royale in Fortnite but it's flavor/building mechanics just weren't for me. PUBG blends just the right amounts of simulation and ludicrousness for an incredibly fun competitive game that's easy to jump in and out of. While the game itself is no means a 10/10 (mostly due to the aforementioned roughness even after coming out of early access) PUBG is definitely one of those games where you'll wonder where the last 100 hours went. "I'll just play one more match" can quickly turn into 5 10 more matches if you're not careful. If you were like me and watched streamers play for the last year give it a go! If you had fun watching others play you'll absolutely have a great time!

review: When I first got PUBG (from a friend who insisted on buying it for me because he envisioned it would be fun to play together) I did not think much of it. I wasn't an FPS kinda gamer to begin with and the whole Battle Royale concept was also very foreign to me. Despite the many bugs lag and insanely awful vehicle mechanics the game turned out to be very addicting and super fun to play with friends. I loved the whole idea of a squad of players tactically assessing the terrain and situation to outsmart and outgun other squads. I started to rack up several hours and was really excited to see where the game was going to go.Fast forward past numerous patches several chicken dinners and high hopes for the official release the game had begun to really unravel. Constant game crashes insane FPS drop and infested with Chinese hackers the game was beginning to look like the horror stories I had heard from friends about other Battle Royale games that had tanked. This on top of the fact that Bluehole had implemented crates where you had to pay for keys really started to shake my faith in the devs.As official release came around it seemed like the devs were finally starting to tackle all of the issues we just wanted an optimized game with no cheaters! Seems simple maybe put off the whole esports adverts and pay for crates and actually dump some of that money into this game to improve the actual gameplay and experience.Unfortunately enough even though the "official" release has come and gone the hackers remain my $2k computer still can't run this game even a fraction as well as other optimized games and as a result the love has died out. I put in a ton of hours can still clear the school out and get the chicken dinner no problem but the game just has way too many issues still. I waited to post my review well after the smoke had cleared just in case the devs would be able to work it out but I can safely say to stay away from PUBG. The concept was great and the intended direction was perfect as well but the execution just flat out failed to meet any real expectations of the community.I'll probably still play a few games here and there just to kill some time but take it from someone who has played a thousand + hours it's not worth it if you're expecting a high quality game it's clear to me that the devs DO NOT care whether or not they have a loyal player base and would rather continue on with their pay for crates as well as failing to address the real issues at hand.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Such potential. Such staggering potential. But wasted by truly incompetent developers.What do you get when you strip away the fetid detritus from most every other FPS throw 100 people together in a sprawling wilderness with nothing but the clothes on their backs a dash of lady luck and the promise of a chicken dinner? You get potentially the best battle royale experience since well the PlayerUnknown's Battle Royale mod for Arma.But what happens when you put that potential in the hands of developers who don't appear to know their asterisk from their elbow where each progressive patch over rules any gains from the previous patch taking three steps backward for every one step forward? You get Bluehole's PlayerUnknown's Batttlegrounds. Not so much a missed opportunity but an opportunity that can't seem to be realised because of the regressive nature of each bandaid update.Yes bandaid. What they break in one update they fix in another update by enforcing or entirely removing complete features hobbling together something that sorta works if you approach it in just the right skewered and off hand way. And of course because it's Bluehole the bandaid is often filthy and hastily applied so it breaks something else.The reality is PUBG has potential. It's shown it has potential. But is also has bugs and flaws in equal number. And they never seem to get resolved in a complete capacity. Hell most of the issues that existed six months ago are still prevalent now. And each bug fix update seems to be a step backward that typically breaks something else along with it. A more cynical mind might believe that Bluehole are actively trying to sabotage their own product here but I believe it's just plain old fashioned incompetence.PS. Yes. I play it to death. I'm hooked. You'll probably be hooked too.The End.

review: This game at it's core is a very good game. I started out a bit skeptical about it and didn't really play a lot. Then I started getting into it and now that first person mode came out it's like a whole new game within the game itself. The devs are obviously listening to the community as a first person mode was extremely desired. People are saying how this game is all RNG and pure luck. I can't say this game isn't heavily based on luck but there is still a thought process involved. However this game isn't without flaws.CONS Like many others have mentioned the devs did break their promise of microtransactions before complete release. That simply is outrageous.I understand it's still an early access game but the optimization is almost non existent. I have a decent PC running a GTX 1050 and I am getting drastic frame drops on the lowest possible graphics.Although all of this is the case once you get to that top 5 there aren't many games that can really get your blood pumping like this game. Go solo or grab a friend or friends this is honestly still a very entertaining game.

review: PUBG is a battle royale (pvp) style multiplayer FPS. Start off in a plane with 100 players up to 4 players per team &amp choose where you parachute down. Once you hit the ground quickly find a gun and take down everyone else trying to take your loot in the area. The loot consists of items to heal yourself armor guns &amp attachments for them. Each map has their own variation of vehicles &amp guns.Recent patches have made the game much more playable from a performance stance compared to how it was.Currently there are a couple of major things stopping this game from being flawless at any rate. First of all the huge amount of bugs from things stopping your characters shooting to vehicles instantly killing you from the slightest tap or from tripping up on thin air as well as things not loading in or bullets not registering etc. But the main thing is the huge amount of hackers at the moment people who are shooting through walls flying around aim botting no recoil scans for the map to get the best loot &amp anything else you can think of.I would say to keep an eye on the progress of the game as it has regular updates &amp wait for the vast hacker problem to be sorted.

review: Ive only had this game for a few days. so this is sort of a FIRST IMPRESSIONPros The game is thrilling af i havent had my heart race like this in YEARS. knowing each second could be your last and overcoming that is extremely rewarding. Cool cosmetics though they are paid for either by grinding ingame currency or paying outright. Awesome fun when you re playing with friends i havent laughed this much when playing with friends in quite some time. Seeing your toughest friend screaming like a girl while running for cover with 1 hp is fkn hilarious. Learning the game (at least for me) is extremely rewarding going from "oh wtf hes a billion miles away and headshots me???" to "did i just headshot that guy 300 m away??? im so fkn good" is tons of fun and the map is sooo big it offers lots of different strategies from going all snipey snipes to "in your face" combat and that's lots of fun.Cons Right out of the bat i realized this game has HUGE issues with optimization i do admit that im on holiday and ive only tried it on my gaming laptop. but after seeing a few reviews ive realized im not alone when i say this game is melting my laptop down the buildings arent rendering not to mention you either get terrible quality or super hd no real in between. and that's bad unless you have a monster pc. HACKERS... funny when you see someone running at 1000 mp/h through the map. Not so much when ppl start dying on the plane becasue some hacker is killing us all without having a chance to fight back. Unrendered buildings. i know ive already mentioned the optimization issues but i think this deserves a mention of its own. There are times when you drop and the buildings havent rendered so u just stand there like an idiot hoping the house renders b4 someone kills you. The learning curve this is as much a pro as it is a con learning the game is exciting and rewarding HOWEVER the game doesnt have any sort of matchmaking YET so you're stuck with ppl who have waaaaay more playing experience than you and that can be frustrating for a new player.All in all if you have the cash to spare and youre looking for a game that will have you switching from "I loooove this game" to "Fuuuuuuuck this shiieeeeeet" back and forth then this game is definitely for you. i might update this review as i get more time with the game. but for my first veredict i definitely think this is a must buy.

review: Where shuold I start...PUBG is a very competetive game which I like. It's difficult to properly learn how the game works but after 50 hours I was able to get my first chicken dinner. The game is very addictive.BUT there are a few things you should consider bedore spending 30 euros in a game like this. Though the game is officially not in beta it feels so. The community is sometimes toxic (shouting in plane etc.) but after all not bad. The developers are fu**ing lazy. They sometimes listen to the community after months but with all the money they got from the game they could've made it so much better. VERY BADLY OPTIMIZED. If you have a weaker pc dont't expect this game to run like others. Again this is the developers fault. Constant perfromance problems with the servers. It all feels like a beta status game.Other than what is above this is a great game. I think the best battle royale game. If you like or interested in this category this game is a must have.After all I recommend this game if you are passionate enogh. I will stick with this game because I like it so much.

review: The game is littered with game breaking bugs and horrendous performance issues. And while there are is some visibility of work being done to fix those issues it still is justa visibility. I understand that 9 women can't give bith to a child within a month but with the immense popularity this game has accumulated and the budgets that come with that the developers now have plenty of resourses to get the product to a MUCH more playable state. Instead it is yet another testament to making money on hype trains and terrible products defying darwinism.It's not EA bad but it still is horrible.If you got this far then the issues I'm talking about and have experienced firsthand include at least 1) teammates not seeing your nametag thus being prone to seeing you as a hostile which is crucial in this game2) character stopping every few seconds instead of running consistently throughout the while match3) sound not working throughout the whole match4) horrendous load times resulting in you staring at a black screen when you have already been dropped off and have already landed5) not being able to jump of the plane until the end of the route is reached6) app crashing as often as up to 3 TIMES within a 20 min session

review: This game is a blast. You spawn in an airplane with up to 100 other players and chose your drop in point. From there it's a race to be the last one alive by finding guns ammo medical supplies and armor. The map continually shrinks until it's a VERY small area. I've finished top 10 once but every game has been a TON of fun and always felt different.The gunplay is great the map is huge and pretty deep mechanics that you have to learn the nuance of. All around fun time.My biggest gripes are the pre game lobby where it's just a bunch of people screaming n words and f***ots. Children probably optimization (but it's 2 months into early access i'm sure that will be brought up) rewards are slow and borderline not worth it.Pick it up spawn in die and keep on playing.Edit After getting 105 hours in which isn't much but has given me a much better understanding of the game I can safely say I still love this game. The devs are responsive there are weekly and monthly patches and the gameplay is always engaging no matter how many times I play. I can see my self continuing to play this game for a very long time to come.

review: A shooter game from Asian developers what could go wrong??? Well apparently everything. Don't let the stupid overhyping from the so called gaming media outlets deceive you because if anyone is even more ignorant than the developers of this game it is those game journos. PUBG IS A BAD GAME. It is objectively bad. That's something every single person who played a real high quality shooter knows. Some cannot accept it tho but it's ok. And Asians are completely clueless about online shooters anyway so of course they think PUBG is a good game. They made this THE MOST POPULAR FPS IN THE WORLD (https //www.youtube.com/watch?v YeCO6AiY2y4) so let that sink in for a second.I bought the game because region price was good and also I admit it has it's moments where you enjoy it very much if you have friends to play with. Beyond that tho??? The game is utter trash it is Quality is so low you feel like you wouldn't play it even if it was free. Animations suck gunplay suck map design suck game design suck graphics suck UI suck performance suck progression suck. Cheaters are rampant crashes bugs glitches everywhere. And most importantly netcode is beyond horrible. Even when it is 2v2 tickrate can drop down to 2 Hz (yeah just two) and I csgo community have been complaining about 64 tick for quite a few years now. Movement is so stupid you feel like you are driving a car rather than controlling a character. Now some say it is intentional but then it is not just horrible it is also stupid. Overall almost everything about this game is bad and can be done way way way better. THat returns me to the first paragraph When will this game be fixed???NEVER PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds WILL NEVER EVER BECOME A GOOD GAME. Trust me I know the state Asian game industry is in. They have NO WAY OF FIXING THIS GAME. I am not saying they are lazy like Valve or greedy like EA. They are simply incompetent. Only way this game is being fixed is if Bluehole sells it to a proper Wstern dev or they come here. FPS is the most difficult genre to develop and even the biggest industry leading studios like Valve DICE has many troubles about getting it right I am simply shocked how can anyone with a functionaing brain can believe some random asian mmorpg dev can fix this game.Verdict Buy and play it with friends if you want because it is fun. Just don't become a blind fanboy and lie to yourself (or everyone else fanboys of PUBG is like a cult at this point). Also don't pay too much attention to the game it is a trash game and it will soon find it's rightful place.
