review: So far I have 44 hours in this great game. I have actually brought this game twice the first time I just didn't enjoy it and got a steam refund. I felt that it deserved a second chance and I haven't regretted it since.Playing in a duo or a squad is far more enjoyable than playing solo in my opinion. Solo is somewhat more difficult compared to duo or squad. The fact that you could be sniped by someone you never saw is frustrating however when you play as a duo or squad you can be brought back up to your feet on extremely low health is make the experience so much better as working as a team is rewarding. Of course if you like a more tense experience solo is very good for that it is tougher but getting a kill is so much more of an achievement.Playing as a duo has this tense experience as it is difficult to drop somewhere there isn't another team but not to the exent of solo and once your nearby oppenents have been dealt with the game plays more like a squad game than a solo. A squad game in my opinion is the most enjoyable game type in PUBG. Playing with others just makes this game great there will be moments you will remember either because your teammate mistakes you for an enemy and kills you (This actually happened to me and we laughed about it for about 5 minutes straight after it happened) or because you won a squad game without anyone in your squad dying.If you buy this game which I recommend you do having friends to play it with makes it 10 times better. Anyway most people do own this game so you shouldn't struggle to find a squad. The dev team is constantly working (so far) to make this game even better than it is. The game does need better optimization and until the dev team works on that you will need a good pc to play it but ignoring that this game is great and a definate purchase who enjoys these type of games.

review: Fun but extremely flawed. The game still acts as if it were still in early access with crashes performance issues such as visual studder and just things that don't make sense. The looting and shooting can be a lot of fun but considering how unstable the game is I cannot recommend it. Here is a list of bugs that I have encounteredlast 6 months Died to a shelf. The shelf then killed a teammate who went to loot me. Both was from falling damage On landing with parachute I get launched in whatever direction the game feels like I should be (this one appears to be fixed) Hit a cardboard box with a undamaged vehicle causing it to explode and kill my entire team. Someone was able to glitch into a rock and then kill my teammates Friend getting out of moving boat and dying instantly last week until now Crashes and unable to load back into the game. Grenade launching me a great distance and outside the safe zone. Players vehicles and loot not loading in on screen right away. Blood splatter from shooting someone but them not actually getting hit.Spec wise I am well over the recomended and the game just doesn't run well. The good news is the developer is constantly working on the game so there is hope.

review: Its better than H1Z1 KotK Battle Royale mods for Arma or anything similar.You get a few seconds in the plane to figure out where you wanna jump. On the way down you'll see wether or not anyone else is heading in the same direction as you. Depending on that you either need to just hurry up and find something useful to kill the others or you can spend a few minutes looting and getting everything you need. The game has great pacing when it comes to narrowing down the playzone and actually finish a match. You need to be clever and patient to actually make it to the end.Still needs a bit of work but is 100% playable in this Early Access state.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've been playing this game for two days already and here are my thoughts so far the idea is awesome don't have to wait long to find a game it's freezing and lagging AFThe adrenaline you get from playing this game is massive especially if you play with someone so you know you can't let your comrade down plus the cooperation part makes this game even better. Also it is quite friendly to new players cause me and my friend come 3rd and 1st after 7 or 8 games and we didn't have any experience playing such survival games. Also due to the laggs if I drop too early from the plane I have decent chances to find buildings and cars not visualized properly so I can go through textures and even die from stucking in them (not funny at all).I hope that at the final version all these bugs will be reduced some more weapons and equipment will be added maybe the map will be expanded/or new maps will be added and give a wee bit more time for looting places and this damn blue area won't shrink that fast.All in all if the game will be optimised properly it's a must have item especially when you have a friend or two who is also willing to spend loads of time playing in it.UPD This game was released in early access 1 5 months ago but from that time the major errors were not fixed despite the enormous amount of money they received after releasing this game. However after 1 month of patches which did not fixed game's performance they decided to take a 10 day vacation and make a charity tournament (which just proved how many bugs they still got). I expected more work from their team. That is disgraceful 4/10

review: Incredible game solo and with friends got game today not even slightly bored worth every penny the gun play seems so good and feels rightnot pay 2 win like other games *h1z1* ( which is also terrible compared to this and terrible in general )good graphics ( by the way turn POST PROCESSING to very low it wil get rid of blur dont know why it has so much blur on ultraNot the best optimised on i5 4690k 4.6 ghz and gtx 1070 evga sc i get 90 fps in open and always above 60 in cities also with 120 screen up rez with most ultra other than post processing and effects also with the steam comands of USEALLAVAILABLECORES malloc system sm4 ( sm4) makes trees look bad but gives fair bit of fps i not really nessicary if on card like mine on lower card its recomended also game has fairly bad ram leak with it costing 10gb of ram with out malloc system and just above 8 with it IF YOu have 8 gb look up the lowmemory command for steam im pretty sure that will help.

review: Revised review as of 01 02 2018Can't choose which map you want to play... I can't fathom why they would leave a map selection feature out of the full release... It's pretty arbitrary and dumb on the part of Bluehole.RIDDLED with hackers. No exaggeration every 1 2 matches at least one person in my squad is killed by a random obvious hacker. A studio with this many game sales should be investing heavily in a state of the art anti cheat system... I've personally spoken with people who proudly proclaim that their hacks will never be detectable and they'll never stop hacking PUBG.Bluehole is failing miserably on this front and they're running with our money instead of investing in proper systems to prevent hacking.Bugs dying behind walls textures failing to load in massive dsync issues etc. Honestly the list goes on and on.I'm changing my review from positive to negative because the game has left Early Access and is apparently what Bluehole considers to be "full release" material. To be completely fair I've had a lot of fun times with this game. Those fun times have recently been overshadowed by the realization that the problems the game has are not just "quirks" and small bugs. These are problems that come with the fully released game.If Bluehole ever gets around to addressing these problems I'll switch my review back to positive.

review: I love this game itself its not a buggy mess. Its a great concept and plays well.. The problem is that The servers are LITERALLY FLOODED with Chinese players and a good 50% Of them are either Terrabad or OBVIOUS hackers. I have nothing against chinese people but their playerbase is utter trash. They Need a region lock BAD. And this isint just me crying about getting spanked. this is me coming here after spending 6 games in a row having my whole squad wiped by a single guy with a UMP at 300 meters within 3 seconds before he speedwarped over and took our gear. this game is untill it controlls its player base and puts the trash in its own server.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is a lot of fun and addicting to play there are a few drawbacks tho. i have noticed that some of my friends have a constant problem with crashes in the pre game lobby this may be due to the fact of all the guns and such creating lag which some pc's may not be able to handle i recommend if you have this issue as well to run to the water as soon as you enter the pregame lobby this seems to help the issue. the other big downfall to this game is the memory leak... i find myself constantly having to restart the game after a few rounds some times after every round i must restart. other than those 2 cons this game is amazing with too many positive features to list. if you are looking for a better version of H1Z1 or a new shooter survival game i highly recommend. and the non pay 2 win unlike h1z1 is amazing. i highly recommend this game to all!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: GTX 980 ti Overclocked to 1430core Clock I7 4790k 4.5Ghz 16g of Ram.2 hours on the game and I am officially ready to do a review to PLAYERUNKNOWN BATTLEGROUNDS.I have Played Rust DayZ and Other Battle Royale games didn't have the oportunity to play Arma 3All I have to say about this game is Positive.1 Weapons Feel super Realistic the feel it's just awesome2 Variety of Weapons3 Squad Duos are so much fun even without having friends even thou I have some playing4 Fps on my GTX 980 TI were from 80 to 120 while playing on ground.The game doesn't have vsync so I went to my GPU and enabled Vsync but it didn't work. Then I Did some research and I found this helpful Post which I give the credits to the person that wrote it.Originally posted by YoloSwag Bristleback its AppData Local TslGame Saved Config WindowsNoEditor GameUserSettings.iniFrameRateLimit XSo I set the Fps limit to 60 fps even thou I was getting 80 to 120 because my Video card temperature was 75 with my fan set to 75% even thou is not a dangerous temp I wanted it to be Capped at 60frames per second.5 I found out that Friends appear online only when they are in the lobby and not playing a match when they are in a match they will appear offline.6 Buildings are awesome and there lots of them7 The gameplay feels realistic on my first game I actually joined a Squad team and we killd one guy from the other team and to loot his weapons one of the guys from my squad used a smoke bomb and we looted him it felt so good lol8 Cars are awesome and they feel realistic 9 The circle that pushes player to ingage is not as fast as other Battle Royale so i felt it kind of Slower which is pretty good for tactical playersGame is 10/10 for me
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game rocks. Impressive that the dev took it from alpha to beta to early access and has a plan to be out of it by the end of the year. Finally a dev that makes significant progress on their game. This game is fun to play fun to watch... no really go check it out on twitch.tv.100 players spawn in an aircraft you choose when to jump out. When you land all weapons and gear is procure on site. The player has to gain various upgrades (whether they are healing items weapons or other equipment) that are scattered throughout most of the map.For those that have somehow managed to stay ignorant to the battle royale concept you essentially are playing in a play area that shrinks over time pushing players together. If you are outside the play area you take damage. This zone will eventually shrink to non existance although typically the game ends before that with the last player (or team in team mode) standing. The game is playable in 100 players solo 50 teams of 2 or 25 teams of 4.

review: PUBG good game in terms of fun with ur mates in squads or duosthe first 50hrs of pubg is really fun it gets the adrenaline going and its cool to learn the maps and get a grasp of the pubg arena. but once it gets around 100+ hours the game is very boring. This is because of a very poor netcode. This means that when you land it is very much impossible to do anything. In most cases this is life and deathin my opinion this game is fun but can get boring and vechicle physics dont make sense. On many rounds i get on a bike drive with good loot i hit a small rock and then die from falling.only buy this game if you dont care about the hackers de sync and the netcodemeaning i dont recommend this in my opinion a rushed and unfinished game

review: Very enjoyable even in the under developed stages. One map one mode and very effective game mechanics. Only a small selection of guns and items so it's not daunting and you will understand everything after one or two "tester" games.Still very much running on bare basics. For example once dead you simply exit the match no spectating leaderboard or any way to see who wins the round. You often don't know where you were even shot from so it's a little anti climactic having just spent 20 minutes working your way down to the final 20 players.Graphics are similar to DayZ standalone. Occasional glitches and popping but not enough to change gameplay. Maintains 40 45 FPS on AMD RX480.

review: PLAYERUNKNOWNS BATTLEGROUNDSVery Fun huge world with a huge variety of weopons/play styles because of huge world trolling and having fun with random people is POSSIBLE (h1z1 im talking to you) sure it wasent optimized for the first few months but it was still fun i play it everyday before and a little after work (hence my 90 hours) 1050ti and an AMD fx 6300 with 8gb ddr3 ram runs great on medium (littered with pros/try hards) so very hard to get into. Snipers/scopes and recoil very hard to get used to (full auto is not call of duty full auto)3rd person makes running seem slower than 1st person but is good bc i play 1st all the time CONSim not racist never will be but for the sake of my internet please PLEASE region lock china i like meeting new people with new places of origin BUT PLEASE REGION LOCK CHINA they have a game called ring of elysium PLEASE STICK TO THAT. ADD NEW SMGS/SHOTGUNS or a mass drop sniper with low damage i like sniping. 2 shotguns and a sawed off gets boring fast. events are bland (tequila sunrise with only 3 shotguns available is not acceptable in my part) war mode is VERY FUN i have a semi esports legue for this game at my school and i can say ALL ten of us group up XD but it is littered (with try hards and pros) so we never have fun. people always have seem to be god like aim. (i have adhd so everything is now now now so i die alot in gunfights) m16 is way to annoying the gu sound is ing awful) 30 dollar price tag is very heart hurting to say the least i do not get 30 dollars of fun out of this. savage testing is stomach churning i JUST WANNA PLAY THE NEW DAMN MAP. i hate huge games who "tease" people its ing annoying my sensitivity feels very heavy wasd moving is clunky when ever i press w it takes like 2 secs to get to full walk speed whenever i slow down it takes a while. VERY RAGE INDUCING so hard i never get to 5 or less peopleReward system is bogus the brightness is absolutly a joke and the smgs in the game are never used pass 50 people. ARS dominate and the armor system is a ing SICK disease other then that a good 7/10 (PS I WANNA ING WIN)

review: The most breaking bugs that are in the game are hardly ever fixed.. also dont expect the developers to listen to the community they're mostly the reason for the negative reviews.best short review https //steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198149776948/recommended/578080/PROS Intense gameplayEasy to learn / hard to masterGood graphicsNice variety of mapsNo rounds are alikeNo grindCONS ALOT of hackersWonky colisionsVery demanding on hardwarebad connection to servers in main menuGreedy developers (many F2P elements in a paid game)Lack of care to the communityWith that said the game is alright. It's fast and intence hard but not too hard. The more you play it the more you get used to how people will move around and you'll learn to counter it.I've had alot of fun with the game but i cannot recommend it to others because there's most likely better Battle Royal games coming out where you wont have to deal with really buggy gameplay and developers that doesn't fix their mistakes and are extremely slow. (would recommend battle field 5 or black op 4)In the hands of developers that actually care about their game it would really have the potential to one of the best games out there. I had my hopes up for the game when i first bought it back in March 2017 and oh boy has it grown since then but since they got competition on the same market they've begun to take the game to places it's not ready for at all and making lawsuits that doesn't make sense it's like watching an 8 year old kid being forced by his parents to be an adultThe developers barely care about the game anymore they just want your money and you have to pay for the game to see that.

review: Graphics 8/10The graphics on Ultra really blow H1Z1 and Arma out of the water. I'm only giving this an 8 because there are some obvious issues with colors when the graphics are cranked up. Example characters hair gives a skunk effect in certain lighting in game.Optimization 4/10Whether you have a GTX 660 or a GTX 1080 this game can still bog down into the 30 and below FPS Range. Professional streamers with $10k rigs have trouble getting proper Frame Rate from this game. This is an early access game so I expect this to only get better but as of now this is a big issue.Gameplay 9/10I really think the gameplay is much better than the competition. Hit registration feels the way it should attachments add some variety to the gameplay and it seems slightly more skill based instead of luck when firing long distances.Areas for improvement would be input lag when opening doors and better responsiveness when moving. I understand this game delays your full sprint speed by 1 2 seconds which is realistic but it feels sluggish in this regard. The ranking system also applies to solo/duo/squad gameplay so you can finally get credit for your games where you're not forced to play by yourself. Loot crates are easily obtainable as well so no more spending $20 for a single crate. Overall If you're playing H1Z1 and you're tired of the luck based firefights and stale gameplay play this game!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: No. Just no. When this game came out in early access it had a lot of potential. It was glitchy and broken af but we all gave it a pass on that because it was just so much fun anyway. When the game released it was still glitchy and broken af. This is when things started going down hill. Bluehole listened to absoloutely no community feedback cared very little about what anyone actually thought and the creator himself Brendan Greene started quite literally making fun of players on twitter for whining about this lack of communication and calling players "bad" for dying to literal RNG. (I seriously suggest you check out his twitter to see the utter disregaurd for the community he has) But even so with the recent release of Sanhok things were looking up. I enjoyed the game it felt clean the map was good the guns were good and yet even with all of their money and all the hype up Bluehole had created it fell apart after only a few days. The servers are worse than they've ever been the game's endless glitches are becoming more and more apparent leaving us with an unplayable mess. This game is not competetive in any way because the servers and the terrible bugs of the game leave every fight up to chance. Do not buy this game has never really been good and I think the only reason we all bought it was because we all had faith that someday it would be good. I see clearly now that this will NEVER be the case. This is a terrible game and it always will be. If the devs haven't fixed their game with the amount of time and money we've given them they never will.I'm over it wishing every day for this game to finally rise to it's full potential. This game is garbage and I'm finished waiting for it to get better. Go play Islands of Nyne or something if you want a competetive BR shooter.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. Great game with lots of potential and a so far stable player base. Run by a developer capable of prompltly fixing server related issues pouring patches on a rather regular basis. No pay to win system implemented yet with no trace of one being made so far. Open beta non the less. This should be put into consideration before purchase. The game has been out for a while now yet it is the worst optimised piece of software I ever played so far. Dark souls 1 without DSfix runs smooth compared to PU BattleGrounds. Waiting for performance fixes and patches is advised.The leap of faith that is purchasing a open beta is one thing. Running the game for the first time on whatever high or ultra settings the game recomended to you is another. In my case I had to wait through roughly six minutes of 1fps slideshows before alt+F4 did its magic. 30 for a unfinished product is a gamble. A guarantee of the game entering a closed beta state doesnt come with the purchase. Although with this title that may be the least worrying issue. This game seems to have a lush future ahead but with performance issues deep as these a price tag of 30 deserves consideration on the buyers end. (Unless runing a NASA equivalent PC)Just for reference Running a gtx 960 (2gb) with a mild overclock FX6300 3 5GHz (6 cores) 8GB Ram with 40 stable fps on such demanding titles like Wither 3 or GTA 5 on High settings (60fps with AA off). Yet this game is incapable of running stable 30fps on all graphicall setting turned all the way down and or off including .ini file tweaks for max performance. Take this terribel performance optimisation into account.PUBG 1.0+ UPDATE Game is no longer early access. Still runs like crap. 55 60fps on very low with the occasional drop to the one digit plane with semi frequent stutters and net code wich I believe uses RNG to determine hit box locations.Speaking of RNG shotguns are a blast in this game. To clarify if you ever find yourself at an Impasse in PUBG and feel the need to erase yourself from existence commiting suicide with a shotgun pressed against your skull does not guarantee a one shot kill or even a hit...Yet lots of fun to be had with this particular piece of software just make sure your PC is high on the high end spectrum. I recommend this game to anyone who has more money in their PC case than in their wallet.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Playerunknown's BattlegroundsThis game is hard to describe I personally am not one for these battle royale games due to them having cheaters or being quite boring.I started this game with an open mind and experiance playing arma and other shooters the graphics could be better but never base a game off the graphics look at a game by the gameplay and controls.The shooting gameplay is fairly spot on aswell as the movment.The fact that the game starts to get smaller and smaller as it goes makes you engage with enemies forcing you to make a choice "do i shoot or do i waitor just run" i find most of the time if you have played arma you would want to shoot them as well as because they are human you can you mind games to throw them off meaning tactics as well as quick time thinks helps set up flanking attacks. To be honest Solo matchs are fun but duos or teams of friends all on discord or teamspeak is where this game shines.I would recommend this game its funs but much better with friends

review: Spawn on an island. Chant "Human Centipede!" in hopes of forming a line of 100 people crawling prone face to rectal region. Ended up being hilariously impressive in length. Im a proud father. GAME TIME! Load into a plane. Jump out of a plane. Find a strategic spot and gather loot. Looted up. Sweet time to venture off into the vast and terrifying world. Ready for anything. Get shot in the middle of a field and scream out loud while moving my mouse way too fast in search of my attacker. Poor strategic choice...Get laid out and lose everything including all hope of a happy life. Re queue. Repeat. Works well with friends too. Leaving them to die in a field while i cry in a gross bathroom pointing a shotgun at the door is a common occurance. Them watching me after their death and being bummed and scared for me is also common. Death is coming quickly at all times. Is that a frying pan? yep.10/10Would centipede again.

Besides of not being able to jump out of the plane facing in game lags and whatsoever. Not to forget the HUGE FPS drops that occure during the game which is extremely annoying. review: I've spent some time in this game and have come to the conclusion that there are some major fundemental problems with this game. But before I get to that here are the pros The game experience is intense and there is no other game that I can think of that makes my blood flowing as much. There can be geniune moments of fear panic heartbreak but there are other moments of sheer excitement shouting and cheering. The gameplay is unique and there are many different strategies one can emply whilst scavenging around the two massive maps. Team play offers more dynamic gameplay but Solo is just as fun.Now to the Cons Guns are sluggish and it feels like you have to wrestle them down just to control the recoil. You can spend an entire clip on someone at medium range without hitting them once. The game is about as buggy as can be. There isn't one aspect about this game that feels refined or polished. Hackers everywhere. Due to the randomness of the circles there are some instances where skill is taken out of the equation and you're forced to hope for good luck. Community is Toxic as hell. Often times death feels unfair or cheap. I'm not talking about being salty over being killed by a camper either. I'm talking about how close range firing seems to be a complete 50/50 since weapons lose all but some of their accuracy after the first shot. No region locking.I want to love this game. I've played so much of it hoping that at some point I'll see some sort of end to the equation and be able to work with the game and all its flaws. But it becomes difficult when it seems to actively work against you at every corner. I've stopped having fun with it now I've become more experienced in it. Now every time the match ends even if I win doesn't seem to be worth all the anger and frustration that you have to put up with in order to get there. All this added on to the fact that there is a hacker about every two games leaves a sour taste in my mouth.That and it's just insulting that they've added payed loot crates a system which is already seen as cancerous to a game that in its "released" state feels like a Beta.I would not reccomend this game to anyone but the most hardcore of players.

review: As much of a riot this game has been I've been repeatedly let down by it. I enjoy the gameplay when it works. I understand that this game is in beta but it would be great that instead of updating the games weather effects and weapons if they could just make it playable first Everything from server lag memory leaks framerate drops and having to constantly tweak PC settings and it seems they couldn't address that in their first "major" update. This game is mildly fun for a round or two before I get so frustrated with the performance issues I decide to play something else. I have multiple PCs I play this game on from my $2000+ desktop to my $1300+ laptop this game runs like absolute garbage. It's an awesome idea just poor execution along the lines of making it work for everybody. If you want a game that functions properly and is user friendly this one is definitely not it. If the playability issues were ever addressed I would gladly come and change this review to a positive one.Update Frame rate issues have been fixed! Now if only in every clutch moment when I go to pull out my gun or pick one up in the beginning of the game I could actually pull it out pick out or just plain use it. You know to kill the opposition (the point of the game) that would be great. This is a recurring issue if there is a lot of activity in my area.Update THe game now runs as it's expected to. I get major lag in some lobbies but overall my experience has greatly improved with the 1.0 update. Thank you BlueHole!

review: This game forces you into major time sinks without any engaging or worthwhile gameplay. While a lot of media focused around this game targets the fights between squads and other players the majority of the actual game consists of three things chasing your way into a zone across a boring and dull environment collecting meaningless attachments and armor that affect nothing in your run and sitting around waiting for the zone to shrink or a person to show up. In order to complete the game and win you have to sink at least an hour into the game with this dull gameplay on a huge empty map. The game seems bent on wasting as much as your time as possible in order to create artificial investment. Nothing about this game is remotely enjoyable or entertaining.

review: I have about 6 hours into this game and for an early access I will give it a thumbs up if it was a ready for release I would give it a thumbs down. So the game is pretty fun and it is hard if you are seen first. Once someone starts shooting at you you are pretty much dead if you cannot locate them quickly enough or drop a smoke grenande in time. First seen first dead is the way it seems. There are some frame rate issues and some issues with the lag but this is early access so it is to be expected. Hopefully these issues will be addressed with future updates. The game is fun and the concept is really good. Pros Vast open world Quite a few different weapons Good diverse terrain flats to hilltops buildings Vehicles with limited gas Method to keep players in the play areaCons Some lag in response to picking up items there are times where you have to hit the key multiple times to pickup an item Play area shrinks to fast Draw distance needs work FPS needs improvementSystem specs i7Nvidia GTX 97032 Gig RamSSD Drive

review: Let me start off by saying the game is awesome. It's an awesome concept and brings a fresh look at TPP and FPP games. With that said the problems with the game aren't really with the game at all. It's Brandon Green and Bluehole that are the problem. To be even more specific it's their liberal world view which is basically ruining the game. First the players from day 1 have been complaining about Chinese players. Not that we don't like the Chinese but their pings are absurd. The Dsync caused by this is SOOO bad that it makes the game unplayable. You can put a full shotgun blast point blank into sosmeone but because they have a 27438686432 ping it won't even register. Sounds like a legitimate complaint right? Something a normal dev would look at and be like "Oh maybe they have a point". Not Brandon Green. Nah he says we're all xenophobes. It's not that the game is broken it's basically because what he refers to as "his community" is just being racist. That's how the dev's feel about the people who buy their game. If you complain about flaws in their game it's not their fault it's yours for being a racist xenophobe. The other obvious issue with having large amount of chinese players playng on the North American server is the breakdown in communication. If they could speak English or I could speak chinese it wouldn't be a problem. Trying telling someone who doesn't speak your language that someone is entering the house they're in. Not so easy. But of course this again isn't a legitimate complaint i'm apparently just being racist. So thats really what you should be prepared for. A fun game thats broken because the people who should take care of simple issues would rather call the people who spend money on their products racists and xenophobes. Don't worry though our complaints have recently been heard. Instead of fixing the game they gave us micro transactions. Just what they claimed everyone wanted. Nobody wanted a functional game according to them we wanted to spend more money on a broken game.This is the typ of experience you can expect. It's like a super talented up and coming sports star who gets busted with 100 kilos of coke. A waste.

review: I was extremely excited about this game when it came out. The intentions of the designers and developers are great and I have no doubt this game will be a dominating force in the Battle Royale genre (some would say it already is). But the fact is that this game is really not ready for even Early Release. Here is why 1) When it runs smooth it's an amazing game. IF it runs smooth. There has not been one day I have not experienced some major bug in the game. I don't mean hearing bullet shells from across the map (which is a thing) but falling through entire buildings because they failed to load before dropping onto the map.2) It's a RAM hog. I have a decent computer with 16gb of RAM with a GTX 760 and it just freezes up when running this game at times. When I exit out of the game the computer feels the shockwaves of playing the game for minutes afterward and takes some time to get back to normal.3) If you happen to have the game running smoothly that does not mean the others around you do as well. If you are prone to being triggered by teleporting enemies then it would be better to wait for this game. There have been multiple encounters in the game where you may shoot at someone and they will all of the sudden disappear and reappear right next to you over your now dead body. It can make for a frustrating time.4) It is impossible to tell where someone is shooting from. They have not worked out all of the sound issues though I know they are actively improving this aspect of the game. But for now good luck finding that guy lighting you up from who knows where.I cannot wait for this game to get optimized and some of the major kinks to get worked out. I know this is Early Release and that is the nature of the beast but when it starts to make a game unplayable then it becomes an issue no matter what stage of the game development you are at. In a couple of months watch out this game will be unstoppable.**UPDATE This game has come a long way since my initial review. From addressing hackers to optimization there have been enough improvements for me to easily recommend this game now. There are still plenty of areas for improvement but I think that with the rise of other games such as Fortnite the devs understand more than ever that to stay on top you have to always improve. The pressure is on for the title of the King of Battle Royales.

review: Solid base for a good game. Needs lots of work though to be excellent game.Current Price is not justified as there is no diversity in maps and gameplay.Pros Giant Map but guaranteed enemy encounters as playing zone decreases over time you'll HAVE to get close to others Unreal Engine based so high quality textures models and shaders perform fine on medium power machines Playable as Solo 2 or 4 Player Squad gamemodes. A ton of fun with actual friends Gunplay is well crafted and player encounters mostly lag free Since the ending zone location is random each subsequent game is different Complete Gameplay is cloned from Arma but works properly as it is not made by Bohemia.Cons Is meant to be based on the Arma 2 Battle Royale Mod (who's creator is PUBG's creator).That is not any contra to most people but Arma games are not a good example for good multiplayer games ever.I personally am glad that PUBG has only copied the good Arma mechanics. At the moment EVERY time I start the game the first round I join has the Loading Screen ontop period and I only hear the gameplay. No menus are displayed. I have to alt f4 the game and start again. That's just an unnecessary bug. At the moment only one static map no random generated maps At the moment VERY sluggish player movement. Not animation based not simply transform based but seems to be inertia based.I still have trouble jumping over 30cm fences or a 20cm step into some toolsheds. From a standing pose it is impossible to jump forward. You only jump upwards. You have to walk 0.5 1m before you jump forwards correctly.I hope this get's adjusted sooner than later as it is a common gamebreaker to me especially during medium range gunfights where it is important to quickly navigate terrain to get a positional advantage. At the moment Audio engine is completely in need of redo. 80% of the time when I hear a friendly player run near me or shots are fired around me in medium distances the stereo channels seem to switch. Things that I know are to my right I hear on my left. It's really weird and COMPLETELY disorienting.It ONLY happens with medium range sounds though.When closer than 50m I hear correct stereo. When farther than 200m I hear correct stereo.When in between these distances the channels seem to be flipped. I don't think this is intended ) At the moment Interaction commands are delayed randomly not depending on ping. Sometimes doors when tried to "open" start to play the closing animation meaning they snap to being open then close. Wastes time.Getting into a car does not work properly sometimes I have to hit the command 2 3 times before it works. Annoying. The price of 30 bucks is not justified for a game still this early in development.Only one map which is always the same only loot locations are random.Gameplay is not diverse it's always last man standing. Combined with only one map it's quite boring after you know each part of the map. After that it's just Get in Get good gear avoid being killed kill others. Just like DayZ.I'm 10 hours into PUBG and have seen each part of the map already. That's not a bad thing it's just..for 30 bucks I expect many different locations and gamemodes already in the game.Overall I DO recommend the game if you have 1 3 good friends and you all find it thrilling to work together tactically against others.I am however not satisfied with the current features and lack of map availability. But other maps are planned in the future so all that's left is ironing out some poor mechanics adding more diversity and you have a decent battle royale game.I might have forgotten some minor pro's and con's but you should get the picture.Edit 2018 I have to revert my recommendation after the jump out of "Early Access" the game has indeed improved performance wise but bugs are still completely unadressed.Just now I had a "network lag" error which on MY machine means the game is irreversibly broken and there is now way to rejoin the match.On my friends machine it is possible to rejoin with the "match still in progress" window but on my machine it is NEVER possible. I just have to ask him to quit and start a new round.Also the more players are around us the more it lags stutters and glitches out.A bike suddenly flips while driving straight on a road even killing us on impact.This game is still as poorly made as it was before the "final version" the "finished game".Almost all of my previously stated bugs are still impairing gameplay even more have appeared regarding gunfights. Hitting the window frame when clearly aiming above it Killcams and replays are NOT any indication on what the person watched was doing whatsoever they instead infuriate me because it is just some random aiming and snapping on my player then 3 shots and dead.I am not satisfied at all with the final product and do not recommend it.As much as it is fun to play with friends and joke around (which PUBG is A LOT) too many glitches and game design flaws result in unfair deaths.

review: Tha game is fun for casual play with friends that said it's horrible to be taken seriously as a competitive game the tick rate input delay and server lag are a joke. Shots frequently go unregistered and its common to die half a second after you hid behind a wall lagged players jumping into you will see and shoot you half a second before they appear on your screen. I play on optical fiber always above 100fps on a 144hz monitor my ping on local servers are all 5 10ms. The game needs to match players with the same average ping times needs better "netcode" and better server hardware. Also need to make weapons less arcady and bring some realism to it like ArmA level of ballistics which can be easily introduced in UE4 (ffs theres a tutorial for it on youtube) along with damage models that make sense. The reason being you can apply common sense when handling them instead of having to memorize whatever nonsensical stats the developers decided. Supressor for a 762 revolver rofl. If those things get improved the game will still be a bit based on luck (what you find where the final circle is related to you) but at least everyone will be able to compensate a lot of it with sill instead of complete luck based on "netcode". I guess the good thing for developers is that based on how the netcode of this game is it leaves the spot open for a proper competitive game to be developed still. Maybe ArmA 4 will get their together? I doubt it Bohemia Interactive is also a mess.

review: Current Review 12/22/17 So the game is out and it's better than ever. The 1.0 launch has almost doubled my FPS averaging about 120 fps and never dipping below 100 with the specs listed on my profile (1440p). Not to mention the new map has been worth the wait and then some along with a handful of new weapons vehicles and vaulting which completely changes the flow of the game. The map is super optimized and the experience is much different from the base map that shipped with the game in early access. If you were waiting to try the game out after it came out of early access now is the time. The game is flurishing and for good reason. I have high hopes for the future of the game along with new content for it as well.Previous Review EDIT 5/29/17 As of right now the game is running incredibly well on my hardware and many different computers granting my recommendation boasting high framerates with minimal frame drops. The last thing needed to make the game almost 100% stable is to better the servers. That's really it. The game is suberb.PUBG is pretty much all you could want from a battle royale game. Tons of weapon customization frequent encounters a well fournished map satisfying sound and gunplay and most of all tense moments of action. This game delivers a sense of tension that a lot of others fail to create. To adress the elephant in the room objectively speaking this game is better than H1Z1. But it's not to say the game is without fault. Even after the recent set of updates the game is still incredibly demanding on most systems with only the highest end computers being able to run the game consitently abover 60 fps on the optimized settings listed in one of the games most popular guides (in my experience with a high end rig and watching several streamers withhigh end computers play the game). Several of my friends (with Pc's ranging from the low to mid/high end range) have trouble running the game without massive frame drops. Even after the recent updates my PC still seems to choke every now and then too dropping from low 100 fps to low 40's for seemingly little to no reason. I understand it is still a developing project and the world is big and it is a pretty graphically impressive game but frame rate consistency is VITAL in games of this nature where at any time you can have an encounter that requires precison and lighting quick reaction.Overall I think with a little more work and the continuation of vigourous updates to the game (which are coming basically weekly now) will be the definite choice for people looking for a battle royale experience. However the game as of now is very inconsistent performance wise and has a very different style from that of H1Z1. It is most comparable (in my opinion) to Arma with it's weapon upgrades the large amount of weapons and very meaty gun mechanics. Which is neither here nor there and just as Dota and League of Legends are compared forming militant groups of fans respectively I see that becoming the case for these two games. Just consider before buying either that they are both early access and they both have promising futures.

review: In the beginning this game had a lot of potential but all the inspiration went down the drain very quickly. It's like the company cared very little for its playerbase or the game in general after receiving greater revenue than they expected it to profit. Now the game feels like a drowning version of Arma's battle royale sinking deeper in the ocean. If only the devs just stuck with early access instead of releasing the too early for its type. Then maybe it could've avoided being slapped on the wrist. At the same time this game is not bad but it's bland and unpolished in terms of gameplay and mechanics. One reason I still play it is because I want to have a good time with my friends but eventually they feel the same way too.

review: Okay so let me start of by saying I love Pubg I still play it every other day and even though I will not recommend the game I will probably continue playing it.Why am I not recommending it? Well much like a abusive relationship pubg can give incredible amounts of fun and excitement but it does beat me down from time to time. They released an incomplete game to say the least the amount of rubberbanding at launch is beyond laughable. We still have critical glitches bugs exe that ruin the experience. On top of that there are a few game elements that I can t for the love of god figure out why they have kept Red zone much unlike the blue zone which servers a very important purpose om forcing players to fight each other the red zone just feels like a big random middle finger that exsists just to randomly upp someones plans. The looting mechanics have always been unfair in pubg and I can t help but think there must be some way to make it better Of course the rng is what makes the game replayable but there definetly needs to be an improvment. In summary sure the game is good but I can t stand behind it even if I wish i could.Edit OHH LOOK AT THIS NOW YOU DON T EVEN GET A FEW FREE LOOT BOXES TIME TO CASH UP GUYS. YOU ALREADY PAYED TO BAD!Edit ps Look I gotta be honest and say they fixed most issues nowdays the main issue is chinese hackers. But still from a gameplay perspective I gotta recommend it again however since they did try and make this a cash grab and broke some of their promises out of principle I sugest you don t buy it.

I could sit here and rip them a part all day but from other comments in this dissussion for reviews I see others have done it for me... Bluehole could have thrown punches with the big leagues if they would have just focused their sources into the game and not just profit. Now battlefield is going to crush you and throw you into the wind. R.i.p Pubg

review: Battlegrounds is a battle royale game wherein 100 people drop into an 18 by 18 square kilometer island in order to battle to the death. A short time after the game commences a gas field begins to close in on the island killing anyone foolish enough to remain within it for too long. The gas gets more and more powerful and moves more and more quickly as the game continues. Eventually players are forced into deadly confrontations as they must stay ahead of "the circle" as it is commonly called. Upon dropping into the arena players must search for loot with a mad rush to acquire a weapon as soon as possible. With some luck a helmet as well since headshots are lethal. This is where the game will start to lose people. The initial surge to find the loot you need is exciting. But after you either evade or kill everyone near you you now begin to search for better loot level three armor level three helmet your preferred weapons first aid and so on. You develop tunnel vision for items and it feels cheap when you're shot down by some punk hiding in the upper story of a house somewhere.The gunplay has weight to it and is satisfying. The guns themselves look good and are detailed. The characters move pretty realistically aside from the jumping which not only looks stupid is clunky as hell. You have the ability to play in either first or third person at the press of a button which is handy for close quarters. You also have an inventory of course where you can view and use your items. First aid and boost items take real time to use and must be used wisely as moving will cancel the action forcing you to redo it.I am currently playing in 1080p with everything on Ultra except for shadows which are on High which takes a 15 frame hit on my rig Gtx 1060 6GB i5 4690k 4.2Ghz 16 Gb RAM 1600 Mhz. With these settings I average 60 FPS although certain areas of the game cause that number to drop by half. The game is not opitimized very well at all as of this writing and prospective players should note that even players with powerful rigs are not running the game well.All in all I recommend this game.

review: This game is amazing! The game just keeps you comming back because every round is different so its always exciting. Killing people is insanely satisfying and there is the perfect balance of quiet searching and heart pounding action. If you get bored in the "one vs all" game mode you can play duos or squad wich can pair you up with a group of random players or you can invite your friends to play with you. Admitedly you can have streches of bad rounds wich can make anyone angry but then you can just swich into duos or squad and have your buddies watch your back. The game is no doubt worth the price because it can supply you with TONS of fun and connect you with new people of similar game interests. If you dont have this game... BUY IT! I cant express how fun this game is. The guns are just awesome feeling to shoot and the sounds are rich! Its one of the best games I've played in a while. Just freaking buy it.

review: This game has a somewhat interesting concept that would normally align well with what I consider my favorite games in terms of genre style and so on. I really want to love this game but sadly I just can't bring myself to it. I get that this is early access and have fully considered that fact before leaving this review. That being said I also am not up to speed on the history and development of the game so some of my complaints about the game may be known and there for some compelling reason. The Good The world is pretty massive and has a fun layout with all the buildings and geography. The ARMA/DayZ mashup feel/concept is appealing to my gaming interests (in theory). It should be a good combo. There's gotta be something else??? The Bad Gameplay is fun for a bit. You get dropped onto an island and wander around killing other people as you run into them. It plays very much like DayZ (or similar) but what I actually think of more is the "Gun Game" mode from the later Call of Duty Black Ops game series. While you get to choose your weapons in PUBG it is still very much a game where you run around as fast as you can dodging bullets and eliminating other players like you would in Gun Game. All players in PUBG start on equal footing at the start of the match that is without any items or special perks. You must perform well (or get lucky) to get good weapons and increase your odds of survival. The concept is fun for a bit but gets repetitive very quickly. It felt like I was playing the same thing over and over again without any real variety. There was no development and nothing to keep me intrigued after a few rounds. I know that a lot of people like this repetitious style of gameplay but I don't love it and was bored to death before I knew it. I thought that maybe given how much world there was and all of the possible options for weapons and upgrades that it'd get old less quickly than other similar games. I wasted a lot of energy and gained a lot of frustration by getting disconnect in the matchmaking screen and occasionally in the middle of actual game play. I had so much trouble getting a good stable server connection that about half of my "gameplay" time recorded was actually me in the lobby trying to connect. I should mention that I have fiber optic internet and connections have never been an issue for me on any other game. I have not experiences framerate issues like others have had. I am running GTX 970's in SLI and was able to run the game in the "Ultra" graphics mode without issue. However the quality of the graphics still seemed pretty poor to me especially for Unreal Engine. I don't think it is just my incorrect perception the more I played the game the more I became sure that the graphics quality was more on par with UE 3 or something similar and outdated. My final complaint is with the match time and is potentially just my personal preference more than a hard fault of the game. At the beginning of the match you have several minutes to find weapons. At that point the region of gameplay starts shrinking and forces players to the center of the map. I get why this is necessary and I wouldn't want a 5 mile x 5 mile map with two players trying to find each other over the course of many hours. My complaint is that I feel like the amount of time between gameplay regions shrinking is too short. Gameplay and a singular match goes by too quickly. It'd be nice if they would double or triple the amount of time to slow down the game just a tad and allow players to focus more on scavenging and exploring. I really feel like this would increase the survival feel of the game which I thought was part of the point. Is exploration and scavenging generally part of the point of an MMO world too? It just felt as if there was too much focus on the fast paced shooter portion and not enough on the exploring and upgrading portion.In summary for the $30+ I paid I felt like I didn't get a very good value. There is nothing really unique about this game to make it worth that sort of money. It's a $15 game for sure. The MMO thing has been done many times before. The weapons are all very cookie cutter and there was nothing to really get excited about there. The graphics are lackluster. It gets boring really quickly and there are not really any qualities that I can think of that set this game apart.I rate the game 5/10 overall. It's fun for a playthrough once or twice but isn't a game I'll keep coming back to and I doubt it will be recognized as a classic in the years to come.

review: For quite a long time now I have been looking for games to give me that nostaglic feeling back. The feeling of spending hours and hours at once on a game with friends having a ridiculous amount of fun and 'accidentaly' staying up way too late. Safe to say this game has done that. Sure it's far from perfect but I truly believe that the developer WILL get to the point where everything people are complaining about in the reviews will be in the past.Here's my personal pros and cons list PROS Can be incredibly fun Getting a kill is very satisfying Brought back that nostalgic feeling Fairly frequent updates Getting that chicken dinner makes you feel like a ing god With the right friends this game is an absolute blast.CONS Can get repetitive sometimes Playing alone is not fun Only two maps (they're working on new ones though) Some guns have an insanely high and random spray pattern. These two DON'T mix together well so you sometimes just have to get lucky with your shots. If you don't prepare for rage Dying early and your having your teammates still playing is downright annoying and kind of rage inducing The parachute sometimes does a thing where you are just stuck and have to watch everyone find guns and contemplate your death ING SHOTGUNS OH MY GODThe only reason I didn't include hackers in this list is because I barely encounter any. Not sure why but I'm not gonna complain about something that is not happening to me.I think the 30 bucks is definitely worth it. One of the best purchases I made regarding games in the past year. Play it.

review: On release this game was a buggy piece of garbage. While I don't have a problem with the traditional battle royale 'running to circle simulator' formula and I understand why people find it enjoyable it does not excuse PUBG from the rest of it's faults. The game was and still is incredibly poorly optimized and it doesn't look particularly nice even when maxed out on a high end PC. Not that it matters anyway because playing at the lowest settings gives players a distinct advantage in that they have less grass and bush visibility. I would expect this lack of polish in a small neglected indie game not in the most popular game on Steam. The loot is also completely randomly generated so you could drop in a small town with nobody else around you and still fail to get any good loot and be doomed from the start. You could say that despite its faults the game is still fun to play and I would have to agree with that but I would have the same amount of fun playing just about any other game like mount your friends for a much cheaper price. Overall PUBG can be fun but I would strongly recommend just playing another game since Battlegrounds costs a ridiculous $29.99 and it isn't even included in the winter sale I feel betrayed.EDIT After the new 1.0 release update the game has a new map (which is infinitely more boring than the first one) new weapons and new vehicles. I think that the new weapons are good additions to the game especially the sawed off. But most of the flaws from the original game are still there connection issues are awful performance is slightly improved but nowhere near good enough and the community is as toxic as ever. This 'full 1.0 release' still seems like a game that should be in pre alpha to me and I will happily change my mind about the game if they decide to finally release an actually polished finished product in the near future.

review: Note This review is written from an eyes of a New Player as you will be when buying the game.Even though I do recommend this game there are some things that are a pain. a big one. Here's a list of the Pros and Cons.Pro A) The game is over all fun and challenging. B) The game is unique the scopes the modification it lets you choose how to play.C) You can choose between First Person and Third Person which is a huge plus for people who get annoyed by TPP where you can see people through walls and for people who want it to be as realistic as possibleD) It's built on Unreal Engine 4 which in my opinon is the best engine out there (apart from custom made engines but that's a whole new story... Or maybe Disrupt but that's Ubisoft)Cons A) Rubber banding and the servers are crap. two out of five times whenever I land I can't move for 10 seconds and i get rubberbanded back. And It's not only me...B) There is literally NO way of getting familliar with the weapons no gun range no DM nothing... so when it comes that you find a sniper in game and you shoot a stay still from 200 meters you will have no idea how high enough the gun would need to be for it to actually hit which is highly frustrating. The argument could be made that you could jump into high populated areas and hot fight but that's just pain. Nevertheless there have been promised an aim map by the devs but they are running into trouble getting an offline mode for this game. The promise has been there for a couple of months now.C) The mini bugs. Getting hit by a car through a CarePackage losing health when parachuting etc.*Side note The game is not really 1.0 it's only like that to help the sales.Neutrals The game phase is slow. may bore some people... Overall I do recommend buying this game I hope that when time advances they will fix the bugs and they have the money and fundings too do so. an argument could be made that they could just "throw money on the problem" but as they said "It's hard to find good devs".

review: Loved this game when I first bought it in May 2017. Battle Royale was new to me so being a part of PUBG at that time felt very "exclusive". Around the time when they added the new desert map was when it was clear that this game was starting to decline. It has always been riddled with bugs and glitches and even after its official 1.0 release it still feels and acts like it is a broken game. The desert map was too big and not as fun to play on as the original map.There is a lot of luck involved with winning in this game. If you don't find a gun within the first few seconds you're pretty ed. If you don't find a good vest and helmet and find a lot of meds to keep your health up in combat you're pretty much ed. There is really no point in shooting at someone who is far away and near decent cover because as long as they have more meds than you they can keep ducking to safety heal and return fire. If they have more meds than you that in a way forces you to have to push on their location which could give them an easy kill.This game has 0 progression and there is nothing to unlock and try to earn. No ranking system. It has recently added an Event Pass similar to the Battle Pass in Fortnite. The Event Pass should not have been behind a paywall. This game was $30 and you have to pay real money to open loot boxes (buying keys) and access and a real progression system (Event Pass). Fortnite's Battle Pass is a much greater value because it costs only $10 and the game itself is FREE. All the money you'd have to spend to enjoy PUBG at its fullest and it's still very buggy and very unbalanced.If you want to get aggravated over playing Battle Royale (because lets be honest dying in BR is frustrating) just play Fortnite. You'll have a much better time. Cross Platform and frequent updates and much more fluent gameplay make it the better option.

review: A good buy. I never played H1Z1 King of the Kill but from what I've heard from friends PUBG is way better and I can believe it. It's a good game with my only real complaint being the optimization. I have had a couple crashes due to insufficient memory (I have 16gb ram) and one crash to desktop. I can play GTAV Witcher 3 and other high end games all on ultra maxed settings but for this game I need to lower the graphics and not have any internet browsers open in order to avoid memory related crashing.Overall I'd recommend it. It's a neat experience that is simple in form yet each match differs from the last. Once they improve optimization for the game and I believe they will it will be just that much better.TL DR Buy the game it's werf.

review: very early access jankfest. i'm happy to update this review when the game is fixed but right now it's too broken to recommend buying.performancethis game runs like absolute butts. the best gaming pcs barely get 80fps. medium settings run better than low in some cases because the game is not thread aware any more than 4 threads on your cpu is wasted. $10 000 PCs still suffer from random stuttering on very low settings. the settings are so basic that you can't even toggle vsync or disable mouse smoothing without an ini fix.crashingright now the game crashes about every 3 matches. it wouldn't even be a big problem if you could reconnect but once the game crashes you have to find a new match. settings don't seem to matter. i tried using the crash report tool but their crash report server is down.glitchesthe game has so many glitches. every time you quit out of a game the whole game has to restart taking like 10 15 seconds. clientside damage and smokes flipping vehicles desyncs parts of the map disappearing spectator cam doesn't work at all just to name a few. otherwise it's a standard exciting survival shooter where all the people are really hard to see but if you kill someone you feel like you've got a big old pɛcker.

review: This really is a first impressions review I feel compelled to write.One word Wow!Had this game on my radar for a while and purchased today. I've played 6 rounds over about 4 hours whilst learning the ropes and now I'm completely hooked. This game is dead easy to pick up the idea is very simple but OMG well implemented. I guess the big comparison to this will be DAYZ and yes it's very DAYZ but seems already so much more than DAYZ in every way. No stupid zombies not even any chat. You can turn off the voice comm and you are literally alone. No stupid GTA stle blips telling you where everyone is you can play exactly as you want to. Jsut watch out for the blue death ray every now and then which draws the surviving players ever closer. A game lasts around 15 20 minutes then it's back to the lobby and into another. The object to acheive a higher placing than you did last time. ALso steam store tradable items which are gained from in game crates bought with RP which is nice (a nod to TF2 for sure). Graphically I think for an early dev game is really good sure theres some ragged bits but on the whole I love this game day one and I shall recommend whole heartedly.

review: I like the game don't get me wrong but bugs like flash grenades crashing/freezing the game shoot response time being awful (occasions when I have to rapidly Left+Click just to fire one shot from a rifle) the awful driving physics (funny though) getting stuck in a parachute or just plain getting stuck in a wall. I get that it's an early access game but the bugs can drive a man to put his head through his wall since the game is meant to be purely based upon competetive play. Other than that I had a lot of fun playing with friends and can see this game having great potential after it works out it's kinks. OVERALL 6.5/10 (Gotta work out those kinks!)

review: After playing this game for about ten hours I have been very happy with the care and attention to detail the creators put into the game and I would whole heartedly recommend this game to anyone who is thinking of getting it however I feel that a lot of the time when you die you have no idea where from and so you can't learn from that death if the developers were to add a feature where the game were to pause and show you (relative to you when you died) where the person that killed you was it would give less angry fists on desks and more understanding aahs. I feel this system would also help weed out the sneakiest of hackers as it would show if the person was inside or out in a car or not even whether they were actually looking at the person or not or shooting whilst driving.Just to sum up that big paragraph above I would recommend the game however I feel that some added features such as the pan blocking bullets that we just saw implemented wouldn't go amiss.

They told us it was 50/50 to get both maps but it is blatantly a lie where it is more like a 10% to get erangel (the good map). People even went as far as to remove files of the map so they could actually try to enjoy the game but what does PUBG do? They make it so you can't load up the game unless you have the files. Pros Gun fights are fun.Cons Desert Map30 minutes of walking around and lootingAll they care about is cases15 minutes just to get into good map80% of time in game is just in loading screens trying to leave and join games to get good mapDevelopers don't give a damn about your opinionsUnoptimized30$Third person is an option in the game.They removed rainy weather.. review: Early Access_______________Most part it is a good game.Massive map.Foliage is beautiful if you have the GFX capability.There are some cheats but most games will have cheaters.The best is the chatter. Kind of wish there is a basic Gester for yes/no/etc that you can assign to a key combo or F keys.Just remember this is an game.And it's an Early Access. (Beta/Alpha/AlphaBeta?)Don't act on it.Enjoy it.Version 1.0_______________There is a small bug. Everytime I restart Steam I have to reopen BUBG to get it working correctly. Could be the video card. Or have to flush the memeory. Has happened before on other games.AS server has a stuttering lag. But I'm in NA.Which brings up something. If I'm in NA. Then my server should automatically on NA and not switching to AS. I'm guessing it's because server is full.I think in the long run the game will get better.Love the desert map. Would be cool to have a snow map.Still love the Chatter. One guy felt asleep. Snorted during the game. I started to laugh and got hit with a sniper.

review: I have played the game on and off since day one and it is undeniably a blast to play. From early game all the way to late game the combat has its own unique aspects. The shooting is fluent and feels very natural. For an indie/early access game it is a f*cking blast solo duos and squad are all equally enjoyable and I would highly recommend this game. However it does come with flaws and many of them. With laggy servers slow actions and textures that take a couple minutes to load it is clear that the game is incomplete but it seems that the current dev's of PUBG are determined to bring regular updates. My only wish is that it doesn't turn into another DayZ

review: The game is fun to play solo. However it is VERY VERY almost ludicrously fun to play with friends.100 people parachute onto an island and fight to the death Hunger Games style. You are unarmed when you arrive and must find weapons and gear scattered across the island. There are three game modes 100 player free for all 50 2 man duos or 25 4 man squads. Statistically speaking there's a 99% chance you will die in any given match so the enjoyment in the game for most people is seeing how long you last and how much you tear up before dying. I've played the game for only a few days but already I've had a lot of memorable moments. It's just that kind of game. The game has no official phases but in my mind I like to personally divvy up every round into three phases 1) Initial scavenger hunt. Maybe 20 40 people die immediately here each round. Towns and military bases typically have the best initial gear so LOTS of people will parachute into them. This leads to a mad scramble to be the first person to find a gun and a massive occasionally absurd bloodbath. If you parachute into the wilderness you probably won't fight anyone right off the beat but gear is slightly less common. There are even more nuanced advantages and disadvantages for different starting areas so you'll have to play around and figure out what's right for your play style.2) First couple circles. The game forces players into smaller and smaller areas by having a circular magnetic field constrict the play area at random. The first circles are very big and roomy and aren't hard to manage. If you are outside the circle you will need to move into territory other players are likely dug into. If you are inside the area you can fortify a house and hunker down. If you're playing squad or duo fortifying a house or hill with friends can be quite fun. 3) Final circles By the start of this phase typically around 15 25 people will be left alive. By now the play area has gone from being a massive island to a TINY area filled with only the best players. Tactics and strategy is key here. Eventually a winner/sole survivor will emerge.

review: 13th September 2017 ReviewThis game needs more optimisation than ever. I recommend you not to buy this game YET as it is still in its early stages hence it won't run smoothly on a decent system. FPS ranges from 25 40FPS on my system commonly ending up in the lower end of this spectrum. (I don't have a spectacular $10k gaming rig with liquid nitrogen cooling or some other sort of alien tech attached so I lay down my reason for my crappy FPS in an FPS having a decent system.) Uses up probably 70%+ of your RAM while in game 60% is already used when queueing up for a game and crashes every few games because of low memory. (I had 10GB) In this case I only had the game on with only Discord on. The moment I turn on any additional browser/software game crashes. Random audio and FPS stutters so I usually get killed typically in all 1v1 CQCs. Vehicles are still bugged sometimes gets stuck inside a tree or house.* will only give a good rating after OPTIMISATION is done right. *18th October 2017 ReviewI wonder if Bluehole is going to listen to 99% of players who are currently being taken a on by the game due to lag netcode server performance etc etc...or the 1% elite tryhard cashers with $99k gaming rigs who says this game is already the best in performance because they don't have trash computers like us?I swear there's always those 3 man china dog squad trying to teamkill you every single solo squad game.28th October 2017 Review me this game still has connection issues. (I'm on wired and optical fibre internet) Oh right Bluehole is already doing so. Since they already have a separate team for PUBG's dev only why not use those brains to fix exisiting problems instead of creating new ones?4th December 2017 Review* FINALLY AFTER 10 MILLION CENTURIES *PUBG finally used their brains and decided to fix optimisation. And finally I can give this game a good rating. Receiving 30 60fps on a non SSD laptop with decent specs on lowest resolution. review: This game was the reason I built my first gaming rig.. At first it's a little overwhelming because of the style of game.. Early on I had a tendency to hide in buildings bc of the eerie feeling I had.. Once you get accustomed you'll play more "balls to the wall".. It is pretty buggy overall. It's nothing to crazy in my opinion.. Some people have whole heartedly stopped playing because of the desync/lag slow progression of improvements etc.. To be honest I don't experience close to 10% of what others describe.. I've never encountered a hacker in the 70ish hours that I've played. I think it's a good game.. You just have to ride it out as the sloth like Devs improve things. I run an i5 8600K with a 1050Ti at the moment.. I average around 70 80 fps with graphic setting on very low except AA Textures &amp Virw Distance.. I have those set to high or ultra depending on the way the game runs that day.. Point in case if you have the $30 &amp don't mind dealing with bugs/lag here &amp there buy it )

review: Dayz minus the hours of travel in a good way.100 Players go in 1 goes out. Players are all air dropped with the same equipment their fists in a desperate attempt to hit the land and find anything to defend themself with. I compare it to Dayz because essentially it is but better. The game runs smoother animations feel more natural and overall the gun play is much more refined that its competetiors such as ARMA and Dayz.While a lot of the negative reviews of this game are rittled with angry remarks about hackers and aimbotters I have suprisingly not yet had an occasion where I was thinking to myself that they were cheating. Maybe its because there are less cheaters here (or maybe im just not a poor sport).The games map resembles many traits of ARMA 3 maps (hopefully more variety coming soon).They feel large enough that the game is immersive and just small enough that you're always at risk. On landing a designated play area is assigned which gets smaller as the game progresses forcing players into smaller areas so they will fight one another. Winning is the ultimate goal and provides you with nearly a 1000 tokens (which are only used to open cosmetic item crates).

review: As many times as I try I just can't play this game. Sure we get new guns a new map but the games functionality is progressively getting worse. I'm running into hackers every game now because the crappy anti cheat isn't do it's job properly. 3 games in a row and I died to some to guy with a full number name spamming a sks or mini 14 from 300+m away and kill me with headshots. I try and try to play this game but it's ALWAYS a disappointment. The core game mode is great but the fact that the developers can't seem to fix their problems is whats pushing me and many others away. I don't mind hackers in other games it's PC there's always gonna be hackers. In pubg it feels so infuriating. Spend all this time to loot make sure you have the best gear to take with you to the end game only to die to someone who didn't out preform out luck out skill but just to straight up incompetent devs? Yeah esports ready! Yeah 1.0 ready! I can't bring myself back I'd rather go to fortnite where they can PROPERLY handle the hackers PROPERLY develop servers PROPERLY update the game. You don't see fortnite or any other game keeping their updates in a test server for 6 months because it breaks the entire game. You don't see any other game pushing back EVERY SINGLE UPDATE because they're incompetent and can't update their game. Stick to mobile games s making a successful steam game isn't your thing.

review: This is a fun game but I find the characther animations/movements a bit clunky for my tastes. Admittedly I'm not very good at the game and have less than 30 hours of play but I learned a few things worth sharing This game is difficult many shots from the weapons will take you out instantly. The inventory management is pretty simple/straightforward but takes time to become familiar with and you will be at a disadvange until you get it down for quick looting/management The playable area of the game shrinks quickly as time progresses and you must always be mindful of time and lastly there are way too many cheaters in the game. Players hack so many different aspects I see autoaim cheaters infinite ammo vehicle speedhacks and the list goes on. It really does suck to spend 20 minutes working toward a win and having a stinking cheater take you out. All things considered it's worth checking out but be prepared for hackers ruining the fairness of play.
