review: Early access.. The new gaming standard so just a heads up.When Battlegrounds works it works well. The overall experience is enjoyable and despite negative reviews complaining about aimbots etc I can honestly say that when I've died I've not felt cheated. I accept I'm not the best player so I don't feel the need to call "shenanigans" every time I die. (Some people are just whiney pups.)When Battlegrounds fails it does so bigtime. Now considering it is early access you do have to make allowances I still recommend this game but in its current state you should be prepared for frequent crashes. My own experiences *2 in 5 games results in the game closing unexpectedly to desktop.*1 in 6 games locks my PC resulting in a power off restart.*1 in 6 games fails to load UI lobby correctly. (Theres a refresh button but this reloads the whole thing and takes 10 15 seconds but at least the Dev team have in a small way dealt with this issue.Otherwise the game is worth the money but Fingers crossed they take it all the way out of early access and crack on with the reliability issues. 10/10 would not check map while out in the open.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The concept of the game is great how ever the mechanics in regards to hit netwokring and shooting are just atrocious. Getting one shotted after un loading 4 8 shots is just the start of it. The 5.56 should be a 3 shot if no body armour yet i shot a guy 3 times (One hit his leg) he should have been on &lt 10% health and yet he still one shots me and kills me in a gun fight when i have full health with a smg..... I expected atleast decent shooting mechanics &amp hit mechanics. Hopefully the devs are listing and can make the necessary improvments that will make this a fantastic game.If they leave the game as is with its B.S. Hit mechanics i will have to give it a 1/5 stars. At this stage it is better than H1Z1 Battle Royale so i will recommend it asumming the devs will make the necessary impovments.

Other then that devs just work on the game and keep adding stuff and smooting the gameplay and it will be very good game.Also what i would like to see in this game as a fun factore of more 1 More maps at least 5 with diferent scenary (forest zone snow zones desert place...ets)2 Loads of variety of weapons all tipes and maybe rocket launchers?3 Traps...that u as a player if u can find a trap put it...like a landmine tripwire mine like beartraps and so on.4 As u deploy in the field via a airplane at least give all people a ordinary knife thats mine opinion.5 Day and night ciclus or in this game case day and night maps...i think that would be cool )6 Maybe some kind of chara progress? review: Boy Scouts will be pros at this...get it...campers... d( O L O)bI like the adrenaline rushes feelings of disappointment replayability graphics and sounds. It's still in alpha so there are a few bugs here and there but it hasn't affected my gameplay and I keep coming back to play it. The buggiest part of the game is the waiting area while the match is being populated (which doesn't bother me at all because it's not like it counts or anything). Besides this I can't complain. In the future I would like to see a different map in another part of the world with different geography and architecture.One thing I like is the role that vehicles play in the game. Yes they can get you from point A to B faster but they are ridiculously loud. So the vehicles are balanced in such a way that they give the user an advantage (faster mobility) and a disadvantage (giving away position).If you like shooters frustration campers camping survival games etc. then I totally recommend this game.

review: Pros+Hitboxes are b e a utiful if the game doesnt lag around+Balanced weapons the different type of weapons actually feel like they do what they are supposed to you arent limited to an AK or a M4 all the game if you dont want to.+Attachments the attachments are a small thing but atleast for myself is great it adds a bit of depth to the game and for some reason just makes it more... fun.+Spawning method this games spawning is 20 000 times better than in H1Z1 according to me you arent randomized with a parachute somewhere and can instead decide where you wanna jump out of the plane which again adds depth to the game and if you have a bad spawn its your own fault (most of the time)+Variety of weapons not much to say but it feels good to have atleast a couple of different pistols shotguns and rifles to choose from.+Well designed cars cars in PUBG actually looses their tires if you shoot them and you can find a car not needing to mixture with it or put in gas. you just find it and drive.+Not dependant on cars finding a car is not something you HAVE to do to win or do well in PUBG a car is a quality of life item and going without one can even be to your advantage at times.+No desolate lonely place on the map pretty much everywhere has houses or atleast something that isnt plain ground. Cons Network connection especially in the beggining of games alot of the time rubberbanding and teleporting can happen for a couple of minutes before the server settles. Bugs probably the most annoying one is when you start a game land in between some houses and neither of them load you are just stood there with some low poly models and cant enter anywhere and loot leaving you vulnerable other than that there are some minor bugs here and there which can annoy you.TL DR Basiclly King of the kill but better polished.

review: tl dr Great gameplay spotty optimization overall recommend While I recommend this game I feel the need to point out that this game could use some work in optimization and and fluidity. The game itself is a blast to play (I know I have a small amount of hours but I spent time playing it on a friend's account) and it is even more fun if you team up with friends. The implementation of the battle royale in this game is far superior to that of H1Z1. There are a couple things that can be improved. This is mainly optimization. I struggle to get 60 fps with medium settings at 1440p with a pretty hefty graphics card (980ti). However I feel the developers will fix this within the coming months. Another thing that annoys me (however not to the extent of the optimization) is the fact that textures do not fully "load in" or sharpen until a couple seconds after I start the battle. These things can all be fixed with time and I have no doubt in my mind that the devs are working their hardest to do this. Overall I would recommend this game to anyone who felt that H1Z1 was a dissapointment this game helps make up for that hole that was left by it for me. Just beware of some of the performance issues and lack of optimization going around right now.

review: I had been looking for a game like this for a long time. Even in its alpha stage its quite good. Run around solo coop or in a team of 4 in a game close to 100 players. There is never a shortage of people playing and your queue literally takes a few seconds. The game You are dropped via airplane with 100 other players onto an island. You have to forage for weapons and accessories while not getting killed by other players doing the same thing. You are then forced into a smaller and smaller area until you cannot help but see other people and fight. The game lasts until the last man is standing or your team is still standing. Its not easy to be the last one I've only done it once but the adrenaline rush and the fun is always different and satisfying. The Cons obviously this game is in early access. The game has some SERIOUS lag problems where you will literally freeze for 10 30 seconds. Sometimes it doesn't happen sometimes it seems like ever minute it does. The devs are aware of this and working on it. The game also isn't optimized and so even great computer rigs will struggle to get consistency. All in all great game. With the bugs in mind I'd give it a 7/10 but after they fix the lag problems i'd move it to a 10/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Intense and realistic game. Bullet trajectory and gun recoil makes it feel extremely realistic where proper aim is needed. Fast decision making and spotting makes it intense where dying means the round has been lost and there is no respawn unlike most fps games. To summarise the only way to truly win is by beating the other 99 players.PROS IntenseFunHas a skillcapReal world decision making in playCONS The pace towards the late game gets too extremely fast and the winning condition is too highly based on RNG. E.g getting into a gun fight + getting chased down by the destructive circle close to 0% chance of winning

review: It s a mixture of Arma 3 and H1Z1 less arcade than H1Z1 and more survival cos kills don't count as much as the strategic tactical and survival skills the player needs to achive the meaning of the game SURVIVE!!!The game is still in early access so nothing much to say about it. Of course still a lot of things to be fixed and improved graphic quality for me it's cool enough just needs to be setted up properly to avoid FPS's drop in certain situation which is a pain cos it can cost u the whole round. Latency is not massively effecting the game even if sometimes makes your shooting impossibile due to a not fluid and consistent flaw but we can live (for the moment) with that. The gameplay side is fun but with a slow pace no running and gunning around but finding the right spot to hide to search for ammunitions weapons and whatever items to improve your HP and resistences is essencial. Cars and bikes are available too but forget the jumping out the car while running cos it will only kill u (like in reality) ). The weapons are still underway to be balanced properly and depending of the situation the right choice at the right moment will keep u alive in most of the situations. Different kind of scoope equipment cloths helms weapon's attachments and as much things as u need to survive will be found around the 8x8 km map with cities and villages to be searched and discovered.It also gives you the chance to play in 3 differents mode Solo Duo or Team mode. ( team mode is so fun).I'll stop here my review cos honestly really too early to give a solid statement but i can tell you that PERSONALLY i've got a very good impression about this game and I'm sure it will give the players what they deserve seen the game is sold at 26 sterlins ish and still not completed. So just gamble it if u feel confident as I did.PS Everything u read in here is a personal statement coming from my point of view and maybe not reflecting what the game itself looks like.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Honestly I do love this game and it was very fun at first but here are some glaring issues nowadays. Battle Royale is getting out of hand and im ing tired of it. We are buying games loaded with microtransactions bugs and server issues it is more punishing than rewarding. The game had a lot of potential and still does but now with new games that offer a different experience it is time for this phase to die in gaming. You should save your money for games that you are hyped for and are good vs an unpolished game that renders it a good amount of time unplayable. Again don't get me wrong it is fun but BR is not fun. They have an event mode called war mode which is basically a massive battle where you drop with guns and duke it out and respawn. It is fun it is so fun it reminds me of when shooters just had a respawn mechanic not a survival over fun mechanic.

review: Review update As I promised I am changing my review due to the fact the game works for me again. I don't know what they did but after about two weeks of the game crashing constantly I can finally play. I still don't condone them sueing the devs of Fornite nor do I condone the selling of skins being treated as more important then fixing the game. But I have to say man is it good to play again. I really enjoy this game and I do recommend it for people who enjoy the battle royale genre. If you're not sure that you'll like it try Fortnite on for size. It isn't quite the same and to be honest I dislike Fortnite after playing a few matches but it may help you decide if the genre is right for you before purchasing this title. Below the little quote thing I do to end these reviews is my first review for the game that I wrote when my game was broken. Take it with a grain of salt but know many of my opinions still stand."Shots from the uh... northwest." *shots from the east* "No that can't be right..." Cmdr. V. J. Perrin while being flanked by one or more enemy groups.Old review I loved this game. It was a genre that I wasn't sure I would like and actively tried to avoid. But one of my friends bought me this game and urged me to try it. Let me tell you I'm glad they did. It quickly became one of my favorite games to play with friends and I couldn't understand why people disliked it. Then BlueHole started rolling out "performance patches". Now I understand that PUBG really needs performance updates but the problem is since the implementation of said patches mine and many others games have become unplayable. The game will crash constantly and the crash report will crash too. Now if you are a gaming company that just broke thousands of peoples games with a patch that would fix the other thousands of peoples already broken games would you a). Work hard on patches that would make the game more stable for everyone play test them then release them so everyone can play or b). Sue another game company the made a free game that is the same genre but different enough that it isn't breaching copyright and is also mostly if not totally bug free while also being actually free.That's right everyone PUBG is sueing Fortnite instead of actually fixing their game. I only have ten hours in this game because after that amount of playtime my game broke and now it is actually unplayable. Thanks BlueHole.If they fix their game and make it so I can actually play I'll update my review."Why don't I just play Fortnite you say? Well cadets it's because I've already purchased skins." Cmdr. V. J. Perrin teaching recruits the dangers of micro transactions

review: I have a lot of time in this game. Nearly 600 hours and I used to love it. Now however it's frustrating to see how the game is in it's current "released" state. The worst are the hackers. Used to not see any in First Person Perspective (FPP) but last night I had 3 run ins and now after only my third game of today. I've only used the report button 4 times the entirety of all my gameplay. I usually say "oh he got the drop on me" "maybe he got lucky" "maybe the replay deathcam was acting up like it always has". But going back and watching the game replays and they're looking and shooting at me and other player through walls snapping onto target and it's easily seen they are not playing fair. It's gotten far worse and unfortunately there is nearly nothing being done about it. Regardless of region locking china or ping locking people i feel this will not solve the issue. Developers are slow to fix issues if they are to fix them at all and have shown to me they won't take proper action.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is the very definition of "greater than the sum of its parts."The graphics aren't great the looting and combat are clunky the sound while improved is just good. This is the type of game that is never the same twice. It creates these fun stories almost every game. Whether it's a nailbiter that comes down to a last second charge up a hill into a barrage of gunfire to win the game or a fun ten minute firefight that you lose or getting your motorcycle stuck in a doorway and getting launched into space... It's just fun to play.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Honestly the game is fun. I have fun playing it. But it is entirely too flawed to be a released title. Getting stuck halfway inside a building spawning in under the map and the other hundred or so unique bugs I've experienced since release are only part of it. There's also the broken so called "50/50" map selection process by the game and Miramar's just not a good map. I prefer it to Erengal because of how rare it is I get dropped there now but it's too big too empty and has too few vehicles in my opinion. Either make the map smaller and move all it's settlements slightly closer together or cut out all the extra in the north that rarely gets dropped in. Anyway this has been a review of a sometimes game called PubG.

review: The One That Started The Battle Royal Boom This is the game planned by PLAYERUKNOWN who made Battle Royal mode for Arma 2. This is a game developed by Bluehole Studio that made cash grab RPG games TERA. Most of the Over the medium Korean game companies only wants money. Like Nexon Netmable Hangame etc. But this was little bit different this game wasn t fully cash grab. This is a few game that passed Early Access state. Yeah there was some argument about it yet it was succesfully launched. No pay to win item added in the game and game itself keep improving! I was suprised that this game made by Korean company. Solid gameplay nice grapics optimizing is keep getting nicer new contents added in the game now and then server is getting improvements and most of all it s not full price only $39.99. If you think about it most of the AAA Publishers would sell this at full price like $49.99 $59.99. They know how to make and improve the game. But knowing making the game is not everything that makes game perfect. The one and important thing to make perfect game is publishing and polishing the game. They promised the users that We ll not add the random box supply drop thingy until game is officially released. But they broke that promise. They promised users that We ll keep the users between Korean Kakao server user &amp Steam Korean server user. But they broke that promise and said We ll split the user base. And they also failed that. Also this game doesn t have proper anti cheats so that hackers rave though server punishes player that doesn t use the hacks. So do i recommend this game or not? They broke all their promises doesn t catch cheaters that well they don t have skills to polish their game. But they made it good and solid. Despite the facts that they don t keep the game well but game itself is very good. Also they re keep improving generic gameplays. Also they tested new maps and guns so i m hoping they add them soon. If you want to play the original well made battle royal game you need to consider this game.Pros Nice graphics Solid gameplays like gun shooting driving vehicles etc Relatively cheap prices New contents added now and thenCons They don t fulfill promises Doesn t have proper anti cheats Server needs more improvements

Yes as i said this game has it's flaws it can lagg and very close combat can feel clunky but just the little amount of time i've played this game i have seen improvements and i believe this game will end up being extremely good. review: I was on the fence about buying this game given all of the negative reviews but I've got to say I don't regret it at all. I've really enjoyed what I've played so far and I've not had any issues with gameplay aside from a few small bouts of lag.I've been a huge fan of the Battle Royale franchise for well over a decade now and I've been waiting for someone to create a videogame that truly did the concept justice. I feel like this is the one I've been waiting for. It's still in Early Access so it of course needs a lot of fine tuning but the player base is active and involved and it seems like the dev has enough passion for this project to see it through to the end. $30 may be a little steep for an Early Access game but I feel like it's worth it in this case.Edit Now that I've got a few more matches under my belt I've definitely experienced some issues. I've had two games completely freeze on me. If you get this game in Early Access brace yourself for that frustration. There's nothing quite like reaching the bottom 30 well armed and feeling like you've got a shot at victory...... and then having the game freeze. For some reason I handled it a lot better than I thought I would. I suppose going into the game knowing that I'm not going to win anyways makes it fun in a whole different way.People complain about "luck" and RNGs having such a heavy hand in the way the matches turn out but that's what I love most about it. I've had a game where I parachuted into a cluster of houses and walked out with two assault rifles a handgun and more ammo than I should realistically be able to carry. This last game I spent 20 minutes running around the map and only managed to find a 12ga with 20 shells and a partially loaded 1911. I had a ton of mods for guns I didn't have though.I absolutely love that variability and it makes it so much more tense. You never know who you're going to come across next and how lucky they've been. I've lucked out and run across a player that hadn't even found a pair of pants.... and then shortly after run right into the sights of a fully equipped sharpshooter.You won't win every game. You won't win most games. You just have to see how long you can survive with what you're given.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: As of right now i have 64 hours on this game and in all honestly this game has the best gun play that any game currently out. That being said this game is loaded with a ton of bugs and glitches that will get you killed and make you rage but you wont care because the game is so good.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It's a fun game that actually requires skill. There is a steep learning curve so prepare to lose a lot when playing at first. Also winning is difficult for even the best players as they only win at most around 10% of all games they play (even 10% may be pushing it lol).There are some glitches but the developers do try and fix them quickly. Sometimes you'll get caught on little pebbles or bushes when driving.Is it worth $30? I'd say yes even though it's an early access game. It's quite addicting and the feel you get when you find good loot or when you kill someone is quite gratifying. It's also worth mentioning the game is poorly optimized which is unfortunate and is something the developers should really work on.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Great games. Just bought it 2 days ago. Spent 11 hrs on it. To some players it's maybe a game where you rackup the most kills but to me it is about who can survive the longest.My strategy is to avoid crowded place i always try to jump as a late as possible so i dont have to worry about other players and concentrate in finding the best weapons and armor while slowly advancing to the safe zone. If i'm lucky enough to be in the safe zone it will give me plenty of time to find a killing spot and waits other players closing in. With a map that is so big it's really fun to find a place to ambush others. And usually all the last 20 30 players have got a decent weapons and armor and are quite ready for any ambush and confrontation. And when it gets to 10 last player the safe zone are so small it would definetly create confrontation which can come from any direction.The character movement is quite good but still not as good as the division like cover behind wall or objects. The weapons aiming is not quite realistic cause there's no movement (you dont even need to hold your breath for a steady aim).Overall this game is quite good i'm really looking forward to how this game will be develop. And i jope the develper will put enouh effort to stop cheaters and hacker that could ruin the games.

review: It's fun but there are a few glaring issues that need fixing Projectile weapons are great but the crosshairs are basically useless since they don't adjust for the trigonometry between the target the weapon and the crosshairs. An offline practice mode is a must have for a game like this which has far more complex gameplay elements. 2 hours of offline practice (not even with bots just targets) would be more beneficial than 50 hours of painful and frustrating grinding. IMO every melee weapon should have a secondary use. The frying pan can block bullets so let the crowbar open special crates let the machete have a bleeding damage effect or let you throw the sickle. Maybe let you use your pistol when you are knocked but at half the rate of fire no aiming down sights and no reloading just to make the gunfights a bit more flavourful and interesting.

review: Product received for free. I came back to the game to expect improvments fixes and a lot less hackers in the game. Sadly All them are still not here after all this time. Lag spike and even frame rate issues occur at the start of each match mid to late game. Put yourself in a situation where you land right next to a guy. You grab a gun. S/he runs away. you're about to run after her and kill her. You then teleport back a few steps before and being unable to move while your prey gets away. Ruining the moment. What happened? We expected this game to be better not worse! AND THIS GAME WAS NOMINATED GAME OF THE YEAR? The game's conditions has showed little (or some would say no) improvements. With the release of Gambling Crates (Which Bluehole promised PUBG Won't have) Hackers have been freqent and aren't slowing down. Whenever theres a new crate added to the game People will use their in game currency to gather as many of the current crates as possible to sell and make money on steam. So because you can literally make money on Steam and likely in real life Hackers will exploit this to the extend to make money. Winning the game by cheating and ruining for others.Fortnite runs better than this.... AND THAT GAME IS FREE TO PLAY! and this charges money.In it current state? How?I could care less about the arguement of "Oh but that was developed with a big studio and this was done with a small team of modders" and "Oh but that game is free to play so it doesn't count"Quality &gt How big the development team is and if the game is free or notIts also doesn't help that Bluehole is sueing Epic Games for 'Copyright Infringement' when games like The Culling HZ1Z and ARMA Battle royal mod were made before they arrived to the spotlight. So I'm guessing they should sue PUBG for copying them according to Bluehole Studios

review: Now I haven't played too much of it but I have enough to say that it's a GOOD game. Gunplay is satisfying and the sounds are amazing (good thing too cuz sound is very important here). I'd never played a "Battle Royal" game before so instead of taking a chance with this game I played around with Last Man Standing (the free2pay knockoff of PUBG) for about 10 hrs. To be honest it took about 10min for me to get hooked on it. PLAYERUNKNOWN has everything customizable characters gun modifiers lots of guns (and the promise to add more) good visuals (GTX 1070 and i7 6700k gets 60fps on a mix of high and ultra) efficient matchmaking and reliable servers (so far). You can also play in first and third person view. The map is creative and immersive with little secrets here and there. With the developper's promise that Early Access will be done in six months (1 month down as of April 23) 30 36$ is a very reasonable price for the game.8/10 The only con is that loot boxes (purely cosmetic stuff) are wayyy too expensive.

review: Welcome to P.U.B.G if you would like to pay for an anti cheat that is about as useful as an autistic kid on a submarine then this game is for you you unlucky son if a . This game kicks off with a thrilling drop into a cluster off butt useless equipment on the rare occasion you get a weapon congrats you may have gotten a single kill... Now if you would also like the deluxe model it comes with a red zone that may on occasion blow you up inside of "safe areas". Also if you enjoy long walks/drive's to calm you down then get ready. For about 5 minutes/ as long as the illusion lasts you can have some bliss but once thats over you will probably die to some random poorly generated rock that will get you caught in it and blow you up for no apparent reason. Also if you are working with an average computer dont even bother attempting to run this thing its optimised about as well as your experience will go. Now if you somehow make it past all this then prepare for the blue zone this mistress will creep up on you slowly bend you over and you senseless as it will kill you faster then you are able to heal/5 seconds so if you make it past the 20 minutes of the game without being shot but some hacking cuck then get ready for that... also thsi blue zone tends to do everything in its power to place you in a spot to you silly.. all in all the dopamine you get off a single game may be worth it but hey atleast the bikes are fun to ride...

review: If you have a weak heart this game is not for you. the ADRENALID you get when in the end game of this BATTLE ROYALE is touching the EXTREME. but if you love thinking strategically to experience IMENSE ACTION exploring try new ways to play and do not forget the SWEATNESS of getting a DELICIOUS CHICKEN DINNER then this game is solid for you. You never get tired of the new events and changes the game is testing every now and then. and the big maps with endless possibilities this is a game for you if you like GOOFING around with friends or just have some fps or tpp SHOOTING experience. It's a wonderful game of entertainment from start to the finish every match. and as a player who has played since the start although I'm not too good I would definitely recommend this ADDICTINGLY BLOODY GOODNES. and although it has its fails this game is really KING OF BATTLE ROYALE GAMES!

review: It's alright Me and my team sometimes will run into glitches and bugs such as on the desert map in the hills you can fall inside them and shoot out of the ground. This can be a game breaking glitch especially when the game ends there. We also would like more optomization fixes and possibly a deathmatch mode so It will be easier for us to do Tryouts for our new recruits . We would also appriciate it to be easier to make custom games and possibly make it easier to add people on steam through pubg or see the recent people you have played with. Another thing that my clan is would like to request is a way to set clan tags and even create clans in pubg with the ability to see the average kdr of the clan and the average win ratio of the clan. Thanks overall great game

review: Was loving it until they introduced paid mechanics before fixing server issues and performance problems. Actually they relesed paid mecahnics and introduced more lag and this shows that their priorities were not set right.EDIT 19 October 2017 Despite getting so much money they didn't deliver on promised new map vehicles and vaulting. To this day there are frustrating bugs. In the past 2 months they held a tournament and started to work on the XBOX version of the game instead of fixing the PC version from whch they earned the money from. They are on their way to another tournament already and no good updates in sight.There are people still drooling over this game that's because compared to other online games in the same genre this one looks graphically attractive and has better gameplay but if you only look at what we paid them and what they delivered then they failed to deliver on their promises and are only partnering up with other companies to earn more and more. Already Nvidia shadowplay has been incorporated into the game instead of having some custom technology without adverts.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

One thing I hate is when searching for a match even though I click on "NA servers" the people flooding the in game chat are obviously not North American. It's early access yes there will be issues. But please fix this.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Spawn in on the airplane look for a good place to go. A random town feels like the best place to go. Drop down along with about ten others. Loot a house hear gunfire find a crossbow a Coat and a level 2 helmet. Hide on the upper deck of the house and watch a fight break out right in front of my eyes. My heart is pounding as I line the shot up perfectly. I pull the trigger sending an arrow into the back of someones head. Other guy comes over to loot his body I drop him another guy dropped. Finally I look around make sure the area is clear go down to loot the bodies get killed by a guy camping in the building across the way who ALSO had a crossbow. 10/10 would do it again.

review: Addictive but frustrating. Devs are more focused on making money than they are on making a game. The zone times are still far too short leading to end game being luck based. The short zone times allow next to no fighting in the late game as stopping AT ALL will lead to you being engulfed in the zone and killed. This also means it's a frequent occurance to be killed by teams/people sitting in or on the very edge of the zone in places that should be deemed out of play. The early game is of course as all battle royale games luck based but is the only point in the game where you can have a definite firefight without the risk of the zone killing you. Mid game is essentially a running simulator where you put your weapon to your back and autorun while alt+tabbed for 10 minutes until you arrive at the next zone. Netcode is reminiscent of Battlefield 4's launch cheaters still ruin games and dreadful performance leads to crashes in the late game or frame drops on smokes. Expect a free to play model on a paid game very unfortunate.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Would be a good game and some of them can be fun but my god does it run like garbage. The amount of desync and server lag is pathetic for a game out for so long. If they fix all or most of the problems with the functionality of the game then i'd happily recommend the game. However their current patch system seems to be fix one break two and considering they have had over 7 months since the full release to improve it it doesn't bode well that at its core it's still in an absolute shocking state.I continue to check back every once in a while to see if they've made improvements because I actually like the game and hope it's better but every single time it disappoints.

review: This game is just a giant cash cow.So this is what I think about the game.ProsFun and exciting.Involves some tactical thinking of combat situations created by other players.No playtrough is the same for any weapons found is something different with each round.Cons High chance of being banned if a streamer reports you even without any solid evidence. Lots of bugs and crashes. Broken promises over micro transactions which they now have. The removing of free loot crates. (You have to buy your winnings now.) In game adds.Streamers are loved by the developers because they provide lots of positive PR and thus money. But even though Bluehole has sold over 100 million copies they decide to get more money off their existing player base to get into some games competition. So that keep me questioning... Why is the game still buged? They are charging you 30 to play than another 2 to collect your price. So that's why I'm giving this game a negative review.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It's an asset flip mainly put together with third party materials and no programming on the part of the developers. It doesn't help that it's a good idea for a game when no real effort is put into its development. It got big primarily on account of Youtubers misrepresenting the game through edited videos and mum criticism which in turn have earned them direct preferential treatment by the developers. Even if money has not changed hands there are obvious linking without disclaimers going on.Add to that the broken promises not to monetize the game before it's done not that it looks to ever be done by the pace of the development so far. The 100+ millions of dollars of revenue are not put into the game not even spent at good enough servers to handle the amount of players. (In practice the PC community is mostly funding and beta testing for the upcoming console launch.) Technically speaking this game has one of the very worst online experience of todayus shooters even rivaling games that run on a peer to peer basis.That even the silly bug which defaulted the game launcher for everyone to asian servers took months to fix shows the low bar that the owners of this company have set. It's all about milking this trash for what it's worth. I see no reason not to expect that some time next year it could even be abandoned. IF we're lucky they'll then at least launch a serious project on a new game since this will need to be rebuilt from the ground up anyway. That's the best you can really hope for at this point. Enjoy the beta testing.

review: Great idea poor execution. This game lacks necessary polish and definitely feels like a amateur mod. Here's all you need to know that represents the quality of this game. The lobby menu has a "reset lobby" option. So it crashes from time to time and you get stuck where not everyone in your group can click "ready" to get into a game. So instead of having the chops to fix this bug they just inserted a "reset lobby" button. That's it. That was their fix. That's a joke. There are countless other issues(cheating being a huge one) that are represented by this one simply example. There's a problem...the devs lack the ability time or interest in fixing it..and the enjoyability of the game suffers because of it.A large studio is going to swoop in and build the battle royale game mode into their product (Far Cry? Battlefield?) and when they do PUBG will seem lika prehistoric turd that helped get things started but was quickly surpassed by people who know what the hell they're doing.

review: Extremely fun extremely polarizing. The developers leave a lot to be desired and are open with their plans to market this not as an actual game but as a "game as service." Their primary intent with PUBG is to make themselves and Brendan Greene richer. If you simply think the idea of Battle Royale is fun and can't decide between this or FortniteBR play FortniteBR since it's free. If you just freaking love the game mode but want it to be more serious then maybe this is for you. So unless you're a big battle royale fan or your friends all play this and you wanna join in just skip this game. It's only a massive hit because it's the most decently programmed and polished battle royale game to come out so far. It's still riddled with bugs the developers seem uninterested in fixing in any reasonable amount of time. They were completely unprepared for this game to blow up and seem completely overwhelmed when it comes to managing it properly. This is an early access review so I reserve the right to come back and change my stance once it's in "full release."

review: Full disclosure. I have had some genuinely fun experiences on PUBG however these were much further back in development. During the Early Access there was a steady stream of content with just a small selection of freely dropped items and it felt like a fresh professional game. There are a lot of odd changes and rushed content that feels out of place. I don't think I would have enjoyed it as much in it's current state of affairs therefore I have to give a thumbs down review.One thing to note that may not be obvious to the trend is that this is a Korean game despite not looking like the general MMO it does encorporate a lot of the business models of the nature. It may mean the item systems feel alien for you compared to regular FPS shooters if you haven't played a Korean MMO/Mobile game before. 'Gatcha' style item systems are very popular in the asian market and hugely unpopular in the western market where you gamble on items for money on essentially low reward. It is very similar to loot boxes in games like TF2 or Overwatch but the chances are generally very low. Unfortunately on PUBG the common items look very poor and the good stuff will cost you money. Its a common thing in Korean games to make their income outside of the single purchase. The game has also taken on it's success very badly. The way the devs have branded themselves under 'PUBG Corp' going for a very businessy model with a lot of non gaming industry management and seemingly making updates purely for the sake of making money over improving the game leaves a bad taste in my mouth given I have had some fun on here previously. I'm not saying the change is negative but for my own western expectations I feel like I'm getting very little enjoyment out of changes that seem to frow back and forth.To give an example the M16 used to be very strong at long range so rather than plan changes to adjust it's damage at range they just made it impossible to fit an 8X scope or higher on it despite the capability on the real gun. Later they made a change to 'average out' the stats of Assault rifles along with releasing new scopes so that ARs in general aren't as strong in long range engagements. However they don't back out the original change now that it isn't really relevant so the gun is in an odd spot compared to its other compadres. Trading on third party websites causes a loss of revenue for PUBG corp and is a practice that steam are wanting to do away with in general. Rather than trying to make up a suggestion they have removed in game trading until they can come up with an permanent solution which has left some people losing a LOT of money on third party sites because they can't get their items/income back. Changes like this would have been great to plan in advance to give people chance to recuperate. A last complaint would be that there are still optimisation problems present stuff that has been ongoing since the Early Access. The devs will work to resolve the problems and you get to a fantastic framerate but a new update will come out purely days after and it's back to frame problems to push some new unimpressive skin you have no chance of obtaining a new temporary mode that's generally just there to test some new mechanic or removing old content from the game in place of something to make it easier for new players. I digress. All in all for 26.99 you'll get one of the best battle royale experiences out there and to play the game for the first few times is very thrilling. The game is much better played with friends and there is certainly replay value. Unfortunately with the development path this game has been taking in 2018 so far I have to severely recommend against buying this game.

review: You're probably reading through the horde of negative reviews right now wondering whether to buy the game. Don't be discouraged. I'm gonna be real here.You see people who have put in over 500 hours into PUBG contradict themselves by giving the game a bad review. If the game kept you excited entertained and enthrawled enough to play for 500 hours ask yourself is it really a bad game? Why are you playing this HORRIBLE game for 500 hours? Don't you have anything better to do than play a game you don't like?It seems like everyone is bandwagoning on hating the game (it has a 4.5/10 user score on metacritic compared to a 8.5/10 critic score). And yet their problems don't revolve around the gameplay itself but more the external issues.Chinese hackers... fps lag... server de sync... etc...Personally I've encountered very little of this. And even if I did were these problems to be so big then PUBG wouldn't have a chance at becoming the biggest game on Steam which it will be for a long time forward.But if you look at the game itself then oh boy you're in for one hell of a thrill ride. Being in the top 10 players is the undisputably most butt clenchingly intense gaming experience I have ever had. To get that kind of feeling in real life would be downright life threatening. I'll let you discover the rest for youself.So if you've a got a decent PC a pair of stereo headphones and no life then you should probably buy this game.

review: Never played a Battle Royal style game before so here's my review on my first 5 or so hours. (may update).When I first started playing this my first thought was "This is like the Leage of Legends version of Rust".In the sense that you jump into a match and if you do good then great! But if you have a crappy match then "ah well onto the next match". There's no long term consequece to having a bad match. Unlke a game like Rust that might make your rage quit the game all togther rather than just take a break. Funnily enough in my second game I'd actually come 1st! I was the lone surviver and even got a kill doing so! But I didn't earn anything rather than a bunch of money to spend towards a crate. I'd have thought that coming 1st would at least earn you a crate or some cool looking gear to show off to everyone you can came 1st once!Following on from my paragraph above I think the reward system needs a bit of a boost (especially since the crates get more expensive everytime you get 1). EDIT I REALISED THAT CRATE PRICE GOES BACK DOWN TO 700 AFTER 24 HOURS In a match I've literally just finish before writing this review I'd come 10th in a game which earned me the Top 10 bonus (which is a nice start to improving the reward system) and I'd earned myself 2 whopping kills! Since this is a survival game 2 kills is an okay amount to know I earned my spot in the Top 10. And these were 2 well earned kills too! Stalking my pray and waiting for the right moment. Felt really rewarding once I'd destroyed them. However when I looked at how much money I'd earned from my overall points once and those 2 kills only netted me a whopping 40 points!! I got 32 points for just hitting someone with my bullets so to get 40 points with 2 kills was pretty disheartening. HOWEVER THIS IS A VERY FUN GAME!! ABOVE IS JUST NIT PICKING BUT STILL NEEDS TO BE ADDRESSED.

The performance is not optimized yet (although the first monthy patch doubled the FPS on my potato). Jumping is a bit clunky. Steering the Chutes can get wonky. This game creates magical moments.

review: Product received for free. Thumbs up for the idea... for the execution not so much.You can manually select the server you play on resulting in people from other continents playing on servers located in your region. Those people have a bad ping hence your hits don't register.In my opinion the gunplay needs lots of work. Hits don't register (which is as mentioned above partly caused by Australians Russians and Asians playing on EU server) you need to hit a whole mag into the enemy until he goes down (but isn't dead yet) headshots never kill. Although this may be intentional I personally don't like it. And I suck at shooting in this game. Oh well.On my end mouse input seems laggy or clunky in general. Even though I slide my mouse fluidly the game somehow manages to show a "wobbly" camera/aim movement.Some sounds are way too loud (I'm looking at you airplane) while others are too quiet.Anyway I will follow the game's development as it's definitely an interesting game which unfortunately has quite a vew problams at the moment.

review: Stop reading the reviews. Here is the truth!The game is fun. I mean a lot of fun. But only when you have people to play with. The community is toxic because there is no accountability for your actions. That makes a lot of hackers. Most are from China and use the NA servers so the can get a ping advantage. That being said 8/10 matches wont have a HACKER. But it is a problem. The fact they don't allow region locking is silly not racist. The developer sold a lot of the company to a damn hacker company out of china and that's why there is such a big problem. Im sure they might have not known but still. Overall even with the crazy glitch here and there or a hacker the game is still a solid 7/10. But it still needs a lot of work. The china player base is a huge issue right now. 9/10 hackers are from China in my experience. That doesn't mean playing with people from china is bad it can be fun. But Blowhole has no idea what they are doing so its crap shoot right now.

review: I think this game was really fun to play. But now I believe I understand some of the negative reviews. I was playing with my friends and after the game it said I was "suspended" for a day. This was really annoying since I didn't do anything wrong but one day is no big deal so I just let it be. The next day however I was premanently banned. Now I was really annoyed. So I wrote to them asking why this has happend.The answer was "We can assure you that the account was blocked because there was a violation discovered on the account. We apologize but we cannot provide any specifics on the details of the violation.Therefore we do not accept any requests for rechecking account restrictions."I think it's good that they are trying to get cheaters I've never seen a player whom I even tought was cheating and I really like that. But the system fails if someone who doesn't deserv it gets banned and with zero explanation (they say its for preventing cheaters to understand the system so I guess its "okey" even if its very annoying.) But hopefully they will find the error according to one of the last things they wrote "However we also constantly check our systems for false bans and if found we correct any issues internally." Until then. I won't recommend the game with the "thumbs up".But it's a really good game otherwise especially when playing with friends. So if your not afraid of this happening to you which I guess is a really small chance (#the choosen one) then I would strongly recommend this game ) Edit Now after about a month they have in steams own words "removed the incorrectly applied In Game Ban". Guess they found the problem. So now it's a like!

review: PUBGs is a good game. The adrenaline and pounding heart when you hear footsteps within a very small play area is hard to match in any other game. The weapons are varied enough and for the most part have their different strengths and weaknesses. A cautious or heads on playstyle can be achieved regardless of where the plane flies in and unlike H1Z1 you aren't at a major disadvantage because someone has a faster PC than you. The game is exactly how you expect it to be and is seriously fun especially when played in a squad with friends.Downsides "I'm a snake follow me." Theres also a split second when loading into the plane that everyones mic seems to quadruple in decibels and can cause temporary deafness. This can be avoided by turning your mic to team only though but sometimes it's good to hear other people chatting so you can get the drop on them.Recently (since yesterday maybe) the game seems a lot laggier. I witnessed my friend being shot around a wall and then experienced it for myself. Hopefully this can be sorted soon. My biggest problem though is the major gamebreaking bug a stun grenade has a very high chance of outright crashing your game and I think they should be disabled til the problem is resolved. The bug report takes forever to submit too.TL DR Great game good fun much adrenaline. Buggy and laggy.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: In all honesty the game is fun in doses. I've played about an hour or so and its kinda already starting to get old. The best rounds are with friends and whilst the game is the sort that creates it's own stories (dropped into a place and fist fought a guy over a helmet to the death) often you'll spend 20 40 min getting loot nervously running about between houses hiding in rooms and waiting to kill any er that walks in because you heard your own footsteps and then turning your back and being shot from behind and killed before you can react. Getting to the last 2 is easy. Sit wait camp with a shotgun in the centre of a circle. Then die because the other guy planned your death before you installed the game and lined up the headshot whilst you jumped out of the plane.It's a great game but play with friends and then maybe 1 or 2 rounds a day if you really like it but more might make the game feel somewhat repetitive. Best early access game to date though. Long Dark Sail Etc all need to learn from this.

review: Product received for free. Playerunknowns Battlegrounds is a fun game with friends but is very much unfinished in it's current state. I'm sure you have already seen gameplay and know what the game is about so I'll just skip to my personal opinions. I think the developers really need to lower PUBG's price of admission especially considering the success of it's free to play main competitor Fortnite Battle Royale. 30 dollars feels like way too much for a game that doesn't even run at 100 + frames on my high end PC. It also baffles me that the developers feel the need to add random loot crate purchases to a game that feels clunky to control and is dizzying to look at.Please don't mistake me though... The game is fun to play. There's no doubt that hopping on the back of a motorcycle with your best buddy driving only to crash violently into a rock and die is stupid fun! Gathering a party of four into a pickup truck and gunning down other players on the street is the kind of experience you look for with games like these.That being said I just can't recommend a 30 dollar game when (arguably) better alternatives namely Darwin Project and Fortnite are free to play and run great on my computer.Thanks for the free copy Brayden!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Edit 2018 08 29 I'm waiting for the whole FIX PUBG campaign to pull through and bear fruit before I can actually recommend the game again.Edit 2018 06 13 After two weeks of patch 14 the game performance item spawns and desync are still horrible. PUBG still needs way more optimization it still runs like xEdit 2018 05 31 Update #14 improved tick rate FPS during gunfights and when dropping frame times. Not so sure about items spawning late though. I'd have to test it some more. The patch has restored my faith in the game.Some context I caved in to the hype bought this game and started playing after 1.0 release at around January taking a leap of faith despite the mixed reviews at the time.After 650+ hours of hoping it gets better I can honestly say I don't recommend buying this game in it's current abysmal state. It just seems that the core gameplay problems that I've experienced from the start haven't been fixed or don't look anywhere near being fixed AFAICT.Rubber banding is still a thing even when playing on the newly added SEA solo and duo FPP queues. Loot spawning waaay after you land happens too much it somewhat disincentivizes learning to chute well. Hell even the very basic action of picking items up is pretty hit or miss. I've had many instances where desync causes me to get hit after getting back into cover. And the FPS drops maaaan. This is the only game in recent memory where I've tried setting everything to very low and it still runs like crap. Dropping hot in school hacienda or wherever there's a lot of people is an exhilarating but ultimately frustrating experience when all of the aforementioned problems combined just start happening all at once.Many other BR games and modes are just around the corner especially with COD BO4 announcing theirs. What could be the final nail in the coffin for PUBG I think is when Battlefield comes out with their own BR. Unless... UNLESS the devs start getting competent fast and making even just the core gameplay experience smooth. all the other features more crates. Hell even gun and general gameplay balance. Just make the gameplay smooth FFS.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Although the game has poor optimization it is still very fun to play and has lots of neat features that are much better than other battle royal type games such as H1Z1 King Of the Kill to name one. The game is run on the Unreal Engine the same engine that the Arma series was made on which I heard is kind of challenging to optimize. review: 28 Hours in as of this review. 5/16/2017 Super solid gameplay with a few issues that need to be cleaned up but overall great experience I forsee myself playing for as long as this game has players. PROS The player movement ramps up speed to the cap which prevents one of my biggest gripes in most shooters which is strafe dodging. Weapons feel different and satifying to use Most guns have a fairly solid punchy sound to accompany their excellent models. Full body awareness is gorgeous and works well albeit wishing I could adjust FOV to be slightly larger in first person. The vehicles handle well and are more or less free of jenky physics. Party and skydive system is excellent and works great Third person serves as more of a view assistance rather than the superior aiming method as bullets come from your gun not your camera.CONS Stability is an issue at this time sometimes my friends and I can get into consecutive games without a problem and other times we have to quit a match 3 5 times in a row just to play a match together. That being said once we are in the starting plane we are crash free with the exception of one time which may be chalked up to his computer.Latency can be a bit rough while the game "plays fine" visually sometimes interacting with an item can take a moment which is primarily an issue with getting in and out of vehicles in a panic situation resulting in getting and out of the vehicle mutliple times. FIXED Expanding on the latency issue this can result in some frustrating close range fire fights typically only when in close quarters as someone pushing around a corner can shoot you without even being around the corner on your screen if their ping is high enough. It's pretty rare to encounter someone with such a high latency but it has happened a couple times.*They now have movement and trigger locking when someones ping is too high.* Performance can result in some dodgy frame rates at higher settings but it is more or less exempt from this point at the moment as it is early access. Lack of mantling can be a tad frustrating. Lacking the ability to climb over low surfaces can be a slight issue sometimes not being able to jump over something you could easily tumble over can be frustrating.Overall 8/10EXCELLENT Last Man Standing Shooter Does the genre justice
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I really want to like this game but I just can't see how anyone would consider this game "competitive" in the current state that it's in. To name a few glaring issues The netcode in this game is terrible. Even when I join games with low ping on my 120 mb/s internet I still get rubberbanding and hit registration issues. Mouse issues. This game has both mouse lag and mouse smoothing which are big no nos for competitive shooters. There's also no way to fix this so all that shooting practice in CSGO isn't going to help you at all. Cheaters Call me Xenophobic if you want but about 99% of the cheaters I've encountered in this game are from China or South Korea. A region lock would fix this problem at least for us Americans instantly. Team killers. Again this is a problem coming from Asian players. If you don't speak their language then they will instantly kill you for no reason. Bugs galore. Dying from getting a door closed on you? Check. Vehicle randomly bouncing up into the air and exploding? Check. Textures not loading? Check? The circle of death. This is a problem that the developers never seemed to have adressed. You get a vast detailed map yet you can only explore the center of it or else you'll get zapped by the quickly collapsing circle. If you just so happen to land far outside of the circle then you have to spend the entire game chasing the boundries only to get shot while running. If you're not fast enough then too bad. The circle collapses faster than you can possibly sprint so you may be a few feet away from the boundry but unable to make it in bounds before you die or get shot. I understand what the circle is for but when half the server is killed by the out of bounds area then it kind of takes the fun out of the game. Otherwise I really want to like this game but I can't recommend it at its current state.

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds The Forcefield AwakensMatchmake to either join a game alone or with your teammates as you land on a Russian Island that was seemingly cropped out of Google Maps. Free dive out of a cargo plane filled with #ChinaNumber1Players and dive towards a location that no one else should be able to reach until you suddenly realise you are ed because 5 other people have the same midget brain as you do. Duck jump and weave as people start shooting you eventhough you got to a house first but the only things you find are useless because the game hates you and your guts. Complain when getting shot complain when the servers stutter and get you killed complain as you get killed complain while your teammates disobey your direct orders because youre captain midget retard and complain when you drive into a building that has not even been rendered.Loot shoot and run with your boots as the circular wall of blue pain pushes you towards its center to be chewed up like cabages by people who are already in the center waiting for you anyways. Every game you start all the pain you endure most of the problems you have to deal with buying an early access tittle just for a Chicken Dinner. Hell yeah. The game that you couldve played as a mod but now its getting sold as a standalone thats making a tonne of money and still gets a larger palyer base than your mom eventhough the servers are defacating potato farms.10/10 best marathon of death simulator to get you a non existent chicken dinner. 10/10 not worth the money spent.

review: Amazing!With only 4 hours on record I am a little skeptical about putting a review my first review on Steam at that out there for others to read however in the first 5 minutes of this amazing peice of game ALL and I mean ALL negative reviews that I have read about this game seem to fade away! I read reviews about lag rubberbanding HORRIBLE graphics especially on the foliage in game negative reviewers said that devs made the foliage look exceptionally well in the screen shots on the game page but actual in game graphics were by far below standard. Of course there's countless other negative reviews I'm not mentioning but those were SOME of the one's that made me hesitant of purchasing this game you know with all of the BAD games being put out there now that are passing as GOOD games and even GREAT games I am very skeptical about what to purchase as of late. Let me tell you now if any of the above mentioned reasons is why your'e not getting this game DO NOT WORRY ABOUT THAT. THIS GAME RUNS AS SMOOTH AS A HOT KNIFE THROUGH MELTED BUTTER!!!! Now I also have to believe that the game running so up to hype standards is or could be because of my above average Machine I play games on... If you own a machine that has problems playing minecraft on the lowest settings than you also have no business Writing a negative review on a beautifully made kept up with and time consuming piece of art such as PUBG. Before purchasing the game pay attention to the minimum and recommended hardware and software requirements and also know how to operate your own machine know how to maximize your machines' performance not only for this game but for all games and if you can figure out how to do that than this game will be the most fun amazing and played item in your STEAM Library. Every review now has pros and cons and they are all the same... PROS * the game runs great * the game looks great * the game is the best thing since the last best that was better than the thing that was put out before it that it replaced... CONS * The bad things are obvious the trees look like sponges * The bullets don't kill fast enough/too fast * The game lags so bad * The rubberbanding will pull me back one KILOMETER and when my guy finally gets to where he was supposed to be I'M DEAD.... So with those examples of the reviews people are putting up about this game I wont' go there because those are just not the case I mean the PROS are but the way they are put together is embarassing and need to be more maticulate at least out of respect for the Devs these one's in particular these guys put together something that probably no one thought would succeed because 90% of games today are built around the same or similar ideas kill kill kill and if possible in the end survive. Somehow these guys did it and with the game STILL ONLY IN EARLY ACCESS at that... they made this work and also made it not only likeable but loveable!!! I have only as said before 4 hours on record but I have followed this game since the beginning watching videos and getting that "ITCH" to play it even though I didn't have it and it was driving me nuts so I purchased it yesterday downloaded like a charm booted up set up created character launched into my first battle royale!!! I when my character was loading into the map was the ONLY lag I hit so farbut I assume that was only because there was 96 people in the room with me and for all that to load in I can accept a little lag for about 3 seconds than smoothness!!! so the plane ride in to the parachoot was fun than we land and the killing starts and I mean it STARTS with people raiding houses the second they hit ground load the guns they find slam some ammo in the bastard BAM BAM BAM until they or everyone around them falls short of life... With all of that being said I will leave you to make your own conclusion just remember that if you do get this game know that it's on you and our equipment how it runs because it is not on the Developers they did a fantastic job with this Early Access piece of platinum!!! THIS GAME DESERVES ALL THE HYPE THAT HAS SURROUNDED IT... obviously there are some things that can be worked on such as the area of play that closes in on you faster than the flash on speed and after your're outside of that "little blue line" your health depletes even faster than the blue line that moved in on you I think it's punishment enough being outside of the play area and out of the fight instead of killing you while you're outside the line maybe make it so said player can't win or participate in airdrops they have to make it back to the area of play in order to get full access to their arsenal and/or the game they're in and when they are back all of their inventory items can be restored and used or something along those lines... anyways the game is amazing and I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE THAT IS OF AGE TO PLAY THIS GAME AND WHO LOVES THESE KINDS OF GAMES IF YOU DON'T LIKE THESE GAMES AND GET THIS AND DON'T LIKE IT DO NOT REVIEW IT THAT'S JUST BEING A JERK and not needed here or in the world... So with my 200% Recomendation of this AMAZING game I really hope you decide to give it a try and love it as much as I do because these guys deserve a huge pat on the back for this... A HUGE THANK YOU TO THE DEVELOPERS and their families for the patience it had to take to create such a masterpeice!!!! To you reading this play the game check you system settings and do what you can to not be a stooge and have your machine running at optimum performance so you can enjoy this game and not be like the negative nags that don't know it's their machine that's holding the game up not the game itself it's not enough to have a bad*** machine alone you have to know how to adjust the settings to said maching there's alot more to it than just the in game settings.... BUY PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS PLAY IT ENJOY IT LOVE IT AND MOST OF ALL SUPPORT IT ALSO PLEASE I'D LOVE TO SEE THIS GAME REACH IT'S FULL POTENTIAL AND SEE WHAT IT CAN REALLY DO WHEN THE DEVS OPEN HER UP!!!! God bless you all and have a great day!!!P.S. will update review when I have played over 200 hours just to let y'all know I still love it!!!

review: Landed on the opposite part of the island and had to run to the circle.Ran the whole game across the island to chase circle after circle.Nearly died from the energy field.Finally threw myself in a bush in the fourth circle.Shot my gun for the first time that round.Three Shots.Hit enemy once.Got killed.Finished 9th place.All in all that game is pretty intense (only Singleplayer). In my experience the best chance of survival is being unnoticed as long as possible and only shoot when necessary. It runs fine on my rig but i also experience noticeable framedrops sometimes. There is still a lot of room for improvement (graphics animations map variety weapons melee system) but imho it's a really tense experience everytime.But be prepared that it might run on your system.Also unplug your controller or you will get a serious heart attack when you get shot the first time. They still haven't implemented a "disable" option for the controller in the menus.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Playing the game on an RX 480 and intel core i7 4790k at 4.7ghz game runs barely above 60 fps on high.the optimization of the game could definitely get some work done on it the graphical difference between medium and high is pretty significant when it comes to texture blur and quality if you dont mind the game looking a bit blurry (even without motion blur on) overall the game is more fun when playing with 1 or more friends but definitely has a learning curve when doing some controls and some actions. overall i would recommend this game if it was a bit cheaper in its current price i dont feel like i am getting enough content for the price.

review: After trying really hard to enjoy H1Z1 and the Culling I felt like giving up on the battle royal genre completely. That is when a friend introduced me to this game. This is the most well though out tactically awesome game I have come across in the last few years.Spawn system is easy to useTeaming up with friends is just one click awayRandom spawns add that extra bit off luckVehicles available but not too common.Shooting mechanics are on par with the AAA shooters unlike many many recent games!!!Inventory is about a simple as it getsMaps are layed out nicely good spacing and not too big or smallConnectivity is excellent games are fast to join.Community is neat no cursing or teabagging.Performace is good no dropped frames or issues though friends that stream on twitch report some stutteringThinks I would like to see Hardcore 1st person only ironsight only games. Clearer tracers to track shots (works both ways) Less damage from slow moving cars Gas grenades to flush out the occasional camper )All in all a cool adrenaline rush every time. Can't wait to put more hours into it and see how the DEV's develop the game.

review: I love this game it feels satisfying but runs like crap some issues in the game are still left unsolved since it was launched such as bad servers and poor optimization. Even the mobile version of PUBG runs better than this.Balancing is a joke as well. Frag grenades are already fairly strong and no one was complaining about it. They buffed the hell out of it. Also they buffed SMGs and you can kill people at long range instantly without having worried about the recoil ARs become almost useless as they also nerfed the damage of this category at the same time.It's also worth mentioning that these devs are unbelievably lazy. Instead of improving its anti cheat system they region locked all players on the Chinese server alienating the player base and treat the Asian server as a quarantine. They also spend more resources sueing other companies who released BR games too prioritisation at its best. It's a great game but I don't recommend anyone to buy this before the most of the biggest issues such as randomly stop running are fixed.

review: Updated for 1.0 Game has come a long way and I have been playing it the whole while. The game is now released and even more important than that anti cheat has been added. The game has become better optimized since 1.0 bugs are still rampant and frustrating but I still can't seem to stop playing. With addition to the game like Death Cam and kill replays the game itself becomes a little more transparent. Have you ever died and claimed someone was a hacker but none of your friends believed you? Well worry no more now you can review your death from the point of view of the culprit and back up that claim... or find out you really do just suck like your friends suspect and exit out of the review in shame. Driving has become better motorcycles are not as much of a death machine as they used to be. The guns all feel good and each one seems to fit a different playstyle except the AKM always take death over the AKM.The dopamine hits in this game still make it a very enjoyable experience that has gotten better by the continued support of the now millionaire developers.Early Access Review Game has many bugs isn't optimized can be completely frustrating and is one of the best games I have played in 2017. So far the developers have been very transparent about their games shortcomings and how they will be fixing them in the coming months. If bugs frustrate you dont get this game yet. If balance changes frustrate you dont get this game yet. But it doesnt matter if you wait till its released or buy it right now you wont regret it.

review: I don't recommend this game even as I continue to play it. It's a complicated relationship.The long standing reality is that this game has a problem with cheaters. And for all the trumpeting about how much better it is I still reliably have messed up experiences. My last game I was shot two seperate times through windows that didn't break instantly downed on both occassions by an Mini14 (1 of which was to the body) before being attacked by the same squad who moved past me within five feet without making any noise. I have decent surround sound headphones and keep the volume high. They were wearing boots. It's a mechanical impossibility.Invisible parachuters. People loading weapons without ammo. Pistol snipers with impossible aim. The chap I blasted with an SKS once to the body once to the dome (And the kill cam showed the helmet getting toasted) who took 3 points of damage. This game is FRUSTRATING as a competitve environment because it's often straight up t.But it's a well populated shooter. And for it's flaws it's not Call of Duty with it's intolerable gamerbro combat aim steadiness preparation can really help in PUBG. Everyone starts on even footing every time. Teamwork happens and matters. There's real positives.I just wish I could see past them and put this how to rest. Because for every round I enjoy there's another that makes me wonder why I like to abuse myself.

review: Even in Early access this is a great game that is well refined and well worth the purchase if you are into Battle Royale games. The game is all about survival and finding the best gear you can to defend yourself. All while staying within the ever dwindling play area. Tons of different weapons and combinations so you are sure to find something to suit your play style. All in all this is a great game that plays increadibly smooth. It really is hard to believe that this is an Early Access title. With all that being said this game is not for me. I hate constantly being rushed by the decreasing play area. I always seem to land as far away as possible from the area that will become the play area. As soon as I make it to the area it starts the countdown to the next restriction. So I start heading that way and again barely make it. If there was a mode of play that took the restricting area away I would love this game. Always spawning and having to find gear is fun. I love everything about the game except for the dwindling play area. All said and done if you enjoy Battle Royale games with a play area that is always dwindling then you will love PUBG.

review: The game is fun when it does not lag. Right now that is its biggest issue...the dreaded lag. Fix this and we can all enjoy this game as it was meant to be played. Until then its worth waiting till the lag bug is fixed by the *Devs before playing since it is unplayable for some (if not most) players. *Note The lag issue needs to be addressed server side by the Developers. Lowering your Graphics/Video settings DOES NOT fix the lag just gives more FPS. Which of course is pointless if you are gona be lagging back and forth all over the map and can't pick anything up.That being said the Developers have stated (via Twitter) that "We're making some changes to the servers to try to resolve part of the lag you are experiencing. However this will not fully fix the issue." PUBATTLEGROUNDS 5 04 AM 26 May 2017 The Devs are Hell bent on improving this game so I have no doubt it will be fixed eventually.
