review: IF YOU ARE CLOSE TO YOU $$$$ AS YOU SHOULD JUST WAIT AND SEE BEFORE CONSIDERING BUYING Games cannot exceed 30 min max because the circle that defines the gameplay area ends up being too small too avoid direct confrontation. Would you choose to play alone or in team of different format any minute could be filled with intensity that will blow up your hearbeat. PUBG has a lot of attention to details and as much tacit knowledge to accumulate that you'll get earning experience in this deceivingly simple game in appearance. You will have to learn to hold on your killing pulsion to stay alive. You constantly have to intellectually scan your environment and assess the situation before taking a shot if you happen to be in a predator position. Often you will surprise yourself being in a state of accute awareness when in fact nobody is around and you'd better be because death might be in the house next door running in this forest or laid down in that field of wheat. You cannot rely on your aiming ability alone to win a game unless mayyyybe if you are that 1/10000000's population MLG godlike pro player à la Shroud or Drdisrespect. I love that hunter/hunted feeling and the sound treats it extremely well the rain the reloads the crawler in ghillie suit hiding in a bush 1 meter away from you about to bash your head with an iron cast pan (used to make the best sauces and reductions I know what I am talking about here I am french don't mess with cooking) the plane passing by dropping military loot that lures the brave fools willing to go out in the open to get that unique sweet loot etc.Your suppressor or flashhider will make the difference if you are lucky enough to find one. No weapon does best in every situation a shotgun or an smg will own ARs in extreme CQC for the mobitly they provide ARs dominate mid range snipers for long range...Like me you will probably tend loot literally to your death as this maniac behavior will make you forget that your ennemies are not your feet (yet?). There are plenty of dilemmas in regards to equiping keeping on the side or discarding the loot. Looting is fully comprehensive of the learning experience just as positionning movement and all kind of intuitive timings. Most pieces of equipment and most guns have their very specific and objective value to which you will little by little as your earn experience add your own preferences of gameplay.(yes I am a VSS fan being that invisible mosquitoe is too much fun). This is this perfect balance between your own gear preferences and your actual needs that makes the looting system excellent one of the best I have ever encountered in decades of gaming experience. Driving vehicules is also surprisingly enjoyable.You get it I love this game it's the best at what it does a non hardcore realistic battle royale the perfect alternative to the ARMA franchise however I totally recon its difficulties to get to decent post release standards and Steam negative review bottom line even if extrapolated is justified. There's a reason why this game got so successful that fast. Now the only reason I do not recommend this game is because more realistic BRs games are coming out soon and we can expect them to provide a smoother experience than PUBG. Wait 6 months and see where PUBG is at compared to its competitors.

review: Basically throw 100 people on island and either watch the carnage unfold in front of you or become part of the carnage. It's fun to play with a group and have a lot of silly moments. The random spawn of weapons keeps things interesting and prevents certian areas always being the place to be. The choice/randomness of spawning also helps. At the end of the day it's a mix of hunger games and a cage match that eventually forces someone to be the top survivor.

Horrific aim stutter. horrific animations. horrific character movement in tight spaces. need to add more game modes.oh. aiming while prone is this game is garbage. i can't aim up more than 10 degrees? what is that? also sprining doesn't automatically take me out of iron sights wtf is that ? so many problems. controls are so damn clunky they are almost on par with DayZ controlls for combait.horrific connectivity isssues. fair firefights? third person hip fire is them ost effective way to play? what a joke. come on. make a shooter than actually takes some skill and not hip firing.a lot of things wrong. i give it 5/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: No matter how many times I get killed at the spur of a match I can't stop playing.I think your enjoyment of this game will be dependent on the kind of person you are and your company.To me personally the few and far between moments of badassery make the long seemingly endless trudge of worth it (kind of like real life). It's a completely different game with friends. Coordinating with a squad of people that you know is fun and shooting the as your group runs from place to place on the map between gunfights is always a good time.It's also worth noting that my best matches have been ones where I've been playing with a few friends and discussing completely different topics with no actual stakes in the game. Could be a coincidence.I definitely give this one a recommendation if you can relate to any of the playing conditions mentioned above.

review: EDIT The game has now also banned me for no reason. I've never cheated in my life. Their response to me is that there's nothing they can do. Be careful if you're using your lifelong steam account your account might get falsely game ban tagged by running their game. Mine did alongside this account.I will tell you something about the most successful game ever made also known as "bug". I think the servers are like below 1 tick. You will die behind walls you might die just driving a car around you might die due to unknown reasons you might die due to lag you might die due to desync and you will die due to bad ing care for this project. What the have they created...I have been shot with a shotgun aimed in the air after I was 5 meters away from the only door he could shoot me from and that's just the beginning.It's a horrible non functioning piece of crap. When it lags desyncs bugs or a combination of all written before it's the worst piece of ing you've ever played and you will feel like you've wasted countless of hours on eating raw bull testicles. When it works it's an exhilarating experience.You will shoot at a player and blood will fly across the fields like there's no tomorrow but he's still going and alright. There's no ing damage in this game at all. Weapons feel like they're BB guns. If someone says this game is realistic he's gone beyond the rational world. This game is the opposite of realism. Yeah they've done some bullet physics but so ing what? There's Arma and they've done it way better. I don't like the way Bohemia Interactive does their work but that's the only comparison we have after all this game is copied from Arma 2 &amp 3 except it's been dumbed down. I don't have binoculars to take a look around I can't take a weapon scope and look around with it I can't mount my weapon on a window I can't shoot through wood (except a door and a particular shed) I can't detonate whole buildings where enemies are lying foliage draw distance is optimum at minimum (makes foliage a hinder more than graphics) shooting at players deal jack damage... well there's a lot of things you can't do that you feel as an Arma player you should be able to. I want to add here there is no bodily harm if you've been hit besides damage taken. You will not bleed your hands will not start shaking if you've been hit in the arm your legs will not get broken you will not get concussions your friends cannot be taken to a coma etc. It's an arcade version of Arma. If you've come from Arma do not expect Arma. It's nothing like it. More like a child's version of the ballistics and every game feels like they're over 200 ping. I boycotted this project for ages and I thought well not many games get out of steam early access so I guess I'll give it a try once it's launched 1.0. Guess what? It's in a worse mess than it's ever been says a couple people who've played it for a long time. I knew it all along this was a money scam t project with no future.I have played games for 23 years including multiplayer games with bullet physics and I have never seen such a buggy ing mess. I love this game and I hate it at the same time only due to how it's been made. I have no words to describe this pile of If you like it It's an acquired taste for rotten diarrhea really.Just makes me off that the game's idea is great but how they proceed to care about their project is ing embarrassing. Just stay away from this game and you will not learn the taste for Holy ing hell this game is bad.

review: I've had this game since way before the full release. I really loved this game at first and played nothing but this in my freetime for weeks straight. I stopped playing regularly about February of 2018 due to being burned out. It really is nothing against the game as I still have played on occasion. I also do appreciate the developers attempting to update the game with the help of the community to make it a game that we all want to play. As a battleroyal game this one is the best but battleroyal games are surrounded by luck. It got old really fast when I would drop somewhere and not get a weapon but the other team that was with me did. It really ruined the experience. To anyone who is interested in playing a battleroyal game this one is the one you should try but it comes with a harsh learning curve a lot of practice and you need a lot of patience to excel. I do look forward to the day when this game puts something out that makes me want to spend days playing again.

review: It is similar enough to H1Z1 but plays so much better. If you enjoy tacticle movement and teamwork (in duo's and squads) then this game will suit you so much better than the arcade feel of H1. This game is fantastic when it comes to team work. You have to cordinate and be aggressive in some instances and really passive in others. That balance is what makes each encounter feel so fresh and you wont be saying the game got me killed you will be saying I got outplayed. Which in turn makes for a game with much more depth than H1. Are there some bugs sure but nothing that breaks the game from my experience so far. I played H1Z1 when it first came out and was fantastic as the game evolved it become less fun for me. This game however after putting 10 hours on my first day after install left me feeling like I made good plays and bad ones but never felt like I died because of random ness. Fantastic pick up I was skeptical at first after watching hours of Summit play this my friend convinced me to try. So glad I did. Don't pass this up if youre sour at H1Z1 like me youll be missing out.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It's a good game but still have a long way to go.Crashes &amp crashes again on a good PC gaming config.When working the game is nice looking good framerate.The gameplay is fun and adictive especially in combat situations.It needs more maps more environnements maybe differents maps from countries all over the world because it's getting boring very fast.If i recommand it ? Yes even in early acces. It's little bit too expensive (maybe 20 would be better for that amount of bugs) but it's fun and original to play.

They nail the sense of urgency amount and balance of loot (for the most part) and full on clenched b hole panic. 100 player queue takes about 2 seconds. With weekly updates in Early Access I'm excited to see where this game goes.

review: welp... good game but few problems(last edit was feb 14)PROS1.great concept the loot shoot and skoot idea is good and promotes action and tesion2.nice size map you can some what play the way you want with the weapons u want3.vehicles a nice touch for u to run away from the blue zone and be mobile4.recentley optimized the game alot more than it used to be5.added a new map finally6.ya this is dumb but vaulting is now a thing so ya good additionnow then to the CONS1.optimation is ok and or sub par even after this recent patch. i have a gtx1050ti 8gb of ram intel i5 4460 qaud core (3.2ghz) and tend to have to run this game at lowest to get 70 89fps or medium and get 20 35fps (note i can run fallout 4 almost at max and still get 60fps) and the game dose'nt really look any better with higher settings on the old map.the new map dose look much betterand runs alot better also. AND BOY OH BOY the crahses are pretty bad and tend to happen every time i play the game.....2.one gripe about controles is you can't toggle firt person ads to a hold bind in game.You have to go to a ini file wich is kinda "odd" 3.the servers holy smokes.the lag and dissconects are bad. i have had games with great gear and im ready to go and lag and end up ouside the blue zone and die becuase i cant even play or move. now this has gotten better but with xbox sharing servers it will be cancer for a few dayswhile xbox is stil hip and cool. hopefully some time they will get more servers up and running.4.the devs as some one who programs i can say you plan your project with optimzation from the ground up. making something then optimizing it can be a really bad experience.and dude they have sold loads of copies and are getting ready to release on xbox? BRUH the xbox can't even get 30fps at this stage cause your team cant figure out how to optimize there game.thats why the xbox team had so many problems. they had to find all ur bad code.5.THE STREAMERS. ok so i have not had this happen to me but people left and right are getting banned for killing streamers like wow kys.if u dont want people finding were you are ad a delay to your stream (which there is some delay already) or block out the radar.dont blame people for killing just cause u died in a wierd way.also go get some proof. if the have hacks orare watching ur stream dont just ban people.get a review system in place and see if its true. so all in all it IS a good game but the problems seem to keep coming up. micro transactions were on there list and they did that pretty fast so why is every thing else so hard. the new map is late and vaulting is also late but i feel they have really done some good with this game and the recent 1.0 patch so gotta say for 30 bucks i think the price is in a good sweet spot any less is a must buy any more and not worth it but i would be ready for the train wreck u wil face when buying this game and the extreme amount of problems you will face so be ready to either love or hate this game.

review: EDIT Server issues are still abuntantly clear hackers are even greater than ever the game is NOT fun to play any more.I thought the issues were temporary but they are as alive and worse as when the game was in beta.This should NOT have been allowed to be classed as a full release and certainly shouldn't have been ported to console in its current state. The game has great potential but looting for 10 minutes to get shot through a building isn't my idea of a fun game.Won't be playing again till I see people posting positive things about it.You have enough money now PU buy your own servers and stop letting people blame Google or Amazon for your server issues!!!OG review Despite the sever issues I still think it's an amazing game. Granted I don't get to go online as much as others because of having 3 kids and all that jazz but it's still amazing when I do get ot play. The adrenaline of sniping someone from a rooftop then running and getting their stuff all the while being sniped or drove at by someone else really makes you feel alive pServer issues are temporary enjoyment is forever

review: Product received for free. Constant frame drop literally EVERY time I come in contact with a player. It's as if this game does not want me to win any gun fights what so ever. My settings get put at the very low pre set I only get 40 frames and when I either try to shoot someone or they shoot me my frames drop to below 10 before I can react. Listen here this is what I run GPU GeForce GTX 770. CPU AMD FX 8350 Eight Core Processor. They rushed the ever living out of this game I know for a fact my computer should be able to handle 60 frames on very low settings. But no the very last thing the devs put on their list is optimazation when it should have been the first and makes it nearly unplayable for me and my friends who all have basically decent gaming computers. OPTIMIZATION FIRST MONEY LATER.Also you can't put a sight on a Winchester 3/10. Gonna select Recommended because I feel like the devs only care about those.

review: Persistent bugs loot boxes horrid drop rates for paid/free loot boxes (seriously just sell them right away for steam funds cause every time you open a $0.25 1.25 crate you're gonna get a 4 cent pair of blue high top trainers or some purple and biege gloves lmao) constant frame drops loot boxes still no public access to private servers (hosting them can always wait endlessly to play on one of the few that aren't empty/locked i mean if you enjoy running around naked unable to pick anything up while the host and his 3 friends simply slay a servers worth of people with full gear to simulate ZOMBIES lmao) loot boxes most fun to be had are event servers which never last more than a couple days before being removed poor weapon balancing very poor graphics* for how poorly the game runs even on beast hardware ect ect There's a reason there are server farm pic memes labeled "still can't play pubg"...The biggest issue is that this game is just a waste of your valuable time. There is no progression system or anything to unlock. I put over 300 hours into the game mostly just to play with friends who only play this game but it's about time for an uninstall I think. I realize all gaming might not be the most productive use of ones time but this game more than any other I've spent considerable time on is simply unenjoyable anymore. The whole time I play I feel compelled to do literally anything else laundry dishes stare at a wall... all more appealing than holding down W for another 28 minutes running across fields just to get killed by a sniper you never saw or some racist lag switching china boi exploiting the games client side lag issues to spend another several minutes waiting to get back into a match rinse repeat rinse repeat. Welcome to PUBG.

review: PUBG is an alright game. I feel it is getting hate for adding micro transcations in early access as well as the mass amount of people being banned because of stream sniping. In my opinion I find this game so reptitive it would just feel really fresh when they update the game and add more maps. For optimization of PUBG it has gotten much better. When I started playing in July I was barely pushing 30+ fps with a GTX 1080 it was 2k on Ultra but still the optimization at that point was utter garbage. Now I can get 70+ fps so I'm impressed that they optimized it a bit better but it could still be optimized more. I don't believe this game should be getting so much hate in my opinion this game does exactly what's it's meant to do. Be a fun game to play with a squad of friends even now though we find the game rage inducing but in the beginning we had a ton of fun with it. The last game my squad played we played against a hacker which I have never encountered before in my entire time playing the game. He had an aimbot mod but it is just sad to see that their servers are now being targeted more to be hacked into. That modder stole the chicken dinner away from my squad as well it's just sad. Still like I said earlier I had a lot of fun on this game and have a lot of good memories playing it but it does need to be improved upon. Some of the funniest moments I've had in this game is when their is someone in your building you're terrified not knowing what to do run through the rooms of the house searching for a weapon. You end up finding best weapon in the game the pan. You find the guy lurking about your building beat him mercessisly with the pan teabag him then leave. Even these fun moments are fleeding though this doesn't happen often but I don't hate this game. When I come back to the game to play more is when they release new maps because for now to me it is starting to feel really stale. This review is based off my opinion.My final score for this game is a 6.8/10

review: Honestly I don't usually follow all the hype around a game and buy it so early on but I had to try this game and I was not dissapointed.Pros GraphicsGameplayImmersionHit BoxesAdjustable Shooting Distance on ScopesTactical movement (i.e. crouching going prone)Cons When first entering a game the connection seems to be a little laggy because of the huge amount of people in each game (100 players) but after the first minute or two after the start of the game connection gets a lot better as usually 30+ people die in the first few minutes.Jumping is a bit off sometimes and can be difficult to get used to.Optimization I can run Far Cry 4 on Ultra High and have AA and V Sync at max with a stable FPS of 80 but this game I have flucuations from 50 60 on medium graphics.

review: It's not a finished game. No aspect of it feels polished and some aspects feel broken despite being out of Early Access. I regularly have to kill the game because it hangs while joining a match. The shooting feels inconsistent at best. It is a resource hog when it has no right to be. Simply it is a poorly developed game.While this is much more subjective I also do not find this game the least bit enjoyable. Regardless of your skill level the majortiy of the time you spend in this game will not be spent shooting at anyone. It will be spent waiting for a game walking swapping gear and oberving your teammates that remain alive after you. If you die during your first encounter you've spent anywhere from 5 minutes to maybe upwards of 20 minutes waiting and performing mundane activities for literal seconds of excitement. If you're lucky or a higher level player this ratio improves and pehaps the game is more enjoyable.Extending that topic further for a game that seems to be largely about inventory management the inventory management is terrible. If a significant portion of your time in a game is going to be spent looking at gear comparing it and swapping it while simulatenously trying not to die those tasks should be damned simple and fast. They are neither. Unless perhaps you've memorized everything and developed muscle memory for the necessary interactions. Once again if you're an experienced player maybe this part of the game becomes enjoyable. But there's no good reason it should be that way. It's just poor design.Anyway this game is popular for a reason and if you've seen it and it looks fun you'll probably have fun despite the bugs. If you haven't seen it or if you're otherwise unsure if you'll like it keep a close eye on that gameplay timer. It's easy to lose track of when you spend most of your time not actually doing anything.

review: This game is awesome fun. As it is currently on Early Access it is not without its flaws such as textures not loading correctly random glitches lag objects going through one another such as grass into the floor of a house ect and what seems to be poor optimisation at the moment. However this game is so promising that the current flaws (which i have no doubt will be sorted as the game progresses) dont stop it being really enjoyable.As the trailers show it is built on the Battle Royale formula of everyone being thrown into a combat area to scavenge what they can to kill each other until only 1 remains who wins. The game setting is full of areas to explore wide open areas to worry about crossing red zones that have bombs dropped on them that move periodically and a combat area that continually decreases in size to force the combat.The game combines stealth action excitement and suspense all into one and for such a simple formula it could provide endless hours of entertainment and is certainly difficult to be the last man standing.On top of solo play it also has co op and group play which adds a cool alternative game mode and i am sure once the game is out of early access that additional maps and potentially different game modes will be added.All in all this is a decent game as it stands now and looks like one of the early access games that could be a great success. I certainly know i made a good choice in picking it up and cant wait to see how it develops!

review: Battlegrounds is a multiplayer powerhouse. The highest played non valve game on twitch ever. It is a blast to play with some mates or as a solo experience. It is in early acsess which intails there will be bugs. So if you want a perfectly polished game go play somthing else. Even with the occasional glitches it is an absoulute great time playing this game. It takes a while to get good but once you are getting 1 4 kills a game its just pure fun. I would definitly playing a ton of this game with some friends. But do a bit of reaserch first. for example tips and tricks videos or learning all the controles. It is incredibly more advanced then its other Battle Royal counter parts. Almost definitly the best multiplayer experince this year. I would rate it 5 AWM's out 5 as a multiplayer expeirience.

review: This game is awesome. From the moment you parachute out of a plane its a race to get geared up get a gun and clear the area. You can play it slow or balls to the wall. I was a little anxious when I first started so I played it very slow but as I got tired of losing at the end with one kill I sped up my playstyle and actually got more kills by doing it. This is one of those games you play with friends with headsets to get the full experience. That being said you can go solo and have a great time but its more fun with friends. It has a dayZ vibe without the zombies and less walking. Sure there are bugs but its still in alpha. The microtransactions was kind of greedy but meh its not like you'll get an advantage by forking over cash.

I will be kind enogh to give you a list of what to prioritize. This list might make us happy again! Increase your communication with the playerbase. We will be more satisfied if we know what you are up to. (Overwatch) Optimize the game. Fix this and you can compete. Deal with cheaters. Nobody likes cheaters. Optimize servers. Fix this and you can grow the playerbase. Make a better BP system. Look at R6... No crates. Remove pay to open crates. Your game (price) does already scam us. Give us more content new weapons skins and cosmetics. Bluehole I hope you listen and start prioeitize I really love this game. I don't want to see it die I don't want it to become a scam. Just take your time and follow this list. I made it for free!

review: After many hours of jumping dying jumping dying I can still say I love this game. The new patches have given the game a smoother feel and fixed alot of the bug issues (even though there are stilll some) but overall the feeling of being one of the top 10 remaining and reaching for that win is worth it. I have never had a game hook me in as much as PUBG. It can get frustrating at times but the amount of fun I have had with it makes me forget about the bad. I will say if you are a person with rage issues it may not be for you. This game is alot like gambling. You get your cards and hope for the best but skill is also brought into play when it comes to fire fights especially when you can actually hear footsteps and where gunshots are coming from. Its all about knowing when to be patient and when to go in for the kill. With PUBG still being in early stages its incredible the amount of fun i've gotten out of the gameplay. Best Early Access I have ever played hands down and can't wait to see what the future holds for this game. I randomly purchased off of the top sellers list and have been in love with it ever since.As far as bugs at this point it's mostly network lag and some freezing issues but it has came far from what it once was.If anything I would give it a try and if it's not your style simply refund but personally I recommend it to all my friends.9/10 (Once it is fully optimized I have a feeling it's gonna be a 10/10 for me. So simple yet so great)

review: I've played 14 hours in 36 hours. For an Early Access game the matchmaking and server performance is amazing. There are some issues with disconnecting from a game that force you to restart your game. There is no rubberbanding or FPS issues. The games different "modes" each add their own spice and I've played Solo Duo and with a squad of 4. If you like Battle Royale this is the cream of the crop if you've never played a game like this grab a friend and just jump in. 10/10 would recommend.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Needs optimization and bug fixes but it's a hell of a lot better than any other Battle Royale style game and it finds games instantly unlike The Division's Survival mode. I love it and will continue to play as long as devs are active. Totally worth 30 bucks.

review: Okay so It all started from when I was playing solos I asked a guy for a ride but he drove off. So I got 3 cars and blocked the bridge after the zone getting smaller the guy had to cross. After about 5 minutes he eventually comes around and drives up on the sidewalk. I was spent a good amount of time on that road block. Hunted the guy down after a good 10 minutes same guy. I had no gun prior to this because of ing around making this road block. After finding this guy im shouting telling him he needs to respect me I ram my car into his he gets out and starts to shoot me. After running around the car and so many fail attempts to kill me he runs out of ammo. My good old friend the frying pan did the job knocked the guy out and got to tourture him with my great singing. 10/10 game. Highly reccomend you to get the game.

review: Great game. Feels like what a lot of the DayZ clones should have done right. With the way DayZ and H1Z1 is... this is probably close to what THEY should have been. Love it. Action packed lots of people with mics (useful for squad and needed) and there isn't a mountain of micro managing.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: After some playing I meet a group of people that im currently playing with and we are having a blast compared to the toxic community on H1Z1 ive only meet a few asshats.Pros Better loot and drops over the map u dont need to look for hours to find what u need.Reward system feels rewarding as in points and no loot crate and keys money grabs skill determine what you get even the good stuff.Little or no game bugs ive found one so far and its the killer car that if u hit another car kills them all look it up.Frying pans! the ding sound they make is just epic.GFX and controlls are 100% better then any game ive played in genre.Wide range of guns and attachments easy on the go equip for more awsomeness.Cons Points can feel horrible hard to earn in squad Que and i would hope they could make a better reward system for squad play that for me is the main reason to play a game like this. even doh the reward is crap in squad I still play for giggles.Windows in buildings are always shady and hard to see threw meaning u have to bust it to make sure u get a clear shot giving ur position away.Squad members have complained about the Rain on some matches causing them alot of lag and until optimized i would suggest you could opt wheater out for these people(never had a issue myself).All in all if your looking for a real battle royal game this is the game its well worth the 30 asking price you get alot of polish for your money and alot of fun if u like the game.9/10! and a frying pan!Ideas Would actully like a survival game in this aswell with base building and stuff just because.Would love to see wildlife and maybe some infected to make the game even more hectic.See u in game )
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is my first ever review of a game on steam so that should say something.I liked to play the battle royale in arma 3 but there are some features I dislike.I like to play H1Z! battle royale but there are some features I dislike.Battlegrounds takes all the features I like in H1 all the features I like in Arma 3 and combines them into one.It's a Arma3/H1Z1 hybrid. + You can drive boats scope in 3rd person/1st person by either clicking/holding.+ There are lots of different items and guns you can use.+ It's slower paced than H1Z1 but faster paced than Arma 3.+ The developers actually listen to the community work with them. I hope it stays like that. There are occassionaly lag spikes but I'm sure optimization will come with time.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: When I first got this game I was honestly a bit skeptical. It didn't run well at all and was buggy as hell. But these issues weren't what had me nervous (It was and still is early release of course it wasn't fully optimized yet).No my main concern was that it would be stuck this way like so many early release games before it. Fortunately this never happened.I am very impressed with how the developers have been on top of player concerns and am very releaved that the game now runs quite well. With the weekly and monthly patches the developers have ironed out many issues with the game and have even added new content.Of course the game still has its flaws (Afterall it still is in early access) however it's miles ahead of where it was a couple of months ago.

Seeing s this gme is still in early access there are bugs and glitches everywhere but the developes appear to be working hard to fix these with very regular updates and patches. Solid 8.5/10 ps. review: This game started out as something revolutionary to gaming. With a leaderboard system that would actually be worthy of watching it would have become the game of games. Unfortunately it has been ruined by cheaters who just want their 5 seconds of glory. If you buy the game expect to just play it for the fun of it. Their ranking/leaderboard system is 100% broken now as the top 300 players (on all servers) is just flooded with cheaters. Its too bad too. If they had actually cared enough to protect their community from this stuff I doubt there would be a single game on the planet anyone else would be playing. But because of the rampaging cheating its just another shootem up game with the script kiddies winning the rounds now...

review: Adrenaline Rush comes to mind when thinking about this game. Still need some optimization but very impressed by the level of polish for an early access.Played duo and solo and had a blast. I noticed a fairly large ram usage while playing I was averaging 8gb used out of my 12gb so that's something to keep in mind. Although I imagine this will be lowered as the game gets optimized. Getting about 60 fps on ultra with shadows on medium and foliage turn down to the minimum with a 1070 and an I5 processor.I predict that getting 40 hours out of this game will be easy and is a great value for people like me who enjoy getting at least a dollar per hour played from their games.

review: My grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him "If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate you need to stop immediately.". Tears welled up in his eyes when he realised what exactly was at stake. He quit immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and it destroyed me. My mother said to me " Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 25 I have never touched a cigarette. I must say I feel a slight sense of regret for never smoking because this game gave me cancer anyway.

I thought thats nice of him... turned out to be another duo waiting there who smoked me soon as i got close to him. They preceded to play as a 3 man team in duos. I was less than pleased and preceded to give them some gangnam style over the speakers the rest of the round. They did not win but were met with a laughing English speaking indivduals who nicely ended there stroll in pubg. Would ruin another match for teaming asians in duos.

review: This is my first time since Rust (old branch) of having that feeling of contstant paranoia and thrill while playing this game. Overall the game is good in concept and is in the vein of The Culling or H1Z1 KOTK. I bought it after watching some streamers seemingly enjoying it and I am excited to see how this hold up. Right now I've had to tweak the settings to "stay competitive" meaning that settings are cranked down and grass is minimal so now I know what I assume everyone else is seeing. The devs have a road map of improvements and a time table of when they will be reworking certain parts of the game. I've been burned by Early Access in the past (looking at you Toxikk) but the game state right now is much further than what I'd expect from Early Access and I'm happy with the purchse I've made. Remember that staying hidden and camping is a viable strategy.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Mechanic wise this game is far superior to H1Z1. A big plus is the lack of bunny hopping and zipping around as you have stamina and you turn slower. At the moment however the game is still severely in Alpha and needs serious work. I've heard they're working on optimizing it though. Which it needs. I can run Doom on almost max settings and get a constant 40 50FPS but I can hardly run Battlegrounds on all low settings.

review: I used to love this game there are definately bugs i can deal with that. There are Netwrok issues since bluehole rents their servers and they are complete garbage with fluctuating server tick throughout the match that affects hit detection still playable. The reason after 8 months of gameplay i finally uninstalled this game is because of the cheaters and the microtransactions. Cheating is extremely prevalent Bluehole claims to be working on it but their game code is written so that most essential items register client side there are no checks in place no way of the server knowing if you actually scored that headshot with a shotgun from a mile away but the client said you did so alrighty then. I dont expect this game to ever be fixed reason being for every one of Blueholes "ban waves" the only thing they are succeding in are selling as many new copies as they banned. Its just more income for them to make it look like they are trying to stop it while doing it to make extreme profits. as long as they give the cheaters time to make their money back from the initial purchase theyll keep buying new copies to keep doing it. Now they have gone and thrown a paid loot crate in with the rest on a random roll. I refuse to pay money to buy a key for a chancce at a cosmetic item I already have 10+ of. I cant complain too much though for $30 I got almost 600 hours of playtime and made about $400 in steam cash. Loved the game but hate to see what it has become.

Next game I landed at least 8 shots with a SCAR from less than 50 meters and I get shot twice and I die. This game is incredibly frustrating and at the same time it's incredibly confusing because it doesn't seem like it's getting better. I keep hearing about how much money it's made and all but where is that money going? The crates are trash because I've gotten multiples of the same item multiple times. I wouldn't play this game as much if I didn't pay $30. Don't get me started on the lag and the extremely frustrating times when during a game you will not find a gun.

review: Great Game! best online multiplayer realistic shooter out there. People have complained about some hackers glitch killing you but i have found hacker encounters were rare at this point since realese so it didnt detour me from enjoiying this game at all. Sometimes as a player encounters another player in close quarters some lag could present its self giving the illusion of a hacked kill but was rare. A death cam replay is offered when you die so you can see how your opponent killed you. By watching the replay you can determine if they glitched hacked killing you. at that point you have the option to report them. Hacking and glitching are getting more rare as PUBG tries to combat hackers with updates. This being said i do definitely recommend this game. great game totally worth it. )

review: ONE MAJOR FLAW BLUE ZONE! This game is broken messed up freezes crashes lags has tons of cheaters and generally is what you would consider a pretty poorly made game... and I still enjoy the hell out of it. It has that "IT" factor to it and the gun mechanics are really good. It's best with a group of friends some alcohol and no life on a Friday night. As mentioned above though... The zone system is by far the worst part of this game. Dying outside of the "play zone" or getting caught out in the open because someone else guessed where to drop better than you removes the skill aspect of the game. The system if it doesn't change its very basic nature needs some critical additions. ONE audible tones to warm of zone movement (i.e. 1 minute 30 second and 10 second beeps to warn you that the zone is about to move). When the game gets down to its final players STOP moving the zone let skill be the deciding facor not forced movements or a deadly zone (example I just finished second in a game because I was in a gun fight with someone and thought I was inside of the zone. Because he hit me a few times my health was low and I didn't realize that I was 6 inches from the zone and not actually in. He won because I died outside the zone ONLY SIX INCHES FROM IT he was hurt badly too as we were in a great gun fight with each other). YES... there will be campers... but there already are. Those players are always found and usually killed. Rarely will the final "X" (X a set number of remaining players 10 5 2 etc.) just crawl through the grass for more than a few minutes before someone gets antsy and goes hunting. For those rare occasions when guys just snake around they'll be tied up in one game and not spawning into another to ruin the gameplay. Ideally the zone system is replaced with a system that only kills you if you are sitting idle outside the zone. If you are moving towards the zone then you should either NOT take damage OR only take the smallest amount of damage. If the second suggestion is used when using meds (First Aid Med Kit Bandage Booster) then your health should remain idle for those 3 5 seconds it takes to use the item. Again I still recommend this game but it NEEDS a new zone system!EDIT THIS GAME IS TRASH. SAVE YOUR MONEY AND BUY FROM A REAL DEVELOPER.

review: Please fix some spots on the map that you can get stuck on. Also please understand that the Desert map is so boring and the gun fights aren't fun at all. Most computer cant even handle the map anyways and it always lags at the start of the game. I thought the reviews for this game were going to be quite positive but i was completely wrong. Please remove the desert map. Theres many ways this game is fun but theres also many ways this game is broken example is that when you shoot people it some times just doesn't do damage and when your using a Kar and shoot a person that laying down the bullets wont render to hit him. Overall this game has to many flaws that they just dont care about they only put in emotes because people said thats why Fortnite was better. Pubg had many benifits over Fortnite but when it starts to copy the game it starts to get pretty old. But the game has fun gun fights fun to drive and the snipers are very fun. You start to lose the feeling of the "Top 10 Situation" after you won about 14 game. But still fun to play with friends and have a good times while playing it just dont take it to seriously or you'll end up not having a good day/night.

But there was/is nothing really gamechanging!If u have some friends to play with its so much fun in duos/squad play and if not solo is also a hell lot of fun even in its early development! )I played H1Z1 KOTK too and I can say that PUBG has already more content and is much more skill based! ergo way more fun D and H1Z1 KOTK is already 2 years on steam xDI get around 90 120 FPS on a mix of low/medium/high/ultra settings!I use a EVGA GTX 1070FTW i7 3770k no SSD on an resolution of 1920x1080And the biggest PRO is PUBG is getting mod support! I can't imagine right now and I can't wait to see what the community can/will create! ) TRY IT YOUR SELF! 100% WORTH IT! LOVING IT )

review: The game itself carries a beautiful concept which prvoides you with a unique gameplay experience of battle royale a mode where you struggle to survive in a ruthless fight with 99 other players. I'd give 10/10 for the idea but PUBG doesn't really meet the needs of players. I won't say anything about optimization that's a well known issue of this game so if you don't have a superb beast of a machine don't even try it ( NB last patches improved the situation a bit ).First 10 15 hours feels like something incredible. Your heartrate increases palms sweaty knees weak arms heavy... you know that feeling don't you? The game makes you taste adrenaline tremble in horror when you encounter a possible enemy in a local villiage and feel jubilant after securing top1. But having played around 50 hours in total ( Part of it on my friend's PC ) You're becoming sick and tired of all that repetitive gameplay. Yes it felt great in the beginning but as soon as you have learnt the gameplay patter it becomes dull and pathetic. Basically any match you play comes down to 2 things getting a good rifle some medications at least lvl2 armor and helmet and THEN just moving to the innercircle area and trying to secure a good spot for yourself. This is probably the only game ever that tells you "Hesitate. Don't take the risk. Sit here and watch them kill each other". I've taken top5 around 7 8 times without even killing other players just by hidding and waiting for a good moment. Is this game competitive? I don't think so. ANOTHER PROBLEM is that looting system in my opinion doesn't really make the player go for it check every building loot villages and towns. As mentioned before you simply don't need much stuff and the amount of loot which spawns literally everywhere is just INSANE. Usually you easily get a M16 or M4 with several upgrades so you don't give a damn about other weapons ( who needs shotguns and pistols?). As the fight almost always happen in a wideopen area you only need an automatic rifle and you just get rid of your UMPs MicroUzi pistols and stuff... There's a very limited pool of weapons mostly because of the spawning chances. THIS LEADS to another conclusion you're not really that intrested in killling people if you want to secure a top10 or higher. The game doesn't reward the player for being the fastest hand in the West. You're not intrested in the loot other players have because 90% of things you had already gathered yourself long before you met an enemy thus it is almost always better to avoid fighting because you'll only risk yourself or reveal your hidden position. Yeah sure when you're in top12 15 you're forced to battle with other players but again it comes down to your initial position you obtained earlier.THE SHOOTING in the game is great though. It requires a lot of skill and practice which really makes the game way better than any other games in this genre. So what do we have? We have a CS GO in an open world where instead of buying weapons you have to find them yourself and then meet the foes far away in the middle of nowhere. You're great at shooting and got the best loot possible? Good there'll always be somebody who is happy to shoot you in the back or meddle in a fight when you're not checking the other angle. Don't get me wrong it is fun in a certain way even a worse player can win. The problem with PUBG is that it doesn't reward risky play much. The only thing which gives you an advantage is a paradrop with AWP/another good gun but this is the only thing currently present in game. Whether you land in a big city or a small villiage the chances you'll get everything you need are almost even. Above all there's no point if fighting until you reach top 20 because you won't get anything but another round of bullets you will not use anyway ( Seriously who the hell needs 200 ammo for M4 ? ). and maybe some bandages to the 500 you already have. That's what it feels like when you're playing solo. What I'd like to see from the devs is implementing more rare loot and rebalancing this system.How about adding more top loot places faraway from the centre of the map or making another map with like a megapolis architecture which will force players into close combat areas? What if players could bleed and you couldn't stop that with painkillers or energy drinks ( Same goes to breaking legs/arms losing sight and etc... ). In other aspects the game is great But I still have to give it a negative mark mostly for the optimization issues and that repetitive playstyle.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Game has completely stopped working for me since a few weeks before the last major update and so called release.I fun whilst this was in beta but they have completely gone too far and tried to add too many changes and messed them all up.The new dessert map (i've managed to load in once) is way way too big you spend hours trying to find people...Honestly I wish i could refund this game now it was fun but its complete utter waste now. I've re installed re built my PC I'm also using SSD and 1080i gfx... it should run perfect. I can never seem to load into a match I always get stuck at the pubg logo or it crashes or rubber bands during game play then game just closes.. its unplayable.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have one and only one MAJOR issue with this game. But its something that annoys me so much I'd rather not play the game then deal with it.It's the damage system. This game has an identity of hardcore(ish) realistic gunplay bullet tragectory graphics and so on. But all this falls apart for me when i can empty my 30 round mag of 9 mil ammo into a guy who then turns around a 3 shots me with a 5.56 Caliber weapon.This is further amplified in the new "Death cam" mode when you clearly see his health go down by mere incriments then he executes an about face and destroys you. I get some people are going to revert to the "git gud" argument and thats fair but at the very least HEADSHOTS with any caliber should kill you almost instantly. 2 shot kill at max if you're wearing helmets not 3 or 4. There's nothing more infuriating as placing your shot at the upper torso and letting the recoil guide you to his face like most fps shooters only to realize those last two shots that landed square on his forehead only removed his helmet. Literally this game is amazing and aside from normal gaming hiccups such as lag hackers and performance drops (which have been greatly improved i might add) I have no fault with this game.Fix the damage system and i'll be satisfied.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I sorta like playing and it has the ability to keep me coming back but I cant count the amount of times I land and find nothing but junk laying everywhere. Ill find a micro uzi stock in 5 houses in a row. Ill find pants hats flashbangs and ammo until my 5th 6th house which is a very common scenerio and finally get an M16. And when u do find guns oplenty its shotguns and pistols. Do they work? yes are they effective? if you can survive long enough to empty your 45 into them or have time between pumps of the shotgun yes. Now finally when I have a game where I find the scar or M4 75% of the time I find my self the farthest possible distance away from the circle which means I have to take one of pubg's loud and dreadful vehicals which I absolutly hate for the fact you can hear them from a mile away and no matter how defensive and evasive i drive 50% of the time Pvt. Jackson is there to snipe me in the face. You will find your self being assassinated by Seal Team 6 frequently too they just pop up on your and take you down . The game requires both skill but more so then anything else... Luck. so the last thing I should mention is you spend about 15 to 20 min in game and get maybe 20 seconds of action. Thats if you didnt croak early which is common pending on a variety of scenarios which alot of are not in your control.

review: Product received for free. Wait i haven't written a review on PUBG ?Well better late than never.Alright where do i begin... General First off it's a pretty nice game. Concept is really good and the map size alongside with the balistics physics and weapon customizations. Not super complex but not a point 'n' click adventure. The 2 1 map Erangel has a really good setting with multiple tiers of loot progression (before you say " t" read over to the Loot and Spawns part.) Community Community is more or less "Meh".Not a case of Counter Russians Offended but it's no safe haven either.In the starting phase when you're waiting for the game to start while players gather you'll be having your ordinary mic spam. Kids with ear piercing voices multiple languages being spoken (if you're in EU) some music or people with a silly gimmick such as 1 of my encounters a guy asking if i wanted some " ". Sometimes you might get a very salty individual to scream insults at you upon his death sometimes in some ancient long gone language which is a nice sprinkle of commedy in my opinion. Gunplay Gunplay is nice. It's raw and feels responsive when you get used to it. Snipers feel extremely satisfying the longer the distance is. Every single weapon has an attachment available to it whether you're putting a Bullet Belt on your WWII shotgun or finally finding that elusive compensator for your AKM you have it all. And in case you're trying to snipe that 1 guy 500m away from you don't worry there's a zeroing system to help you with that just open the map get the rough distance between you and the target zero your scope in at the proper distance and take the shot. As i mentioned above in the General tab there's actual balistics in this game meaning that you have both Bullet Travel Time and Bullet Drop as well as degredation in the bullet's speed and damage over distance and the recoil mechanic is really in depth with a lot of stats put into it. You can check This site pubg.gamepedia.com for all the details on weapons statistics from damage to velocity and damage per distance traveled. Shotguns are just charming. Of course with a drop of sarcasm. A big drop. Movement Movement i'd say is 6/10. It gets the job done but it does feel kind of stiff though it's FAR better than Arma 2 on which the Battle Royale game genre originally ran on. You can Walk Sprint Run Crouch run lay prone. Basic stuff for a mil sim like game. The 1 thing that puts it above those mil sim games is the Vaulting and Climbing mechanics which works flawlessly 9/10 times. It's dynamic meaning that whatever you need to vault over you will vault over. Same goes for climbing. Vehicles Vehicles... I'll just say that the only vehicle that handles somewhat well is the Buggy. The Uaz is stiff and definitely not a good choice if you decide to drive away from flat surfaces. The Dacia (or as a friend calls it "Grandpa's car") is fast but boy is it furious. The thing slides about on any terrain mud grass rock and even handles like a sled on asphalt. The Bike is a nice option if you know how to handle this raging bull. Most of the time you'll land on your rear tire but instead of going back on both of its wheels you'll be catapulted into a front flip and prossibly die from the event. The Bike with a basket is not an option unless you're desperate. It has really unrealistic handling steering is just as bad and if you try to use that thing off road... God bless your soul. Hippie Van is nothing special it's a goddamn Volkswagen Van what would you expect. The Pickup ... Made specifically for the map you rarely get matched on which is mostly off road. Here's the thing It's definitely not good for off road Boats and Jetski are your only options if you want to sail across the PUBG seas. Nothing to say here does what it needs to. Loot and Spawns "This is where the fun begins..." Anakin Skywalker Probably the biggest problem in this game.Not gonna do any "BUTS" and "WHAT IFs" here. The loot spawns on both Erangel and Miramar are not very encouraging to the player. Most hotspots and "high risk/high loot" locations aren't all that they would seem to be. Loot spawns in those hotspots are really spread out and unbalanced. You'll be dropping on the Military Base on Erangel only to kiss your shotgun goodbye before you get mowed down by someone who found an M416 right next to you. Most of the spawns are clothing which is pointless it doesn't give you any advantage doesn't give more storage capacity (with the exceptions of the Belt which isn't even something you find on the map you just have it by default and the backpacks) Only clothing that gives you an advantage is the Ghillie Suit which is found in airdrops. Loot is HEAVILY RNG based meaning that sometimes you'll find a single flash in a big building or find 2 first aid kits laying around in the toilets. (Check my screenshots it's an actual thing) It's not really common to have reasonable gear unless you kill 2 3 people in Solos or 1 2 teams in Squads/Duos. Looting extensively wouldn't reward you for your efforts as you think it will. They've made some changes to the loot spawns in 2 relatively small patches which is nice but i'm still trying to find an UMP when i drop on Pecado Arena. They're going to release a new Jungle map sometime this year and from what i saw they're actually learning. In fact i think they put a little too much loot on the hotspots luring people out in the same spot and leaving the rest of the map unpopulated with 30 40 people alive Mid Game each time meaning that the games feel sluggish and slow. Maybe even boring. BUT it's a step forward since those people that died in the Early Game had an equal chance of defending themselves unlike in the current maps. Game Performance and Bugs It was FAR worse before PUBG came out of Early Access. Building weren't loading in even on high end systems optimization was leaving people with 1080s struggling to keep over 60 fps at 1080p and people with decent PCs were experiencing a stuttery 40 fps at most trainwreck.It can be better definitely but at least buildings are loading in unless your HDD is slow and/or Fragmented to hell and beyond. My PC specs are just about the recommended 8Gb of RAM i5 4460 and a GTX 1050 2Gb VRam and it runs fine. 60 to 80 fps on 1080p but when i'm moving around the map it starts to stutter and lag spike because it needs to load in buildings props and god knows whatever else.Bugs are... well not a rarity in this game. Sometimes the servers decide to totally themselves and decide that this 1 bullet needs to hit you after you've went to cover. But the same goes the otherway around! There's shots that don't register sometimes. Shots that visibly hit people. There's this occurrence when you shoot somebody he kills you but your bullet is flying towards him. Since you're dead the game says "He's dead he can't shoot anyone" and decides that your precious bullet lethal or else is just a harmless BB. Vehicle bugs such as hitting invisible stuff or not letting you out of a flipped bike are present and were present for quite some time. There's this rare but just awfully irritating bugs i've been experiencing where the game sometimes forces you out of ADS. It hasn't happened a lot in my play time and it's a pretty recent bug as well so it's not all that critical. CONLUSION A really good game.But a really trash one at the same time.It's a bitter sweet experience. It's addicting and you can enjoy it regardless of the bugs and issues but it hits hard when those bugs and issues take place in your game. 7/10 from me.

review: PUBG is a great and genre defining third person Battle Royale. There is a unison agreement on what's good with the game yet it has its flaws mainly when it comes to optimization and controllers. As a shooter enthusiast one quickly discovers that the controllers feel unprecise. Yet the game's main contribution to the gaming scene probably is the concept and tension built in its battles. Nothing compares to the adrenaline this game imposes and I expect this to be a recipe which will only be improved upon in the coming years.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Experience has been mixed with this game. Past two days I have been messed around by the game deciding it wants to randomly play on my second monitor (which is positioned vertically) crashing my whole system when trying to change res in game and throwing me a network lag message completely freezing me out of play whilst in top 10. I find it amazing that with the attention the game is getting that the same level of attention has not been taken with the game itself. Oh but they made sure to sort out the micro transactions. Sometimes I wish it was still 1998..

If anyone has experianced the same problem and has any advice I would love it hear it. Im having huge withdraw symtoms I need this game back in my life!!!!

review: I've played this game since it first released on early access. It has grown so much since those early days but there is still a lot of room to improve. I personally experience very few bugs and when I do I get frustrated and play another game anyway. Replayability is crazy. It's always fun especially with a core group of friends.However the event mode is all but useless as the North American servers are being taken over by foreign gamers and causing intense lag spikes. This is the single most frustrating thing I have experienced. Devs seriously have to implement region lock to maintain even my loyalty. It's beyond annoying.Best case scenario I get a chicken dinner.Worst case scenario I rip my keyboard in half....both are likely.12/10

review: Product received for free. This game is the result of having a good idea but being a dev.What will make you rage hard and curse the moment you decided to pay for it ( thank god I've recieved it for free )1) Worst vehicle physics EVER ! Mottorbikes will KILL YOU 100% you hop on it you ride you die due to invisible objects that send you and your team mates up in the sky. Bumps will make you want to die 1 ing mistake and you will flip you turn you drift you flip ... Manuvering your vehicle ? hahahahaha yeah sure !2) You cannot peek for ! The aiming system should be fine and smooth in an fps/tps instead when you aim from behind cover and you peek slightly to the left right or from above and you are just a few pixels away from the cover trying to shoot your enemy you shoot the cover instead ...3) You get maps hats hats for the weapons microtransactions on top of microtransactions BUT NO BUTTON TO LET YOU CHOSE THE MAP YOU WANT TO PLAY ... IN 2018 ... Is that hard to program or what ?4) I've spent 350 hours on this game and 60% of it was to loot rage cause I dont have loot or running away from the bluezone just to die few minutes after. The rest of it was the game loading another game restarting the lobby cause the servers were busy or simply rage cause when you try to ready up with your team it doesnt work propperly and you cannot ready up ... Oh and ofcourse there was some action too but mostly looting.

review: Update as of 1.0 Release (12/23/2017) The game now runs better than ever and have had little to no hackers. It is my favorite game and my game of the year. I now highly recommend it to everyone. Performance is perfect on my i7 3770k and GTX 1080 it rarely drops below 60 with all settings on high. Killcam and replay make it easy to see if you were killed by a cheater or just got outplayed (git gud) and the report button also works now and reports are being processed so cheaters are dropping like flies. 10/10 Would recommend the game now.I enjoy this game it has been my most played game in months. However I cannot recommend the game in its current state. It was getting better for a while but it feels like any progress has been flushed down the drain. As of the most recent patch my game has been crashing when loading into the main menu a lot. Also as of late the amount of hackers has really put a bad taste in my mouth. I would recommend this game if they actually optimize it so I am not dropping frames on a GTX 1080 and if they also make the report button do anything. Reporting hackers and team killers with the report button does nothing.EDIT (11/24/2017) As of the latest Test server builds all the issues seem to have been fixed including hackers. Here's to hoping it makes it to full release in this shape.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

The fanbase for this game is already massive and thats because even though it has alot of glitches it is still a fun game I just hope PlayerUnknown fixes these issues before the games starts to lose players. I will still give this game a thumbs up because it is still fun to play and at 30USD I find that a reasonable price I would recomend this game to a friend.

review: Game could be better in some ways. Vaulting seems to take too long when going over short objects. I hate that windows and balconies get in the way of shooting unsuspecting enemies below when you can see them (you attempt to shoot but then realize the window sill or bar or balcony is in the way of your weapon and you just expose your position to the enemy). I hate how loud your footsteps are when you move just an inch. I also dislike when you run barefoot but sometimes when you're indoors you footsteps sound like you're wearing shoes.. makes no sense. this game has a long way to go but is worth the 30 bucks.

review: I have a love hate relationship with this game. Too many rounds I spend ten minutes looting before I get a decent loadout then die to somebody I never see. Then occasionally I have a round where my kit comes together to give a good weapon with optics which allows me to be competitive but the circle is on the other edge of the map and I spend the round running just to die when I get there to somebody I never see. Then the third type of round comes everything I do turns to gold. Weapons and armor are plentiful other players dont get the drop on me and I make it to the end of the round and get kills. That third round is transcendant fun and it hooks me hard. In summary this game should be played with friends in your squad and has some of the most awesome gameplay ever when you can find gear to be competitive and dont instantly die to somebody getting the drop on you.

review: I got banned for removing miramar map files after almost 1 000 hours of gameplay. I was nearly done with this game before that point anyway having played since the closed beta phase and only seeing the game spiral downward with each update. I went ahead and bought this new copy just to keep tabs on the game (No more removing miramar map) and it only continues to dissapoint. A couple of updates ago they put out a patch and the game all of a sudden ran amazing again like the early beta stages of the game (Yes there was a time) but that lasted mearly 3 weeks and after two more patches it is now running at an all time low. Almost my whole crew now uts more hours into Ironsight a free to play fps game that resembles call of duty modern warfare 2. It's a lot of fun so if you read this review do yourself a favor and go check that game out and patiently wait for a good battle royale game.Who's ready for Islands Of Nyne? I Know I Am!

review: I didn't want to review the game but I thought I would and give a reason as for why I havent really played the game that much ( I have only played one match and came in 13th) and that is because the devs said their would be mods so I am taking a chance and when modding becomes avalable I am hoping their will be mods like DayZ and Arma 3's Life mod that is really the only reason I bought the game so now I will list the pros and cons IMOPros Graphics look good The game gets your heart racing The gunplay is very satisfying Sound is really good Hardcore mode is comingCons It is way better with friends When you get killed instead of going to a waiting area like you do when you first join a game you get kicked from that game and go back to the main menu and have to look for a new gameThe game lags alot thats what got me killed Most of the time when playing duo your teammate will either take you to a ambush where his friends are and kill you or he will kill you and take your stuff like what the hell why did they make it where your teammates can kill you If playing duo mode with a stranger you still have to press t to talk to each other it's annoying and they get in Skype or Discord with their friends and your teammate will tell their friends where you are so they will come and kill you Feels like its missing something if you are not playing with a friend and I have no friends to play with Third person is a thing and I dont know why because people will just stand behind a tree when you are coming up a hill and because they are behind a tree you can't see them they also do that in buildings too and IMO that is cheating Third person camera So their is my review I am giving the game a thumbs down mostly because I have no one to play with the lag and the third person camera

review: Playerunknow's Battlegrounds is a fun and fast paced 3rd person shooter that pits player vs. player in a Hunger Games style battle royal. This game is similar to H1Z1 but seems more polished. It is currently in Early Access and is working out some bugs. Besides some of the issues that plague any project under development this games runs pretty well. As a gamer that loves survival I love this premise. I enjoy the shoot outs and running away from the invisible killer EMP. I have a lot of fun with this game. If you are looking for a finished product I suggest waiting until the game is officially released. If you don't mind a few bugs filling out some surveys and being apart of the development process this might be a fun buy. Hopefully it wont's stay in Early Access limbo. FUN or RUN! Fun Great shoot outs hunger games style 1vs.95 battle open world cool guns survival elements &amp sky diving.Run Early Access can be laggy at times under development if you exit a car while driving it runs you over &amp some players are jerks.Watch some of my best kills so far in my Blow the Man Down game play music video with the link below. It might give you an idea of what Playerunknow's Battlegrounds has to offer.https //youtu.be/qYQop5sLKtE
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

You'll need a super good computer to play on the highest graphics as well.

review: As of the 1.0 launch the game runs much better.It's still not perfect but game performance is much more acceptable. In previous version I used to have to run the game on low (with a GTX 1060) to have anything close to 60fps (which would still regularly dip). Now I can play it on high and get solid performance.It still stutters at the start of a match but once you get going it stabilises and doesn't seem to affect most actual gameplay.Death cam is a nice touch too makes it much better to learn what I'm doing wrong in games/why I'm losing.While I still think the game has been overhyped many of the laws have at least been ironed out

review: Awesome EA game poured a lot of time into this game as a solo player in the squad queue. PROS +DEVELOPERS ARE LISTENING AND COMMUNICATING WELL THUS FAR+Squads is lit+Some of the fights can get very intense+When you win a big fight it is very rewarding+Being #1 rocks+Gunplay is solid each gun feels different and hit boxes are decent for the current stage of gameCONS Optimization obviously. But this is at the top of the list for the developer so not worried Lag start of the game is generally slightly slow because of the amount of people and bad optimization but gets better the less people there are. Still something that could be improved because it also kind of makes any grabbing door opening getting in cars feel slow. Teammates can see a 1 pixel enemy across the map while I strain to find an enemy right in front of me (just kiddin only takes practice)Played Rust before this as well as rust mod for battle royale and this is much better.Most of the negative reviews I have read thus far are complaining about things that could be avoided if those people "git gud". I would recommend this game I've already got my moneys worth

review: I've tried my damn hardest to find a way to give this game a positive review but after 31 hours of gameplay I can't. Been playing this game during it's early access run and it's still as buggy. If not even more buggy. From ed hitboxes to a weird yellow screen lighting bug it's really not the best. PUBG Corporation do not deserve to be called a "Corporation".They do not respond to bugs *Ahem lighting bug. Been happening for months now.* as quickly as they should and hackers run rampant in this game. It's overpriced. I barely get to know when my friends are on as the friends list always displays them as off even when Steam says they're playing I'm constantly being put into Asian servers when I live in the UK. PUBG was way better back when it was in early access. I could actually ing play it. Do yourself a favor and get Fortnite.Edit After 70+ Hours I can confirm that this game is NOT getting better the devs only care about the money and the region lock clearly isn't happening.TL DR DO NOT BUY THIS PIECE OF OF A GAME.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I can't recommend this game at the moment. There have been some good updates but in general the updates come to slow and we're forced to play the horrible Desert map. Maybe some of you might like it but I don't and after getting the map several times in a row I just can't stand to keep playing. Even when I get my favorite map I can't really enjoy it as much because if I die too fast by doing something fun like dropping into school or military base then i'll risk getting the desert map 8 times in a row again.It's a fun game that's how it is so popular but the performance still isn't great and the aiming in the game just feels so rough. It's not a smooth experience and if you aren't an amazing aimer then this magnifies the problem. When I play other games the aiming and tracking feels so natural but not this game.Honestly though I could forgive the rough performance and bugs if they just let us pick our own map. I still like the game a lot and at it's core it's fun. It's just not fun when we get that horrible desert map. I clocked so much time on this game and after the new map came out I can barely force myself to get online. Even when my friends call me to get on I find myself just telling them to play without me.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This Is The Greatest Running Simulator on Steam Highly Addictive!Great wide open spaces lush forests running rivers... all the lovely scenery that you can ask for in your not so leisurely jog across the island.This game provides a fantastic entrance for your high energy jaunt through the island of Erangel. You and about 99 other marathon fanatics get to choose where on the island you want to start plummeting to the Earth at 234km/h or popping your chute early to enjoy a birds eye view of the quaint towns and verdant farmlands.When you hit the ground the game will spawn a white circle as far from you as the island allows. You will also get about 5 minutes to lace up your shoes and stretch out a bit. After 5 minutes the Blue Circle of Death starts closing in on the island. You don't want to fall behind the blue line or you get Achilles Tendinitis and you slowly start to die just like in real life. I love realism in my games.You may try looking in to some of the abandoned buildings for some gatorade but you will only find painkillers and Red Bull. The energy drinks may be high in sugar or perhaps you have an allergic reaction to ibuprofin... but on this island taking lots of pill makes you run faster! So grab them when you can. Avoid putting on armor though unless you just want some added weight for stamina training. The armor doesnt actually protect you from anything as you will still find yourself being one shot by a pistol from across that sparkling lake you were appreciating. Always pick up the gas masks though these are totally awesome for altitude training BRO!As you run down the roads dirt paths or just taking it off the trail you may run into fellow athletes who try to attack you. These are just some newbie joggers who didnt stretch enough and know they wont make it to the white circle with the killer cramps they have. Just run away from them because they will eventually die out in the wilderness anyways. Or you can take your chance with an actual gunfight but I dont think this game was designed for that.You may try to take a cheat day and just drive to the white circle but thats something else this game wasn't designed for. Driving in this game is similiar to running in QWOP. You will frequently find your vehicle flipping itself into a violent deathspin for no apparent reason. Never get out of a moving vehicle either as it will hunt you down and run you over out of spite. You need to bring the vehicle to a full stop and turn off the engine if you plan on finishing the race.Anyways keep running to stay in the white circle. Eventually everyone else will succumb to their shin splints and you'll be awarded with a chicken dinner.p.s. If you find yourself in a building with a weapon never try to shoot out of the window at another athlete. You will severely damage the windowsills and probably off the person you were trying to shoot at outside.Kid tested. Masochist approved.Seriously though Inconsistent damage inconsistent movement inconsistent gameplay. The loot and spawns are supposed to be RNG not the very core of the game. Terribly optimized with top of the line video cards SSD drives processor memory this game still has trouble hitting 60fps at medium settings. Switch to any other AAA game and get 140+ on Ultra.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Literally the most consistently awful game ive ever played. It still feels like early access. The devs dont seem to have any idea how to fix anything. Many parts of the game arent clipped properly and your bullets dont hit. It feels like crap whether its the servers or the netcode or what I dunno. Ive never played a game thats so massive and so popular and has so many problems even smaller games that havent sold well are more polished better than this.Ive got a few clips ive saved of people killing me when they arent where im shooting. For example a player at a window I shoot at him through the glass and I die watch the replay and hes out through a door on to a balcony. You are shooting at shadows in this game its so terrible. This game is only gonna make fortnite more popular.People are knocked out lying on the ground and you shoot them point blank with a shotgun and they dont die lol. Literally you shoot them 2 or 3 times and they are still alive. So bad its unreal. Worst experience ive ever seen in any game on pc and even on console.
