review: Great game! Even if half the time I have no idea where the headshot came from! From close combat in the streets to a sniper battle in the woods it doesn't get boring. I would and have been recommending this game to others.To tackle a couple of issues some people are having Yes there's glitches and other bugs but it's Early Access. If you have a problem let them know. I don't understand when someone (I know not everyone) downvotes an Early Access game when they run into their first glitch. (Might just be my luck that I haven't run into many glitches)I'll admit going back on a promise is bad but it's not game changing. It's cosmetic items not starting off with an unfair advantage. Completely forgivable if this extra money means improvements new content and general progress which I want to believe it will. Personally I won't be buying any in game items but that's not because I disagree with it.I'm having great fun with this game and looking forward to see what's next for PUBG

review: I won't go into the bugs and completely random loot distribution because it's just tip of the icebergTo not be completely negative I want to say that the game has the most awesome and unique shooting mechanics I have ever seen in an online FPS. It feels amazingly rewarding to shoot opponents in this game and win gun fights.Unfortunately with each update the optimization gets worse.It has become unplayable on EU servers because of server instability and packet loss.NA servers are somewhat playable. They have the same problems but feel more stable Another problem is the game movement doesn't feel smooth. It feels weird unintuitive and inconsistent.It also feels as if every action in the game other than shooting has an input delay which is incredibly frustrating.1 5 months ago I simply quit playing the game because I was getting too frustrated with all the above issues (and more) and recently I wanted to check if anything changed for the better.It didn't. If anything it got worse.I'm writing this review because I believe this game has huge potential but it's unfortunately on a downward spiral because of sloppy development.It feels like the game was designed by a team full of people with passion for these kind of games but is being maintained by completely different team who doesn't really care about anything but getting a pay check.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Don't really write reviews but here goes.The game has a lot of upsides so I'll start with the downsides.First off the optimization isn't there. I'm not saying it's bad I'm saying that it's unoptimized. Sacriel put it very well in a stream of his saying the game is badly optimized is a bad way of putting it. The game has not YET been optimized at all the devastated have focused on gameplay and creating a working game first and now their top priority is optimization. This means that soon enough you will be able to play this game on less than an i7 1080 monster rig with stable frames.Next off the glitches. Things like the ridiculous vehicle flips occasional invisible players silent shots ed up sounds and the likes. All this is due to the game being early access of course but if you look at games that were this glitchy to begin with like dayz no matter how much they patch bugs at this point new ones will just pop up imo and it will always be kinda buggy.Also server issues. I'm half decent at this game and often make top 10. The amount of times the server dies at vital moments or even no vital is ridiculous. I was once able to use the lag to run into a building and shoot a guy 20 times without him even seeing me because on his side I probably wasn't even in his area yet. (Yeah I'm a scumbag for using lag but at least I can see it as a problem)Also some minor game mechanics like the time you have to get to the circle can be a little ridiculous as sometimes you will take damage from the circle even if you begin running as soon as the next circle pops up due to the distance it often spawns from you and the 2 minute timeframe it gives you.Now the positives.Gunplay is great up there with Arma and DayZ it has some of the most intense and heart pounding battles a game can give.Looting is very easy and the inventory system seems pretty refined. Compared to games like DayZ Arma H1Z1 and the likes which often have very clunky inventory systems it is very easy to use the PUB inventory. REALISM you can't jump out of a car full speed and live! Which is awesome.... however jumping out of a boat full speed kills you... which is a little ridiculous (but I assume just a bug as they have the boats a similar code to cars)The map isn't crazy huge so it's not that much of a running simCar and boat chases are crazy fun and intenseThis game really has too many positives to list. The community is pretty great and I've really enjoyed the time I've played.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: First of all I wanna say that I really like this game. It looks good it feels good to play BUT there are simply too many hackers getting away with freely wallhacking and auto aiming to the point where they are comfortable enough to just make it so obvious that they are hacking that they KNOW they won't get banned. I've played this game way before they even had Miramar (We won't talk about Miramar being an absolute shambles of a map) and there was hacking back then BUT the hackers would get banned when they did it so they kind of just slowly diminished. Until 1.0 where they update the game with a bunch of new maps and systems which is really cool BUT they also updated their NEW ANTI HACK SYSTEM that allows players to get away with hacking sounds a little backwards right? Well that's how it is.I would be more than happy to recommend it to others with a thumbs up but this issue with the hackers makes the game completely unplayable and very frustrating... I will only recommend this game to others ONLY after the developers decide to fix this hacker epidemic issue instead of going down the money grabbing route. I get that companies need to make money but it'll be a bit hard to make money when you neglect your fans so much that they're forced to stop playing because of the people that like to ruin the fun get away with it because of and bad security/Anti hack systems.

review: It was fun while it lasted.I've been playing this game off and on since April 2017 when it become available for Early Access. Up until Version 1.0 this game had promise. Then it got swamped with cheaters. And microtransactions. And no updates that resolve the fundamental issues with the game the laggy netcode terrain clipping and overall clunkiness of the movement and physics engine. And cheaters are still prevalent. They're not subtle cheats either search Youtube for "Shroud PUBG flying car" and you'll see what can happen due to abysmal server side data validation.In Australia good luck finding a match on a map you like. An update towards the start of 2018 broke the matchmaking and the player base plummeted from there.After 650 hours I can't force myself to play this game any longer. They keep giving it a fresh coat of paint with things like a new map and new skins and guns but it's all on top of the rusty chassis and failing engine.

review: If i have to start with an honest opinion One of the best games i have ever played in my life.. To start with a bit of feeling and mechanics The game is quite realistic as in modeling physics laws animations etc.. Terrain Textures Lighting and Modeling are quite satisfying and with the additional optimization changes after 1.0 it runs quite well on a variety of pc specs.. About gameplay and progression it doesnt require you to grind anything to play the game so you can just play for an hour or two and do something else.. if you can that is ) Considering the amount of games that require grinding nowadays be it achievements or unlocking certain elements to progress this is a perfect game for those who does not have too much time but wanna enjoy a really cool game. It might feel a bit strange at start to learn things (if you havent played this genre before) but you get past that period quite quick so even the most casual player can enjoy it in no time. There are alot of game modes for your pref. so i believe it will be easy to find several ways to play the game even if you dont have any friends. Also as a last note the game still has some problems (which i think there is no such game without bugs or glitches.. even those from big companies) which are very few compared to early access and its developers are (even when they started as a very small team) listening the community and they fixed majority of the problems as they promised and people seem to be quite happy about it so far. I mean there will always be people that will complain about the most insignificant things and they are impossible to please (and i will be honest even i complained in the past from time to time but from what i have seen so far they did a great job to fix alot of things) but overall i find this game to have an incredible potential and the genre proved itself to be quite fun for both casual and competitive manner.. So these were my experiences and opinions about the game (considering it being my first battle royale game) and i hope it helps those who are not sure about.. )

review: Now I have 40.3 hours on this game and you are probily like "YOU HAVE 40.3 HOURS I AINT GONNA LISTEN TO ?%#$" Well I know a bit. #1 you need a good computer to run this game. In one of their patch notes resulting in "upgrading their anti cheat they would not fix it because hacker would just keep on coming back for more. This patch made people with lower end computers go from a solid 60 fps to around 10 or 20. Same for me. Now for the good stuff. The game is really fun and I suggest you get it if you have never tried any other br (Battle Royal) games before. You can do some insane stuff and play with you buds going for that winner winner chicken dinner. Although wile doing thins you may find some bugs. This game is flooded with chinese people in the North America servers. That is a huge thing to advise. If you grab some of you friends though you wont have to deal with all of these people altough some of them do speak English. Thats pretty much all I can tell you about the basics and what you need to know to get started playing this really great game.

review: I no longer feel I can recommend this game in it's current state. Despite now having been out of early access for several months the game is still plagued with tons of issues including server lag poor optimization inconsistent hit detection and tons of other bugs and glitches. What is the point of leaving early access if your game still plays like a beta test? And yet they continue selling it as if it's a finished product. On top of that the game has been plagued with hackers and cheaters as of late and the developers are remarkably quiet on the issue I guess hoping that it'll go away on its own somehow? I so badly want this game to be good it has such huge potential but I feel like it's getting wasted away as the game slowly loses more and more players to other games in the BR genre. If they want to keep this game in the spotlight they're gonna have to start putting some serious effort in the coming months or it's going to go the way many other similar projects end up.Original review for archival purposes Despite its technical flaws which are expected for an early access title this game destroys the recent trend of multiplayer survival games. It has found the perfect spot between survival and tactical shooter something other Battle Royale games like it before have failed to do in my opinion. The game still leaves something to be desired in terms of lag and performance however I feel these issues will be padded out over the coming months as the game pushes towards a full release. The dev team shows a lot of promise. Many of these games end up in something I like to call "early access limbo". Right now I don't believe that will be an issue with this game.Also to comment on the recent controversey involving a new microtransaction system. I don't see it as an issue at all. In fact I think it's a good thing. The crates being sold for real money contain items that are purely cosmetic. You are in no way at any disadvantage if you don't want to buy these crates. Meanwhile the extra income from these microtransactions gets put back into the game making it even better than before hopefully able to be supported for years to come. I'm aware people are upset that it was originally said that their would be no microtransactions in early access however you have to understand that this was said well before the game blew up to become now one of the most played games on steam. Plans are expected to change in these situations.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

It's not a terrible game it's just pretty mediocre the real appeal is just the looting like in many games. Thing is you are going to gear yourself out to be some kind of badass and likely die pretty pathetically some 5 10 15 minutes later hopefully while getting some shots in.

review: This game is a very unique experience and one I very much enjoy. And the developers are by far some of the most attentive and willing to please I've seen backing any game I especially love the little details added like the graffiti furniture lights even the lightswitches sounds like the newly added bandage tape tearing dropping the can after drinking an energy drink and turning over when you're doing something while prone plus the idle motions wonderful and well noticed little details that enrich the experience. for gameplay. I'd give this a 9.9/10. There are very few problems with the game really but the ones that are there are still an issue. First off the rewards system was ok in the earlier stages of it being in early access now it's gotten a little broken. To be blunt it's just overthought. The points are spread throughout a team when you're playing duos or squad when they could have simply made it a standard "you got this place you get this amount of points for it" and have that decrease the more players there are. The hitpoints system is overdone as well it should just be a set amount per kill maybe a bonus of 10 or 20 for headshot kills. Simple to the point (pun intended) and fair. The last game I played was a squads with 3 people we got 5th place and I got 2 kills. 74 points. This kind of thing is what has made getting anything above the 700 crate a chore. And the reloading is a bit messy at times. Like you'll reload in a critical situation you'll hear the click of the first round supposed to be going in the chamber but then you start firing and there's nothing in the mag for 2 seconds and those 2 seconds matter at times. And this is less common of an issue but again in a critical moment can throw your game away. Holding the ads in third person puts you in a sorta "zoomed hipfire" which is a lovely and very useful tool but you can switch which shoulder you're looking from to peek around different corners again great system but with that occasionally comes a glitch where it will switch shoulders without any reasoning to it and throw your aim completely. And my final problem is with the "zoomed hipfire" again when you're backed up against a wall in close quarters combat accuracy is still important and in a pinch you'll go to use the zoom for more accuracy faster but because you're against the wall the third person presses the player model basically in front of everything making you blind to 80% of the space in front of you. If it forced a first person view then there would be no problem. Those are my few real complaints with the game overall I still love this game and play it adamantly it's amazingly fun with friends or going solo and I highly recomend this to anyone who likes a fun competative experience. All that being said what I and I think others would like to see implimented in the game would be firstly making the wooden/plastic/whatever bars that stay after you shoot out a window either destructable or at least penatrable that 3 milimeter thick piece of adamantium has saved countless of my enemies and screwed me quite thuroughly. If you're in the passanger seat of a car or the sidecar of the moterbike that has it you should be able to use healing supplies Drivers seat or the back seat of the bike would be the obvious and understandable exceptions. You should also be able to move at least at walking pace while using them as well. If sprinting cancelled the action I'd understand but you can walk and wrap your arm with a bandage or drink a soda at the same time. The last thing and this is just something that wouldn't change the gameplay at all but would add just a bit more to it having the option to spectate and see how a game ends from your opponents view after all your teammates have died of cource have it an option to spectate the rest of the game and see what happens. That is my input on the game as a player who is pretty addicted to it and enjoys it as is

review: TLDR It's unoriginal but fun. Runs like trash but in apha. If you don't have above average hardware don't waste your money. Tried this game to see if it would work on my mid range machine. If you've ever played BattleRoyal in Arma 3 then you've played this.I do enjoy the engine as it has a good balance of complexity and usability. But I have to give 0 credit for creativity. This is somone who made a mod in Arma 3 and got really into it. So now they are trying to rewrite the Bohemia engine so they can make some money from the game. This aside the game feels good and plays well mechanically from my brief passing by. I'll still pay for it once it is optimized. I have an i5 4660 6Gb of RAM and a GTX 950 HDD. Not a great machine by any standards but I can play similar games with much higher performance. It feels like and issue fetching the game models. Any time you turn your view or when you are jumping from the plane it takes so long for the game to call the lower to higher poly model that I get sub 1fps. Not sure if that's exactly the correct explination for what's happening but that is what it feels like. Anyways I've refunded this game until a time that it is optimized or maybe I will but it in 3 years when it's on sale and I have a new PC. I'll be recommending it because it will be fun if you can run it on your PC.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I was skeptical about buying this game at first but with a little encouraging from a friend I finally gave in and purchased this addicting game. I would first like to say great job with the development team and for giving us a new and improved game with 1.0 update and also just the game overall. I honestly thought it was a knock of H1Z1 but no this game is unique in so many ways. I love the different game options you are given to play every game you play is different no matter how many times you play. A must have game paid full price and worth every penny.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game has a lot more bad than good but for some reason it is still fun.If you are playing to win a chicken dinner then you'll never have fun because you're playing to win. You're against 99 players when solo 50 others duos or 24 other squads. You have to play for the hell of it not for the win. You get better by not hiding in a corner because when comes down to being the last ones you most likely will lose because you don't know how your gun works.The good about this game is that the audio cues are really good so playing surround sound is your literal savior. The gun play is crazy good in my opinion. The bullet having drop drag and travel time. The vaulting is alright wouldn't say it's bad but it could be a lot better. As well as each game is unique since no situation is the same.The bad is still the rubber banding and desync when there is a large amount of people in one place. The glitching of through of hitboxes for certain terrain and buildings when vaulting being not able to climb up certain rocks using vaulting even though there is a clear ledge you can grab on. Vehicles getting phased through walls and blowing up.Overall this so called "fully" released game has more problems now than it did in early access. Not saying it isn't fun but if you want a clean game this isn't really the game for you. I would still recommend this game if you want to have a more realistic gunplay or if you're just trying to find a game with some of your buds.I personally find it more fun with a duo or squad with friends because you guys just play for fun and not to win.

review: Good game very fun but has some flaws. As with many games this is not perfect but I have found to enjoy it a lot. This is especially fun when playing with friends as a team or God forbid strangers. It seems like the developers have not been putting a lot of effort lately since there is no absolute changes to the game only more useless content. Now I love the idea of having a progression in a game and this game certainly needs one. What I mean by "useless content" is that we are not receiving any useful stuff for the game. Instead of fixing bugs and what happens to some bad internet connectivity and lag they are adding more skins and loot crates which I am not very inspired to obtain. The game devs should really focus on fixing the flaws in this awesome game and later add the content we could have fun with. Overall it is a flawed but awesome game that has innovated with a new formula and never gets old of playing.Oh also PUBG&gt Fortnite
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I know there are a ton of negative reviews but don't let them turn you off to this game.This game is a paradox. It's controls are wonky. There are bugs aplenty. It's graphically . . . outdated (but not by much). It's frustrating 99% of the time. Hackers use to plague this game pretty hardcore (though I have noticed a significant drop in the hackers recently). But here is the most important quality I keep coming back. I've played games that were significantly more polished. I've played games where the gunplay was significantly more satisfying. I've played games where I was significantly more skilled. But this is the game I continually come back to month after month. Why? *Shrug* It just has that "it" quality. Winning is hard so very satisfying. Almost winning is easy enough to make the whiff of victory strong in virtually every match. 30 minutes per match (if you make it to the final circle) seems to find a sweet spot between too quick to be satisfying and too tedius to keep coming back to. If you like a "realistic" battle royale format get this game. I promise you'll find flaws but you'll also more than get your money back in entertainment value.

review: This is an early access game so expect some performance issues and glitches as well as some server issues every once in a while. The developers reputation leads me to believe that his top priority will be taking care of these issues instead of adding more pointless content like most early access games without actually fixing the core game. But honestly you just need to understand the game is in early development and that you need to turn the settings down pretty low to get a decent performance out of the game. The game itself is VERY ADDICTING! When you first start out it can be frustrating because everyone keeps killing you but once you get used to the aiming mechanics you will have a hard time putting this one down. The fire fights in this game will nearly give you a heart attack they can be very unpredictable because of the way the map is layed out and the amount of weapons and attatchments you can find. This game doesn't feel like h1z1 where it seems like you waste 95% of your time running toward the designated zone or just waiting the way the map is designed and the ability to choose where you jump into the map will consistently get you into confrontations keeping the game exciting throughout. I watched this game in beta of other peoples gameplay and i was not impressed but i gave it a chance and im glad i did. This game is a gem among the early access games that are out now if you have a decent PC and can run this game in its current unoptimized state theres no reason why you shouldnt buy it if your'e skeptical buy it try it for an hour or two then refund it. But im confident after an hour of playing this game you won't even think about refunding it. Overall? BUY THIS

review: I was first introduced to this game by watching Lewis Sips and Pyrion playing it on YouTube. I thought that I wasn't going to get it. However I have been craving a game that really sparks my urge to play games again. I have about ten hours into it and I can already tell what is GREAT about this game and what is BAD about this game.PROS Simple but fun formula Lots of variety in gameplay even though there is only one map. Plenty of attachments Fairly accurate weapons (as in true to real life) Open map with plenty of nooks and crannies Decent community (always saying racist and sexist things pre game but once the game starts people generally try to work as a team) Decent weapon balanceCONS I can't tell if there is something wrong with the hit boxes or if the server is just a tad slow (not reason enough for me to stop playing) There is no manteling system in the game. (example can't jump/vault over most fences and or wall)CONCLUSION I love this game. I hope the devs continue to improve upon the game and add more maps as time goes by.

review: I am changing my review that was a very high endorsement of the game and the developer. I bought this game from the developers website early on. I was one of those guys who had the bandana shoes jacket and pants that sold for over $1500. I have been playing the game constantly for several months and my friends and I have had a blast playing together in squads....Until.....The cheating. Oh....my....God....the cheating. Don't get me wrong. I know that there are cheaters in every game and you will run into them every once in a while. No worries. happens. But this game when I am writing this (Jan 4) is absolutely a pile of crap. The past two days I have played 20 rounds and without a doubt a minimum of 15 of those rounds we were killed by chinese hackers. I am not just saying because I died it was a cheater...I reviewed EVERY death with death cam and also replay. Replay is the best because I can actually follow the player for quite a long time priot to my death to futher confirm anything sketchy.I am not exaggerating. At least 75% of our squads games on the NA server end with a death from a chinese hacker.Don't buy this game at this time until they get the chinese confined to their region. As long as they can que in North America I consider this game unplayable. 20 minutes looting and fighting legitimate players ending with multiple laser beam headshots to your level 3 helmet and insta death to your squad is pretty frustrating. Great game otherwise...one of my favorite I bought in the past couple of years. Ruined by cheaters....

I would say I die about 2/5 times from some form of cheating in NA servers. You know this via the deathcam which you can view after you die it essentially gives you the POV of the opponent who killed you. Head lock on without aiming from 50 yards(or 500) away. See through materials both. speed boost(so youre as fast as car) etc. Despicable stuff. Has completely ruined the game as youre more than likely to encounter someone cheating if you get to the top 10.

review: WAY BETTER THAN H1Z1 However there's still a few issues and I do recognize that this is in early access and you can look at their plans for future updates which is amazing but there are still a few worrisome issues. FIRST When you first drop into a server it seems like everyone is lagging. I'll take three or four punches from someone without even knowing it and can be killed before even picking up a box of ammunition because I can't properly see where my attacker is coming from. SECOND Punching does WAY too much damage. For example people will opt in to following you around as you loot in the beginning rather than going their own way to loot because they know they can kill you if you stop to pick anything up. The punch damage is disgustingly high. THIRD The game has no 3D sound. None. It is EXTREMELY difficult to tell where shots are coming from and I'm finding it hard to pick up on whether poeple are right outside my house or three houses down. The footsteps don't seem to be very stable it's hard to hear people reliably. That said the game is still an absolute blast if you can get past the first 5 or 6 minutes of a match to where it seems like everyone's ping levels out and the game truly begins.

review: Pros Solid Combat Doesn't treat you like a five year old (I personally feel like a moron playing Fornite) Good content value for price Consistent flow of new content Very quick matchmaking Fun with friendsCons Worst optimization of any game I have ever played Graphics are mediocre as a whole Hit detection sucks but is getting better Hackers are a serious and frequent issue (I have gotten second place two or three times because of a hacker) Completely random loot means that even the most skilled players lose way more than they win Loot doesn't spawn in immediately Driving is terrible Lots of down time.I am really conflicted with this game and what I should give it. Although the core gameplay is entertaining I just can't help feeling like this game is only good due to a lack of proper competition. Because of this I would recommend this game if you really want it but otherwise wait for another battle royale game that will inevitably release in the next 6 10 months that will blow this game out of the water.

review: After 30 HoursThe Game is really hard to play. I only get 1 kill on most of my games. Even I a Gamer who loves Shooters FPS or TPS find it hard to somewhat improve in the game. Hope that they add a Firing Range of some sort so that everyone could practice spray controls and get the hang of the guns. Movement feels clunky well at least for me. I don't know why but I feel really slow. Sometimes it's laggy and delay can be felt even on the SEA Server (I'm from Philippines). Chinese players are flooding every match even on the NA server. I tried to play in the NA server hoping that I could actually play with people who can speak English but I still get matched up with Chinese people. I don't hate them it's just really hard to communicate with them. I really wish that they'd have their own server. Based on my experience so far I recommend this game. After 40 HoursI'm getting the hang of it. I'm watching a few PUBG streamers and I've been taking notes on how they play and I'm actually learning something. When you can actually kill people in this game and manage to survive for a bit long it's actually fun xD. Still need the Firing Range though. I also like the new Weapon skins though it's not really necessary. Or maybe it's just that I'm poor to afford them. I also like how you can sell the cases. It helped me save up for a game I really want to buy for long. I think that's it for the "After 40 Hours" update. I still recommend this game.I'll continue to add more stuff in this review as I play more.

review: After playing this game for over 200+ hours i can say for the most part this game is garbage. The devs will not region lock so if you play with random people expect not to understand what the they are saying. they keep putting out crates you have to pay to unlock like WTF??? and their servers are constantly down so this multiplayer only game can rarely even get played. The only conclusion that i can come to is that the devs only care about generating money because they keep implementing in the game where you have to pay to unlock anything and they do nothing else. Hackers are also rampant in the game so more often than not you will get killed from weird angles and places you should'nt even be able to get killed at. so all in all if you want a game you can rarely play you like speaking to only chinese people you enjoy getting gunned down by people that arent even pointing their gun at you and you love pouring tons of time into unlocking only to have to pay to unlock said then this game is for you. The only saving grace of this game is being able to play with friends because you can on rare occasions after 8000 tries trying to join a game squeeze a drop of fun out of this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Personly i really liked the game when it first came out now there is lag issues the client still isn't fix they brought out a new map with out fixing all the issues from the first one and the new map is so badly constructed so i like to play the old one but there is no way of choosing which map you play on. I feel this is because the creaters / Developers knew that they spent so much time on it and it was a waste of time because 90% of people would rather play the first map. Then there comes the desync issues which make the game impossible to play on my screen im leaning out the door on my screen but on a enemy's screen im stood out in the open. faulting they said will fix the game and make it more noob friendly and only 75% of the time vaulting actually works and they removed crouch jumping so you can't do that in stead of vaulting. this is why personly i would never by an another copy of this game until the Creaters/Developers fix the minor issues.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is utter trash its more bug ridden than my grandmothers god damn house and the optimization is poorer than even dayz standalone which quite frankly is an achievment you should get a medal for this Gameplay is horribly buggy how is it that in a game thats trying to be "competitive" i get instinces in every single match where i hit the enemy on my screen AND even see the blood splatter but then while rewatching it turns out that the shot didnt even register WTF like seriously there was even blood wat. I try to live my life without regrets because i mean whats the point youre just about something in the past that you cant change and honestly i have never had a regret in my life....until i bought this ing game honestly i have sleepless nights crying being ashamed that i spent 16 euros on this garbage i didnt even pay the full price so i cant even imagine what the people who did feel like. If i could revert one thing in the history of the world i wouldnt revert the holocaust i wouldnt prevent the starvation of millions I WOULD PREVENT THE CREATION OF THIS ING GAME
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Would be nice if it weren't for the chinese cheaters who aside from being lowlifes with no sense of fair play are so numerous that they clog the servers often turning the game into a "Servers are too busy please try again" simulator. That problem would largely be solved by simply locking those degenerates into their own server where they can hack each other to death but apparently PUBG's devs are afraid of looking "racist" and hurting people's fee fees so they refuse to do it.On top of that despite the creation of new maps the game feels stagnant and development seems terribly slow for what pretty much amounts to a large scale arena shooter. The undue focus on churning out loot crates instead of actually fixing things suggests it's all going to end up just like H1Z1 a game which PUBG's lead creator had a hand in developing too.As it is now the game's only good for farming crates to sell on the market. Avoid unless you're desperate to not miss out on the battle royale fad have friends/groups to play with or want to milk the community market until the game inevitably dies.

review: This game can be fun at times but mostly frustrating. Should still be in early access still having the game crash every 20 25 rounds or so. Servers have imporved alot but they need to region lock based on IP or something. People join other regions just to have a lag advantage. The hit reg has imporved alot but if you face someone lagging that doesn't help... Way to many hackers which they are working on...?In 100 hours the game has crashed maybe 4 5 times but every single time it has crashed I have been having an epic fire fight causing me to die....... This makes me pretty salty... The new map feels really rushed and way to open. But you cant drive because the surface is extreamly bumpy.Also they need to add a small chance of winning a key for a crate. or make it cost a lot of BP to purchase a key. I would still recommend this game if it didn't feel like early access. (Lag and gaming crashing with random reports. Not my PCs issue.)

review: This game repeatedly fails at the very first hurdle. The first thing you do when you play a game of PUBG is land in your parachute. Rarely does this go to plan. Either you fall/take damage or land somewhere completely different to where you intended to. If a game doesnt even allow you to perform the very first task appropriately then it is highly overated. Dissapointing game made worse by the lack of attention to problems. It is bizarre how the developers of this game have found the time to produce 2 new maps but cant even fix issues that are already present. In my opnion dont waste your time with this half game. review: This is quite possibly the worst taken care of game every created it came out and it was fantastic it lagged a bit and servers were clunky but itll all get fixed right? Wrong the game has done absolutely nothing to get better in fact the only way to win or hit anyone is to have the best internet possible and hope that its enough that anything you do is actually registered server side. Picking things up is awful shooting is the worst you could lay a full clip into someone never miss a shot and then they kill you because on their side they only got hit 3 times. Not to mention for over 3 months there was a glitch that rendered the game unplayable if I moved my mouse to the right I couldnt shoot or aim or do anything with my mouse until I moved my mouse back to the left it made aiming and shooting impossible and if anyone was on my right side then I was sure to die. Save your money and your time this game is complete and total garbage.

Simplest headshots not registering. Half a mag fired into a guy running through a field 70 meters away from you BARELY registering. Getting hit behind cover. Smoke grenades not rendering. Knocking down teammates by lightly touching them with your bike.This CANNOT happen in game where one mistake costs you 30 minutes of adrenaline filled gameplay. Wait for something to be done before buying this.

review: Really hard to rate this game could totally use a "mixed" recommendation option on this one.This game has a great round mechanic. The whole idea of dropping 100 people on an island and letting them fight till only 1 (or max 4 in a team) are left is genuin fun and makes for some intense gameplay. Unfortunately thats where I'll have to stop with the positivity because apart from that the game feels like a cheap F2P shooter. It's just wonky unprecise technically low grade material. Basic animations sound design that I've seen done better in HL1 mods back in the day. Customization options are basically a joke no progression system of any kind. The most horrible netcode and server performance I have ever witnessed in a game I actually paid for. Server tickrates are a complete joke. It just feels cobbled together and barely able to handle itself.So. Many. Cheaters. If you can see beyond those things this is a great game and you will have alot of fun. For me the initial hype had died away at some point and I was getting more and more frustrated at how little the game improved in (to me) important aspects. Seeing how they made a gazillion Dollars with this game just made it worse. This game might still improve and as I said you can still have a lot of fun regardless.

Well guess what? review: PUBG offers two experiences which are both equally enjoyable. You can play seriously which offers a more tactical experience where you work with your teammates. The other way you can play is goofing off with friends and messing with the game's physics. I prefer to play with a mix of the two. Some of my favorite experiences playing video games with friends are in this game. That is where I believe this game really shines playing with friends. Single player rounds for me tend to get boring after a couple of rounds. But duos and especially squads can take several rounds to lose any of their enjoyability. However this game does have some big problems. The most famous of the problems is the bugs especially with the vehicles. The vehicle bugs are a blessing and a curse. Playing a non serious game and suddenly having your car launched is hilarious. But when you're trying to win and suddenly your bike is thrown into another dimension is frustrating. Most of these occur with the bikes most notably being the three wheeler. The three wheeler is cursed by Satan for having the worst stability ever. You can go over a slight hill going three miles per hours and the bike will do a quadruple flip. The game seems to decide when these bugs will kill you or not. You can slam into a couple and trees and maybe have to be revived but if you do a single slow flip and land wrongly you launch in the air crash into the moon and explode. They have been updating the game much more and changing things. For example most of the weapon sights no longer give you a severe migraine while you try to look through them. However there is still the problem of the mid game. The mid game feels very slow with not much going own. You may face the occasional fight but most of it is just walking towards the new zone. The beginning is fast and chaotic while the end game is intense but the mid game is just cold. Hopefully the new smaller map can get rid of the mid game and blueboys can finally release an update that doesn't break something else. Overall the game is a fun experience especially with friends but has many problems that are slowly being fixed.Also people don't post PUBG wins on Snapchat so that is a plus. 7/10

review: One of the worst games ever existed.Not as idea(as idea is perfect)but let me explain what i mean.First of all the audio is literally garbage.Pure garbage.You have no idea where u get shot from sometimes.When you are in a house with an enemy and u hear him inside just go and find him or leave the house 'cause u will never know where he is with this garbage audio.You could hear him 5 floors above and actually be next to you.Second there is a delay between players about 3 seconds.Nothing more to say here.Driving is worse than the first NFS game ever made.The motorcycle can loop sometimes for no reason or the cars can explode by crashing a wall with 4 km/h.Trash loot everywhere.And the most importand of all?The ing damage is not balanced.Literally i was killed by 2 shots from mini in level 3 vest when i was full hp.Sometimes if you are lucky u could leave by a kar98k shot with level 3 helmet.Literally how they made the damage in this game is completely garbage.Every time the guns deal different dmg and vest do different work level 3 helmet and vest btw are useless most of the time cause u die from 11 shots from ump ofc.I just dont understand what the are they doing literally.Oh i forgot to mention hackers.9/10 games u encounter one who shoots you from 600 meters with scar without recoil in the head full automatic.But at least we have emotes!Literally this is the worst gaming company in the world.They dont know how to fix this game they made which btw as a gameplay idea is perfect but it still needs a lot of work to call it a game.In the state this game is now i wouldnt buy it if i were you.I just hope they fix it or another company buy it 'cause this one is awfull af.Btw sorry for my english i am not from english country i dont know very well to speak.

review: PUBG An Honest Review (For Justin).Hey I'm MiniM your gay super friend here. If you don't get cancer you'll find some cool information about PUBG in my review. Lets go!PUBG is a MOBA (Battle Royale for short) and places you on an island against the wits of your enemies. The objective of the game is to be the last man standing out of the 100 players (even though an average of 20 players leave as soon as the game starts). You can play this game alone or stratagize with up to 4 friends amd make some MLG outplays.The game starts with you on United Airlines going to either Sweden or Australia that is.... Before 100 plane tickets were bought and all 100 passengers were forced off the plane. Unfortunetly you were dropped off right before they started filming the hunger games and as soon as you dropped they told you the rules "Kill or be killed."So you start looting and looking for the best items in the game when... BAMYou were shot in the back of the head with someone hiding behind a door waiting with a shotgun...You laugh you lose.You join in a game again and find the legendary shotgun. You repeat in your mind "If you can't beat them join them." As you set up behind the front door. Someone comes! The zone is moving in and someone take refuge from the outside attacks in your house. Little did they know you were sitting there with your ultra strong lil pump action shotgun ready for this moment. You aim.... Aim... Aim... They stop moving.AND YOU HEADSHOT THAT RIGHT IN BETWEEN THE EYEBALLS!You did it! You finally killed someone in PUBG and as they're bleeding out on the floor waiting for their teammate you say "You laugh... You LOSE"And shoot him one last time with your pistol and begin looting all the stuff he has. You leave the house because of the zone approaching and as soon as you walk out the door your only victim's teammate opens fire and you die.You might be thinking "Hmm that sounds like a not fun experience and a ton of t"BUT IT'S NOT! It's the MLG pro status you get after gaining your first kill and the immense amount of pride you get after beating a 2v1 and the heart pounding exhillerating feeling getting that lucky headshot winning you your first ever chicken dinner that makes this game so fun. And I think after you realize that having the best graphics and having the highest rank in the game doesn't matter you'll be having tons of fun too!Thanks for reading my honest review.

review: *early access review*This game is basically the offspring of H1Z1 King of the Kill and Arma. It is what H1Z1 was meant to be. This game could definetely use some work *cough* optimization for the love of God please *cough*Pros Lots of different types of guns and weapon attachments aswell as gear The ability to choose where you want to land from a plane Gameplay is fun encountering other players is always excitingCons Game is not very well optimized I have a gtx 1080 and an i7 6850k and most of the time I am only getting about 40fps on ultra. The "safe zone" and the "blue line that limits the playing area" could be improved. They seem like they were implemented towards the end with not much effort put into it. Landing with a parachute can be kind of buggy aswell as it slows you down to the speed of a sloth when landingThis game is a great game for early access with lots and lots of room to improve. The devolpers of this game are not like those of Daybreak this game will be updated and that is what will make this game popular. I can't wait to see what this game will turn into as the devolpment continues.Edit Optimizations have been consistently added and the game runs very smooth now.

review: PUBG. This game brought light to a niche genre of battle royales. Pretty fun to play but it does have shortcomings. The community is terrible (even if hilarious to me). if you have bad RNG it is impossible to win. Despite this the game is a must have for any gamer. If you are a fortnite player pick this up. (In my opinion) It is a better game. It is a wonderful action shooter game and every battle can be your last. Many shooters don't have the pecision and skill needed but PUBG delivers. Many shooters have some aim assist that makes me feel like my hand is being held but in PUBG I rely on my skill alone.PROS A great shooting experience A fair challenge Fun to play overall Balanced guns (shotguns are a little sucky though) Good to play with friendsCONS Community is worse than CSGO ( If that is even possible) RNG can be a problem even if rarelySome could argue the RNG makes for a better experience but i personally don't like it.OVERALL SCORE 8/10

review: After the last monthly patch (August) i have changed my review I changed my review from negative to positive this change is thanks to the Dev's hard work at constantly fixing and optimising the game it may take longer to fix some bugs than others but thats the whole purpose of EA.PUBG is now a fully playable game with minimal game breaking bugs if any at all. There are some bugs but these you won't notice i have to give major props to the Dev team for the good work. The cheating in this game has gone right down but the number of scriptors is rising. Scriptors various in different ways and it's highly unlikely you will come accross many at all. The inclusion of FPP was heavily needed with alot of the people in this game heavily relying on third persons issues there is still some issues with FPP such as no leaderboards (coming soon) and the issue with focus lock (holding right click) but this is a problem in TPP also). The ADS alternative in this game which is some sort of focus lock is extremely broken basically when aiming you get 2 options FPP ADS and the Focus lock i am on about the focus lock is highly innacurate and seems to get blocked by the smallest things (E.g. trying to shoot over a buggy is impossible as there are so many random invisible hitboxes that bullets can't seem to pass through best option is to go FFP but you can still have issues.)No doubt my issues i have had will get sorted soon so buy the game and win yourselves some chicken dinners!

review: I have been a console gamer my entire life. Never really got into PC gaming. PUBG released and after watching countless hours of Twitch Streams I finally caved in and ordered a PC literally so I could finally start playing PUBG! It was well worth the purchase as I have put countless hours into the game in the short two weeks I've owned it. This game is by far one of the most intense games I have ever played. Making it into the top 10 on solo matches always gets the heart pumping. The squad matches are extremely fun when the entire team communicates and works together to progress in the match. I also get a lot of enjoyment out of the first person matches and actually prefer playing the squad first person matches over anything else. No real complaints for this game as it is very well put together and fluid for being offered at the 29.99 price point. The only things I could pick at would be the hit detection at times it seems like my shots are missing a guy literally 20 ft away from me with my reticle deal on with the target and sometimes the jumping can be frustrating getting caught on random objects. Looking forward to seeing where this game goes in the future and cant wait to see what new features will be added!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Game's great microtransactions aren't great but they are completely cosmetic and the economy is broken causing items that would normally be &lt $0.10 to be nearly $30.Also don't let the majority of these people fool you whenever it comes to what these microtransactions actually are. There are 3 different types of crates at this moment 2 of which are free to obtain AND free to open. You earn all 3 of these types of crates by earning in game currency based on how you did in the "battlegrounds." Like I said 2 of these are free to open one of them requires a key. The key costs $2.50 and the items included in the crate consist of movie tie in items for Battle Royale. If you ask me the items you can recieve via the regular free crates are 100 times better than anything you could recieve in this paid crate not that my opinion really matters.The gameplay is fantastic and it is everything I could have ever wanted in a survival/arena shooter. If you like H1Z1 King of The Kill or The Culling this game is better than both of those.Technically speaking this game is hit or miss. Some of my friends can play this game perfectly without any stuttering while others with superior rigs can't even hit 15 FPS in some areas. This is expected of an Early Access game the dev team should be focused on adding new features to the game not optimizing it. I'm not saying that the game doesn't NEED to be optimized because if the game was released as is today I would not be recommeding it right now.

review: Product received for free. This is one of those games that was made by someone who enjoyed doing the same thing over and over and thought other people like doing that. You can play one of two ways on two maps. 1 Drop where everyone is and the game is five minutes or less long. 2 Drop somewhere no one is get awesome loot then die from a guy sniping in a bush somewhere. Don't get me wrong this game is very fun and addicting. The first few hours of gameplay gives you a rush and a sense of nervousness. After you get used it which doesn't take long it becomes stale. There is only one gamemode with two maps. You can't customize your character outside of a god aweful loot crate scam. As a stand alone fully released game it's not good. Not by a long shot. It feels like I got an add on rather than a full game. Don't get me wrong some people enjoy doing the same thing over and over but to be considered a "full" game you need to put work into it. What i'm saying is it's not a game it's a gamemode plus two maps you pay $30 for.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is total trash ....... Looks like crap runs like crap and plays like crap . Just another mass hysteria lowering the bar on what is considered a good game smh . It took a long time for me to actually try it and yes iam a fan of the battle royale genre and knew all about the game since early access release but ended up on the Fortnite band wagon at the time and got hooked... So as I finally got a little time in game today I was greatly underwhelmed at how clunky and unpolished the game feels ... Videos and streams do not do the game justice for how trash it is .... You have to play it ...... I do not recommend this game whatsoever its way too big along with game mechanics graphics and sub par optomization makes for a unfinished and ugly experience ... honestly H1Z1 just a different name and minor updates to certain things ..... I didnt think i would say this after purchasing this pile but Fortnite is ten times the game as far as gameplay optomization and just overall quality of the product .... and its free ....... The game is garbage I cannot understand the hype behind it much like ark survival ........ I will be refunding a steam game for the first time ever today

Theres tons of glitches and unrealism in terms of the vehicles which are terribleYou get a ing heart attack every match because you get hit from somewhere you dont know and the objective is to survive PBtw the reason why its so ing boring is because its the same over and over againMatch die after 5 min(or even faster) repeat.And if you're lucky you'll be holding shift for 20 minutes just to get killed.I know this review is chaotic but i'm just really upset about this game... I wish i could refund it or get money back in some way...The market? Damn. Bluehole sure is making some cash off that INCLUDING valve. You get a 60 cent worth case that is not worth opening every 10 matches or so? I mean its awesome! BUT. Here's the catch of the 60 cent case you get rewarded You have to play this terrible game to get it for a whileOh and uhh the gameplay is ing horrible. I still don't get why this game isn't obsolete since the free to play announcement of Fortnite (Which is an even prettier more fun and overall better game).I would'nt even play this if it were f2p.CONCLUSION Don't buy it. Even though the misleading videos that make it look fun+streamers influence you on buying it.. You'll regret it after 10 20 hrs of playing like me

review: This game is not esport ready.But boy it makes your heart race in the lategame.You land in a city with dozen of other nutjobs you find a crowbar and a biker helmet then when you run to a different house you get shot by a guy across the street with kar98 and x4 scope. You curse you smash your keyboard like Chris Brown beat Rihanna. Then you play again.You play smarter you land and get into vehicle probably one of those suicidal bikes standing nearby. You drive away but then you accidentaly jump on one of the hillocks you do a triple backflip and you land on your head. You killed yourself.You clench your teeth harder than your mother hold your father's hand when she was pushing you out you play again.You play even smarter you land faaaar away from any bozos you get some guns a nice lookin vest holy is that lvl.3 helmet? Yes it is. You pick it up because your skull doesn't like 5 56 rounds. You're sneaky you avoid any contact with any other players unless you're 100000% sure you can kill one guy running through the open field. You get yourself to last 10 your palms are sweaty knees weak arms are heavy vomit on your sweater already mom's lasagna. You let those guys kill themselves because you have no freakin' idea where they are. Then when there's only you and one other guy you get headshoted by some ghillie suit guy with AWM 1000 hours played and/or cheats if he's Chinese.Your 145 bpm heart rate drops to 0 scent of chicken dinner fades away.Then you play again.Because you want to be the last man standing.Because you want that freakin chicken.

review: It's a fun game not a good game. There are way too many bugs and they release loot crates that you need keys to open that you pay for with real money like CSGO crates before fixes. On the note of loot crates first though ive been playing since Early Access probably bought about 100+ crates by now usually get 1 4 every week depending on how much i play/win. Ive only ever gotten ONE item that wasnt grey rarity and it was an uncommon or the greenish rarity. It's absurd how low the drop chances are for some players and how many other players get much better rewards. Maybe im just the unluckiest man on earth but that doesnt seem right somethings wrong there the chances cant be THAT low. Also with the addition of "pay to open" crates whenever i get them they basically sit in my inventory forever or i sell them on the marketplace because i refuse to pay money for them (which i shouldnt have to because i bought the game for $30 already) so thats one less chance at an item every week. Its a small issue but a rather annoying one. Just let us buy a damn crate of our choosing with our BP greedy devs.As for an example of bugs my friends discovered TODAY after a "patch" that you can walk backwards through a wall in one of the most popular spots in the game at one of the apartments of El Pozo. Obviously they dont bug test enough because that one should be a no brainer. Not only do bugs make it a bad experience but the plethora of "cheaters" is absurd and the fact that the loot seems to be RNG based where you can land somewhere and have amazing amounts of ARs SRs meds armor and ammo for a full squad one game but get absolutely nothing in the same area the next and killed by a team with all that loot JUST because of the place you landed. It's ridiculous. Try using pistols to take down a team with level 3 helms vests and m416s its "possible" but not probable. Game has serious performance issues as well but im sure thats one of the most discussed issues with the game. Honestly they could remove probably the entire outer edges of the only two maps they have in the game make them smaller because no one ever goes to those locations anyways. Would probably help a little with performace but im no expert.Overall its a great idea a great design even (in some ways) and its really fun to play especially with friends but these large issues that may seem like small ones at first start to grow and grow on you and eventually it just ruins the fun entirely. I'll still play it because of the time ive invested but currently im not enjoying it as much as i used to so in its current state i cannot recommend the game mostly because i want the devs to wake up and fix these issues that have been discussed since the game launched from "Early Access".
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'm not normally one to buy early access games but after watching a lot of people play it I caved and made the purchase.One of the greatest buys I have ever made. While the game is not without issues it is incredibly entertaining. The experience is tense exciting frustrating exhilirating and most importantly fun. Single player is fun but the most frustrating of the game modes. Duo is significantly more fun but the game really shines when you find a group of four people to play together with. I don't normally recommend an early access release but this one is being developed very well and will provide much entertainment!

review: All year long I was skeptical about purchasing the early access version of this game so I withheld. All year I would stumble upon Youtube videos about PUBG and once in a while check in on some streams of this game. I also play on Xbox and a good friend of mine told me about Fortnite it was fun ... but I felt it was missing more. You know that feeling of being knee deep in your own blood holding on for dear life when an unsuspected goes straight to the loot box of your first victim a great trap just empty out a clip on them and maybe wait for the next on or move on. It felt glorious and that's the feeling I got from this game. I made the mistake of first purchasing the game preview on the Xbox and although fun it was very obvious so much was needed but I played on. A couple days pass and I read update 1.0 has come up for PC I figured 'it's christmas soooo what the hell why not'. In my 5th game i win my first chicken dinner on PC a victorius moment in which I made sure to eat every damn meat of those bones while stuffing some damn mashed potato and gravy in my mouth while I was chewing that glorious chicken because we all know that's how it's meant to be ate! Only thing that bothered me was in the 6th game when I ran to an apparent hacker I don't remember his full name but I remember the last digits of his username *sigh*666 ... yes the damn devil himself killed me and when I looked at the deathcam all I saw was blasphemy. This demon of jackal's **ssy didn't even spot me all it did was unload a clip on the ground and I was dead my soul wrecked by the way I left not even facing this demon of perplexed idiocracy. Every game after that all I can do is watch the ground to be prepared in my attempt to at least try and dodge those bullets spawned from hell in my sleep I'm only full of nightmares of the way I never saw it's face just a blurry bastard laughing over my dead corpse.Seriously tho loved the game here on PC big improvement from game preview on XBX1(obviously).
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is extremely fun WHEN it works. I enjoy the rush of getting in long range or short range fights with different weapons due to RNG. title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Hey Kids!Are you looking for a great time picking up guns and then using it to shoot the nearest person you see well look no further. Do you want to have a jolly Ol time? Looting for guns Redbull and Oxycodine for 10 to 20 minutes then getting immediatly one shot killed by another rule abiding player that just so happens to use a fair and reasonable wall hack/aimbot. If you like what your hearing so far wait just a cotton picking minute theres more! If you love spending countless hours trying to improve your playing ability to enjoy this game even further then you can go ahead and shove that enthusiasm right into a BlueHole because when you start to enjoy this game even just a bit it will bring you complete frustration and anger beyond your wildest imagination. I will however recommend this game when the developers will realize that revenue isnt important especially when cheaters get banned then rebuy the game over and over but quality in gameplay is what wins over the hearts and minds of loyal PUBG gamers. I would like to suggest if I may that instead of banning cheaters why not put all cheaters on dedicated servers with other cheaters after multiple cheating reports and let them get a taste of their own medicine. That way they quit instead of rebuying the game but that idea seems like a fantasy.

I still recommend the game because if you can get into a cheat free match there's a ton of fun to be had. 7/10 overall from me. 8.5/10 if they add a region lock that works.

review: After 400+ hours on this game and playing in the beta I can definitely say that this is one of my favorite games. When I first got the game though it most definitely needed optimization and bug fixes and such it was far superior to it's hacker simulator state that it is in right now. Everything is perfect about this game and I hate to point out what erveryone else is complaining about but Asian servers definitely need to be locked and though they did just release an anti cheat update it still needs fixing. Not only is it not very effective on cheats being used ingame but it causes rubber banding and other weird bugs considering movement. For right now I wouldn't recommend this game until they do something about the infestation of Chinese players and hackers in North American servers.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Hi! Few things to start off with 1. Yes I added you because you're a female gamer 'tis an awesome thing to see! 2. I'm Brian. 3. Don't be intimidated but I'm not a stereotypical guy. If anything I'll be the one in the kitchen D. In all seriousness this game is not as great as it seems. If you actually happen to read this review this game sucks. Dishonest developers who pretend to listen to community feedback a 1.0 tag to make the game look better yet it feels like it is in early beta changes that are made to the game just to change it not serving a real purpose etc. The gameplay itself would be fine if it weren't plagued with horrible instability and optimization cheaters and hackers and truly awful servers and hit registration. I've quit this game because every time I should be getting a kill the game won't give it to me. You feel like a bag of popcorn when going against any other player they take around twenty shots to kill or at least it feels this way due to ping but you'll take about a hit and be knocked instantly to half of your health when you had better amor and weaponry that your opponent. This game is horribly inconsistent and not fun to play. Please save your thirty dollars so you won't be earraped by chinese players who don't stay in their own server and developers who don't understand that it's ok to region lock a playerbase that has three servers closer to their homeland than the U.S. servers. Can't even play the game I paid for anymore and it has descended through the greed of bluehole as they make more money they decide to not fix the game and simply add the cashgrap lootboxes. So funnnnn.

review: Graphics 9/10Compared to other battle royale games PUBG has great graphics. Realistic and easy on eyes.Maps 6/10Only 2 maps options. Both maps have few bugs when it comes to vehicles or buildings.Gameplay 6/10If you don't know how a 4x scope or 8x scope works in real life. Then you are doomed in the game. Crosshair means nothing. You have to fire while keeping in mind the distance between you and target. If the target is moving you can't just put your cross hair on the target and shoot it won't hit. Gets frustrating after few games.Hackers 10/10This game is infested with hackers using wallhacks and aimbots. I have played on every single server and its all the same.Overall rating 5/10Needs major fixing. I used to enjoy this game but more I play more I hate it.

review: PUBG is a very fun game especially with friends. Although I only have about 130+ hours on this game and I'm not very good at the game it is still very fun. Me and my friends sometimes drop at populated places for fun. We died most times but it was fun to get a few kills and stuff. The new maps and weapons are pretty fun to use and play on. There are some glitches such as cars flying into space. Cars merging together and blowing up. Cars merging into rocks and blowing up. Basically the glitches are mainly with cars. There are some things which need to be improved on such as the kill cam and spectating feature are very slow and are not very accurate but that is pretty much it. This game is very fun and definately recommended.

review: PUBG the game+lot of players+Big maps+Vehicles+Great combat+Lot of weapons+Much better performance than it used to be+Different match different scenariosPlayerunknown's battlegrounds doesn't need introduction. But just in case...It's a battle royale game where you jump out of the plane with 99 other players find loot to kill them and at the same time be in the zone which gets smaller every few minutes.I've seen a lot of people complaining about the hackers but I really dont think it's that big of a problem. With 90+ hours I've never met single one or maybe I didn't noticed him but either way I don't see it as a problem. On the china servers it's definitely worst.Combat in this game is easy to learn hard to master situation. You basically find a gun maybe even a scope and you point on the enemy and try to shoot him nothing hard really except for the hip fire distance to enemy (need to prefire him) and your location on the map. If your enemy is gonna have a better position (better cover high ground etc) you'll need to get a better position too or you'll be dead. But don't forget about the zone oh dear how many time have I died to zone when I was fighting other guy DYou're gear is very important(Make sure to look for helmets and vests) cause headshots are very deadly if you're not careful enough. Try to find long range weapons cuz usually you're gonna use them more than close range (usually you shoot to people pretty fair away from you)You can play solo but i recommend squad cause is soo much more fun to play with friends for me. And fighting another squad is always adrenaline DAnd what I don't like about this game?Well...Let's start with server delay. By that i mean every time I want to pick something from the ground I have to pick it twice or more times. It used to be worse but it's not perfect yet. Also sometimes I have to reload twice cause the servers didn't register it probably.However I am happy to say that this doesn't appear to be a problem when you're shooting st someone the hitboxes seems to be right.Then there is this felling of repetition.Now this is only subjective but after quite a lot hours in the game I am pretty much doing the same over and over again. I jump out of a plane land look for weapons loot and start killing other players and going to the zone. Yes every game is different but you're doing same thing as before. I don't want compare this game with different one but let's just this. In Hunt Showdown you're playing as a hunter and you'll be trying to kill the boss and escape with bounty to one of 3 extraction points. However u can play this game so many ways. Especially in the night missions you can choose to sneak trough the bushes and look for Hunters you can play agresive rush in a try to kill the boss and escape listen for footsteps and other sounds of other hunters and plan your ambush there's just so much you can do.I am not here to on pubg really.It's a great game and I understand why is it so much popular. I still really enjoy playing it just not that much as I used to.So should you buy this game? If u vave a decent PC and you like battle royale games then yeah go for it!But don't play this game only because everyone else is playing it even if you don't really enjoy it cuz why would you be playing a game that you don't enjoy. bugs server delay repetive gameplay almost no stealth and of course toxic community but that's in every popular game sadly (I can't really think about more negatives.After all it's not a bad gameI'll give it 8/10!

review: For those of you that don't want to read my whole review here is the tl dr. This is one of the best games of 2017 in my opinion. This game is fun and action packed. It's not as glitchy and full of hackers and everyone thinks there are (I've only every encountered 1 or 2) and it's way more enjoyable if you have a few friends to play it with. For those of you who want to here the long version here it is. *Gameplay* The gameplay is really solid. It goes like this Find weapon kill people move into circle kill more people die and get second place rinse and repeat. The movement of the character feels nice and the maps are built around the realistic physics engine which helps make it feel emmersive. All the guns feel powerful to shoot. And there is sorta a learning curve to the weapons but if you have played any other realistic shooter you should feel right at home. *Graphics* By no means is this the best looking game. I think it is good looking but not the best. The view distance for foliage is not very high even when the setting is turned all the way up. I know this is for performance reasons but it is noticable. And that is kinda the theme for this "graphics" section of my review. They didn't make it the best looking game because then people couldn't run it. It does look good but not the best. I really don't know how else to put it. *Hackers* Just like I mentioned above I don't think hackers are really a big deal for this game. I've only ran into 1 or 2 hackers in my 90 hours of play time. Just recently the devs banned 1.5 million people for hacking. That goes to show that yes there are hackers in the game but yes the devs are working on getting them out of it. I don't think this is going to be a big deal for a lot of people. And just remember some people are just better than you. I DOESN'T mean they are hacking. *Optomization* It is true that the game is not that optomized. You will have to have a decent computer to run it. But not anything outrageous. I have a GTX 1060 6GB with an I5 6600k (OC to 4.6GHz) and I play at 1440p medium to ultra settings and I get a constant 60 FPS. Yes the optomization could be better but it's good enough to have a fun gaming session. *Competitors* There's no doubt that Fortnite is a huge competitor to PUBG. I think PUBG is more fun but that is just my opinion. I see the appeal in Fortnite. It's way better optomized and it's free... But I promise you PUBG will continue to get support for years to come. I think it has a longer lasting appeal. But again that's just me. Ok I'm done now. If you want a recap go back up and read my tl dr because my fingers are getting tired of typing. D
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Mediocre is how I would describe this game. It is fun to play with friends at times but recent development choices are ruining the game. Loot crates were recently introduced that you have to pay to open. So you play the game and get points you then use those points to get a crate which holds a vanity item. It used to be you just spent the points and you got the crate and open it but now you spend your points and have to Pay $2.50 to open a crate that is just going to give you a junk vanity item. The whole thing is just sad. This game is really not finished at all it doesn t look or play particularly well and constantly has connection and bug issues. The DEV just took it out of early access so that he could make money and speed along the console release. In my opinion it s not worth your money.

review: So here's the DL.Swore to dear jesus I would never buy OR play this because I hated H1Z1 Battle Royale.Have tons of friends who play PUBG. Got bored.Bought PUBG.Got in game dropped in at the military base got wrecked in 5 minutes.Second round Won first place with my squad of friends.Third round Won first place with that same squad.Best shooter with squads I've played and the adrenaline rush is SO real.**********EDIT**********Game's good however after 250+ Hours Ingame and by no means am I the worst player in the world. When nobody is hacking 6+ kills a game is rather easy fire fights are extremely intense fair footed shot for shot killing fun and you do NOT DIE INSTANTLY EXCEPT to the obvious "Oh crap he blew my vest or helmet off then finished me just like that Should've ran". The hacks come back a couple weeks after every big update and it pretty much goes like this.Jump in land loot get a kill because someone had nothing loot a couple more buildings notice a sickly trend of really good loot getting left behind in crates ammo missing but main guns like M416 SCAR L KAR98's etc all getting left behind (Doesnt happen when people survive more than 2 minutes before getting wrecked) get outside think you're safe leaving a city get killed by an instant headshot or full auto at a distance watch kill cam get extremely frustrated and scream at your friends that you hate this game while they're in complete denial of the entire situation.What to expect from a hackers kill cam EVERY time Erratic snappy movement due to Aim bots cross hairs following you through buildings behind cover because of ESP hacks quick switch between rifles 0.01 second scope times no scope kills at 100+ meter distances using assault rifles on full auto snap to instant headshot with pistols and shotguns at insane distances and even aimbots tracing your head with no scope and no recoil in short range (Pay attention to bullet holes behind you if you're in stairwells).The dead giveaway is always the de sync caused by how insanely fast their cursor is snapping around to your position while you're hiding/running through buildings and cover and then to you when you pop out.Long story short I originally recommended this game however I've changed my mind. It was amazing hopping in and EARNING those first 20 or so chicken dinners within 30 matches in the beginning. The Intensity The Adrenaline rush of winning in a game where the odds are SO low was unrivaled compared to any BR games that existed in the beginning Including H1Z1 but for it to amount to what it's become? Please and I mean it PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF the FPS/BATTLE ROYALE GENRE OF GAMES DO NOT BUY PUBG.
